UhDmxHg6hvmOZ-pqtqVIXQ.review_text: Very friendly and attentive staff. The food was excellent. The ambiance is comfortable and relaxing. We'll definitely be back!   Great date night spot.

v8Mu5611FoG-nbOkqg0K4g.review_text: I stopped in here with my Dad after listening to a blues band around the corner. It seems almost blasphemous not to eat Italian while in North Beach but that just wasn't going to work for us that night. I Yelped this place out, and glad that I did. Despite being a bit off the main drag, and definitely non-descript from the outside, this place is obviously a hit with the locals.   We walked in at 6pm and could only be seated at a couple of awkwardly placed seats at the end of the bar.  It worked fine, though, thanks to the very friendly and attentive bartender. I also appreciated that she wasn't put off that we weren't drinking (the responsible choice before a drive back to the East Bay).  We each ordered tacos (el pastor for me, chicken for my dad). While not a huge portion for $9, they were nicely spiced and well prepared. The chips and salsa were a nice accompaniment. The balance of the menu also looked interesting.  I'd be inclined to come back some time and explore further, if I ever found myself back in this part of town.

IFYkRXw4DwrXqPyLptOaAA.review_text: Just came here for brunch so while it's fresh in my head, here is a rundown of the food/drinks/service: -Food (w/o considering the price): 8/10 - had the shrimp tacos and the shrimp was perfectly cooked and seasoned. However, considering I paid $10 for two very small tacos, I probably would give it 5/10, but hey, I was in the nice party of North Beach. The closest place I could get $2 tacos with that flavor would be in San Jose/Mission. The dinner menu looks better and would love to try the soup everyone raves about.   -Drinks: 4/10 - cheap for bottomless, $15 for bottomless mimosas/sangrias, and after we finish our glass, we could continue to get mimosas or switch to sangrias. However, the mimosas were different, they didn't have orange juice but something orange flavor. It tasted a bit water down so if you want to feel something, you may need to have 5+ glasses. Same story for the sangria. I personally didn't finish either of my drinks...should have just got one glass for $8.   -Service: 10/10 - very friendly and attentive staff. Our waitress came by to check up on us often, refilled our drinks and water, and was very accommodating.   Overall: May come back, maybe for dinner.

3VhfOvx64LJHpWjpamrqDA.review_text: I'm not going to stop loving Don Pisto's because the food rocks. Unfortunately, it's become so hip and trendy that the crowd is the bummer. The last time I was in there for brunch I felt embarrassed not to be wasted and wearing Banana Republic. Then I realized that's not how I choose my haunts and just wanted to leave... boo. Awesomeness devoured by popularity.  You should still go. Maybe not during prime time, but it's good stuff. I just wish that no one knew :)

Yi5JKaD1VY4Edeww92PZWA.review_text: I love coming to Don Pistos and I think it's a neighborhood gem. Everything on their menu is fresh and delicious, but my favorite dishes are the ceviche, carnitas and al pastor tacos, and the chorizo mussels. Oh, and don't forget their guacamole; it's one of the best guacs in town! I like their vibe and their service. Their food is worth every penny.

ySUCaa4xM7FOZfshXOVR5A.review_text: THE BEST GUACAMOLE EVERRRR!! I also tried all their tacos and I thought it was good, but not mind blowing...well, almost.  SUPER loud and have long waitlist, I think for weekends. Service was not very noticeable because our attention was more caught by the loud crowd

UVLamhEGcJ3u7_TxfnxbBA.review_text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.   I have not had one bad thing here.  Some of my favorite items include the hamberguesa, al pastor tacos (most flavorful al pastor ever), pork chop (amazing flavor), carne asada tacos, chicken tortilla soup and the guacamole. The food is great, the restaurant has a fun atmosphere, and the staff are real friendly.  Do yourself a favor and check it out !

cEhMBD1_FhyzmzL_AJPG5g.review_text: My favorite neighborhood restaurant. The food is ALWAYS excellent and delicious. Love coming here! Awesome salsa, tortilla soup, breakfast burritos, pollo asada

2xrovuJYOnlDjC_aJABonQ.review_text: The best hipster-mexican restaurant I have been in!

aGYvA2vEwv34rzuJJfVXhw.review_text: Really great pork chop that's super juicy! The tacos are alright - nothing special. The calamari is good also.   mmm the pork chop :-)

MOeT1h_tYabtcU3i1-NL8g.review_text: We were there for late lunch/brunch on a Friday and walked right in.  The place was still busy, but no wait.  We had the market fish tacos (snapper, if I recall??) and the huevos rancheros.  Both were flavorful, nice amount of spice and piping hot.  The potatoes are crispy and perfectly done as well.    Had to try the bottomless sangria's.  Liked that you could switch beverages if you wanted.  We had just one mimosa and went back.  Service was good and quick.  I plan to go back for dinner and try some of their small plates.

hEcZyy-q29lGqy4HHw3BmA.review_text: HORRIBLE customer service.  I've been trying to call this place for a reservation change and yesterday they hung up on me. Then I emailed them, did not hear back. I called back today and they hung up on me again. Beware of going here for a party or large reservation. They are extremely rude.

jHCUuv3bBMy0VmfRWMpW4g.review_text: This is the best restaurant in the city, hands down. Eat here now. My lengthy, drawn out review wouldn't even serve this place justice. Plus, reading it would waste valuable time you should be spending at Don Pistos, eating.

FI0dcCAuFmW0lutdKO2UwA.review_text: Quality is in the house. Pork Chop- Amazing (fat juicy meat) Burger - Gives me instant wood Good service but crowded. Brunch is ehhh (worth skipping).

WoDSAQPRN7BmHVea5YAO5A.review_text: Good deal for 1.5 hours of bottomless mimosas (or margaritas or sangria) for $17. They refill you quickly and generously! Food is solid too. I had poached eggs over chorizo and potatoes. Atmosphere is loud but fun and open with windows all around unless you sit downstairs.  Takes reservations for 6+, otherwise get there by 11:30/11:45 and it's not too busy yet!

UItg26SgE2pPAw3um7yaKQ.review_text: Fancy Mexican food is the perfect way to describe their food. The place has a great vibe and their bottomless sangria/mimosa/Marquita (you can pick what you want each time you refill) is delicious.

23AVdektlfZzpWwKRbUCBw.review_text: Great food tacos, oyster ,the prawns a la diabla everything  is exelent Enrique The bartender is really nice and funny the margaritas are great and the sangrita too ,all the time I get there I have a great time

u0Y7DeOzOt_aPDZiQpEvng.review_text: Fantastic vibe and always hoppin! Best chips and salsa in the city. Ordering the lobster is a must every time.

y5KvJihQmAdRDiIx0wBhPQ.review_text: Bottomless mimosas that you can swap out with sangria or margaritas? Ay caramba! I'm always on the lookout for bottomless alcohol options on Sunday mornings and this place did not disappoint. They have food too:-) I especially like the Chorizo & Poached Eggs and the Huevos Rancheros.  The place is small and they don't take reservations, so be prepared to wait a bit. Totally worth it!

nwKsR5_epCypSzGPsMn0HA.review_text: Came here with a friend on Thursday around 7pm.  I did not give a lot of hope to have a table because this place always packs.  Surprisingly, there was no wait and even a lot of empty tables.  The service was good and attentive.    We ordered:   Fish Tacos (two per order) - It was pretty good.  Flavorful but the portion was kinda small and kinda pricey.  Slow Braised Pork Taco - It was good but I like the fish taco more.    Ceviche - Very good.  It was so fresh and flavorful.  I love the sauce.  Chips & Guacamole - The best dish of the night.  The sauce was full of big chunk of avocado.    Overall, this is just an OK restaurant.  Good that I did not need to wait at all for the table.  I don't think this place is worth for the long wait.

qFbJF-qbRvUUg3Jcb6Dh1Q.review_text: Don Pisto's deserves its near-5-star rating.  The food is incredible and the service is great. The only downside is a function of its popularity: expect a wait if you come during a busy period. We went during senior citizen hour, ~6pm on a Sunday, and by the time we left the place was packed and people were spilling into the street waiting.  I highly recommend the tuna tacos, the enchiladas, the ceviche and the meatballs. The plates are pretty small, so we ordered 5 dishes for 3 people to split. All were amazing, and the drinks are pretty awesome too. Whether you are a tourist or a local, you should definitely check this place out.

Slu7GA6wBnA2fAXXH_dT-Q.review_text: This place is truly a jem. The service was friendly right from the moment I walked in. After the bartender looked at my ID (I'm 21, not a surprise) and seeing that we both have lived in Missouri, my first drink was on the house. Who doesn't love a free (amazing!) sangria. I just moved into the neighborhood and he assured me that everyone has each others back, which made me feel very welcomed. He made great small talk with me and my mom.  The waitress we had was very friendly and informative on the menu items. She came to the table at the right times while also lettings us take our time and not rushing us. I got some of my food wrapped up to go and she even through in a small free bag of chips. Very appreciated!   It's no doubt that the food was amazing. I personally got the fish tacos - to die for. We also got the grilled corn, not sure what all was on it but I've never had corn that great before, and I'm from Kansas City. After dinner another waiter/buser came up and talked with us, recommended a few places around town since I'm new to the city.  Overall an A+++ experience and I'll be returning very soon!

tAQITCQ0Hg0ie3psdw5RBg.review_text: Don't come here hungry.  I say this for several reasons, only one of which is a knock. Overall I think the place is great, so let's get down to it.  Don Pisto's seems like this little hole in the wall place over on North Beach/Telegraph - there's no signage or anything, so you just have to keep your eye out or go with somebody who's been there before. Very minimalistic, very small.  Incidentally, so are their portions. Tiny tacos all around. If you're hungry, be prepared to order seconds.  But the other reason not to come here hungry, is because you'll be totally willing to order half the menu. Everything on it sounds awesome, and that's generally because they ARE awesome.  It's also one of the only places I've dined in where they carry Mexican Coke, you know, the kind made with real sugar and in the old fashioned glass bottles? They'll bring it to you with a wedge of lemon, and it's outstanding. Mas refresco, amigos.  The service is good, it's about as quick as you'd want it to be, but not overattentive either. It's just right.  Ultimately, it's great for a brunch or light lunch, but if you want to really pack it in, you're better served elsewhere. Either way, Don Pisto's is quality. Check it out.

nos7eU-naFk32w15RwvDRA.review_text: Great food (huevos and guac) and Margs for brunch! Bustling place. Not as trendy as I thought, but still cool

uTM52iXtz_IhasV6mk2XLA.review_text: Pork chops! They were great (and huge) as pork chops and in the al pastor tacos too. Sashimi was yummy as were the oysters. We also had albondigas. It came with crostini & marinara.  Yum!  It is loud. It might ruin the night for some so you should know. It didn't bother us though.  To find it...No sign on the street just the address. Look for the brick building with the good smells coming from it. Be prepared to wait for a table; it's worth it.  The bartender tonight was a sweetheart and our waiter was entertaining & efficient.

0-IDXVNWgdmLeA36mgHqWQ.review_text: Holy Heaven I love this place.   Chips and fresh Salsa Verde, done.  Pitcher of Acai Berry Sangria to wash it all down, another done.  I've only ever had the Camarones tacos, because I can't get past how  delicious they are. They are consistently tasty, which is important.  All the servers are friendly and attentive.  (My only tiny criticism, it can get SUPER loud, in Bauer's terminology, a BOMB)

Jd1XHglA85pI3H1gXwzwfw.review_text: Fantastic place! There was a packed house when we walked in, but the host gave us the DL on who would be leaving from the bar next. We scored a seat right away, grabbed a drink from the SUPER friendly bartenders and ordered some al pastor and fish tacos, guac, and margaritas.   Everything was the right temperature, full of flavor and excellent. I do not have a single complaint EXCEPT that I left rediculously full without eating a lot of food. I will have to return to order another small batch of awesome.

qUJ3tNw35hcmlUOWeGvVew.review_text: I had a wonderful birthday brunch here. The mushroom omelette was extraordinary and the all you can drink Pina Aguas Frescas mimosas didn't hurt my experience either. I'm a big salsa verde fanatic, so the fact that this is their standard salsa kinda blew my mind/gave me a food boner.   Aside from the food, the service was really really really good. At one point I had to go put more change in my metered spot, I asked for $1 change from my waitress, rather then giving me change she gave me her parking card and told me to use as much as I needed. She was great about refilling my mimosa and making conversation with my whole group about how our respective meals were.   This place makes group meals easy, and Sunday mornings a hazy euphoric memory of wonderful delicious food. Try it out!

VX63D1pxxwd9vaxbqd_wDQ.review_text: GREAT food, but the margaritas are no good. Stick with beer for drinks.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I was a little skeptical at first, but by the end of the meal I became a fan of Don Pisto's. The chips and verde salsa were perfect and I couldn't stop eating them alongside my Michelada (which was also perfect). We started with the Tortilla soup which was damn good. Then on to the tostadas which were my least favorite of the night. The carnitas tacos were spot on, but the hamburgesa was great, definitely the best of the night...

CXQWHbSoWAZVMaplMCkPBg.review_text: Great food!   Enrique was the best bartender Good sangria too! They made me a custom Veggie plate because they ran out of enchiladas Super nice staff all around

i2B6LFJ6sJGq03ooznvu8A.review_text: i call don pisto's "fancy mexican", but i definitely don't mean that in dismissive manner as I would many of the catered for white palates, overpriced places found all over the bay area.  don pisto's has many of the mexican staples - soft tacos, menudo, ceviche, pozole, etc. it also has some fantastic cuisine you wouldn't traditionally associate. such as the pork chop. oh my, let me tell you about the pork chop. that thing is the most succulent, decadent, piquant pork chop i've ever had (ok, that last adjective was a bit forced... couldn't think of any other appropriate words). i also enjoyed the grilled calamari, the guacamole (which tastes the way i make it at home, fresh and chunky), and the mussels.  they used to have these bacon marinated burgers with guac on them, but sadly last time i went it seems they've limited these to wednesdays only. this is my only gripe with this otherwise fantastic establishment (especially for those of us who don't live in SF and would only get to go on the weekends).

etKKH6F0D9BJan-UPQgQaA.review_text: This place is excellent! I came here on a Sunday evening when the beers were only 3 bucks. We had  the shrimp tacos, carnitas tacos, mussels & chorizo, and the calamari skewers; each dish being very tasty. The presentation of the food was also very nice, along with the atmosphere/decor of the restaurant. You can tell all of the ingredients are very fresh and well prepared. The service was also very professional. I shoved one of those roasted jalapenos in my mouth and was burning up so bad that I had to have our waitress get me a glass of milk and side of sour cream. I can normally handle spicy food fairly well, but just a warning - don't eat that jalapeno all at once!  This place is a gem, for sure.

Nfw6KZys6dVXnB5oiuZPdg.review_text: One of my favorite meals during our home finding trip from Dallas!  The first time we came here, we loved the experience.  We chatted it up with one of the managers (could be Zuckerberg's cousin?) and thoroughly enjoyed the food.  We agreed we'd be back and exchanged some foreign currency with him.    Now that we are residents here, we lived up to our word, came back and the food was just as good as the first time, but the hostess (I believe another manager) should not be in any service industry dealing with living objects, especially humans.  She was just cold and very short.  We put our name in, she said 45 minutes, we took a hike, came back after 30 minutes to grab a drink at the bar, while waiting - thought we'd just "check-in" on availability and we got a "didn't I tell you 45 minutes?" UH, yeah, you did, just wanted to make sure our watches were in sync.    All in all: the food is great - would have given them 5 stars, but you know...didn't appreciate the big attitude.

ZNF5zB9KrTPko81PtssCJw.review_text: A new SF fave!  Came here a couple of weekends ago for the first time and would definitely come back.  We fell in love with the salsa there, so much that I've tried to recreate it at home.  We ordered the guac, ceviche, pork chop, and fish and carnitas/al pastor (can't remember, the margarita was strong) tacos.  What really made the dinner was the pork chop, WOW!  Super juicy and flavorful, probably the best pork chop I've had to date.  FYI: Expect a long wait and it's pretty loud inside, we had to yell across the table, but it's a fun vibe.  Lots of bars in the area to chill at while you're waiting for your table also.

VnGnv_r-yiWmeis2k_uOiQ.review_text: First introduced by my coworkers and brought my girlfriends here the next time. The bottomless agua fresca mimosas are delicious! You can alternate your choices between agua fresca mimosas, sangrias, and margaritas. I'd recommend the mimosas as it's most fresh.They say they switch between oranges, pineapples, blackberries, watermelon, etc...based on season. Nick was our server the first time and he remembered me the next, awesome memory! He's the one that looks like Ferris Bueller. He SAYS he gets Keana Reeves, but that could be from the ladies he's been pooring too many refills to. JK, he's a sweetheart and a very attentive waiter. Daniel also kindly gave me and my girls jello shots to make sure they were perfect for cinco de mayo, they were REALLY GOOD, so go get some! (I obviously had this in drafts for way too long..since it's mid May now, sorry Daniel)   Brunch food isn't phenomenal but still delicious. I've tried the chorizo scramble, comes with 2 poached eggs, chorizo, and potatoes. YUM! Also had the tacos and ranchos huervos, also highly recommend.  Definitely coming back in the summer,  someone please tell me when they have watermelon mimosas available, PLEASE!

dGy6LmfgfJyftpcHVkPtEw.review_text: It was a weird Thursday and I was a little off kilter in the afternoon. Assuming it was low blood sugar and the hunger making me cranky I went for some Mexican food.  Anyone else feel like it's the weekend when you eat lunch at like 3 in the afternoon during the week?  This place was really relaxed, which should be a requirement for Mexican food in my opinion. You can't rush eating those chips and sippin a drink can you? I think not!  Someone had told me if I ever went to the Don's that I needed to try this 'Hamburguesa' thing. Having never tried it before, and feeling wildly adventurous even if it meant Montezuma's revenge, I went for it.  Oh I think I might have found a new love! It has this incredible bacon and onion flavor and was so good; like I moaned at least once eating it good. Moaning while eating food always reminds me of this girl I knew in college. She loved good food. Miss you Tara!  So back to Pisto's. It was a wonderful place to eat with friendly people and staff. The chips and guacamole were very good and the hamburguesa is a must try!

YOMgApSk9x4aub1iYdcv_w.review_text: This place was great. Service was excellent. Food was cooked to perfection and the price was right. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this food. I don't think you can go wrong on the menu but I especially like the carne tacos. Delectable!  Only issue is the parking in that area. But hey, you can't win them all.

K1mas1AjV3K2Dao2N6hKiA.review_text: Fourth stop in our quest to try the best food SF has to offer.  We made this our main lunch. At this point, we are not hungry but we manage to scarf down some more food and drinks.  We ordered the hamburgesa, al pastor and carnita senora tacos.  The al pastor had explosions of flavors. The carnita is very tender and flavorful. All tortillas are homemade which is always better than store bought.   The hamburgesa was good but all so heavy. I heard it was cooked in bacon and onions. Burger was tender but I wish we had an option to cook it medium rare.  We also shared a pitcher of acai sangria. I haven't tried much sangria, but it is one of the best I ever had.

xNszKL7Zt92K7ypiI0YYAg.review_text: Flavorful and light yet fulfilling, Nick is an additional bonus to the entire experience. ThAnk you Pete&Nico;D Totes Faves!

0s7x6iXviZTBDHPSfxF-4A.review_text: Please note this is an update. Our opinion on the food has not changed---its a solid 5. Our opinion on the servers has not changed---a solid 5. Pete is a great man----great owner---really cares.   So why the update?   Demographics.   When we first found this gem it was quiet and offered a mixed age crowd.   Not anymore.   The whole place is packed with 21-30 year olds. They are LOUD and really (in our humble opinion) annoying.   We feel really bummed because we love this place---but we just can't stand the noise or the encroachment of the Marina set.   We wish Pete continued success but if you are older than 30 and like to be able to have a conversation without screaming----pass this by.

K_Iyyg0EMJzh8hf5oiC7aQ.review_text: I think this place is a bit over-rated. What I really liked about it was the ambiance (young and hip), rustic decoration, and its fun environment (good music always ads to the pleasure of dinning).   However, I was quite disappointed with the quality of food. I went here with my fiancé mid week. We didn't have a reservation and walked in. Luckily, they had an empty table for two (pretty much most other tables were taken though, so definitely this place is in high demand, and I would recommend that you make a reservation before you go).   I should say their margaritas was quite delicious! We ordered chips and salsa with guacamole, carne asada, and diablo prawns, and pollo asado. They first brought us chips and salsa with guacamole. It took them good 20 minutes to take us the next dish. By then, we were already quite full digging into the chips and salsa. Then they brought the diablo prawns. My eyes sparked (I love prawns), but shortly after, I had tears dropping from my eyes and nose for the rest of the dinner! Damn! Speaking of HOT?! The sauce on top of the prawns was super "hot & spicy" and made me burn throughout the dinner! The food was actually delicious, but they poured way too much of that burning sauce on top, so it was even hard to see the prawns anymore.   Not until we finished the last piece of the initial dish that they cared to bring us other dishes. So the tacos finally came after I swallowed all the hot and spicy diablo prawns and dropped tears as I ate (I'm sure my fiancé had a good laughter though because he doesn't like prawns and just watched me finishing that dish alone)! ;)    The tacos were average (but also quite spicy)! Nothing too fancy about them though...The chicken however frustrated us....It was greasy and didn't taste great. So overall we were not too impressed with the food here, but the ambiance and vibe inside the restaurant get high scores.     I would suggest that you go to this place if you want to have a great ambiance and care less about the quality of the food, or if is one of those days that you are feeling hot and spicy! ;)  Was this review...?

MV8TOvzG88wjSlV0rS9zYg.review_text: Great food, great staff, had such a great nice sitting at the bar with my wife talking to Nick and the rest of the team..... The sangria was also excellent.

nHxVMQCcqolabPO93Nf5Ag.review_text: I'm writing mostly to rave about the service I got at brunch this morning.   I was really excited to try Don Pisto's, especially because I don't eat meat, and read that there was a vegetarian brunch menu. Unfortunately for me, the non-egg eating and usually dairy-avoiding patron, vegetarian here includes eggs and cheese in everything. They made me something egg-less, and it was all good. Everyone at the table LOVED the food, and we got a side of guac that tasted fresh and delicious!  My small table decided not to indulge in the bottomless brunch cocktails (alas, they looked amazing). I was SO impressed with our waitress because a) we did not order drinks, b) she did not ignore us after realizing we would not be a big ticket, c) she was just a freakin awesome waitress! Super friendly and attentive to our table, we had everything we needed without being hounded every minute.   My only real complaint is that they don't have coffee. That's just weird. However, they did allow us to go get coffee at a nearby shop and bring it in. Just a weird management choice on their part.  The other super-waitress quality our gal had was that she held the food until everyone was back at the table, ensuring no one had cold eggs. How sweet!   I look forward to returning to Don Pisto's to try out their dinner menu sometime soon!  Definitely go here.

KjXID5UvwxS1-TRAsw2aYw.review_text: A hidden gem in the city, they don't even have a sign outside the restaurant! The place has a romantic - ish ambiance, my fave is their big windows and very traditional looking chairs and table! I felt like I was eating at a latin American's house.   The food is beyond amazing! From the chips, to the salsa, to tacos! I had the shrimp taco which has good guac sauce and plenty of jumbo shrimps! My friend had the carnitas taco and he said the sauce was amazing! We went on a Sunday which they have $2 beer and $3 sangria! The only downside was looking for a parking, it took us 10 mins driving around to look for one.   It's super worth it though, and I'm def coming back to try their ceviche!

Wfvwi-PXrFnIyw5HZkMk2A.review_text: One of my favorites in town. I love the sangria, and the Al Pastor tacos are to die for. They have a great soup, and the seasonal corn is really tasty. It's well worth the wait, however it's better to go midweek to dodge the crazy wait that is so popular on Fridays and Saturdays. The ambiance is great, and the food is always consistently good. If you are waiting for a table you can usually sit at the bar with some chips and guac and some sangria until your table is ready. The only reason I'm not making it 5 stars is because sometimes the service isn't as great as it should be. They could be a little more attentive.

M1BoUpwckEGI1OIW25CjEQ.review_text: This is my favorite spot in North Beach. The Pork Chop is the best I've ever had and I can't get enough of the Diablo Prawns. They have an awesome brunch too. Bottomless mimosas and the Chorizo and poached eggs is my go to. The downstairs is great for large parties and the service is amazing!

DqwcovLjZSRj3NJgg7iiMg.review_text: Had a fantastic birthday brunch with a group of 17 people in the downstairs area. Excellent service. Can't beat bottomless mimosas/sangria/margaritas and way too much food for $35/person. They kept the drinks coming so we got more than enough in the hour and a half. We ate the breakfast burrito, chorizo and poached eggs, huevos rancheros, omelette and French toast. They served it all family style and every plate was delicious. I've come here for dinner plenty of times and there food is on point. I was happy to find a place to accommodate such a large group for my birthday. Will definitely have to come back here for brunch. And I will be going back for dinner shortly I am sure.

gdJO-gVfaosFL_g6fX-BSA.review_text: After hearing such wonderful reviews from my roommate and reading about the bacon-marinated hamburger on a Hamburger Today blog (aht.seriouseats.com/arch…), I had to try Don Pisto's. Things that I love about Don Pisto's: hamburgeusa, their corn tortillas, sangria, and margaritas. Now I will go more in depth. The hamburgeusa was one of the best hamburger patties I've ever tasted. It actually had more of a "smoky" taste than a bacon taste. It was so juicy and the bun was amazing too. Toasted on both sides and just delicious. I only meant to have a couple bites and practically ate half of it. I will admit that the hamburger purist in me was missing the tomato and lettuce. It's already so rich that I don't think it needs cheese and extra sauce. It comes close to one of the best burgers I've ever had except for the fact that I missed my usual garnishes. We ordered the Al Pastor tacos (grilled rib chop, charred pineapple ), but truthfully I'm not sure if we got those. I didn't see any pineapple in the taco... maybe it was the Al Pastor... maybe it wasn't. It was still delicious and the corn tortillas are amazing. I'm not normally the biggest fan of corn tortillas (I prefer flour) but these were really delicious with a nice consistency. I hate it when the tortilla is slightly dry and starts to break while I try and eat my taco. Not really an issue here. Nice filling to tortilla ratio and they get a little messy while you eat them. We also ordered the shredded kobe beef with 2 fried eggs on top served with corn tortillas. Think of it as a mixture of carnitas (except beef) and huevos rancheros (except no beans). The eggs are served sunny side up and they recommend you to break the yolks and mix it all together. While not extremely bad, this was my least favorite dish. It was a little too salty for me but the tortillas helped with that balance. I liked the hamburger more. Sangria and margaritas are both solid and served in cute glasses. Apparently, Don Pistos does not take reservations for less than 6 people. We got there are 6:45pm on Wednesday and got the last 2-seater table. I would definitely go back and get the hamburger and try different things on the menu. The soup looked really good!

cgDZVtYICeiK5t1rkesamg.review_text: It seemed like every twentysomething in the city was at Don Pisto's on Sat night.  Our group of 14 (all of whom definitely past the twentysomething stage) was bribed with free shots of tequila so we could mosey on outside of the restaurant after we had finished our meal and our pitchers of margaritas.  There was quite a crowd outside waiting for tables. I  didn't realize just how popular this place is!  If you're gonna eat here and want to be able to talk to your friends next to you or across from you, either bring a bullhorn or have a fully charged phone so you can communicate with them via text. It is way too too loud inside (thanks to the music and din of the crowd) for any kind of meaningful conversation. I can see my friends' mouths move as they shout something at me, but understanding what they're saying is another matter!  My throat got really hoarse after a couple hours of shouting across the table.   The tacos were great. I tried the beef, shrimp and al pastor tacos and they were all tasty.  The shrimp dish was also good. I didn't get to try the meatballs dish, but my friend said it was just okay. I would definitely stick with tacos. The chips and green salsa are both really good. The salsa had a little heat to it. The guacamole could use more lime and cilantro though! I ate lots of chips at the beginning as we were waiting for the rest of our party that I got full real fast. Hard to resist those chips!   The margarita was good. One side of our table was enjoying it a little too much. Haha But that's cool! The birthday boy must enjoy his and his wife's night out without the kids!   Service was good.  Our server made sure everyone had a drink and everyone had food!  The free shots of tequila was a brilliant tactic to get us out of there after paying for our bill. We toasted, took a picture,  and went on our merry way to Amante for more toasting, pictures and merriment!

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: Stopped by here for dinner with some friends one night. We ordered the guacamole to share, I ordered the carne asada tacos and a margarita.  The guacamole was some of the best I have ever had. It was very simply and had a strong citrus flavor but was perfectly balanced with salt.   The margarita was also quite delicious. You could tell there was tequilla in it, but it wasn't strong tasting.   The tacos were incredible. Very simply, just meat and tortillas, served with a wedge of lime and some radishes.   I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves guacamole! Also, I would recommend coming early, they get very busy and the wait can be long.

X0BwGZWUVvlPrtohOL096g.review_text: If quality, simple, delicious Mexican food is something you enjoy Don Pistos is a great option.  I only spend a couple of weeks in SF a year, but this is a guaranteed stop for me every time!  The lobster poached in pork fat was a great special this week, and the Poc Chuc is a go to for anyone that enjoys bone in pork treats!  Nestle up to the little bar or grab a table with friends this place never disappoints.  Don't forget to order some chorizo mussels and guacamole to share with the lucky ones you invited along.  F yeah Don Pistos!!!!

j7Ew20Kh33lFEaUXW1rGNw.review_text: One the best Mexican places I have tried. The guac is fresh and tasty, try it with an Anchor Steam beer. My table split the beef , pork, and shrimp tacos (each is an order of two). All three were excellent but try the pork if you are only going to try one. All had lots of flavor without being too spicy and each had a unique flavor.   This place is a walk from the Wharf but worth the wait.

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: Make reservations!  I've been here a handful of times, and each meal was fun and enjoyable, but it's not necessarily a place that I crave.  I have yet to try the burger and tacos though, so that may be a factor.  Here's a rundown of what I remember enjoying on my past visits:  -sangria: deliciously sweet and so easy to drink -tortilla soup: large portion, fairly tasty, definitely on the light side as I recall -mussels: very yummy -breakfast burrito: I wasn't able to discern what was inside but nice presentation -huevos rancheros: not very filling, but quite tasty -chips and salsa: I don't care for the chips but the salsa's flavor is good, wish it were thicker though -agua fresca mimosas (pineapple): a nice change-up to the standard sunday funday drink

QMDDs7hUzppKNvtevT2XeA.review_text: I had my first Hamburguesa last weekend. Holy. Fucking. Shit.  I only had a half of one because my friend and I were also splitting a lobster, but after my first bite I regretted not just getting 2-3 hamburguesas for myself!  As the guys from Epic Mealtime would say the gratuitous use of bacon is "Fucking SMART"!  But what I'm most impressed by is the bun.  How it's able to stay so dry and crunchy on the outside and the inside be like a Yorkshire pudding supersaturated in bacony-beef au jus is beyond comprehension for my mortal mind!  Cheap awesome sangria is the icing on the cake for a great pre-party meal.

Euv9MX5XY7bJP1BX-73zxA.review_text: Great time with my buddy at Don Pisto's, unique Mexican food and outstanding service. Shannon, our server, was so helpful and pleasant.  Try the pork chops, you won't be sorry.

eqI8S7aW1rZ3byEGafnCxA.review_text: Love this place!   Here's why...   1. Exceptional service!   2. AMAZING Sangria, get the pitcher for sure. You won't be disappointed.  3. Sharing is caring --  you can definitely go and pick a new dishes and share. The portions are big. One thing that I would have normally not had that was actually pretty great was the Poc Chuc, not sure how they make it, but it was delicious.   Make sure you make a reservation if it's a busy night, tends to get crowded.

dVydwMxJRzJRPTN7T21HHg.review_text: I would give this restaurant 5 stars for dinner and 3 stars for brunch (unless you want to have a boozy brunch, then it should be 4 stars). There are plenty of dinner options that are delicious. I personally love the ceviche and mussels with choirzo. The music is always fun and the waitstaff is attentive. It's a great dinner option in North Beach, although the wait can be long. The brunch menu is fairly limited and I was underwhelmed with the food. If I had been drinking bottomless mimosas or sangria, I probably would have enjoyed it more.

weovUlj9XrkQGJ-DIxaiqg.review_text: The line is long(Just go get a drink on Grant st.), but totally worth it!!!!! If it is your first time, you have to try the pork chop and Margarita!! Definitely the best pork chop I ever have!!!!!!

-lMmAjajUH6Q4TJMrrYFAg.review_text: So I'm gonna keep this review short, mainly cause my iPhone battery is under 10% (hashtag sadface) Anyways... the food was really good, 4 stars minimum, possibly 4.5. Here's the problem, SO OVER PRICED. 6 mini tacos for $38?! No thx. Then I ordered a bottle of beer for $5, ok that's reasonable, but she brought me out a can, ummmm... is this a frat party? Won't be back.

yWT3N03AGpcQnmFCT_gZYw.review_text: Went there for brunch on a Sunday... Good things:  bottomless drinks, great server, guacomole was tasty challenges:  food did not arrive all at once, this was the saltiest meal I have ever eaten!!!   Salty chips are one thing (OK by me) however the chorizo & eggs, hamburger, and huevos rancheros were extremely over seasoned.  I could not even finish the chorizo... portions are small  Perhaps based on the reviews, the nightly menu is better

-HrpBhN-1GoEX7TTXDT7jw.review_text: Red snapper in the fish tacos must not have been fresh. I had food poisoning. The staff was friendly though. The atmosphere was fine. Just avoid the fish tacos.  The food is expensive.  You should get at least 3 tacos for $10-11.  You get only 2 tiny tacos with little amount of ingredients.   I would not go here again.

l6Rb99rGbgjH3xYooyKaHA.review_text: Love this place! The carne asada tacos, ceviche and guacamole were delicious!!!  All a little spicy which I liked but my sister couldn't handle. The chips were perfect... a lil crunchy and lightly salted. Sangria was really good, but it will sneak up on you. Service was awesome, they frequently checked in to see how we were doing.  Will definitely be back!

F8VD3utHe_8nn3-DY8CS_A.review_text: Don Pistol was on my list of places to eat at and am glad I went there. The service is very good, staff is attentive. The ambience was a little loud which you might or might not like. We started with a pitcher of margaritas which was good - not too sweet and not too tarty, and the guacamole had the right amount of chunkiness and creaminess.  As for of the rest of the food it was OK. Ceviche had a sweet twist which I liked but it didn't have much fish in it, the fish in the spicy fish tacos didn't taste very fresh. The al pastor was pretty good but carnitas was a little dry.  Overall the experience was good and I would come back once more.

qBBlHfNQ2GZLzeu8nrWwYQ.review_text: Amazing!! As a transplant to California from the farm in Iowa I was really skeptical about ordering the pork chops. Most chops are thin and void of flavor. This chop was so big it allowed for left overs. The flavor was simply amazing!!  The chop was cooked to perfection (don't let s little pink in the middle scare you). The service was good nothing outstanding but good. I will be back!!

kpL9GJYRkE_DYV6dsM-Y_g.review_text: Great late night mexican food.  Small but interesting menu.  Loved both types of the pork tacos.  The fish taco was ok, but a little bland for my taste.  Good guac and tortilla soup.

ma5uLlD2GdGA9lpPGArAeA.review_text: Man the mussels with chorizo is amazing. Personally I'm never been into shellfish but this dish had change my perception of shellfish. They are delightful! We also had the pork chop they name it in a different wording i just cant remember what it is. But it is one of the juiciest , tender, tasty pork chop I've ever had! I recommended those two dishes!

PEp5ytDnZ34r4KQuab-aog.review_text: ATMO:  Like the wooden tables BUT, for the love of god... a little sound dampening goes a long way (they have none).  Even with few people there, it's loud.  GUAC:  Not as good as mine, but the best restaurant gauc I have had in Cali.  It's $6 but they do give a good amount (too much for 2 people and a meal).  SALSA:  Verde and chunky!  Tasty!!!  Great to add to the Guac! :)  CHIPS:  Thick, crispy, tasty!  FEEEEEEESH TACOS!:  I loooooooooooove di Spy-Sea Feeeeeeeeesh Tacos!  Plenty of feeeeeeeeeeeeeesh and oh so Spy-Sea!  Comes with a grilled pepper, tasty and spicy as well.  CEVICHE:  Chunky, tasty, (and thank god, they clean their shrimp!  no poop!)  OVERALL:  My favorite "Mexican" spot in the Bay Area!

lzbCO-IKLL1wEkbdww-Ktg.review_text: This place is everything you would ask for in the optimal brunch experience. Here's why:  1. BOTTOMLESS mimosas, sangria, and margaritas...and here's the kicker-- it's inter-changeable, meaning you can try one OR, which I personally recommend, try them all.  2. Super simple menu with things that you will definitely want to order. You can't go wrong with anything. I had bites of the breakfast burrito (OMG), the huevos rancheros, and the daily ceviche. All were delicious, flavorful, and fairly priced.  3. Free chips and salsa-- come on, everyone loves free chips and salsa. And the salsa is REALLY good and fresh, not out of a jar.  4. The service-- amazing staff who put off that hipster vibe, but are actually super friendly and hospitable. Our waitress bought us shots.  5. They also take reservations for parties of 6 or more. Or if you show up right at 11 when they open, you'll get a table no problem.  I will be taking all of my friends and even family here. It's a gem. What an awesome experience.

Lg3FZLzSs-RHmFrE_WMumQ.review_text: Came here with a party of 6 and we had an amazing experience at Don Pisto's. The Hamburguesa is juicy and as you take a bite you taste the bacon and onion deliciousness instantly. I also recommend the carne asad and camarones tacos!   The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it's in North Beach and parking can take forever (we literally drove for an hour before we found parking). I've only came here during dinner and it can get pretty busy, but our waitress was very attentive.

gY4VarSQDhGYAygl8sJNpw.review_text: Best Mexican I have had in a long time, the carnitas were great, the guac was money. Simple menu, upbeat environment. Tip: wait is always shorter than they quote especially when you order a drink at the bar while waiting, also there is a big downstairs area you can't see at the entrance

Lu5rKDLy6T2V-kqCO6UoSQ.review_text: Awesome! Kate ( bartender) did a fabulous job... Excellent service, great knowledge of the menu and took great care of us. The entire staff was super and made us feel welcome. Don't let a smaller size menu fool you... All of the dishes that we had we're well prepared, great portions , and we had a fantastic meal. Don't have any doubts about coming here for a well prepared and satisfying meal.

32M_2x0IzeIxcJucQp6BOw.review_text: Thank god for Yelp and for a fine establishment such as Don Pisto's.  Based on the amazing reviews for this place, I decided to check this out one Thursday night when I was in SF.  Dining solo that night, I figured it wouldn't be too hard to just sneak into the bar, grab some food and head out.  Well, I came in and found this place was packed!  The bar is relatively small and was quite occupied to say the least.  Nevertheless, I remained persistent and waited...and waited, and waited...for over 45 minutes before a seat cleared.  Now this was completely volitional and I was not expecting any special treatment because of my decisions.  Nevertheless, the staff was so incredibly friendly!  The manager thanked me for waiting!  The bartender (Katie), came out and bought me 2 Dos XX on the house, while I waited!  When I finally sat down, she promptly handed me a menu when I noticed a lack of vegetarian options.  No sweat, she came up with a veggie taco option for me and within 15 minutes I had incredibly tasty veggie tacos, a load of guacamole and some salsa to snack on.  This entire meal was billed at $7.47, which was absolutely fantastic.  The bartender introduced herself to me, was super personable and made me feel welcome.  Some of the best service I have ever experienced at a restaurant.  When I move to SF in a few months, I will be back to this place.  Highly recommended.

TVTFr5EDgMBbzIziRr98Eg.review_text: Very good.  The Mexican Sashimi was excellent. The Diablo prawns were good. They were so ducking spicy! I had to eat them with tortillas which were hot and fresh.

H3PFTHE-SL1gg2exnNy1jg.review_text: I tried this place several times hoping that it would just wow me. But the last time I went was the last straw. After over an hour wait, we finally got a table right by the drafty door surrounded by extremely loud and rowdy tables. I'm okay with noise, but this was to the point of not being able to hear the other two people in our party! Our waiter couldn't hear us order and had to lean in so close it was uncomfortable. We also had a vegetarian in our party who felt very left out of the fun as their only vegetarian option was sides and a few tortillas. It was a rather gross looking pile of beans and rice. So sad. In SF it should be better than this, at least provide some sautéed veggies!  Overall the tacos were not nearly as delicious as several taco trucks I've been to or a similar restaurant, Tacolicious. I probably won't be back. Sad :(

QOlY5FYliVVvkgqgtjdP_w.review_text: It's Funville.  Food is outstanding -- best tacos north of the Mission.  Great staff.  Leave your inhibitions behind and go bottomless -- with the sangria.

OPechgu5mffAaOdE9NU_Yg.review_text: After walking by many times and noticing the good vibes and smells emanating from Don Pistos, my wife and I finally decided to give it a try. The space has nice ambience with with dim mood lighting, great music, and big windows allowing you to take in the North Beach night-life. I've heard the wait can be long, but we went on a Friday evening and were seated fairly quickly with some of their delicious Chips & Salsa.   The service was excellent; friendly and attentive, and I always appreciate it when staff take the time to explain the menu and specials. Don Pistos seems like a great place for picking a few things to try and share, and we split the Carne Asada Tacos and a house specialty, the Pollo Asado. Both were fantastic, served with warm tortillas, and fresh toppings. I would definitely get either again if I were't so excited to try other things on the menu! Overall, a great experience and looking forward to returning soon.

KgzXLr6cGWS8NQXgpogDRg.review_text: This is by far my favorite Mexican food in the city.  Great location, cool atmosphere, reasonable prices, and first rate food.   I knew this place was good when I went back down to So Cal to re-visit my favorite spot there and it just couldn't compete with Don Pisto's.  I'm very thankful this spot is close by and is open late.   By far my favorite Tortilla Soup.   It is also a great spot for take-out as the food is still warm and delicious when you arrive home.   The owner is a super cool guy who really cares about his restaurant and his customers.   Like their green salsa, this place is HOT!

1fgqYpHnp4rJFv5LcQGMQQ.review_text: I'm going to provide a proof of my rating. Each category has a possible rating of (0-10) with a rating of 10 beings extremely favorable.   teh Facts:  _________  * Hostess says 20-30 min wait, but seats us in under 10] +8  * Bottomless Mimosas @13/person] +6       I       ^^^^^ Started out with a pitcher, once that was d'd then it was waiting for the swamped staff to give a shit and refill. Quality was good, alcohol content was "Average".   * In a party of 3, serve 2 then the third over 20 minutes later] +0   * Serve a burger of such awesome concept yet horrific prototype that I can only finish half (imafatassandalwaysfinishmymeals)] +1   _________  sum(x*) = 13, 13/ 4 = 3.25, 3.25/2 (convert to 5 star scale) = 1.625 ~ 2   In a nutshell, this place blows and I will not go back again. I do have to give thanks though, for it has enabled my fist two star review. Thanks Don!

-vz0B_1Qt2pOmXQNzc8FSg.review_text: Lots of fun with a rowdy group of ladies, and just as special for a late-night date night. You're better off hunting the Mission for authentic tacos, but Don Pisto's is a great spot to chat over good drinks.

5MCBLBxr10NLUKZ4AboAMg.review_text: Ah, Don Pisto's...you did us right, sir. You did us right.   For a group dining experience in San Francisco, I've had none finer. This is the honest to God fearing truth, my friends. I've dined with many large groups in SF as it turns out, so though I am not an expert in all things Bay Area, I've probably taken out more ravenous people in large quantities than the average Joe.   But we aren't talking about Joe. We're talking about Don. Stay focused, Colleen!  My illustrious colleague booked our group of 14 for the large communal table running down the middle and it was comfortable. Elbow room. Not crammed. Perfect. The restaurant is lively and tables turned over quickly, but our wonderful server didn't seem to care that we all wanted to sit and chat for a bit over multiple pitchers of MORE sangria.   Oh, the service. Please, let me tell you. By far some of the best I've had this year, maybe covering back to 2011. Sweet, sane, accommodating. Awesome. I wish I remembered her name! She was so great. Petite brunette with glasses. Also the hosts, owners, bussers, food runners...everyone we met was just so kind, really what you want to feel when you're dining and having a good time. I can' say enough things about it, but I think you get my point.   THE FOOD! Great down home Mexican with a bit of an upscale twist, but no so far so that you feel like "WTF, I came to eat Mexican!" This is Mexican. Tons of taco options (I really enjoyed the fish tacos the best), up to a Mexican-inspired burger (which was excellent), seafood, lobster, I saw a pork chop arrive, a burrito bowl option. I mean really...something for everyone, including our two veggie diners who were quite satisfied with the options as well.   SANGRIA. enough said. I liked it.   And the icing on the cake? They let my sweller then hell team bring a cake for my last dinner with them. How sweet is this!? How many puns can I cram into this paragraph? Through the grapevine I also heard that not only did they accommodate said cake (they do NOT currently offer dessert), but they arranged to pick up the cake for my co-workers, light the candles, bring it out at exactly the right time, take it back to cut it all up and serve everyone slices. I mean really? This is above and beyond, even for a place that doesn't serve dessert. Magical. It really was so nice.   So, cheers to Don Pisto's...I'd add you to my team any day sir, any day. Bring me another burger someone!   *def make a reservation, this place was swingin' on a Wednesday night!

t4o8mWvFo5Q7vwT94h1zaw.review_text: Just stopped in for drinks at the bar. The bar area is small and crowded, but it cleared out later as parties were seated.  This place is one of the few I've found with white sangria, and it was great.  Next time I'll have to stop in for food.

ITa3vh5ERI90G_WP4SmGUQ.review_text: Only an uncultured buffoon would go into a Mexican restaurant and order a hamburger. That's why when go to Don Pisto's, I always get the hamburguesa. I'm not sure what that word means exactly, but it sounds Mexican, and it is without a doubt a pile of deliciously juicy meat marinated in onions and bacon.   It's so tasty that my companions should count themselves lucky that I was able to curb my violent urges when they so selfishly and presumptuously assumed we were sharing. I suppose we DID agree to share when we placed our order, but once it was clear how amazing this hamburguesa actually is, I feel as though they should have known better.  Having eaten quite literally everything on the menu, I can also report that Don Pisto's  excellence extends to their service, their al pastor tacos, the chorizo mussels and especially the poc choc. The latter dish is a fantastically flavorful pork chop (orange chili marinade!) that I'm quite certain was named after the sound you make when someone asks you what was so delicious that you so rudely crammed the entire thing into your mouth, and you try and say "pork chop."  Don Pisto's is currently near the top of my favorite SF eateries, and I don't see that changing any time soon. I love this place. Bring me here, and keep your hands away from my mouth.

TNo1aPj4p9mXkHBR0uHfEg.review_text: Delicious food, really cute spot, good prices and good service. Get the Ceviche, you will not be sorry. Plus they have my favorite beer, Sol.

994SE9NAuXI24y8oCPR71g.review_text: My affection for Don Pisto's is marred by the fact that I'm a big girl's blouse when it comes to spices and spicy food. I'm building my resistance but it is a slow, and often futile, process. I know, I know. "Why go to a mexican restaurant then, Lani?" I hear you.   Up for giving most things a try I went along to Don Pisto's and spice wars aside, it is nothing short of amazing. My dining companions confessed pure and unadulterated love for the Mussels and Chorizo.   While I can't truly tell you about the food what I can tell you is their staff are hands down awesome-sauce. After giving a dish a red-hot go my searing mouth couldn't hack even the mildest of their dishes. At this point I would have fairly copped the staff reminding me where I was and telling me to "suck it up!"   Instead our lovely waitress went out of her way to have the chef prepare me a shrimp taco without any chilli or spice whatsoever. For this I am eternally grateful. While I didn't get to experience the true Don Pisto's menu, I enjoyed everything about our dinner there.

tn9J2lERXLTcsLJ8isqHiQ.review_text: If you know me, you know I live for fish and shrimp tacos. The tacos here?? The bomb!! I wake up at 3 AM craving them! Love the food, the staff rocks, the energy is amazing, and I whine when the wait for a table is too long. Outstanding! We took two of our friends here this weekend, and they really loved the food (fish tacos and the Al Pastor tacos)  and the environment. If you haven't tried it, stop waiting!!

H9LVW5HzFvsLzUxC-0W4hA.review_text: Hard to find if you don't know where you're going. It's literally a hole in the wall so just remember the building number. I really like the atmosphere here: dark, loud, crowded but still intimate and one of the few times I didn't mind having to share a table with two other people.   Never been a guacamole girl as I like my avocado sweet but Don Pisto's changed my mind! Best guac ever, even my Mexican boyfriend agrees.  Tacos are pretty expensive, to be honest ($9!!). I got the fish taco of the day and my boyfriend got the carnitas. They actually use the same sauce for both meats, and it didn't amaze us whatsoever. Granted, it's not an authentic Mexican restaurant so we will eat our tacos at Super Taq instead.  Service was great, our server was very attentive and kept checking up on us. I was being very reluctant to try the michelada here because I'm VERY picky about it and he actually brought me one on the house when we were about to leave. However, I was right to be reluctant; I would definitely never order it here. There were more tapatio and clamato than lime and salt. I like my mix the other way around.

PTF4cAh8X4C-btthtViVoQ.review_text: The food is great, service is great... but it's expensive; WAY too expensive. Same thing in the Mission costs half the price and tastes the same. Not trying to be a jerk here, just stating the obvious.

jPt7lUSUQx1h3VMokNSi0A.review_text: Violently ill after eating the overrated food there last night.  Sweet waitress for our large party, but trust me - you don't want to eat the sashimi here.   Thanks for the horrible memories, Don Pisto.

2TXi4leSwlMY8rmSKol9Hg.review_text: Move over Don Julio! It's time for some Don Pisto's! They were super crowded, but one of the girls in our group worked her charm and managed to get our party of 5 on the list. We waited at a cafe down the street and the nice gentleman called us within 15 minutes when our table was ready. The first thing I saw on the menu was Puerto Nuevo lobster! NO! Really? Because I plan on going to Puerto Nuevo to try the lobster, but I need to hire security to combat the drug cartels. Or maybe I'll just wing it one day when I'm feeling dangerous! I really would do anything for a great meal! Anyway, when I saw the Puerto Nuevo lobster on the menu, I was like diga me! Is this for real!? And it was :) This other random girl vouched for its authenticity!   So we ordered the lobster, the pork chop, the tortilla soup, and the micheladas.   Lobster: So delicious! Luckily, I've been to my fair share of lobster fests so I know what to do with a pair of those lobster cracker things [insert actual title of tool here]. I dipped the lobster in the luscious garlic and butter sauce and just let it sit there for a little bit. I then made my "Leena-Style Tacos" ohhh...the tacos! The corn tortillas were warm, fresh, and I think they were made directly from my Mexican grandmother (if I were to have a Mexican grandmother). They were lightly oiled and cooked just enough to melt in your mouth. I added the beans and rice, the spicy salsa, and of course, the lobster. Damn...that was a great taco.   Tortilla Soup: Because of this soup, my people will now have to travel all the way to Don Pisto's to get me this tortilla soup when I'm sick. If they try to hand me Campbell's or Progresso, that's just not gonna fly...the tortilla soup here is SO DELICIOUS! The flavors mesh so well together.   Pork chop: I was expecting it to be a little more tender, but the flavoring was delicious. It was a bit tough to cut but once you got that savory little piece of meat on a fork, MmMmM! Delicious!   aaaaand the micheladas were awesome and spicy! I was able to convince my table to get a round! They definitely come at you with a bang! :)   I can't wait to come back to this place!! :)

zvKDfdMm6K_xcc1i4GT5Yg.review_text: My girls and I begin our semi monthly all day drinking binge here at the Bottomless Mimosa, Margarita, and Sangri Brunch.  The drinks special is reasonably priced and they are not weak drinks at all. The waitress keeps em coming too, I've never had to motion to her for another drink. (I feel like such an alchy lol)   I usually get the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito and it is YUMMY. I also LOVE their guacamole, I find myself just shoveling it in.  I give this place 5 stars because I love the waiters and waitresses, the bartenders are cool, the owner is cool, the cooks smile from their little area as they work hard to get us our food fast, and the random music that plays is also COOL!

RLWwM7aInJxNoOPKuvAevA.review_text: The diabla shrimp is offf the hoooook and its spicy. I'm not much of a seafood fan so if I like the shrimp, it's gotta be good. Carne asada tacos were good too and so is their complimentary chips and salsa.

UXGlno5B0H05ZhUU3g9ZAA.review_text: They have the best bacon burger in the world!!! We have to get one every time we go.  -I've been here a few times and once they had the most amazing grilled calamari skewer served with a refreshing little salad.    -Pork chop was gigungo, juicy and delicious- a little on the sweet side though -mussels always good -any of the street tacos are bomb -BRUNCH the best- I don't even like breakfast burritos and I'd throw my grandma out of the car for this one!  The bottomless options don't help either or DO however you want to look at it.   -only bad experience was the elote was inedibly spicy but I think it was just our table, since everyone else's didn't look PINK with chile

sH_t9HCv3hIxVagul3J3gQ.review_text: The wait can be brutal and this spot gets ridiculously loud.  But hot damn the food is great!  Hamburguesa.  Poc Chuc.  Carnitas tacos.  Brunch is meh, but the 3 previously mentioned dishes are where you want to be.  Generally I don't hit up mexican restaurants for burgers or pork chops, but these guys pack a punch.  I'll let you test the pork chop and carnitas out yourself, but the hamburguesa needs some more love here.  Hamburguesa: no ketchup, just guacamole please.  Sure, I'll cut up this jalapeno looking thing and put it on for an extra kick.  Wow, this thing is now burning my mouth but it tastes too good so I'll just power through.  This thing apparently is marinated in bacon and onion for a day before cooking, does that even make sense?  I probably heard wrong.

kCqrQ-Ygdy7qUG_LVxAf0w.review_text: What a great spot for brunch/lunch.  Superb salsa.  Great tacos and the French toast is pretty good too. The sangria wasn't anything to write about.  Highly recommended overall.

_w8Ayuw2CTn6nYQtvpdDSg.review_text: Found this place through yelp while walking around near Fisherman's wharf.  All i can say is al pastor taco.  I dreamt of those tacos back in my hotel room and went back to get more the day before I flew out.  The meat was well flavored and accompanied the charred pineapple well.  Best street taco hands down!!  My only complaint is its not your typical street taco price...however, for the flavor explosion that I received, I would pay again and again.  I have this place saved as a must visit on my trips to SFO.  I did eat other things here...but once again, its the al pastor that keeps me coming back.  My other selections were less memorable.  The restaurant itself was small and quaint, and there was quite the wait when i visited.  The sangria was blah, the shrimp taco okay...but al pastor....man. lol

x4dMlJWPH-iaNqdDoRwmqQ.review_text: Bottomless Mimosas so sweet and darling. Guacamole fresh to order. Fresh salsa.  MUST HAVE: Al Pastor Taco Sonora  I have no idea how the waitresses are so skinny at this place. The food is amazing.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: sunday morning brunch...quick cab to north beach...seated and surrounded by bright windows at entrance level...bottomless mimosa $thirteen!...little weak, but tasty...fill 'er up!...few tacos for sharing...carnitas, carne asada, fish and more tacos...tasty and loaded...double tortillas separated and fillings split to make a pair to four tacos...more bite manageable...al pastor always the favorite and guacamole fresh...chips and salsa endless....finding don pisto's relaxing enough for a long bottomless brunch...cheers!

O7sHNLswNJaQ0AjtNVZlyA.review_text: Had a party there for a Thanksgiving reunion. Really great service and good lobsters.

j5huUZ0E3_s8-Dht2zvJcg.review_text: How was this past Saturday the first time I had ever been to Don Pistos? I'm holding this one against my friends in North Beach because this was a truly amazing food experience that I can't wait to share with other city dwellers...onto the review...  Friday nights always end in two ways for me:  1) I go to a great happy hour with my co-workers and get unintentionally sh*t-faced, then party the night away.  or 2) I go home and lay on the couch with my roommate and down 2 bottles of red.  How did this past Friday night go? Door number 2. My parents gave me these wine glasses that hold an ENTIRE BOTTLE OF WINE. Yes, an entire bottle. How could we not test this one out? Since it was a science experiment of sorts, it didn't feel so shameful. Anyways...  I woke up Saturday morning with a real headache. You know the one...Too much wine, not enough water, and there's never food around, so what can you do? GET BRUNCH! Weeeeee.  The roomie suggested Don Pistos and I needed a longer walk than usual (to air out my purple stained teeth ha!), so off we go.   What. A. Great. Brunch.  We were seated rather quickly by an adorable hostess who was not only friendly, but super accommodating. She found us a great spot, immediately brought out water, as well as Don Pistos's famous chips and salsa. This stuff was the real deal. It was a great green salsa with a spicy twist. If you have read any of my other reviews, you know I love the spice, so this was a great surprise for me.  Onto the real upside of this place: bottomless mimosas, sangria, or margarita's. And they're interchangeable. Umm, what? That's amazing. I'll have it all! The mimosas are not mixed with your run-of-the-mill OJ either, but this amazing pineapple-OJ juice. So bomb.   For my main dish, I had their famous burger. This was probably the most juicy, delicious burger I have had in a longggg time. It was topped with guacamole and had a side of radishes, that really made this burger pop. I would definitely recommend this dish, hands down.  Will I be back to Don Pistos? Absolutely.  Cheers!

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: My boyfriend & I had plans to go to the annual St Patricks day alley party at Taverna Aventine this past Fri, but we both decided to avoid the green-infested cluster of intoxicated people.  So he suggested Mamacitas, but lately I try to avoid the Marina.  It was his first time at Don Pistos, so he was excited when I suggested it.  Although the wait was somewhat painful, we both agreed it was definitely worth it.  Guacomole and the succulent smoky-flavored calamari are my favorites, but seriously anything on the menu is fabulous.  Our server was very attentive and super friendly.  Will definitely come back.

UsXqCXRZwSCSw0AT7y1uBg.review_text: Never have I ever... Don Pisto's edish  Never have I ever had a better group-dining experience.  Never have I ever had customized VIP menus for said group  Never have I ever seen one person eat so much guacamole so fast  Never have I ever drank so much sangria  Never have I ever been heard of lobster cooked in pork fat  Never have I ever had such exceptional casual dining service  All in all, a shining dining experience. The service was exceptional and the servers were some of the most pleasant I've ever encountered. If I had to semi-dig at anything, it's that I wish there were at least one veggie option that wasn't just tacos consisting of a tortilla, rice, beans, cheese and guac. A little more for the veggies, por favor?  If you ever have a location for a fun group dining experience, a rezo at Don Pisto's will have your menage a multiples covered.

hbkzlNSNMcXEL-h3jzS2SQ.review_text: This place is great if you are with a group of friends looking for a few good drinks and some good food. I think if you come here you are more paying for the ambiance more than anything. Don't get me wrong, the food and drinks are really good, but not amazing. If i could give 3.5 stars I would :)

RSGmE6ibwNvnmxxWeLC9lw.review_text: Bf took me here for dinner on a Friday night since he raved about this place to me for nearly a year.  We decided to get there at 6 since they don't take reservations for 2 people and it gets filled fast.  We were seated as we get there, the waitress brought out chips and salsa. The salsa was amazing, but the chips were deathly salty to me.  My bf loves salty and those chips were on the too salty side even for him.  We ordered guacamole and it was also really salty.  So double salt with the chips and guac was just a bit too much.   I ordered the pork chop but the waitress told me that they don't start serving that until 7 or 7:30, which really made me upset.  If you don't want to serve it early, then don't put it on the menu or at least label it on there.  Ended up getting the chicken and it was pretty good, had the calamari and though that was really good too.

8ZryN_S-n48g6rsa3W3QtQ.review_text: Sorry peeps, I just wasn't impressed. The food is just ok.   1. This place is cute and very small, so be prepared to wait at least an hr to be seated 2. Pricey Mexican food - I can get better tacos at the roach truck around the corner from my house. $9 for 2 tacos? meh.  3. Mexican sashimi $13 - fish was not a quality cut, I'm a sushi Connoisseur so maybe my standards are too high.  4. Parking is a B-I-T-C-H  Things I did really like about this place: - really friendly service - great ambience - good-looking patrons - always important in my books - awesome bartender - Nick, you rock! - open kitchen that is very clean  I'd probably go back for drinks but definitely not for the food.

Ed20T0T3jkAqVBBiyXju6A.review_text: Overall: 3/5--overpriced Mexican food, but the meat quality is superb  1) Guacamole: 2/5: It was bland and tasted weird. We asked them what else was added into the guacamole, and they said nothing. They use a mixer to blend the avocado together, so I guess the texture tastes somewhat like whipped cream (creamy and thick). I personally wasn't a fan of the newfound texture.   2) House chips and salsa were delicious: 5/5 Also b/c it was free!  3) Chicken Tortilla soup: 2.5/5: eh, not great; I would pass  4) Carne asada taco: 3/5 Why not four stars? b/c i felt the tacos were overpriced for what they are  Btw, super busy on a Wednesday night around 7pm.

QnoN3SNip50oBtgjXmfGYQ.review_text: Somehow Don Pisto's got a hold of my Spotify playlist because the music last night was on point! Give me an MGMT remix over mariachi band music any day..  Guac & chips- delicious Mussles with house made chorizo- def. enough for 2 people to share Sangria- not too sweet, hit the spot  Usually there's a decent wait but after 8:30 on a Tuesday there was plenty of seating.

tc_PhtkVpPlhUCSyb27pww.review_text: Great burrito, and mango margarita. A tad pricy for Mexican food, and the tacos are pretty tiny, but the food is definitely quality! Friendly service and they are willing to give recommendations for first-timers on the popular items. Great stop if in North Beach!

VEBbEios0TfDxGqSMmnxyw.review_text: Mexican sushi? Yup.  Delicious?  Double yup.  I had this place bookmarked to try for a long time but never stumbled by until my last visit to SF.  The place was still crowded late on a Tuesday night.  All of the other reviews talk about the long wait, and I can believe it.  I was able to squeeze in an extra seat at the bar, so not a big deal for me.  I had the Mexican sashimi and the tacos al pastor.  Al pastor is difficult to find on the east coast, and when you do stumble upon it, it's usually just ok.  This place made it and served it perfectly.  The salmon sashimi with lime was an excellent spin on a tried and true favorite.  I might be stopping by here for a snack again soon...

A52kKWKPB0oQGC25KXo41Q.review_text: What an amazing little hole in the wall discovery. Late night after going to the exploratorium and yelping around, we discovered this little gem. As packed as it was, we got seated right away and our server was awesome! She was well-knowledge in the food.  We ordered chips and salsa, ceviche, tacos, the asado dish and the tamales. Everything was flavorful and tasty and they definitely do not skimp on the chips and salsa! LOVE everything about this place and at the end, our waitress came and gave our table a round of tequila shots on the house!! How awesome is that?!   Must go here if you are ever in the area. You will not regret it.

_XFhTYX3wS0ftGc9u4pLqw.review_text: Oh Don Pisto's,  Let me count the ways ... (literally)  Your astoundingly friendly and helpful staff have made my experiences with you unforgettable.. whether accommodating for a party of 2 or a party of 15.. (you take reservations!)  You have never rushed me, even when my friends arrived much later than anticipated.   Your downstairs area (read: decorated basement) is awesome.  You offer AMAZING food at an unbeatable price. I have loved every item I've ordered, and my entire party of 15 did too! (especially the Mexican corn!).   Oh, just one thing: please improve your margaritas- they're weak (possibly because you don't use hard alcohol) and not up to par with the rest of your menu!  That being said:   To anyone looking for great service, great food, and a great time- I highly recommend Don Pisto's!!

F8qshXCfaYgMMTNoFWDM7A.review_text: I know my review may stand out as an outlier here... but I had a horrible experience.  Waited an hour and 10 min for table, when we were told 45min. Not too surprising for a Friday night, but what really bothered me was way the host handled it.  The Sangria was ok, but not very strong. The chips were very very salty (to the point where two people in our group wouldn't eat them) and there we no other appetizer options.  As far as the food, they said the plates were "meant for sharing" and they came out as they were ready. I think they really just couldn't handle the coordination of having everything come out at once.  And the final icing on the cake- I was horribly sick for 24 hours after eating here.  We won't be going back.

JsP6cf_-JLl_0R5eDW2rxQ.review_text: Oh, Don Pisto's, I will return.  I'm not shy about spicy food, but the carnitas had me literally sweating and I found myself actually scraping off the excess hot sauce from my carnitas.  This NEVER happens to me.  I mean, I'm a spicy food champ.  And even behind all that spice the carnitas tacos still had amazing flavor, and the amount of food was just right--not oversized portions like they try to feed you at so many places.  The ambiance is nice.  I added this place to my San Fran bucket list because of the Yelp reviews, and you all did not disappoint me.  I have now happily checked it off, but I'm thinking of adding it again.

_owMBYfzT9dO7FXGXXzXqA.review_text: After having brunch six or so times this past year at Don Pisto's, I just discovered my favorite meal.  The $8 breakfast burrito is a complete deal; it beautifully combines chorizo, eggs, cheese, salsa, and avocado, and it's the perfect size.  And the brioche french toast--though not quite a steal at $12--is big, savory, sweet, and yummalicious with bacon and maple syrup.  This combo was winning!

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: YUM YUM TAPAS and hipster ambience!  The AWESOME:  AL PASTOR TACOS ARE LIKE HEAVEN!! - let me just say that these were likely one of the best tacos i have ever eaten!  it was so juicy and full of flavor, without all the lard dripping down my arm (taco enthusiasts, you know what i mean!)  the added veggies have the right amount of flavor and crunch.    Prawns - OMG SPICY SALSA was so delicious, i almost cried!  maybe it was the heat, maybe it was the depth of the salsa and pepper flavor, whatever it was, i licked that plate clean! prawns were large, juicy, and on point as well!  The MEH...:  Calamari  good flavor with the use of different dry spices, but it was a very light flavor, you may want to eat it as an appetizer because the rest of the dishes we had were certainly more flavorful  Salmon Sashimi - a good cut of marbled fatty salmon, unfortunately it was just a little frosty, however the ponzu sauce was as good as it is in every other restaurant  Oh NO:  Pescado tacos  - salty, salty, salty.  unfortunately these tacos has nothing more to offer.  Service was excellent, i went on Halloween night and the young gentleman dressed in a cowboy  (?) costume was super friendly and helpful!  his service alone was enough to make up for the high priced tapas and long wait for the food  would i come again?  maybe just for the prawns and al pastor tacos on a cold day.

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: Not  just a tacos place, even if that's what they might be known for. In fact, I've never ordered tacos here because I'm not really a huge tacos person, and I still love this place. I recommend the chile verde chicken tostadas ... so yummy.   I've been here in large groups the two times I've been here and the servers are so amazingly accommodating. I usually dislike large group meals but at Don Pisto's it is such a pleasant experience and I feel very well taken care of. I love the chips and they make sure to refill them as much as you'd like....  kind of dangerous but I can't complain! Order some sides of guac, pitchers of margaritas/sangria, and you're on your way to a delicious meal.  One thing to note is that though they offer margaritas, since they have a beer/wine license only, the 'tequila' in them isn't standard tequila... it's some kind of wine. It's really good, but probably not going to get you as drunk as quickly. Prices are very reasonable, so I don't find this to be a negative.   They have a few additional items on the menu in the restaurant (not listed on the menu on the website), and they have daily specials.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: Don Pisto's is a Monet.  From afar, this restaurant was promising. High ratings on Yelp (I should've known better to be more skeptical) , it was packed , long wait time (should've eaten elsewhere) and when we finally get up close and personal inside, it's just a disappointing mess.   After a 1 1/2 hour wait (we only had a party of 5 so they wouldn't take a reservation) we were finally seated in a strange, stuffy downstairs area of the restaurant that smelled like dirty dishes and restroom. Why did it smell like that? Oh , because it's next to both those areas.  By the way, Don Pisto's used to be an Argentinian steakhouse (which wasn't so great either) and the inside is almost completely the same.   The menu is not that big so if you come here and it's busy, don't expect to actually be able to get what you want. They will probably be sold out of many things.  Our server informed us that they were out of the following things:  No more salsa No more ceviche  No more steak  No more lobster   Hold the fuq up. I said HOLD DA FUQ UP! Mexican restaurant without salsa?!? What kind of blasphemy is this?! It's like a Chinese restaurant with no soy sauce - UNHEARD OF.   Sorely disappointed because 1) my friend and i had our hearts set on the lobster and 2) this left our group with just brunch items and a couple of tacos to choose from. I didn't wait 1 1/2 hours for some damn huevos ranchero as my dinner so I had al pastor tacos. Not impressed. Oily and all, but no heat  no spice. Man these are not al pastor tacos ok.  Estas son chingaderas!!!  Oh. We also had a pitcher of sangria. It wasn't very good. As a matter of fact it was pretty weak, there no were chopped up fruits (was it strained out?) and only a lime in it.  I don't get why Yelpers rave about the $6 guacamole and chips. Really people? It wasn't worth the $6 nor was it that tasty. It reminded me of Chevy's guacamole!! Just for the record, I never eat at Chevy's by choice. Had to put that out there. I was just soooo hungry that I kept noshing on the chips before my tacos arrived. Starting to suspect that those who love Don Pisto's are also Chipotle fans *gag*  Many of us felt that the food fell short and really needed that salsa. How sad. I love al pastor too so I really wanted this to work.  Tasted the chicken tortilla soup. It was pretty bland.   Honestly, Don Pisto's is for people who are in the area, want to eat somewhere hip/trendy and don't know any better that they should probably visit a taqueria in the Mission.
