Let it be known that this was the 2nd longest I have ever waited for a meal (the first was for overrated hipster Outerlands) and it was totally not worth it. The food just fell so short for me that I don't care to find out of their salsa, ceviche, steak or lobster is any good. I mean come on, it's like finding a hot guy with a tiny lil one. Once you see that you're like, wtf am I supposed to do with that lil Vienna sausage? You dont go back to him , that's what! Sorry Don Pisto's, I'm dumping you.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: I thought the food was a solid 3*, not the amazing food experience that everyone seemed to have enjoyed.  The hamburguesa was good. The bottomless sangria was good, albeit pricy at $17.  The service was spot on. They kept checking on our sangria refills and brought out fresh glasses before we even finished the previous glasses.  It got really busy after noon on a Sunday, later than most brunch places in SF.

eDalDbIeIeJlZrSW-cpIIA.review_text: So I did end up getting to try the burger, and it is top notch. It has cooked bacon and grilled onions ground right into the beef, and it comes together perfectly. It is too bad that they only do it on Wednesdays.    In this update, I am still giving them only 4 stars, because the last time I went, I had been told that they discontinued the chorizo-braised mussels as a regular item, and it was now only a special. Honestly, without those mussels or the burger, it is just an average (and somewhat overpriced) Mexican restaurant.   I have not been there since, and will not unless I call ahead of time and am told that they have the mussels.

Pe90kBpjsWweBaHN_lNqHg.review_text: This restaurant is amazing. We went here for a late dinner and it was crowded. The environment was so nice and made you feel excited. We ordered salmon, which was covered by Chilly. It was so spicy but delicious. The ribeye  and lamb dishes were very good and went perfect with the corn and avocado. I definitely will go back here, and suggest my friends to come because this restaurant has a huge place for group.

g8TkB9kLwc5JUdLcAU1Tfw.review_text: 4.5 Stars! My question is when does a hidden gem cease to become a hidden gem? I think Don P might soon surpass it's statute of limitations on that moniker.   Walked in with 2 other friends on a Wednesday around 7:45 and had to wait around 15 minutes for  table. Oddly enough aside being tucked away into a side street away from the real hustle and bustle of North Beach the decor lends Don P to really actually feel like a hidden gem. Dark wooden tables accented by the brick walls with some abstract paintings gives this place a very seductive feel.   Chips: Right away when you sit down a FRESH plate of chips is placed in front of you with salsa. I think we went through 3 plates, it was impossible to stop. I worked hard to restrain myself.  Ordered family style: Taco #1 (Carne Asada: mesquite grilled steak, arbol salsa, onions, cilantro)- Delectable! Taco #2 (Camarones: Sauteed shrimp, garlic, red onion, avocado salsa) - my fav of the three. Perfectly blended and I love myself some advocado salsa. Taco #3 (Al Pastor: grilled rip chop, charred pineapple)- Just my own preference, but not a big fan of pineapple so it was just satisfactory to me. Friends agreed.   Hamburguesa (marinated in bacon and onions, guacamole)- Coming in my friend provided a lot of hype about the burger. I came here specifically for the burger and it lived up to the billing. It's a very simple burger, there aren't a million toppings inside and you can actually fit it in your mouth. What it may lack in toppings for some people it makes up in flavor. The meat is very juice and marinading it in bacon and onions is a genius move. I had a great appreciation for the flavor. The guacamole was icing on the cake. Simple and impactful... let the meat shine. My kind of burger!  The service was excellent altho the waitress found it bizarre when my friend asked for a different kind of salsa for the chips and tacos. It seemed like they only had one option. I prefer my mexican restaurants to have a full blown selection of salsa!

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Came here for a friends birthday with a large group so we had a preset menu.  There was some confusion about the number of people we had reserved and whether or not we were doing preset.  We got it straightened out with the host rather quickly though.    The food here is done well and has great flavor. I really like the squid skewer, but I could have been really hungry at that point.  The next two rounds were standard street tacos, frist chicken then beef, nothing special.  However, the next course kinda blew me away.  It was build your own lobster tacos (you are given a whole lobster for every four people).  You really can't hate on this cause the combo of sweet sweet lobster, soft fluffy flour tortillas, and drawn butter is amazing!  The finale was a grilled ribeye, again to share.   Accompanied with grilled green onions and guacamole.  The Ribeye is and will alaways be my favorite cut of steak!    The chips, salsa, and guacamole for the table were also really good. The margaritas were a bit of a let down. The atmosphere is very casual and can get loud, although the 90's hip hop in the background was great!

m-5xKFMINLJ5Zqu3eDx8nQ.review_text: I love Don Pisto's!! EXCEPT THE WAIT is very very long... I guess the food (delicious and of great caliber) and the attentive service (once you do get seated) was worth the wait.  Came here post-Oysterfest on Saturday evening at 7pm, with a party of 10... 8 of them being very hungry men! Our wait was 2 hours so we must have been at least 5 pitchers of margaritas + sangrias deep by the time we were seated for dinner. We were in the downstairs dining room. Group favorites were the hamburguesa, the carne asada tacos, tortilla soup, ceviche, and mine - the mussels and chorizo. So amazing, and the broth that it was seasoned with... such a sensational experience! I greatly enjoyed dipping my bread in that. Glad I met the Chef/Owner Pete prior to ordering... that was his favorite dish on the menu, and it's now mine.  I do suggest making resos, and getting there early if you want to covet a prime dinner spot during mealtime! Service was friendly, and attentive. Will certainly come back soon! And did I mention - their brunch features bottomless mimosas for a super affordable price??? Will have to hit that up soon!

BuRIFmd4Tt1dCm1RomG12w.review_text: 3.5/5. Came here after my meal at the House to see what all the fuss was about. At $9 a pair, these were certainly not cheap. Had to go with the al pastor, which the server strongly recommended. But the pork was much drier than I expected and the taco quite sloppy overall.  The dining area upstairs is dimly lit and quite modern/classy, but go downstairs where the restrooms and tables for large groups are and it's altogether different story. The place is dingy and loud, and right next to washers/kitchen. Kind of disappointing to see that they have a health score of 67/100.

f0wt5A7gSu0gD-9Dakv0Rw.review_text: The food is great but this restaurant is LOUD in the evening.  Even with 2 people you're saying 'what' a lot (and I'm 44, not 84!!)  I prefer this restaurant for lunch for this reason.

2eCOKSmVA8jEmXe32yDnZQ.review_text: Still amazing. Every time.   The 2 people who said the guacamole is bland... its purely avocado. Most places cut theirs with white beans, tomatoes etc. I can't believe someone would be upset by this. That blows my mind. They give you an amazing salsa with it ( ....maybe mix them?! lol)

aXuxyyTDs5RGoFrhajPLYg.review_text: I'm looking at some of the reviews on here and I'm astounded at the straight fanboy status I'm seeing about this place.  Yeah, I think the food here is good.  I've also had better Mexican food in at least 10 places in San Diego.  Bottom line is this: if you're coming to Don Pisto's, you're paying for the atmosphere as much as you are for the food.  I can't complain about the food itself because it's pretty fresh with good ingredients.  The chips are pretty good, although a tad bit salty in my opinion.  I appreciate that when you order chips, it's an endless supply.  Kinda wish guacamole was like that too though, not $6 a pop.  Diablo prawns were as expected - really spicy.  Not that I can't handle it.  Al pastor tacos and pescado tacos (choice fish of day was rock cod) were well-made and had high quality ingredients.  I just can't justify paying $9 and $10 for two tacos when I've had better and bigger tacos for half that price.  Again, when you come here, you're paying for the atmosphere.  It's a fairly intimate atmosphere with plenty of ambiance.  It does get fairly loud in here because the brick walls just allow sound to bounce off the walls and reflect back into the room.  If you're young and got money to burn, this is your spot!  For me?  A bit overrated and definitely overpriced.

yiRZCGwzebRM5mnLpYfFqA.review_text: i live in north beach and this is definitely one of my favorites in this area. forget the italian, come to don pisto's for some fancy mexican food. be prepared to wait since it's always packed.   here's what i ordered.  - hamburguesa - 5 STARS!!! delish. i always get this here.  - pollo asado - SO GOOD - pork chops - ok if youre limited on items you can order, pick the top two. these are good but not as good as the hamburguesa or the pollo asado  - al pastor tacos & suadero tacos - you should try at least one taco. i liked the al pastor better  - guac & chips

rztljGQvXSW8qAL9mJ3g3w.review_text: SO GOOD!  Everything I've tried has been delicious! the  chips and salsa  and margaritas are perfect, delicious fish and shrimp tacos, incredible sashimi (so good my bf poured the remaining liquid in his glass and drank it like a shot) and oysters (I had never liked an oyster before), and the lobster dinner for 2 was amazing! my boyfriend gets the hamburguesa and said it's the best burger he's ever had!   There's usually a bit of a wait to get a table, but it's well worth it and you can always get a margarita or a beer at the bar while you wait!

bJUjjS6oG9OHJsfY_Z8fIA.review_text: We were visiting SF from Minnesota where every bar/restaurant serves food well after 10PM. We were having a very hard time finding a place to eat after the night tour of Alcatraz and found Don Pisto's after searching over 20 restaurants.   We ordered a margarita (delicious), enchiladas and carnitas tacos and we were so glad all the other places stopped serving at 10PM  We had about a 30 minute wait and got a drink while we waited. The bartender and wait staff were very nice AND accommodating! Young crowd and lively atmosphere! Perfect option for a late dinner on a Friday night!

-imIGQsuvUSWVm1d4WsFJg.review_text: This place is fantastic. It is currently our 'go-to' place even with the wait. It's so refreshing to have actual non-taqueria Mexican food. While I'm sure the dishes are liberal on the term authentic, everything is great. Mussels in Chorizo broth FTW!

Nuk5xNvWvi0rq9N-JMmUdA.review_text: This shit is dank!! Lemme tell yall best taco spot i been to over my trip in sf. It was a party in my mouth fsho. The con is that its a bit pricey for some tacos. But definitely the salsa and chips were on point too which is why I gave it 5 stars. Tacos were just off the chain in another world. Bomb!

99cFO-gTl6JOOR_FxFjKQA.review_text: *:::Jenni LOVEs Don Pisto's:::*  I used to live a block away and came here all the time! Hands down best fish taco in town!  From girl point of view- this place is a Perfect date place, small portion food, relaxing music and their acid berry sangria just gets u in the mood - light and not too sweet!  Today's fish taco was red snapper taco for $11, it's perfectly cooked and well seasoned :) so juicy and crispy at the same time! LOVE!

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 5 stars, this is not your regular latin restaurant  If you order anything a definite must try is the Poc Chuc!!! slab of pork cooked and seared like a steak but better then any pork chop that I have ever had. I also got to sample there bacon infused burger. The burger was finely ground meat that slightly fell apart when biting into the burger it was good the bread was slightly dense not flaky decent size and delicious on every bite.  I would definitely go back for the Poc Chuc, we also sampled there shrimp taco, definitely also a must try they didn't give you the standard 3-4 smaller anorexic shrimp you get at other places they give you 6 full size shrimp on crack, the kind of shrimp you get at the fancy restaurants where they are litely seasoned and on a square white plate with a green circled line with a mint in the middle hahhaha. they offer you 2 soft tacos each containing 6 full size shrimp or prawn.  food ***** wow, definite 5 stars on the POC CHUC price $$ service **** very helpful staff ambiance ***** definite good spot for first time daters, small couple groups, or you can just kick it by the bar with the bartender named Kate, due to our long wait on getting a table they offered us a second Sangria on the house just for being patient. I guess the would be romantic setting, really dark inside, the kitchen is lively, flashes of fire from the stove 3 man crew in there. bar is about a 4 seater so you are up close and personal with the bartender.  I will be back for there POC CHUC!!! and possibly sample there lobster meal for 2

z7ZRRTYyXtNwmUYmOhzfMg.review_text: I've eaten here several times, and I've always really enjoyed my meal! On my most recent visit, I has the lobster special- it was delicious!! Brunch is also very good. This is a good place for date night or birthday dinners! Go early to put your name in if there are fewer than 6 in your party though bc the wait can get long. Well worth it though

lAr5mKUOTYWUhnIiwuqY3Q.review_text: Great food!   Very spicy but delicious.   I had the snapper fish tacos and tortilla soup and the margaritas are wonderful.  I don't like frozen margaritas and they only  make them on the rocks.  Get the guacamole with your chips and skip their house dip.   My only issue is we had to wait 1.5 hours and since they don't take reservations for parties less than six it was a long wait for four of us.  Get their before seven if you can and it might not be as bad.  My wife and girls thought it was a little too spices so beware if you don't like spicy food.  Maybe order mild if you can't take spicy!   I couldn't eat desert but I don't think they serve it either so not sure what that was about.

OH2fd_aapkX8JfMdi7q-1A.review_text: At the bar, drinking amazing sangria, perfectly spicy green salsa and amazing ceviche.  Bartenders are super attentive, hostess super nice.  Just on the first 15 minutes of being here, I'm sold on coming back.

JKGfEkxAcUJW4eMOzwF4tg.review_text: Now I know to make reservations before I come cause last time the wait for a table, which turned out to be a joint table with two others, was 2 hours!   However, the food was great and we ended up chatting with our neighbors. We got ceviche as a starter, then split an order of camarones tacos and al pastor torta. Food coma was inevitable!   Can't wait to come back

GhNZzIvDBGKcdEPFVT_eCw.review_text: We dined here on a Tuesday night to celebrate the  birthday of one in our party of six.  The food was fantastic! If you are here, try the bone-in pork chop; it's delicious. Plus, it's large enough to feed two people easily.  The chips, too, were superb; some of the best I've ever eaten.  The menu is small but nevertheless has a good variety.   Be cautious, though, that the upstairs dining room is small, and it is a popular spot with locals.  Reservations are recommended.  I think we'd not have gotten a table if we had not made reservations, even on a week night.  Be aware, too, that the atmosphere is incredibly noisy.  We had a very difficult time hearing each other and our servers.  Overall, it was a good dining experience, but if you're in the mood for long conversation, this is not the best choice for you.

vuIKA7OD86KTVuocN6WqpA.review_text: Don Pisto's makes the best hamburger I have ever had in my life.  All the food is good, and the service is fantastic. One Saturday night, we had to wait 20 minutes more than the maitre d' had estimated. We didn't mind at all, because we were having a great time at the bar under the care of the attentive and friendly bartender. When we did sit down , the host (Dan?) sent over calamari and ceviche - it was a complete surprise (and delicious). All the food (carnitas and steak tacos, chips and guacamole, two hamburguesas for four people was more than enough) was very good and our waitress was great.  My friends were talking for days about how unbelievable the burger was.  This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco - incredible food, energetic but not pretentious atmosphere, not outrageously expensive.  I can't wait to go back.

U58tUHFlDLTzqoRXeIdthg.review_text: We had a group of 13 and Don Pistos was able to accommodate us with a large reserved table downstairs. The hostess was patient even though some in my group arrived an hour late. We started with the Acai Berry Sangria (best I've had), Calamari (delicious, came with a sweet dipping sauce), Guacamole (generous portion)  Entree recommendations: -Hamburguesa: Flavor of the meat was delicious and came topped with guacamole  -Shrimp tacos: Two tacos served with a generous portion of shrimp on each. Good flavor -Pork chop (special): Very moist and had amazing flavor  Our waiter was attentive and cheerful and our chip bowls were never empty. The best service I've had with a large group. They also didn't tack on the automatic 15% tip for a group larger than 10.

fDP3tzea_LP2sn464v6QJw.review_text: "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" is right! I want to first start off that being first generation Mexican, I hold mexican fare at a higher standard and I can be brutally harsh with restaurants. When my husband suggested going here, I immediatly thought... mexican? in north beach? what? Since my first visit, I have been back here again. Great food! The ceviche and guacamole are awesome and so is the tortilla soup.

prTQohnz4S5r7x5h4YlP6w.review_text: The place is swanky, or maybe I've just been spending too much time in third world countries. Either way, I felt like Don Pisto's is the kind of joint where beautiful people go to drink sangria and do coke in the bathroom. And that's not necessarily a bad thing. The food was good, too, the carne tacos were spicy enough to burn the taste buds off my tongue and I also had an exquisite seafood skewer that was nicely seasoned. We sat downstairs in a darkened corner, and to my not-so-great eyesight it was almost a little too dark for eating but the perfect amount of dark for making out in the corner with a stranger. So, choose your own adventure.

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: I came in last minute on a Sunday night with a group of 8 and had the stupid amazing luck that a party of 7 never showed up for their reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.   The feel of the restaurant is great, very inviting and pretty authentic!  We ordered:   Chips & Guac: really good chips & the salsa verde that came with it was also delicious!   Raw oysters: on the smaller size unfortunately, but sooo good with a dash of Cholula.   Tortilla Soup for 2: Split into two bowls and huuuuge portions!  The broth was amazing & the chunks of avocado made for a really really good soup overall.  Could have had some more chicken though!   Red Snapper Tacos: the slaw on top was tangy and refreshing & i loooove fish tacos so this was a win!   Carnitas Tacos: deeeeeeelish! Just enough heat but not overwhelming & awesome with a little extra guacamole.   Sangria: Don't love sangria in general, but my friends wanted to split a pitcher and I joined.  It was ok, but not my thing.   Tips:   HUGEEE 32 OZ Coronas for $8 I think.  Great deal! The boys were happy :)   Our friends got the Carne Asada and one thought it was wayyyy too spicy for her, but others at the table thought they were manageable.  So, if you have a low spice tolerance ask for a side of sour cream with it!    Been on my to-do list for a while and did not disappoint!

Auhoeo3JEPMnAEqs--KwPw.review_text: Well it is true what they say about Don Pistos - it is pretty amazing!  We got there around 7:30pm on a Friday and waited at the bar for about 50 minutes.  They said it would take about that long and no big deal for us as the bartender couldn't be more friendly and attentive. We each had 3 of their fabulous margaritas and some chips and guac.  The margs are great and got us all a little drunk before dinner.  It is loud and crowded but fun and not annoying.   We were seated and had the little burgers and the shrimp tacos which were fabulous.  I recommend both.  The service was good and then at the end of your meal they give you a shot of something - by this time I was pretty boracha.  Fun, great place before going out on the town or hanging out with friends.  Enjoy!

f8SutCe86cqQZmOLF4jJ2w.review_text: Having a blast at the bar with Nick!! This guy needs to get discovered. Must add to ur bucket list: Sangria, Shrimp Taco, Hamberguesa, Salmon Sashimi, and Camerones. But must sit at the bar Thur, Fri, Saturday!

vguybeVhVDGETEm68XzggQ.review_text: Expect to wait.  Friday night - we put our names down at 6:30 and got seated around 7:15.  The wait time seemed to only increase as the night got later (around 7pm the host was estimating an hour and a half wait for folks).  Point being, be prepared to hang out a bit.    Margaritas are not strong, which is disappointing considering the price.  (Pitchers for $32).  I didn't realize it until after we had ordered, but they aren't tequila margs (no hard liquor license here) - you are drinking agave...  In terms of food, we ordered chips and guac to start.   I would definitely do this again.  The chips were warm and nicely salted; the guac was full of flavor and noticeably fresh (though lacking a kick).  We ordered three sets of tacos for the two of us-carnitas, fish, and carne asada; each set comes with two tacos.  The tacos are small, but pretty tasty (the fish was my favorite, though the carnitas came in as a close second).    As for the space, the place is loud and the lighting dim (I would say a little too dark unless you are seated near the window).   I love the brick walls and casual space (no need to dress up if you don't want to!).  Also, they have a small bar at the entrance, and if you can nab a seat, then you can eat/drink there without having to endure the wait.

DLoBXZcWZ6_GTzsb3SzRrA.review_text: Who would have thought a tasty, unassuming Mexican restaurant was hiding in North Beach??  What a pleasant surprise!  I'm not a big fan of North Beach (mostly due to crowds, tourists, and people who've had a few too many drinks) but Don Pistos is tucked up just past Washington Square which felt perfect!   The service was great, but the food is why I can't wait to go back!  Fantastic chips and salsa (a unique, green chile salsa!),  and a hamburger at a Mexican restaurant?  That usually breaks every rule I have but at Don Pistos you'll miss out if you don't get this juicy, tender, bacon marinated, guacamole slathered, chewy bun burger! We also shared the shrimp tacos which were great as well.  Not too expensive, and when we got there around 6:30 on a Saturay night there was no wait--well worth it!

bUZgfIr-hLAv230worYH6Q.review_text: Amazing and friendly service and a delicious burger! Will be back to try more of their menu. Yay for Don Pistos!

fcxVNd3NmFLrDb5Xx10ipg.review_text: Small, dimly lit place that was packed on a Wednesday night. The hostess was friendly and said the wait would be short. After 10 minutes we were seated. Started off with some margaritas which were average.   We ordered the chips/salsa verde/guac. The guac and salsa were fresh and flavorful. We also ordered the carne asada tacos. They were so good...the meat was very tender. We also ordered the diablo prawns. Again it was excellent. The diablo sauce had a kick to it...very well done. Lastly we finished with the pollo. That was also excellent. We left the place stuffed! Definite must stop for mod mex.

KNuRApD1Rx9XaHHDdSq2jw.review_text: Pros: - Excellent service and great atmosphere.   - Great tapas sized snacks - Totally get the Guac (its as fresh as you can get it) - Prefect chips, in that they are thicker, freshly fried, salty goodness - Pesacdo Taco is great with the avocado topping - Al Pastor is good with a salty and sweet with pineapple - Wild Monterey Calamari- not actually fired so I had to not look at it while I eating.  But still delicious!  Cons: - More than likely have to wait (but that can be a good thing too.  Just sit at the bar and enjoy a drink) - Small portions, so either pre-eat, or understand that 1/3 of your meal will most likely be chips - Kinda expensive.  But be willing to share, and go in with the thought you are enjoying one of SF best places to dine.

vaEA9GHrk99ECqkVLtbZNQ.review_text: The food was so delicious and the wait staff super friendly! I feel like a lot of Mexican restaurants only care about the main part of the dish but at Don Pisto's the beans and rice and salsa and chips and everything was top notch!

4iJlcmEQHLCfAWYcr3i9BQ.review_text: I am so happy that I live just a few blocks from this place. Mexican is my favorite and this place does not disappoint. Starting with the chips and guacamole and salse verde -- yum!! Great thick and crunchy chips without seeming too greasy and the salsa verde is so refreshing with a bit of heat (actually, everything has a nice little kick to it, so be careful if you're not a fan of spice!)   The menu is small but I have not had anything I did not like, and the company I have been with both times I've been here also loved their dishes. Chicken tortilla soup, shrimp tacos, fresh fish tacos, ceviches-- all very good! Cool atmosphere as well.

Pb_vpXkhbAqf8w4jdrEixw.review_text: Te amo Don Pisto's! Not your average mex restaurant! Def has a baja twist!   Really appreciated that the menu was tastefully simple and tailored for share bears.   Two of us shared and was perfect amount of food: Sashimi of the day (salmon): really fresh, had a small chile on top of each slice, sprinkle of cilantro and a twist of lime.  Tortilla soup: Very tasty Pescado tacos: Huge chunk of grilled fish that was perfectly cooked. Not like most fish tacos that are drowned in sauce and cabbage, but left struggling to find the fish.  Chips and salsa were fantastic! Loved their salsa verde! Perfect combo of cilantro and jalapenos.   Will be back for the lobster which was cooked Puerto Nuevo style. And probably to try everything else on the menu;-)  Great service! Loud but lively atmosphere!

sR2EMcrCZahvA8zOraeQnw.review_text: So I went looking for Mexican one evening, and Don Pistos in a dingy basement, with half the crowd pouring out into the street seemed like a viable option.  They've got an interesting setup going, an overpopulated Margarita bar, what seemed like multiple layers to their basement, and a pretty constricted menu - tacos, and a few main courses.  If you're a vegetarian stay away; but if you aren't, dig the hell in- they've got really good stuff. I tried the tacos and the mussels and chorizo, such a great combination. They served the mussels cooked in tomato and chorizo.

H06yvBfzMSK6VKvKl_PbhA.review_text: Fantastic restaurant.  The food is amazing -- fresh takes on Mexican standards.  They have a real charcoal grill that imparts delicious smoky flavors to most items.  You can order several smaller dishes for sharing in a group, which allows you to try more options on the menu.  The lobster, carnitas, rib chop, ceviche, and tortilla soup are particularly outstanding.  Head's up that there's almost always a wait and they don't take reservations for smaller groups.  The best thing to do is go early, give your cell number to the hostess, go around to corner to Tony Nik's for a drink, and they'll call you when your table is ready.  Best restaurant in North Beach, as far as I'm concerned.

dS-mwUacQsFQL4ej3QqtBw.review_text: Service was good and the waitress was friendly and helpful. She recommended a couple of things and I decided to go with the huevos. Food came quickly and it was great. Will definitely come here again.

cl9UzcV_D4RDDtMqh9XHdA.review_text: This place was absolutely amazing from the service to the food.  Get the lobster...it will be the best thing you've ever had. We made a 6:30 reservation and it was about half full, but the place fills up, so reservations are probably a good idea. My sister had the enchiladas which were also delicious, but I just can't say enough about the lobster!

E1oXdYvxl-d-4kraoQ6MeQ.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
E1oXdYvxl-d-4kraoQ6MeQ.review_text: Service is exceptional.  Food looks gorgeous, and the atmosphere is fantastic! BUT.....  My only complaint is that towards the end of the meal you can't taste anything other than chili - it just numbs all the flavors.   The avocado guac is also spiced (and I kinda think it should be alllllll about the avocado rather than the onion and spice...?)  Our group of 4 went for a variety of soft tacos (served 2-per-plate with generous servings) - grilled steak Carne Asada, braised pork Carnitas and the fish of the day which was snapper.  All looking beautiful, but any delicate flavoring was gone after a few mouthfuls as you could only taste chili.  Last time I came, and for the first time in my life I had to ask "which meal isn't so spicey?"  It was embarassing, I FELT LIKE MY MOTHER! - haha!!!  I like spice - but I also like tasting other flavors.  OK - enough ranting - it's a great place, and we'll probably be back again...

tTmeC4Gle4F5HIFMLULt6A.review_text: It's so easy to miss this spot because it seems hidden on Union, but once you go there, it will always be on your taste radar.    The hot chips and salsa are amazing.  You won me at chips. Fish tacos and hamburgesa are sooooo good.  The vegetarian plate of beans rice and guacamole is a great option if you don't eat meat or fish.

X1ADpQHrI5ZRSnFBtO-t8w.review_text: If we're talking about hospitality, accompanied by exquisite food you would certainly not imagine I was talking to a chef. I say this because I put myself through school bar tending and waiting tables and never knew a chef that was not a complete A-Hole.   However, Miguel Leon of Don Pisto's does not only pay meticulous detail to the cuisine he creates and manages, but he is a hell of a nice guy.  If I were to make pros to describe Miguel's extraordinary professionalism, I would say, "Emancipating, Prioclomating, Miguel Leon, you are the bomb. -Kaboom!!!!  Or I'm Spanish, "Gracias, Adios, Por Dicha Miguel Leon!!!!"

cshx9v2VfLxN89JabuOpeQ.review_text: I went looking for this restaurant because it looked interesting.  We were staying down  by Fisherman's wharf and walked up Columbus to find it.  I followed my GPS and stood in front of the Don Pisto's for a couple of minutes until I realized we were there.  There was no signage except the small menus in the window with the name on them.  Since it was dark they were hard to see.  You can find it by the address but you really know you are there because of joy and friendliness of the staff and patrons.  My companion and I are around 50 and we were clearly the oldest (by far) of the people in the restaurant.  It was crowded, but they took our name and told us it would be about 30 minutes.  At 7:30 that was a bit longer than we had wanted to wait but he offered to buy us a drink if we would hang out and wait.  We felt instantly welcome and decided to stay.  I am sure glad we did!!!  The food was amazing.  We eventually were seated at a table in the corner and ordered the guacamole.  Now I am an avocado farmer that has become very adept at making great guacamole, but theirs rivaled anything that I have made.  They also brought out a Tomatillo salsa that was outstanding!!!    We first ordered the Tortilla Soup which was very good with generous portions of chicken and vegetables.  It was well flavored but not real spicy.  An excellent way to get the meal started.  We then ordered the carne asada tacos and the pescado tacos.  The portions are "small plates" and the tacos came out very timely.  The carne asada tacos were outstanding with the meat well marinated in a rich sauce.  My companion and I both loved them.  Then she informed me that the I could have the fish tacos because they were too spicy for her.  OMG - the fish taco's were the best I have EVER had.  The sauce that they were marinated fried and served with was incredible.  While a little spicy, the flavor was amazing.  Now I have had all kinds of fish tacos over the years.  I have never had anything close to these.    All through the dinner, the staff was enthusiastic, attentive, and incredibly welcoming.  It is definitely a young crowd but the prices are reasonable, the food is outstanding,  The vibe and atmosphere is lively, welcoming, and the kind of place you just want to hang out.  I can't wait till I can come back here again.  Overall a fabulous dining experience!!

wN94uPjmcyn9yrzrSc7nkA.review_text: Thinking of an easy-going evening with yummy tacos, mexican sashime and refreshing margaritas, in a fun neighborhood environment? Don Pisto's is the answer! I love their creative dishes too (chorizo and mussels!). One day i will have tried everything on their menu...everything sounded great.

yGcGI8wsKgKmDI6ZasP11g.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night at 1030.  I wanted to try the burger, but they ran out.  Ordered the Carne asada tacos and the Pork shank (loin?)  BOTH WERE AWESOME.  A little on the expensive side for mexican food (2 tacos for $9?)  but it was packed with meat.  Very tasty.  The pork was very flavorful and NOT dry.  Chips and salsa was good too.  I will come back for sure.

h3yYR4rSvvNbrrTMCzSVrg.review_text: I absolutely love this place. Great service and good food.

NBNIUJj60tVBKvWHhy3egg.review_text: Brunch here is bueno! Came here on a weekend about thirty minutes after they opened and got seated immediately. I have to say, I almost walked right by the restaurant because there was no clear signage in front, only a little sign on the door but something told me to stop and walk in. The restaurant had low lighting but it really set the tone of laid-back atmosphere of the place.    I had to try the hamburguesa and of course, the bottomless mimosas. They were serving pineapple mimosas that day which were balanced perfectly with fresh bits of pineapple. The hamburguesa was actually not that appealing upon its arrival to the table as it was just topped with guacamole. However, I bit into it and the patty was moist, juicy and had pure bacon flavor goodness. My friend ordered the huevos rancheros and although I didn't get to try her dish, it looked really fresh and tasty.  Our waitress was really sweet and stopped by our table to re-fill our glasses every time she saw our mimosas running low. I hope to return soon to try their watermelon mimosas which I hear are just as good as their pineapple ones.

lNbHiIIoUsPbXLjDa03vLA.review_text: 5 Stars Plus for food +++++ 3.5 for customer service A bit Pricey for what you get  Here's what we ordered: Chips with salsa and Guac $6 (only thing not pricey for amount of what you get) Caraf of Sangria $28 Mexican Sashimi- $16-$18 can't remember  Tacos de Asada- $9 Tacos de Camaron- $10  Arrived at 5:30 promptly. Seated immediately. waitress took our drink order but never offered chips and salsa or Guac.. Felt that she didn't really care to service us... Since she was taking more care of other tables that came in after us. Got our delicious Sangria and glanced over to entrance door and there were people already waiting to be seated. Place filled up Fast!!! Food was delicious! Mexican that we are, it is hard to get moms approval on Mexican food and she was Super happy with the salsa and Guac! The Guac is simple and delicious and the salsa is Amazing!!! Put that sh** on everything!!! Told the chefs that their food was great and were super happy.   Overall- bit pricey but def worth it!!! Will be returning!

33yvn2vpWcl5NL8aoEllcg.review_text: I'm baffled that this restaurant has 4.5 stars. Service and cleanliness was great. Food was average at best. I consumed almost all their taco offerings and kept asking myself why are there so many people at this restaurant. I was underwhelmed and frustrated that Yelpers gave it 4.5 stars.   Summary: If you want good food, go elsewhere. If you only seek a clean place to eat, then go to Don Pistos.

JZMPR_463Jk-Y-eg79m4uA.review_text: i had zero expectations when i arrived at don pistos (what is a mexican restaurant doing in the heart of north beach anyhow?), but i was pretty impressed by the time i left!   a group of us came here for dinner one night (one of my friends is trying to conquer the 7x7 list and the hamburgesa is on it). it was pretty empty when we got there, but it got steadily busier and busier as we ate our meal. we all ordered the hamburgesa, and two of us also got the carnitas tacos to share. it's all meant to be eaten tapas-style, but the hamburgesa is definitely more than enough to feed one. it was pretty awesome - it's a hamburger patty with bacon and onions,  topped with guacamole. deliciousness!!!! definitely deserving of the "things you must eat before you die" label.  the tacos were quite good as well. those are on the smaller side, and definitely designed to be eaten tapas-style. they also give you chips and salsa, and the salsa is awesome! it's not your average variety - it's a very refreshing green salsa.  servers are attentive and friendly and the prices are very reasonable! the restaurant has a cozy, classy feel - it's not your average mexican joint.  definitely coming back!

qMC2yh1KqnzfkQMX2apQUQ.review_text: Dear Don Pistos (you sexy hot thing you),  You got me wet off your:  *chips & salsa (free): perfectly thick tortilla chips paired with refreshingly fresh, clean green salsa w/just the right amount of heat.  *elote (special $4): slathered in butter and cotija cheese.. c'mon now, what else do you need?  *fresh catch of the day pescado tacos: slaw resting atop grilled flaky smoky fish on a bed of dbbl-layer tortilla.. juices running wild.  *porky chop ($16): tastes like some damn good pork: tender, juicy, and melt in your mouth. it's a nice hunky size, but gimme some more!! served with refreshing, crunchy coleslaw.  *hamburguesa ($9): marinatined in B-A-C-O-N. tastes like smoky bacon, reeks of porky bacon, looks like a burger. o, how do they do it? best burger contender: next to nopa.   *sangria: tastes like cranberry juice.  *margarita: tastes like lemonade.  *grungy/cute servers-odd mix.   *you're economical, but you know how to please like a million bucks and hit all the right spots.  thank you, can't wait for our next rendezvous. same place, same time?? maybe next time, we'll add a lil lobster to our *four play. ;)  XOXO.

aa4mixen6vunDF4X3GqV0Q.review_text: Amazing brunch. They were way understaffed and still good service. Unlimited homemade Chios and green chilli salsa.   Huevos rancheros was served uniquely but delicious. Huge margaritas. Bottomless for ,17 bucks. Great atmosphere. Mostly twenty something. Older couples and families avoid . great spot

g7E490CGYPEYgDmLaKt95A.review_text: Don Pistos has the best carnitas tacos! They also have good micheladas! This is a must go to restaurant in SF! Delicious!

NtdgSnyF_xhFjtqAm0eTSQ.review_text: This was one of those dinners that took about 3 hours from start to finish (8pm, no reservations made, 3-person party, Tuesday night). An hour long wait, happily occupied by Micheladas (spicy tomato juice + mexican beer + lime juice + salted rim). We started with the guacamole and chips, the guac was creamy, slightly spicy and topped with cilantro... delish! I ordered the Al Pastor Beef Tacos with Pineapple and a side of the pinto beans. Everything was amazing. My friend ordered the chicken tostadas which were incredibly flavorful but not overpowering, a big hit!   The service was very friendly but I wish they moved the dinner along a it faster. Overall I loved this place and wouldn't hesistate to come back!

4XMONrgt-kBxGyQEok4M6A.review_text: Let's face it, I'm a Mexican food junky/snob. I love menudo on Sunday mornings and homemade enchiladas, made by mom, of course. So sizzling platters of stringy, over cooked shrimp and tasteless strips of flavorless beef served with mashed beans and orange rice is definitely NOT my bag baby. I dig really good Mexican food and my bar of measure isn't a super burrito down in the Mission at 2am.   Located in North Beach, typically known for Italian cuisine, Don Pisto's is one of those perfect "stand out's" in a touristy neighborhood geared for out-of-towners. Just a block away from Washington Square on Union Street, parking might be a chore but in that neighborhood the walk is picturesque to say the least, but pay attention! Don Pisto's sports no signage of any kind so aside from a group of folks waiting for seating in front of a mostly plain storefront, it's fairly easy to miss.   They do not take reservations for parties under 6 so it's not unheard of to wait for up to an hour for a table on the weekends and around 15-25min on average during the week but that's cool, sit down and relax with Pete. The owner/operator and will make with a story or two over a drink. The acai sangria is great but as they have no liquor license the Margarita is wine.   The feel of the dinning room is rustic and simple-elegant. Brick and mortar walls, heavy, stressed wood beams, cast iron fittings, splashes of red and black make for a warm and comforting experience while dining. Heavy, high backed, wooden chairs accompany candle-lit white clothed table tops with roll-up's.  You are initially greeted with the requisite chip and salsa combo but unlike your typical taquria, the salsa is a tangy green tomotillo sauce that is acidic, mildly spicy and slightly sweet. The tortilla chips are nice and warm, light and crispy and are seemingly made for the singular purpose of scooping. The best usage of this purpose is scooping gobs of guacamole in your mouth. Bright green, creamy and chunky, the guac is a perfect match for the slightly salty, crispy goodness of the chips as you peruse the menu.   Simple. Thats the best part of this menu. Simple. No confusing combo platters. A Burger cooked in Bacon grease. A steamed lobster dinner. A carnitas plate. Taco's! Taco's, I'm not going to lie. I rarely get past the taco's. The fish taco's are downright vindictive in their tender simplicity. The fish changes frequently but on this trip they were offering Lingcod, pan seared to perfection and lightly dusted in secret spices it's finished off with a light slaw. The al pastor, made with center cut loin, is tangy sweet with a spicy smokiness and delicately tender. I have a hard time ordering anything else.  To be honest, I'm all about brunch. The Mimosas are made with agua fresca, basically just a shot of watermelon juice instead of OJ in champagne. Let me tell you, so much better than the OJ.  They hand make flower tortillas that are as light and flaky as pie crust, perfect with the chorizo and poached eggs.   Don Pistos is a locals hot spot in a tourists driven Italian neighborhood. They serve excellent food from south of the border with fresh local ingredients, bold flavors in an elegant style, distinguishing themselves from sizzling platter chains and burrito shops. Don Pistos is fun and inviting with excellent service and welcoming ownership. It's a great place for authentic cuisine and a local feel. Be sure to hit brunch on the weekends, try the al pastor -its the best in The City, and ask Pete to do "Thai Mike" it's hysterical.

c5x707w3UKiVIt3OgpU8fw.review_text: Wow - incredible tacos and pretty good margaritas = awesome dinner. Sad to see some 1 stars posted, we had a great experience. Fish and short rib tacos were our favorites.

976xRULBn5e3vEJN1Z66Gw.review_text: I went here on a Sunday morning with 3 friends after a night of drinking. Bottomless mimosas, sangria and "margaritas" (made with agave alcohol that was somehow not tequila but still worked very well) for $18. You can mix and match too, however there is an hour and a half time limit. At first the time limit thing seemed annoying but as my hangover faded and my day drunk began i realized there was WAY more then enough time to finish as many as could be handled. The food was good but I only tried my friends because I felt too sick to eat a whole meal. Adrianne was our server, God bless that woman. The last half hour of our brunch the place was pretty packed. Our table was a loud drunken mess, laughing and saying way too many bad words...loudly. Adrianne never even told us to be quiet. She made sure our drinks kept coming then sent us on our merry way back out onto the streets of San Francisco. Next time I'm in town Don Pisto's will be where I spend my sunday morning. So much fun :)

md_-_X8-sqNpc_pO01rmgg.review_text: Really good. For sure a cut above your normal Mexican place. Their green salsa is really nice. Just enough heat to get your attention but also tons of fresh flavor. Nice house made chips, almost pita-ish. The guacamole is super creamy and delish. I had the pork chop. It's a) huge and b) fantastic. Great char on the outside but just still pink on the inside. So, safe but super juicy. The cucumber salad was a nice surprise. I expected it to be a waste of space. But it really had a lot of flavor.  Interesting music when we were there. Old school gangster rap. But it was made it a little extra fun.  Great helpful wait staff.   Definitely recommend.

t9Bh8B5a5QUS9G_8OPlm2g.review_text: Came here for a friend's low key bachelorette.   There were 10 of us and the waitress was amazing. She was helpful and friendly.  They kept our drinks (including water) filled and overall just attentive.   The food was really good.  I dropped a star bc I didn't think the alcoholic drinks were anything special (wine beer sangria and margaritas were the options)  we had pitchers of margaritas - and I don't think these are from scratch.

Mz-WUZj-AkXsr_kOUE-71A.review_text: Wow, where did this place come from?  I frequent SF fairly often for work and have been told about a lot of Mexican restaurants but this one was new to me.  I was told they don't take reservations so we arrived early and had no problem getting a table. The service was prompt and friendly, and we were given a lot of suggestions since it was my first time.  I really love ceviche so that was one of my choices. It was extremely fresh with good chunks of seafood (delicious scallop!) and avocado. The street tacos were huge and very flavourful. For these type of street tacos, I prefer Por Que No in Portland, but these still hit the spot for me.  As a main, we shared the chorizo and mussels. The portion was generous and there was a good heat in the flavour of the dish, but I wasn't a fan of the little bits of chorizo sprinkled throughout the dish.   I saved room for dessert so I was pretty disappointed and surprised to learn they don't serve any!  Oh well, North Beach has plentiful places for dessert so we went elsewhere. All in all, great experience and worth a repeat if only for the ceviche alone.

BPGiqLVFm6qb_Y5XzXg3-g.review_text: Came here for brunch - the staff was fabulous, but everything was only okay. The music playing in the restaurant was super loud and made it hard to hear the waitress or carry on a conversation. The food was good, but the portions were small and I felt like they just tried to fill you up on chips. Good about gluten allergies.

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text: We were suppose to go for a Italian for late lunch in North Beach. Well, what else do we want to have in NB? There are few pseudo Japo in NB, but I've never interested in.  It was an accident. We just saw a place has no sign. My gf said that this is a new Mexican place on NB. So, we went.  I got the Tortas. Hamburguesa / 10.00 marinated in bacon and onions, guacamole w/ Grilled jalapenos and radish. It was a dripping juicy hot burger! Awesome!  1st time ever for me eating a burger without ketchup.  I don't even remember what my gf was having. I was totally gone to heaven when I was having the burger. I think she got a some shit like pork tacos. I didn't care about the tacos because I am a die-hard taco truck fan, and I do not like a high-end-taco-places like upper Fillmore and Marina Cow Hollow. Well, whole thing in the MCH is very slutty.   We were eating tortilla chips like crazy hen and rooster because the chili verde salsa was incredibly addicting. This is such a nice change and very unique idea for NB. We'll be back.

aCN8B0U9kO8gSGvMwArJUw.review_text: My wife and I went to SF on our honeymoon (woohoo!) and had Friday brunch at Don Pisto's while we were there. It was the best decision of our married life thus far.   Our food was delicious, our server was incredibly attentive - not once allowing us to run out of bottomless mimosas or sangria, and there was no wait to be seated. The chips, salsa, and guac were particularly delicious. We literally scraped the bowl clean. Did we spend well over $100? Yes. Was it worth it? Definitely!  Bonus points for our waitress scooping up the little lizard that had snuck in and escorting him outside in a napkin. Too cute!

14QswYNNZQzIwRlFY0Lapw.review_text: Never had mussels before in my life. My friend told me this was the place to have it first. THEY DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!! AMAZING! My brother had the pork chops and gave me a piece. Melts in your mouth! I WILL BE BACK... and quite often!

WzpS9g-sbaXfEqoaYLgPfw.review_text: So worth the wait! (In addition to the wait at the restaurant itself, I've been waiting 3 years to try this place!)  The Highlights: - Nick the Bartender makes pitchers of fantastic + strong Margaritas!!! - The Pescado Tacos (marinated in this aMaZiNg sauce with a kick - much much better than the Carne Asada Tacos) - Bacon-fat-infused Hamburguesa (it's literally the flavor of bacon with the consistency of a juicy burger) - Dessert Shots! (After two pitchers of margaritas for the table, these tasted like chocolate milk (although composed solely of vodka, I think). They were delicious!)  Would skip next time: - The Pork-fat-infused lobster (sounds winning, I know, but the portion just didn't make it worth the price) (although if you could order just the garlic butter that accompanies it - I'd highly recommend that) - The Carne Asada Tacos (although the meat is tender, the flavor just doesn't compare to the Pescado Tacos - put your money where the flavor is)   But yes sir-ee... there will be a next time!  HOORAY!

LDPVkNDhdYNw1HlXAEEKsw.review_text: The carne asada Tacos were Good.  The meat tasted great but the tortillas were greasier than they should be.  A bit expensive at $9 a pair but everything tasted fresh

PF9VADp5fMb7IMYXQTOFGw.review_text: Loved the food and service. Sit at the bar.. Nick the bartender was a great guy.  Made our experience  Mexican ceviche.  Calamari. Pollo asado. Done. So happy

aElfl4NXqEritqTLGhgcRg.review_text: Came out to SF and was gunna go to Mama's but the line was really long. Walked around and ended up at this place and I'm glad I did. Staff was very accommodating and genuinely good people. The food was great as well! Alvin and Sarah, thanks for making my birthday in SF memorable. You all are good people and that's what I like about the restaurant besides the food, the people that work there that genuinely love making their customers comfortable and happy! Thanks again!

f2PvxaRfZ3c0vJm4Q0rJTA.review_text: Unbelievably good. The sangria is something that you must get.  The restaurants atmosphere is sensational and I would most certainly recommend this place to everyone.

UStq-fZDrIr7Yv-oRn4JgA.review_text: Everything is great here. Get the spicy salmon tacos to start off. Then wash it down with a cool margarita.  I've only tried the chicken and pork chop - they're both amazing. We didn't get desserts but had more margaritas.  I was lucky not to be in the lineup. Get here at a decent time or call ahead. They don't take reservations.

IB0_DRx-L8O1MtzwPF-lQw.review_text: I f*cking love this place. Am I allowed to say that? Great drinks, great food, in a chill setting. We had a huge party, so they put us in the semi-private room in the back, with big picnic style tables with benches. Our server was pretty attentive and checked in with us often.  The chips here are really really good. The salsa might be a bit too spicy for my taste, but the guac is fantastic. Even though I knew I would be stuffed, I still couldn't stop. I was expecting a lot of fancy Mexican food, but was pleasantly surprised by the spread. There was sashimi, tacos, and mussels, and all were fantastic. The star, though, was the last dish we got. I'm just gonna come out and say it. Favorite pork chop ever. Yes, better than Nopa's. It sounds like blasphemy, but it's true. Super moist and flavorful...I'm drooling just thinking about it.  I hear they have a really great burger as well, so I will need to come back and check that out.

CLO6v5VzafvI4Oa0DpIAcQ.review_text: I've heard a lot about Don Pisto's but never made my way to north beach to actually try it out...until now. What a pleasant surprise! I went on a week night around 8pm and was able to be seated right away, no reservations. The hostess was super friendly from the get-go. And the service only got better as the night went on. Our server, her helper, the bartender, everyone seemed to really like working there! As well, the food is amazing. Everything from the complimentary chips and salsa to their tacos and pork dish... So yummy! Everything was well seasoned, perfectly cooked, and above and beyond my expectations. Thanks for a great meal!!

0Lio5NNlqy7OX6TUWx47Uw.review_text: Truly over rated...  Let's start wit the positive comments...the owner is extremely nice and accommodating.  He noticed that we barely touched the chicken tortilla soup we ordered so he came over and asked if everything was ok.  So we were honest and told him it was horrible...it was basically an over salted broth with shredded bland chicken and big chunks of avocado.  He was completely apologetic and took the soup back and removed it off our bill.  That was a really nice gesture!  Unfortunately, as nice and friendly as the staff was there, the food was just so so.  The shrimp tacos had a nice sauce but shrimp were small.  The carne asada tacos tasted like ground beef.  The portions were small and tacos were way over priced at $4.50 each for a small street taco.  For similar trendy mexican food, I would go to tacolicious as they are pretty authentic.   But otherwise I would stick to going to the mission...

sP9W9AwHWPDVA1W11dcW_A.review_text: I came here for my buddies birthday dinner and met up with a large crowd downstairs. It was one of those evenings where you show up somewhere alone only knowing 1-2 people, and end up leaving meeting some great people you would like to keep in touch with.  I realize that has nothing to do with the food here, but if the food was terrible, that may have not been the case. The drinks, the service, the food and the ambiance-- Everything worked together to create a wonderful, warm and memorable evening. Everyone wowed at the food together, clinked their delicious drinks together and enjoyed the wonderful atmosphere here.  The downstairs impressed me for one big reason... There was one table near us, and we were in a big picnic table style set up since we were a large party. And that was it. They could have easily fit in one, maybe two more tables down there. By keeping it emptier, they made it less cramped, more spacious and it seemed less like a busy restaurant and more like a friends house.   We ate tacos, and lobster was brought down which I was unable to get my hands on... but everyone loved it. The tacos were delicious! We all shared their Margaritas and Sangria which were also great!  That was my first time there, and I will most definitely be coming back! A great place to bring friends, people visiting from out of town, or come here on a date (as long as you don't want intimate settings), but are looking for a more fun atmosphere.  If in the area, come try this. If living 3 hours away, come eat here, its a great spot!

WH07rKuOMKxTQWf007MbJw.review_text: Where to start.... food was good, but just to spicy. I would recommend to get the shrimp tacos with a pitcher of margaritas. The waitress was so nice and helpful with the menu. The only bad thing about this place was the host. He was really rude and did not look happy at all.  Overall if you love spicy food this is the place for you.

cY4ogmXSEMfQnQXV7GMJmg.review_text: Some of the best tacos I've ever eaten. Ever.   The only complaint I have about this place is that they don't take reservations. However, I do recommend that you come here for an earlier dinner to avoid waiting. My boyfriend and I arrived at Don Pisto's at around 7pm, and only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. Not bad at all! Especially since we had sangria and margaritas at the bar while waiting.  Chips and guac are to die for. Best taco: Al Pastor. Hands down. The camarones tacos are amazing as well.  Cool vibe, good music (90s rap, what more could you ask for?), all around amazing place to dine. Must go!

9U30DANobkrn3Zlu6T9p6Q.review_text: I came in here this past week with a group of 16. I'm not generally blown away by most Mexican food, but Don Pisto's is incredible. Chips and guac are addictive to a fault - you will easily ruin your meal. We ran through the better part of the menu - Hamburguesa, Salmon Sashimi (exceptional), Chicken and Carne Asada tacos (enjoyed the latter). The most ridiculous part of the meal without question were the Chile Verde Chicken Tostadas.  Get here - ASAP.

IFXoVwdUMcCuumUlSbe9Zg.review_text: Looked for a highly rated taco spot after a Giants game and stumbled upon Don Pistos. I was completely impressed. This place embodies Mexican authenticity. The brick walls and Mexican  Coca Colas made me feel like I was make in grandma's neighborhood. Service was prompt and friendly and the al pastor tacos with charred pineapple were amazing! Great ambience, and great variety. You can go from tacos and a coke to Don Perignon and Lamb...I'm definitely coming back.

LFzlAyoMVkyzjw7WSLo1eg.review_text: Everything about this little place is amazing: fresh ingredients, friendly staff, good vibes, open kitchen, great music. Venue is small and cozy. Everyone in the restaurant - patrons and staff included - seem to have a good time while there.   Simple, clean decor. Very small and fills quickly - about 6-7 bar seats if you have to wait. Make reservations, otherwise about a 45 minute wait. Although it is small, most of the people in there came in large groups, so it is do-able for large (8-10) groups.   Order a margarita. It was one of the best and freshest I have ever had. No mixers here, they definitely use fresh squeezed lime juice and simple syrup - not too sweet. If you like Corona, order a 32 oz bottle for $9 - great deal! Food is amazingly flavorful and authentic. However, the food is very spicy, not for the heat-sensitive palate. Heat-seekers will love it!

piJBDHkAb3eBLBryJIwBtw.review_text: I dig the look and feel of Don Pistos.  The menu is simple, but everything on it is great.  I generally go for the tacos or the hamburguesa (which has a ton of guacamole).  If I'm there for brunch, I usually order the bottomless mimosas and the huevos rancheros with chorizo.  Good date spot, or good for large groups (they have tables downstairs).

RXBmIe79NWIje_vmzJEB1w.review_text: the food was great! -but just know that if you are ordering the tacos, they can get pretty spicey, & they will definitely clear your sinuses if you know what I mean (;  also, I absolutely loved their chips & salsa - we couldn't get enough of it.   cons - don't plan on having a very fluid conversation . . . it gets so loud & you will literally have to yell to the person right next to you in order for them to understand what you just said.

CCNT9Hx9E2iLoLQ3zT6Hxw.review_text: I was really excited to try this place and was super pumped not to have to wait for a table since my boyfriend and I grabbed an early dinner.  Highlights: guacamole & AL PASTOR TACOS. These were one of the best tacos I've ever had.  Not so great: the sangria & the carnitas tacos. The sangria was kind of bland and the carnitas tacos didn't have much to offer- or maybe I was so amazed by the Al Pastor tacos that I expected greatness from these as well.  Either way, I will definitely be coming back at some point!

OpWfl5oWkFUiQmKjyfB-Lg.review_text: I've been here a couple times and have never been let down.   They have the freshest, fruitiest sangria and their tacos are hands down THE best I've ever had. My favorites are the shrimp tacos because their shrimp are super juicy and the al pastor tacos cuz they have a little bit of a sweetness to it from the pineapple.  You get 2 small tacos per taco order, but they really load the tortillas up so they are enough to fill you up. Oh and they give you their homemade chips and green salsa while you wait. I could eat those allll day. So good!  They don't take reservations for parties smaller than 6 people, so expect to wait a while on weekend nights. You can always wait for a seat to open up at the bar and order from the full menu there as well if you dont want to wait so long and dont care about where you're sitting.    Great place for girls night out, guys night out, a birthday party, and even a family night or brunch (if they are hip enough).

6zDBoHgoN2NVDOce9CPmKg.review_text: Wow, what great food.  Friends from out of town wanted to go to a nice sit down mexican restaurant.  Where do you go for that?  I always go to taquerias, so I looked on yelp and found Don Pistos.  No sign outside, agave margaritas, a simple, but out of the norm menu; I was nervous that I would going to disappoint my friends.  And they were apprehensive about the place.  Then...then we tasted the food.  Muscles with chorizo, tortilla soup, ahi tuna, pork chop.  It was agreed that no one had ever tasted a better pork chop.  The hamburgasa, has bacon in it.  Ok bacon in a hamburger, pretty typical, until you try this juicy compelation of beef, pork and avocado.  Don Pistos has made me think differently about Mexican food.

NK5nADZUYGor1Bknp1CrLw.review_text: Came here on a weekday around 730pm. The wait was 1 hour?!?! Fortunately 3 bar seats just miraculously opened up right when we walked in... BOOM!  Bartender is a SWEETHEART, i wish i got her name so I can give her a shout out here. She's helpful, sweet and attentive. She let us know that the bar table is designed to crash and burn drinks if you are not careful (it can slide off very easily). She gave us great recommendations and kept an eye on our drinks/chips the whole time!  Salsa: verde, spicy, perfecto Sangria: get a pitcher, cuz you gonna regret not getting it!  Carne Asada tacos: good, make sure you get the gauc to make it great! Hamburguesa: guac burger? how can you go wrong with that?  Poc Chuc: brined to perfection, cooked to perfection, juicy as all hell and the cucumber/cabbage salsa is to die for. My favorite dish here so far.  Can't wait to come back for more!

TLdtuZm6Ms0V22I6htXBaQ.review_text: I really don't understand the hype.  I had a birthday brunch here in the private room downstairs.  The event coordinator was awesome!  The positives end there.  The negatives: -WEAK bottomless mimosas and sangria -BEYOND TINY food portions.  When they brought out a serving of tacos, I thought it was for one.  But it was for FOUR!  Ridiculous -The price per person for a preset menu is only $30.  Sounds cheap right?  But you get no food at all.  So in reality, it is a major rip off.  I don't get the glowing reviews.  Maybe the service is not the same for a private party.  But nevertheless, I would not recommend this place and I most definitely won't be back.

LbMP3TW3U59c3tqdAcZ03Q.review_text: I thought the food was very good and the service was great.  Arrived right at opening and there was a line outside.  Fairly small but there is room at the bar if you are alone.   Very loud.  It was the day of the St Paddy's parade so everyone was in their early 20's and in green ready to party.  I would recommend Don Pisto's.

t_YYmuG8yRQ1A6acmWMR3w.review_text: A friend recommended this place so I figured I'd check it out. So glad I did!  I went on  a Saturday night, so it was pretty crowded and I took a seat at the bar. Although they were busy, my food came quickly.  First I had the chips and salsa. Both very good. The green salsa is some of the best Salsa Verde I've had. Then they brought out the guacamole I ordered. It was pretty good too. It tasted fresh, but it didn't really have a kick to it. I'm more of a fan of spicy foods.  The next dish to come out was the ceviche. It was amazing! Best ceviche I've had for sure. It was a good portion for two people to share as an appetizer but not too big that it's unreasonable for 1 person to eat as well if followed by something like tacos. Which brings me to...  The tacos! I ordered the Al Pastor tacos and they were very good. They served them on small corn tortillas with radish and lime. Definitely a good set of tacos.  The only downside is that it was a bit pricey, but for a good taco outside of the Mission, it's worth it. Especially if you get the ceviche!

JibN6XRd2LCQeTg-JgkjGw.review_text: This place is great! For starters, they give you chips and salsa at the table. The salsa is a very rough cut salsa verde with a really fresh ad spicy flavors. All the cilantro and jalapenos are still clearly visible, which is great. No pureed mess here. We also got a guacamole which was very tasty,  We order a few entrees. The tacos were good sized and well flavored. The sangria was tasty, but a little weak/dilute for my taste. Would have liked it to have a bit more punch. They did have some trouble bringing out all the dishes together, but they were apologetic. Overall, great food and good service.   I'll definitely come back!

85zTF9K5vaQb1wDswu83xg.review_text: Great classy Mexican food at a good price. Very good date place.

-g3XIcCb2b-BD0QBCcq2Sw.review_text: Greg and I have had a hankering for tacos for awhile, and decided to head out to Don Pisto's on a Friday night.  The last time we were here, it was crowded, loud, and dimly lit.  Well, that much of it hasn't changed either.  We thankfully didn't wait long for a table, and were quick to pull the trigger on ordering when we sat down.  We opted for the following tacos: Carne Asada, Carnitas, and Al Pastor.  I shamelessly asked for the $6 guacamole, and had a very large glass of sangria to go with the unlimited helping of tortilla chips.  All in all, the tacos were solid and the guac was fresh.  Needless to say, we made it easy on the dishwasher when we were done.  It's definitely a little pricey considering you only get two tacos per order, but they are most definitely delicious.  I get why people don't like here, but whether you end up at Don Pisto's or the new Tacolicious joint down the street, you'll be paying a pretty penny anyway.  I definitely enjoyed our meal and would definitely come back for another round.

5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ.review_text: DON PISTO IS THE BAOSS! After some evening debotury with friends, my girlfriend and I landed in Don Pistos just in time to cast in the last orders of the night (12:30AM weekdays). Carne Asada Tacos $9 - yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE… You know me, and if you don't, I'll tell you how much I hate overpaying for Mexican food, especially for something as simple as a taco. I've done it, and you've probably have yourself, and sometimes, it ends up in disappointment. However, the Carne Asada tacos at Don Pisto's is well worth it! A warm tortilla topped with nicely seasoned beef, chili verde salsa, and pico de gio. Simplicity at it's finest (and deliciousness!) Grilled jalapenos do come with the tacos, and more can be requested upon, but one set back is that the peppers have already been de-seeded.. bummer. Lobster M/P ($36 at the time) - yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE… Lobster after midnight? That's how I cure my midnight munchies! A whole 2-pound Maine Lobster (see picture!), bathed and poached in pig lard, with homemade tortillas, beans, rice, arbol salsa, and delicious cilantro butter. My only regret is that I ate dinner already so I couldn't gorge on ALL THIS FOOD! (This serves 2 btw!) The homemade tortillas were amazing; very light and fluffy, you could really taste the time and effort put in them. The Lobster dipped in the arbol salsa and the cilantro butter was the true meaning of calorie careless glutton! The complimentary chips and salsa were also bomb! The chili verde salsa was incredibly addicting. Best of all, it's made fresh! That's what I like to see from other restaurants. Keep in mind that it was almost 1AM and the Don still delivered! With so much win, do I even need to write about the service? Hell ya! Our server, Daniel, was the man! Hospitality skills off the roof. Our chips and salsa were replenished 3x without having to ask (that's how good the salsa was!), our drinks were never half empty, and was simply just a great friendly host that wasn't trying to rush our meal. Much kudos to him! It's tough finding a good eatery pass midnight that doesn't invoke more alcohol consumption (even though the Don Pisto's does is also a small bar), but also serves damn good food. The menu is small but wild with many interesting and mouthwatering Latino fusions, like their signature Guacamole Hamburger, Raw Oysters, or even Mexican Sashimi (you heard right). The hype is TRUE, and hands down, my new favorite Mexican joint. They also serve Brunch too!

1zgWUFbtcxQ37sdMDKCDXw.review_text: Stopped in with family during spring spread to avoid "tourist"crowd. Mission achieved. This place is AWESOME. Our 16 and 13 year old daughters loved it. Food was excellent, sangria was very good. Price was very reasonable. Service was top notch. Would highly recommend.  The tortilla soup is a meal in itself.

xts1GJq4PQ2Dj_-CrsvHWw.review_text: Truly good food.  Hamburguesa is a really special dish--its brimming with bacon love.    One knock is no hard liquor so margaritas are a little different with agave nectar stuff.

bMMRPKHC1LdASDbRHl7RnA.review_text: I would have given this place 4 stars based on the food but the service and hygiene level were SO POOR that I doubt I'll come back anytime soon.   Food:  - Hamburguesa was really flavorful. The bun was a bit over toasted so I ate it like an open faced sandwich.  - Sangria - yummy  Service: HORRIBLE Our waitress was very un-accommodating and rude. She was utterly confused that we wanted sangria and margarita pitchers because who ever wants TWO different drinks???!    My friend requested they leave the bun off the hamburguesa as she has gluten allergies and could possibly get sick if the bun touches the meat. The waitress said no and told her to order something else. WHAT???! Not adding the bun is less work for them.   Then there was a flying cockroach in the restaurant, YES a FLYING COCKROACH, which is just disgusting. The waitress was laughing at us, saying there's a bakery upstairs which can cause cockroaches to come downstairs. That is NOT okay.   The restaurant has potential if they'd hire better staff.

Wex62WTzp8epfzc1JFdGxQ.review_text: A local we befriended on our weekend trip suggested Don Pisto's and his recommendation was spot on. Reasonable prices and delicious food!  My husband and I shared the chicken tortilla soup (YUM) and the shrimp tacos. Small interior creates a warm and intimate dining atmosphere and the service was great!   If I lived in SF, I'd definitely return to Don Pisto's.

aUl2LDkUq1Y701jMHyEuIA.review_text: Arguably the best pork chop I've ever bitten into

DlLZgVRiG9zOfXbyZkuQvQ.review_text: Ok, so as I just told the waiter, every time I think the Mexican food is improving in Vermont, all I have to do is come here for the superb carnitas and margaritas, and sorry Vermont, it just WON'T DO!!  Not going home.

bok6nWeY5bxJgBl_vir76A.review_text: Owner of Don Pistos, bring back the mussels! that was my favorite item and now it's gone! Even with the missing item though, I have come back for the grilled calamari, guacamole and chips and great vibe you have goin' on.   Again, please bring back the mussels. Pretty, pretty please!  P.S. I must try your brunch. Heard good things.

jjh1cY9VKH_VfxD1l_M3UQ.review_text: Ok so I went here last night with a group of friends that live in the city -- it came highly recommended.  I really loved the ambiance, except our food took FOREVER to come out and didn't even come out at the same time because of a big party that came in downstairs. To ease our anger, our waitress brought us free shooters that were on the house, also they did end up taking off all of the tacos on our bill, so that was really nice. That's how customer service should be done.  Anyway, I really loved the inside and the margaritas were very yummy. The only thing is is the plates they serve are on the tiny side but packed with flavor and the guac was simply to die for.  Overall, I really enjoyed and was very impressed with the way they handled their mistake.   If you're looking for a hip place to eat on a Friday or Saturday night, I would go here.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: My new favorite spot?  Why you ask? 1. You can order lobster tacos...yes full lobster.  2. You can order 32 oz. coronas.  3. They have great margaritas and drinks.  4. if you know what to order, you won't have to spend that much.                                       Yes, even with the lobster tacos.. 5. Great tacos! 6. Spicy salsa! 7. Chips and salsa 8. great service  Why is may not be my favorite spot 9. long wait - but they can't help that they are that good! 10. no parking in North Beach - SF is somewhat over-populated.   My recommendation: Make a rezzy and enjoy! :D

isnt22Bni297Ws38ph8qGA.review_text: I am so bummed to have to write this review.  Don Pisto's has been my absolute favorite taco place in the city since I moved here a year ago.  I've thrown multiple birthday dinners here ... have recommended it to all of my friends.  I've noticed the service has deteriorated significantly the past three times I've been in.  This weekend tops it ... We were there on Friday night.  Service took forever (literally 20 mins before the server stopped by for water or drink orders) and then the manager comes by to tell us that their credit machine is down when we're ready to pay the bill.  I completely understand that things happen from time-to-time, but the bummer was that they had taken our credit cards initially and charged each of our cards AFTER we'd ended up paying cash.  Total headache to have to deal with calling the credit card company and canceling the transaction.   Such a bummer!

Eh_ak8vo3NHO8pew9cEMbA.review_text: I had the huevos rancheros, a margarita and my friend had the taco sonora (al pastor w/ pineapple) we perhaps had one of the better brunches we've had in a LONG time. Very pleasant staff - didn't have to wait too long; but the place is smaller and could get crowded. Nice spot for a private party! food is priced very reasonably (i think we paid $9 each) and left very satisfied! Enjoy!

WY80xu9YqOx3vex8fPJu7Q.review_text: Hands down best tacos in the city! Love this place! Came here for my birthday this year and sat in the bog room downstairs! Guac is also delicious!   Will be back for suuuuuuuuuuuuuuure! YUM!

g7kgIdHne0s4Lr7gaJMOFg.review_text: After spending 5 years in San Diego and Los Angeles, I still can't seem to find that one place to satisfy my late night, Tijuana-style taco cravings.  Don Pisto's doesn't do it but it's still pretty damn delicious.  Everything here from the free chips and salsa to the chicken tortilla soup is fresh and yet so tasty.  It's rare to find a place that serves Mexican food in a nice environment that still tastes authentic, unlike that one very popular favorite amongst the hipsters in the Mission...  They don't have a liquor license but they can serve beer and wine.  They make these awesome margaritas with some type of tequila-like wine - really good!  The chicken tortilla soup here is one of my favorite items to order, especially on a cold winter night.  It's very comforting and filled with fresh avocado and pulled chicken breast meat.  I could have this every other day!  We were speaking with the bartender (I think he's the owner?) and he said he spent some time living in Puerto Nuevo.  This means I definitely need to come back and try the lobster.  My college spring break memories of lobster in Rosarito are coming back to me now...

gDxSDnbivUDFeIm02lmYiw.review_text: Though I have been to Don Pisto's a number of times for brunch, both in small and medium sized groups, I am basing this review solely on my experience of going in a group of 15+.   For groups of 15+ Don Pisto's asks that you fill out a reservation form confirming your time, date, and the number of guests in your party. Once they have received your reservation request, they send you a set-menu from which you choose 5 of their ~15 AMAZING options.   Each member of the party pays $30 (before tax and tip), which includes a family style brunch served with the 5 items on the set menu, chips & guacamole, and BOTTOMLESS mimosas, sangria, and margaritas. I strongly recommend the sangria!!   Christina was super helpful in organizing this birthday brunch, and the waitstaff was great! I would recommend this spot for a fantastic brunch to anyone who asked!!  ALSO, as the only vegetarian in my party, I still left stuffed with delicious foods :)

duOWmRN2ErfiqLiYBxzJ8w.review_text: Loved the food.  So clean tasting and lots of flavor.

J1-B5TtWM5CCKlTL_NG7vw.review_text: The Setting: dinner with coworkers, 830p Tuesday, no reservation, waited 20 minutes.   Food: 4.5 Stars Service: 4.5 Stars  The GOOD: 1.  Guacamole - Amazing! Fresh avocado, a lot of it, with much less emphasis on the salsa on top. I always hate when most guacamoles are 3 parts salsa, one part avocado. This was the opposite.  2. Hamburguesa - I never would have ordered this at a Mexican food restaurant had it not been the server's recommendation. The meat is marinated in bacon and onions, so you get this amazingly flavored patty without the actual ingredients overpowering the meat itself. And instead of cheese on top, they put guacamole (see item 1) on it, which is a great addition. So good! 3. Carne Asada Tacos - melted in our mouths, the table loved 'em.  4.  Michelada - For those that like their drinks spicy but not tomatoey (like a blood mary), this is very good.  Perfect amount of zing, tastes great, and one will last you the meal!  The OK:  1.  Puerto Nuevo Lobster - this was actually very good lobster and the "fixins" (rice, beans, cilantro) were great! But for $39, we figured the money was better spent on other items that were equally good for a third the price.    The BAD: 1.  Everything was pretty darn good!  I guess we could have done without the wait...  The Bottom Line - wonderful food, good cocktails (michelada!) and great service, with a nice yet casual vibe, this is a perfect weeknight dinner spot if you're willing to wait 30 minutes.
