This place gets 5 stars, not because it's the best meal I've ever had in SF, but because it's the best value I've had in SF.

-JXgni3R6U_AQ4vx0KMRWA.review_text: Had not been back here in years and I simply don't know why.  Don Pisto's does things right.  It feels like an authentic Mexican / South American cantina.  The food looks like what you might find down as well, but with a nice presentation for the SF crowd.  Started off with a marg and I felt it was decent, but nothing more.  My friend had a Mexican Coke.  Then we had to get the guac and chips.  You get some freshly made guac along with the thick cut chips.  Good start.  We ordered the grilled calamari that came with a nice slaw.  Quite good and the calamari didn't feel chewy for having been grilled.  Next up we hit the tacos with the camarones, carne asada, and carnitas.  All were quite good and tasty.  Was definitely impressed  That turned out to be plenty for two and we stopped there, but everything else we saw going by looked darn tempting as well.  Service was excellent and we were promptly helped with the menus and orders.  All in, we came out at about $90.  Not bad all things considered.  I need to come back more often because the overall experience is quite authentic in feel and food / drinks rock.  There's a good mood here and is short of festive actually.  Definitely recommended.

pbDJGS8PDgqpUPmDH1YJvA.review_text: Got one of the last small tables before the line started forming out the restaurant (Wednesday dinner) and when the superb tortilla soup arrived, I could understand the onslaught of diners.  The soup had a rich, deep chicken taste, with tantalizing spices, avocado, and succulent small pieces of chicken.  The server mentioned that the kitchen made Elote (grilled corn on the cob, slathered with a spicy mayonnaise and cotijo cheese) - irresistible and living up to its decadent promise!  The fish tacos (with red snapper) were well done (although I always regret not having ordered carnitas - nothing can compete with the divine pig), the same goes for the carne asada version.  The service, while friendly and efficient, had some drawbacks, not necessarily its fault, though.  All the food came almost at once!  This is not good when you are enjoying a still-full bowl of piping hot soup.  I could not give up eating the delicious soup, so the tacos and elote got cold, a real shame.  The long line of patrons waiting for tables made me rush a bit and also contemplate a reservation policy that makes no sense to me:  there were several very big tables empty (the restaurants takes reservations for "parties of six or more") while all the while lots of folks were waiting for small tables.  Does this make sense?

my4q3Sy6Ei45V58N2l8VGw.review_text: I'm so glad I ate here visiting SF because I discovered that this is my new favorite restaurant! The ambiance is so hip and the food is phenomenal. Even the chips are thick and delicious! It comes with a green salsa... I think I'm going to drool just talking about my meal.  A pitcher of the Acai Berry Sangria is $20 and tastes like juice! :) I had the manga tuna cerviche which is the most delicious thing I have ever tasted. Big cubes of tuna and manga with chopped onions and a little bit of tang. TO DIE FOR. I also had the mussels with chorizo which was good and I had the El Pastor Tacos which were basically like street tacos of goodness.  I would check out the website for the menu. There's not a huge selection which I like and dishes range around $12.  You must try or you might die unhappy.

Bn-hAT5wdEX8encc3_lYGA.review_text: Really enjoyed that meal! The menu is small and tight, but they do everything right!   Apps: Mexican sashimi and their fish of the night was salmon. Tasty tasty.   Mains, tacos with carne asada, carnitas, and al pastor (grilled pork chop) The carnitas ones were the best I think. They had a little crunch to them as well as a juiciness inside.   We finished off with a bowl of mussels. The sauce of the mussels was so goof that we got a bowl of rice to suck it all up.   Thoroughly enjoyed and will return if ever in the area and need a place for bites and sangria

7-60JxBf0l0x-o8jzcXAvg.review_text: Went on Friday night around 7 and was seated immediately. Ordered the fish tacos (2 for $10) and they were cod. Spice level is strong but manageable. Guacamole was ok but wouldn't like obsess over this place. Liked the music/scene - they were playing solid rap - lots of mid-early 20's diners. Kitchen run by 3 line cooks and they bang it out. Service was very good.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: I've been wanting to try Don Pisto's for such a long time and the reviews on Yelp are raving about how great the food is.... but when we came I was very underwhelmed here.   My group came here on a Tuesday night around 6pm for dinner. The restaurant was had a couple tables filled so pretty open in terms of seating. We had 5 people in our group so they put us at a 4 top. Seriously? We kinda sat for a bit making fun of the situation but in the end we did ask for a bigger table. Our server had to get the manager as its "not my decision" and the manager said they had a big party of 11 coming in at 815pm so they couldn't move us. Really? We had already sat down and ordered -- so we explained we will def be out before the large party so the manager agreed and moved two tables together for us so we could be seated comfortably. But how long do they expect people to sit at tables for -- our table would def be turned in about 1.5 hours. Anyways, for the food we wanted to try the tamales and the hamburger - but they weren't making them that night so  I ordered fish tacos. To my surprise when they came they were tiny (i guess some would call it street style tacos) but for $11, they should make them bigger or add a 3rd taco. My friend got the pork chop which was huge and made the rest of our tacos seem teeny tiny in comparison. We also ordered a pitcher of margaritas and boy were those super sweet! I did not like mine at all so I left half of it on the table. Overall the best thing I liked was the chips and salsa.....   Though i really liked the chips and salsa and my fish tacos were not bad... it would not bring me to come back here again.

cWWLI924VOqXu65irw8HOg.review_text: Food is bland and way overpriced.  The drinks seem really weak to me and the others I've dined with here.  The service is terrible.  Horrible.  Especially the "manager" we spoke with after a particularly bad experience here.  The last 2 times I've been, they've had to comp multiple items off our bill because either they ran out of what we ordered, they brought the wrong thing, or they brought something waaaaay too late after everything else had been eaten and one poor person was left waiting to eat on their own.  The music situation here is so obnoxious too.  Too much bass!  You can't even hear your waitress telling you the specials!  Come to think of it, that's probably why they always seem to get something in our order wrong--they can't even hear what we're saying!  I've tried many times, but I've had it and will never return to Don Pisto's.  With so many other great restaurants in North Beach, go spend your hard earned money elsewhere!

Ievxwr3oqcMS917w49Fnqw.review_text: I lOVE Don Pistos! We have family from the Yucatan and when we brought them here they were more than impressed. The food is phenomenal and the staff is very attentive. Its a small place and parking is limited but if you arrive early and order everything on the menu (and I mean everything!) you will be very pleased.  My favs are the choriso mussels, hamburgesa, and cochinita pibil.

hvjhcPOG8zuqqLOohDKBmA.review_text: I've been dying to come try this place out and I was finally able to come here as a celebration of finishing up my last classes I need to qualify for my certification. I had dinner with  two of my old college buddies.    We had that complimentary salsa, the green one. I love lemons/limes, but boy was this over the top too much lime! You know that sour face you make when you eat a lemonhead candy? Yea, super sour.      We ordered two sets of tacos, pitcher of sangria, and the poc chuc. The tacos were spicy. Good, but not great. The pitcher of sangria is a bit watered down tasting nor was it too strong.     On the other hand, the Poc Chuc was amazing. Deserving that 5 stars rating. Wow, the best pork chop that is tender, juicy, full of flavor.       The service is great, they constantly came around to make sure our glass is filled and were checking to see if we needed or wanted anything else.   Coming back for that pork chop!

dT2PRW1l4KH1BxvY_8if4Q.review_text: Don Pisto's was good, but given the great reviews I expected lifechanging.   The green salsa and chips are delicious, and the sangria is refreshing. I enjoyed the hamburguesa, but I have had tastier tortilla soup and the fish tacos (snapper the night I went) were not that memorable though tasted like high quality, fresh ingredients.  They'll take reservations for groups of 6 of more, which makes meeting a group there easy though the restaurant was pretty loud for the far sides of the table to hear each other. There was also confusion on the bill - the menu states gratuity is automatically added to parties of 6+ so we assumed that it was in there when we got the check. However, the waitress had to tell us after we'd calculated it out that the gratuity was not included. I don't care which way it's done, but please pick one and be consistent on this. Given all this, I'd probably only go back with a small group.  Ok, last thing that just tipped me to give the 3 stars instead of the 4: the restaurant was almost suffocatingly smoky for the last part of our meal and as we were leaving, to the point it felt unpleasant in your throat. I assume this wasn't the norm and probably due to a kitchen mishap, but it was pretty unpleasant.

qAs0KtoGxJ2XMPKCLdZVmA.review_text: One of the most unexpected, but best kept secrets of north beach. Don Pistos is a cute little restaurant that I call secretive because it does not have any signs or awnings outside that indicates a restaurant.  The ambiance is very laidback, and restaurant is very airy feeling. Service was also great- we did not wait long and servers were quick without rushing/pressuring us, friendly without being annoying, and attentive without being overbearing.   The food here was amazing. I ordered the fish tacos, and the fish was perfectly cooked with the best cripsy crust. You only get two, but that was more than enough for me- the portion of fish was very generous and I was definitely satisfied after two. My BF ordered the breakfast burrito which was equally delicious- a little greasy, but that's expected with a breakfast burrito! The watermelon mimosa was delicious as well- they also offer a bottomless option which i wish I had opted for if it hadn't been for the rager I had the night before.   Will definitely be back!!

LPkXc94_xyRN09d8sXSR7Q.review_text: This place gets a lot of hype and it only does because in comparison to other mexican food in the city it's a little better. Or it's one of the few places for mexican food that exist here.   I came on a Friday night and it took about an hour to get a table. The chips and salsa were good, but it took forever to refill on them. When we finally get a refill it was the leftover chips from another table that the waitress dumped into our bowl. I guess I was too hungry after waiting so long that I just ate it.  Then I ordered a few tacos and was left starving.  I had some shrimp tacos, yes there were real large shrimp in there, but they tasted like nothing flavorful. The tortilla fell apart on me and basically it all exploded. And what's up with NOT being able to get a burito? And no vegetarian friendly options AT ALL? If you're vegetarian, you'll be eating chips and salsa all night.   If you're LA purist who loves el cholo, olvera street, the holes in the wall,  or venture further down into San Diego for your mexican fixes, then Don PIsto will probably leave you disappointed. If you're here to feast on food then it won't be a good idea.   I'm giving the place two stars because it has a nice ambiance to it. It's a good place to throw back a few margaritas with your friends and be tipsy enough to not care about how the food tastes.

viAeXrjK47Ig-GGPxwnlvQ.review_text: A must!  If you live in SF, visiting SF, & thinking about SF AND you are warm blooded & not a gluten-free freak, you have to try Don Pisto's.  A solid meal!  Fun atmosphere.  Great Food & Good Drinks.    We had the Pork Chop (very juicy), Hamburguesa (ridiculously good!), Sangria, and some Canadian Oysters.  Everything was so good.  The tomatillo salsa and guacamole were just as good.  If you like hispanic flavors, seafood, and/or meat -- you will love this place.  What a wonderful fusion of all of those.  I'll try the lobster next time.  That looked really good, but the only problem with it was that it wasn't on OUR table.  ** Get there early and be prepared to wait.  Forget driving!  Parking is awful. **

HbS5p7Bnzau6CFBx4uxPCA.review_text: Wow!! Excellent Mexican restaurant!! I'm Mexican and I have to say that the flavor from these dishes are as authentic as it gets. We had the Mexican Sashimi one word "delicious", the Al Pastor tacos and the Poc Chuc (pork rip chop) very tasty. We were served by Michelle she was very friendly and knows exactly what to suggest.

FysDiqCS1fxxwC9PLHNqNg.review_text: Hurried steps. A petite woman rushing through the door in a leopard skin string dress wearing white sunglasses. A man sitting by the bar, nursing an IPA, stood up to greet her. "I'm so sorry I'm running late." She said. He stood up as she took her coat off, and as she hopped onto the barstool. It was a very crowded bar.   "This was a very popular restaurant with no signage on the door. Like the French Laundry." She commented. The restaurant had two parts. One part was the communal table and bar area, the other part was a sit down dining area in a sunken  part of the space.  "This reminds me of Ratskeller in Munich, by Marienplatz. The restaurant was built directly under the city hall, all sunken in." She continued.  Don Pisto was of course not a German nor Italian restaurant, it's Mexican street food located in the heart of North Beach. "Does it look like where you just returned from?" She asked. He was in Mexico vacationing with his son. "No, but it felt like it should have been a very guy oriented restaurant. But there were quite a lot of women here." He responded. The decor was very masculine, no doubt, with open exposed bricks and fireplace for cooking. Surrounded by Italian restaurants in the heart of North Beach, this place felt like a welcoming home in Mexico, occupied by working class people, and you had just crashed their Saturday night supper party.  "The restaurant did not take reservations." He said. He'd been here before once.  He struck her as someone who dined out a lot, alone or otherwise. Just then the host interrupted them and informed them that the communal table was ready.  The man asked to see if they could sit next to each other, rather than across from each other. Why wouldn't more restaurants insist on that? How could two people have a conversation over dinner if you were sitting across from each other at a noisy place where the only way to talk was to shout out from the top of your lungs? She thought to herself. The host immediately agreed and two new table settings were made for the two of them.  "What's good here?" She asked.  He studied menu and ordered her a glass of Sangria as if he could read her mind. It was very plum red, and very sweet. He took care of her as if he was the protagonist straight out of a Jane Austin novel, very old school. Even though they had only been friends for nearly two decades, even though she never needed anyone to take care of her, even though, she suspected, this was how he was with all of his female friends. The wait staff was very attentive and caught the dynamic very early on, so she directed her questions to this man. "What would you guys like to eat?" She asked. He said, "Well, I suppose we should get the ceviche and the spicy tuna tacos. And pollo and posole." He decided for her. The restaurant served street food, therefore portion was well adjusted for that, a perfect way to share a meal with people without getting too stuffed and feeling guilty after.  When the posole was served, two bowls appeared with a separate plate for the herbs and spices. It was a stew dish, delightful and hearty, unpretentious and delicious. He used the ladle to scoop soup into her bowl first. She added spice and cilantro. Over that dish she learned that he was still in love with the woman he's been with for nearly three years. "I am into her. I love her. I like her. She's perfect for me." "No one's ever met 'her", you know." She said. "They know about her. The general stuff." He protested. This man who had never been married, was now in love and had been for sometime. Perhaps there was hope after all. But for whom she was not sure.  Turned out that all four things on the menu were exceptional.  The waitstaff brought the bill to the man. He opened his wallet to pay and she saw an older driver license picture of him. In the picture he had a broad smile, strikingly blond hair sans glasses. He had a carefree look about him, like a child. Not this man who's now sitting next to her, more reserved and a lot more serious.  A meal was ending. Simplistic street food in surprisingly non Hispanic neighborhood but completely out of this world delicious. Full bar menu, filled with Mexican and Californian beer to boot.  It was one of the best meals she's had recently.  "Friday, I'm on Lufthansa to Frankfurt then Munich." She said. "I'm on KLM to Amsterdam." He said. "Perhaps we'd meet at the airport then." She said absent-mindedly. "That would be neat." He replied.  They got up to leave, a half glass of sweet sangria left sitting unfinished on the table. It was a typical summer evening in San Francisco: fog was setting in, wind had picked up, and young people were out and about. At an atypical Mexican restaurant in North Beach: food, surprisingly authentic; goodbyes, reluctantly said; and a new journey, to be commenced.

biIF7Mu4272RrIMifjDWug.review_text: Taco, taco! Love the ambiance but love the chips and quac even more!  Tip- each taco can be split into two! The shrimp Tacos are the best!   Come hungry!

x6Ovhm9vHlFI_WYXttaBww.review_text: I don't have much to add to the discussion but I do love this place.  I'd stick to the pork chop, squid, ceviche and the mussels.  The tacos are great as well, but I think the pork chop is the reason I keep coming back and the mussels with the red sauce are extremely flavorful.  Getting a reservation can be a bit difficult and if you arrive on the early side on certain evenings the pork chop may not be on the menu because it needs to brine for 48 hours.

4q3_TTmXkmAevyN9a0n0Tg.review_text: The good thing about this restaurant is they are able to host large parties which I guess can be a challenge in sf.  The food here is ok.  We had several different things and none were bad.  The service was also ok, not bad but pretty normal.  You could expect the same level of service at Applebee's.  However, I will continue to blast restaurants that over charge and sell the same food I can get from a food truck, the frozen food section of a grocery store, or a TGI Fridays.  I realize everything is expensive in San Francisco, but I have higher expectations with the premium prices they charge.  I'm not sure if they ever built this restaurant out.  They keep it very dark with loud ghetto music.  When you look around you realize you're pretty much eating in the equivalent of a gymnasium with the lights off.  It's not bad, I just don't see why you'd ever go here twice.

I2xldYkyBiWTkU6TkZmt1Q.review_text: If you're looking for a "mom and pop" type Mexican food joint, then this isn't the place for you.  This Mexican restaurant is trendy, modern, fun, and of course, tasty! I love that they don't have a large, overwhelming menu. The ambiance is great too! Their servers are super nice and attentive.  Their ceviche is DELICIOUS (and I don't even like raw fish), their tacos are tasty, and their guacamole is fresh and amazing! To the girl who said it needed more lime and salt, that's easily fixed by adding those ingredients yourself! I like the fact that they don't add too much salt because salt can be easily added but not removed.  Which brings me back to their tacos. The only reason why I don't give them a 5 is because their carnitas and al pastor are a little too salty for my taste, but still very flavorful. I have yet to try their other dishes but I'm looking forward to going back. I've already been there multiple times since I live in North Beach myself.  This place is definitely worth a try if you're in the neighborhood!

xYB4vwPiFhxMHS0ctdpTig.review_text: Amazing brunch. We ordered a few things and shared bc we couldn't decide. Great and new rendition on huevos rancheros. The chorizo is to die for. Each entree was $10-12 which is a steal!

fopV8gipoX8Zy9L3mxUtIg.review_text: Don Pisto's food and atmosphere is perfection.  We had a small civil ceremony at City Hall and rented out Don Pisto's for our low key reception and couldn't have been happier with the day.  The food and drinks were as delicious as ever, and the staff was so sweet and easy to work with from start to finish.  We called several other restaurants to price things out, and while Don Pisto's was reasonable, the real selling point was how easy and flexible they were to work with.  Everyone had a blast, and my husband and I were so happy to have such a lovely, delicious and festive place to celebrate our marriage with close family and friends.

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text: Where have you been my whole life?  A limited but delicious menu of inexpensive Latin food, served until just past midnight with an informal but professional style in an ambiance that belongs to a restaurant at least twice its price.  My tuna tartare or ceviche or whatever they call it was first rate, not a huge dish but quite generous for $13, one of the most expensive things on the menu.  The fish itself wasn't anything to rave about, just basic big, somewhat soft white and red tuna slices, but it was assembled and flavored so well, swimming in a special-purpose salsa-like dressing that could be a dish in itself.  The sangria was for sure in the top of the class, robust with a good dose of alcohol, with good bottom notes, not too dry but not especially sweet, and a little fizz.  You could drink four of those at a sitting, especially on Sundays when they're $3 all night.  The chips tonight were a little too thick and chewy for my taste, oil probably wasn't hot enough, but they were homemade and the green salsa was good.  Four stars on the food for tastiness, and an extra star given the price, decor, and total lack of any trouble or fuss.

8fFI0aEBFJZIHB07Wz-y_w.review_text: They have phenomenal food. Amazing chips and salsa ! I went locco on their Grilled Calamari, it was just fabulous.

6lWwBebL7O9AAE4PFhwvAg.review_text: My sister loves Mexican food and had never been here.  So 2 months before her birthday, I called and made a reservation for 10 people on a Saturday night.  At the time, we were the only party to have reserved a table.  A few days before, we had a friend come in from out of town, so I called back to let them know we'd be 11 but that we were happy to squeeze.  The manager informed me that they had taken other reservations and so my party of 10 was already going to be squeezed into a table for 8.  We ended up having dinner at a restaurant that could seat us at a table appropriately sized for our party, with no apologies from Don Pistos.  Although I won't go back, their brunch is fantastic.

SGrmTy1qSPt_dRmmjTZAcQ.review_text: The grill was wafting through the air, so we decided to wait 45 min... It's okay, but IMHO didn't live up to the hype and I'd never wait again that long. And I love creative Mexican food.  We sampled four different taco varieties, oysters, chips w/guac & salsa, and pitchers of margaritas. $300 for five of us was high, considering what we ordered. Food wasn't bad, but not off the charts either. Flavor was lacking, except for the guac which was outstanding. Service was great, the waitress kept her cool with the packed dining room.  Just know, don't go for an intimate romantic evening, or hope to carry on a conversation with someone across the table--this place is crazy noisy.  I've heard the brunch is great, maybe it's better?  Would I return here? Nope.

kY8l2uKkzzOdDGD7azgdrA.review_text: Bottomless Mimosas for twelve bucks Rocks The Al Pastor Taco Sonora Rocks The complimentary chips and salsa Rocks The music Rocks The ambiance and decor Rocks Cory Rocks Pete Rocks The Other Lady Waitress (I'm SO sorry I forgot your name- but you know who you are) Rocks Don Pisto's Rocks I recommend you go - now

9Mc3mZX_Q8c6H_KjH8DZOQ.review_text: Great brunch spot for a group. I loved the omlette and cocktails!  I would avoid coming here during busy times and expecting to be able to have a conversation though - accoustics are terrible and the brunch crowd is usually, well, very drunk.

6in4OJrKAbAU9_VO3p_syQ.review_text: One of our best dining experiences in San Francisco.  We originally went here because the hamburgesa was on the 7x7 100 must eats.  The burger met my expectations with fresh guac and carmalized onions but the mussels and chorizo topped it off. Served with fresh garlic bread I could have made a meal of just the sauce and bread.  Make sure to show up early as the wait is long and the restaurant small but worth it.

rTgNrNX4EsntHA45MrpBKg.review_text: Pssssshhh....Please, awesome mexican food in North Beach??!!  Yep, skip the italian spots and head here instead.  I shared some open faced taco with beans and meat galore, while also snacking on some pastor tacos and ceviche.  We also downed a couple of house margaritas and called it dinner.    Service was quick, music in the background was good, and the overall experience couldn't have been better.  It is a small place so while we were leaving, and the night was getting later, it was starting to get a line out the door to put your name in for a seat.  I would go back time and time again when in the area.  This is probably considered a more "upscale yet inexpensive" (if that even works as a description) blend of mexican food that you can't find elsewhere.

HF15grCzeujuTX2f5kqygQ.review_text: Wow was that good. The steak was some of the best I have had in quite a while and the guac is life changing.

HQw9MLvR81LyhBJuUN9A3A.review_text: We came here and tried pretty much one or two things from each section on the menu. For the taco & ceviche, we were a bit disappointed. Small hole in the wall places make better taco and for gourmet ceviche, go to Lamar where they give you whole fish chunks rather than ground up. Now, this may sound like a bad review so far, BUT the Pollo Asado and the Tortilla Soup were kick ass. The tortilla soup had good flavor and depth and the Pollo Asado is what you come back for over and over and over again. Service was good. Only giving 4 stars because didn't like some dishes, but would have been 5 if I just got the latter two.

Mv2RWEOKXjsocE0VGSsQ7w.review_text: It's super noisy in here! No sound buffer and they are playing music with a very heavy bass. So far the service is great. Hopefully our food will be also.

VCdP3RY871UmrlVZVI4dEA.review_text: Everything's good and they will even whip up things from past menus if u ask. Pricey for what it is though.

KJ9V8-rbtGafQWQ-qel5MA.review_text: This place has great food and pretty reasonable prices.  I was put off by the "brunchers"  who were obviously enjoying the bottomless alcohol and were really noisy, but once I got the first taste of their delicious salsa, I was happy we were there. They do not have diet drinks which I thought a bit odd and that is the only reason I'm giving them 3 instead of 4 stars.

I37BOCTFhcUpwxcuLGkdmQ.review_text: GO TO THIS RESTAURANT. Went here with a friend tonight and it was hands-down one of the best meals I've had in years. We shared the guac (with the delicious complementary chips) to start, which was truly incredible. We wiped the bowl clean and both remarked that it was the best guac we had ever had. Tasted so fresh and delicious it was absurd.  Then we both had the Pollo Asada, which was just beyond absurdly amazing. The chicken was SO moist and SO well seasoned, and the complements were all top notch.  Long story short - this place is incredible, the good is remarkably good, service is great, decor/vibe is awesome. GO HERE.

dRD2uB9rxA2DhVRVsDz_iw.review_text: Came here for breakfast for the first time during the chaotic weekend that was Outside Lands, and while I wish they would have refilled my bottomless sangria a bit quicker, I understand it was only because they were extremely busy (that sangria was delicious btw!). The french toast I ordered was OUTSTANDING, and the bite of the bacon marinated burger I had was fantastic as well.  Can't wait to eat at this place again.

icH7fj24qhXbimE47_w7aw.review_text: (+) Very simply, the tacos are delicious (-) However, if you are somewhat sensitive to spice, (like me) this makes the dish challenging, or will at least leave you hot!

P-GKa1OgTRMUYiNlxYPcSQ.review_text: Wow...wow....wwwwwow. Short story, my bf and friend were leaving our other friend's spot in North Beach, we're in the car and some guy comes up to the car and we're thinking, "what is this guy's story". He says something like, "hey I'm about to open up this spot, do you guys want to try some tacos?"   Hmmm....12 am, late night munchies, good mood...why not. So we take him up on his offer. Best possibly-sketchy decision I've made 2009. Pete cooks us up Niman Ranch steak tacos...street style - AMAZING!!! Then, Pete says, "let me cook you up some fish tacos"...um...SURE!  But these were not your everyday fish tacos, Grilled Swordfish tacos (he offers battered & fried too).  Wait, am I delusional?  No sir, this is a real deal yummy in my tummy .   Generosity and kindness is live and well in this wicked world. Pete, the owner, is by far one of the greater people I've met in SF, he offered us drinks, and asked if we wanted more food...it was soo good i really wanted to, but the fact that he even offered us free food/beer/soda was filling enough and we didn't want to take advantage of the sampling offer.  All I can say is I really wish the best for Pete and his new baby DON PISTOS. Best Cool Taqueria in North Beach.  I look forward to being a reg here and trying the rest of the menu. The spot is a hidden gem, very low key, but UBER COOL vibe inside.  I love the exposed brick and simple modern art.  There will be a spot down stairs for small/private events.  Keep an eye out for the grand opening.

Pxky6wU2mkrht4YWE1YhLg.review_text: We had my friend's surprise Birthday party here.  The staff was super accommodating, the waitress was so sweet (and hot might I add), the food was so delicious!!  If I can't get rid of the craving for their salmon sashimi even after a few weeks then I think it warrants a legitimate 5 star review!  Just take my word for it.  It is so damn good!

wy29Ca0XGvoIqMm0AQtWxQ.review_text: When I got there half the menu was out of stock so I just ordered the tortilla soup. The soup was average, the avocado they used did not go with the flavor at all and I could barely eat it. The salsa they brought in the beginning was good though.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Don Pisto's tries to be incognito with the no signage outside, but savvy people KNOW about this place because of the:  Bottomless mimosas.  Bottomless sangrias.  Bottomless margaritas.  Only a couple more reasons to look forward to the weekend, right?  For those of you with a bottomless pit (sorry, I just had to go there), they have a short brunch menu filled with delicious items from the huge french toast with bacon, savory chorizo and eggs, hearty breakfast burrito and even a juicy burger topped with avocado. Just watch out for the HOT chile, it left my mouth numb for a couple of minutes, which I fortunately had to un-numb with their agua fresca mimosa. Aaahhh....  We had a group of 15 here last Saturday for a birthday brunch, service was nothing short of FANTASTIC! Chips and salsa constantly refilled, drinks never empty, dishes came out hot and fast.  At some point, the owner had to move our party to a different table because there was another rezzie after us, but in exchange he ended up giving us a discount AND handing out more free booze. AY CARUMBA! All I can say is, it was indeed a birthday brunch to remember!   Make Don Pisto's your choice for a birthday event or any other celebration and for sure you'll have a lot of bottomless fun!  But please, don't come bottom less.  =P

e2OMAscAPZoxcR4wwt7aBw.review_text: I'M NOT TELLING ANYONE ABOUT THIS PLACE.  Daniel is the shit.  Now carry on and don't go.

q3RbAbRdlEing6144RTN5w.review_text: I'm from the New York City area so finding excellent Mexican food near home is a challenge.. so while on vacation in San Francisco we asked a friend for a recommendation on her favorite Mexican spot and with no hesitation she said Don Pisto's.    We were not disappointed.  We got there shortly after it opened so there was no wait.. We started with the tortilla soup and guacamole.  Amazing.  For our main meal we shared an assortment of tacos, which were all delicious.    We left Don Pistos wanting more, but too stuffed to eat another bite.  If I'm back in San Francisco anytime soon, I will be eating here again.

8m4RoAb-34qd7FxsoWyAQw.review_text: Changed my concept of Mexican food. This is a gem.  Great specials but you can't go wrong with the tacos al pastor or pescado. Their tortilla soup is excellent as well.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: I'll be honest, this restaurant's health score (67 out of 100) worries me. I've been to grimy Chinese restaurants in the past with higher health scores than this. It's especially alarming given how nice and clean Don Pisto's looks in person.  I'll give 'em credit for their margaritas, which were perfect and not too sweet. Their burger (which I heard they only serve on Wednesdays) was also incredible, and absolutely worth coming here for. The bun in particular was bready yet light -- a great complement to the tender meat patty smeared with avocado and cheese.  Unfortunately, the one taco I tried (with pineapple and pork) was very mediocre, especially for the price.   The restaurant is charming, but not anything special. Exposed brick walls, moody art, friendly staff -- all the ingredients are there, but for some reason, I wasn't that impressed. I have high standards for expensive Mexican restaurants, and Don Pisto's just barely made the cut.

zJShaa9_k65NlkGokJSWLw.review_text: When my friends told me about Mexican in North Beach, I was a bit weary.  I expected a Taco Shop; however, I was thoroughly surprised with gourmet Chevy's, minus the dated decor.  Tacos were expensive and small, tortilla soup was pleasant, and the Al Pastor was okay.  I expected more for the price, but not overly disappointed.

E92eg6IqUh5Vz5FiciLBZA.review_text: Yes. Yes. Yes.  Atmosphere - great.  Food - great (fish tacos best thing on the menu / spicy tuna tacos a little gimmicky). Service - unexpectedly great.  Price - great.  Go here. Order a few tacos + guacamole and a couple Pacificos. Go home happy and glad you live in the city.

6a19ZIpKWzbMe58ZW49hTA.review_text: This place must be top secret..really. No name displayed and we walked by this place twice!!! Thank goodness there was an address listed.  We were in the neighborhood and were hungry. We looked up our location online to find something with at least 4 stars in the area and Don Pistos popped up.  We walked in and there were a couple of tables occupied.  The place is small, as is the menu...and the kitchen/grill area.  They are very limited in options, but what they do make is tasty.    They make a KILLING...a few simple options, small portions and high prices (for the quantity).  That said....  We liked the chips and salsa (unlimited quantities). It was Sunday, so they had $2 Mexican beers and $3 sangria. Can't beat that! :)  The tacos come in 2's and on small corn tortillas with a pepper and some radishes. We ordered the Alaskan Halibut fish tacos, Carne Asada and Camariscos (I believe that was what the shrimp one was called.) I tried all three and they were all tasty.    The atmosphere was intimate and simple, while the service and the food was unpretentious and tasty.  No complaints here!

F0AAhDFX1D0OmjHsaNk1-A.review_text: Five Stars Came early with a group of 6 and we were seated right away. Great place to catch up with friends! The music is laid back, the lighting is just right, the menu items are exciting and the waitress is super friendly! I live a block away, so will definitely frequent this place.  Tips and Fun Facts Okay I'll admit it, it helped that the table next to us had a couple of very good looking guys that caught our eye. But even besides that, Don Pisto's is very deserving of a 5 star!

JYxt5_1tAoIVHYRZ2PkKcw.review_text: These tacos are great. The pork is super succulent. The Carne asada was soft and cooked just to the point that it was super juicy and totally packed with smokey flavors.  And the flavors were SICK! I wanted to try the chicken, but they only have it in the evenings.   My review is based on the flavor not the value. No value here.   2 tacos = $9 So a "man" will need 4 tacos and a beer.  4 tacos = $18 and a beer (corona 32oz) $11 = $29 is a bit questionable even for some great tacos. Just a heads up.   Exposed brick gives the dinning area a nice vibe. It has a huge party room down stairs.  Could use a better beer selection. They have a poor beer selection.

lKu-jNxk12wJT7h_79MNxA.review_text: Cute little hole in the wall. Food and service are both top notch. I highly recommend the poached eggs with chorizo! Best seasoned breakfast potatoes, ever.  The decor is very welcoming and rustic. Went on a Sunday and enjoyed the bottomless mimosa's which were interchangeable with their sangria and margarita's. Our server Nikki, was awesome, I hope you get her!

3TXNWQ-x98YphuVy2HegJA.review_text: I cannot find a single reason to give this place fewer stars than what I chose!  Don Pistos... I never would've even known about this place if it weren't for 7x7's delicious list of things to eat in San Francisco for 2011. And who would've expected a delicious Mexican restaurant in North Beach?!  My party of 4 arrived here sometime before 7pm, which was PERFECT because the restaurant started to really fill up between 7 and 7:30. We didn't know what to expect when we read that it was a restaurant mainly specializing in Mexican food. I didn't know to expect if it would be one of those delicious but filthy looking places in the Mission, or something generic like Chevy's.  Don Pistos definitely stands out as its own kind of Mexican restaurant, with a slightly dim classy feel that reminded me of a tavern, but festive enough that it was like other Mexican restaurants.  The servers were very attentive and good about checking up on us through the evening to make sure that we didn't need anything.  They start you off by serving you some chips and salsa. It's not just any kind of salsa though. It's the green chile salsa with a slight bit of spice and bursting with flavor. I know I ate almost all of it and hogged it from my friends. For our meals, we ordered the carnitas tacos (small but delicious) and the hamburguesa, which was the dish listed on the 7x7 food list.  The hamburguesa was AMAZING! It's a meat patty that has been marinated in bacon and onions, topped with house-made guacamole, served on (what I think is) a brioche bun. When I took a bite out of it, I felt like it was just melting in my mouth. I would definitely order it again. And it was only $9!!!  Next time, I want to try other things on the menu because everything smelled so good there. Looking at the other tables, you can see just how delicious the food is. As we left around 8pm, there was a large group of people congregating in the front, waiting for tables to free up.  Get here early! They only make reservations for parties of 6 or more!

wmpOUcPCRjU9kb0-YdIusQ.review_text: i cant say enough good things about this place, but here are some highlights:  -ceviche: delicious, fresh, a must try -sashimi: i know, it's not a mexican restaurant, but its effing great. shut up and take my money! -bottomless sangria: tasty. UNLIMITED TASTY. -the chips: i dont know what it is about the tortilla chips here, but however it is they do it, it's magic. every time i tell myself i'm full, i cant help but snack on these things and, whoops, there goes another bowl. refill please.

NvYQswS6CxrAlPsWRDeUjA.review_text: I wanted to try this place based on recommendations from friends and rave reviews on Yelp.  It took us a while to find parking last night being that Don Pisto's is in North Beach.  The host who seemed more like the owner/manager said the wait for 2 was about 20 minutes at 9:30 pm.  We ended up waiting well longer than that.  He nicely offered us free drinks so we chose the sangria.  I don't drink so the hubby got 2 free glasses of sangria.  He said overall it was okay but that his favorite is still from Picaro.   When we were seated, we got the chips and salsa.  The chips were delicious but the salsa I thought was too limey.  The hubby got the Tortilla Soup and I got the Hamburguesa based on the rave reviews from Yelp.  Both of us thought that the quality of the food was good but the flavors for us was okay.  I am pretty familiar with latin flavors whether it being mexican, cuban, spanish, basque etc.  Personally for me the flavors at this place were a little off for me, but I think it is still worth trying to see if you may like/love it.  The prices for food and drinks are very reasonable and the ambience is pretty hip.  It is a good place to bring a group or a date.

ha4DDPPKiMQcu8Hub9CAAQ.review_text: First the bad... still noisy as all heck.  Now the good and the reason for the update.  The pork chop ($25) was just so juicy and tender that it kicked ass over the place I just ate at down the block (Original Joe's).  I will be reviewing OJ when I have time.    But again, the pork was excellent and the tostada was great tasting. Chips/salsa was salty, just the way I like them (had three "yelpings")  Normally at Don Pisto, they push their lime afficionado mentality but I think with lime at $100 a case vs $20 last year, they've toned it done. (hah) ....    Also noticed that there was three families there... so I guess if you have crying or loud kids; in this noisy place, no one will notice. There were four obnoxious twenty odd old guys louder than heck while we were there.  Did I say that the pork chop was greatttt??  Time I arrived was on a Friday at 5:30pm .. found a parking space, was immediately seated and had a great blonde cute server who went extra mile.  (btw, I am a girl making a statement and my guy was not THAT cute to warrant the extra service, so I think it was either me or she's just good at her job : ). I tipped 25%  Oh I forgot... they just opened a new place  called Pisto's Taco around the corner on 1310 Grant near my favorite burger place Mo's .... and I walked by it .. seems more bar and bar food place  (cheaper menu) and will review that one soon too.

PYESpXaUSnyYgQ3P4ayyuw.review_text: Came here with some girlfriends for a weekend brunch and loved it! Absolutely adore the young, casual hip ambiance here! They had a bouncer outside checking ids and it was really loud inside. I felt like I was at a day club.   We all started with the bottomless mimosas ($17), which are made with fresh pineapple juice. Super yummy! They have servers making their rounds to make sure your glass is always filled to the brim :)   My friend's Huevos Rancheros ($9) was my favorite. Great flavor and perfectly cooked eggs.  My friend's Chorizo and Poached Eggs ($10) was pretty good. Great flavor and I'm usually not a fan of chorizo.  My Mushroom Omlette ($10) was really nothing special. It had a ton of oaxaca but wasn't really memorable.  We were all really obsessed with their side of potatoes. Perfectly crisp and well seasoned! Mmmm  If I was going to come back for bottomless mimosas though, I'd definitely choose the Radish. The mimosas aren't as good but the food is so much better.

wBezYnHwX-ioaKBvYWHajg.review_text: Who knew that the best Mexican in SF would be found deep in the red gravy territory of North Beach!  The place hardly has the linoleum feel of your standard neighborhood trattoria like those found in the Mission, rather it's a sleek, nondescript, minimalist, red-brick room with no sign on the outside.  It's best to keep this place secret because the food is simply outstanding- authentic, fresh, and executed perfectly.  I've tried many taco-al-pastors throughout the years and Don Pisto's is the best.  The burger, mussels, seafood items, and tortilla soup are all top-notch.  Every ingredient is fresh and used in just the right amounts and balance.  Combine this food with reasonable prices and a decent alcohol selection and I've officially found my favorite Mexican joint in SF.

O8xTsqWl9uuan-VALBqDSA.review_text: Yummy yummy yummy in my tummy. Great nice dark atmosphere beautifully furnished and good service. Recommend the pitcher of Sangria and the tortilla soup and the Ceviche. Love this place :)

OxJN5K2wI-4Q1mRT_dVu-Q.review_text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! We came on Saturday for the bottomless brunch. You can choose between mimosas, sangria or margarita. We had strawberry mimosas which were amazing! The ceviche was fresh and delicious, chips and guac hit the spot, eggs and bacon were on point, tamales were amazing, and breakfast burrito was perfection. The service was great as well. Can't wait to come back and try all the other stuff.

BatgVqrZsj9fJuL3a4ZL6g.review_text: It's a shame that I haven't reviewed this place yet, because truly, I'm a Don Pisto's fan fo sho.  It's one of my top-ranking go-to spots in my hood, and I make sure I eat here at least once a week.  Like many have said already, I never would have noticed the place if I hadn't walked past it tens of times before leaning my head in.  The best sounds always come out from the doors -- the kinds of sounds that lead one to believe that everyone's having a good time!  So, one day, I bit.  And I've continued to bite for months, through most of the menu.  My new favorite is the chorizo and mussels -- very delectable and satisfying!  The tortilla soup is crazy good (especially with the large chunks of avocado).  When I'm feeling like tacos, I go straight for the al pastor (and all that roasted pineapple!).  When I'm lucky enough to make it for brunch, I always order the tacos sonora -- hey Pete, are you going to offer this on the normal menu anytime soon?  I'd order it!  I wash it down with either a great Mexican beer or a Mexican Coke with lime and I'm easily on the road to Extreme Dinner Contentment.  Great food, excellent service, unique setting and local flavor... win, win, win and win.  And I'm heading there for dinner right now...  you should too.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I haven't stopped raving (aka annoying the shit out of my friends) about how amazeballz don pisto's is after coming here last week.  Before reviewing, I will preface with this:  1) I don't typically like paying more than $10 for Mexican food 2) I had high expectations for this place because everyone else had hyped it up 3) I was drunk when I ate here (but I'm awfully truthful when I'm inebriated, so THE FEELINGS I FELT WHILE EATING HERE WERE REAL I PROMISE)  I ate here with 2 guy friends, which ultimately made the whole experience wonderful.  I didn't have to sit around with my girls listening to them figure out how they could split 2 tacos between 5 people because they're sooo full from half the salad they had for lunch.    Anyway, we ordered the fish tacos and carnitas, both of which were yumz.  (If you're wondering how you can split the 2 tacos per order between 4 people however, the tacos come with two layers of corn tortilla, so... you can just make 2 more tacos with less meat.)  We also split the wild Monterey calamari, which was my favourite because it was grilled rather than fried.  If you have an issue with weird textures, I wouldn't order this, though.  The boys' favourite was the poc chuc, which was a huge grilled pork rib.  I don't usually eat pork, but this was worth trying.  The meat was tender, juicy, and probably not all that healthy for you... but I'm not sure what you're doing at a place like this if you're trying to be healthy.  Anyway, we topped it off by splitting a 32oz corona, and it came out to $73 in total for 3 people or $24 a person.  Pretty awesome.  Word on the street is that they also don't like groups bigger than 4.

mWXKnKdqSL8EKTuUaP_Srw.review_text: We picked this place randomly on a night out in SF. You wouldn't even know the place existed walking by it, I don't recall a sign in front. It looks like the entrance to an apartment building which I thought was cool. It has a downtown loft vibe that you see more in Midwest/east coast. We were seated immediately with no wait whatsoever. Our server was very friendly and explained the small but effective menu. Our waters and drink orders were brought out right away along with our chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were very delicious. Freshly fried tortilla chips salted just right with a green verde salsa that was beyond delicious with the right amount of spice. I started off with a bowl of the chicken tortilla soup. The temperature of the soup was perfect and the broth was delicious, not too salty not too bland. My entree was an order of shrimp tacos. You can tell the tortillas are freshly made in house. The tacos were loaded with fresh, non fishy shrimp and tons of garlic cilantro and that green verde sauce. Our tab was less than 40 dollars!!! It was an all around awesome experience and the next time I am visiting San Francisco I will definitely be eating here again! Los Angeles needs to get with the program and open up a gourmet Mexican place such as son pistos

8AjmaGfsVOcRkJ7qyXRZAw.review_text: The pride and gem of North Beach. I dare anyone else to recommend something else. Mama's? TOURISTY AND DAT LINE. Park Tavern? Yeah, Marlowe's. Anyways.   TAKE AWAYS:  - They have the coolest take on the "hamburgeusa." It's a must-try from Don Pistos.  - There's no restaurant sign, so be cool and see the three red lanterns.  - The organic consistency of their kitchen is worth a slow clap.   If you never ate in the Beach, please make sure this is on one of your food stops.

sAf5uv2ceoeutpqajpOOrQ.review_text: How can you go wrong with a pace that barns a shot, "baby what happened"  Oh and bottomless margaritas are a must!

UrkD6iinGp26KvsWi8c7pQ.review_text: One of the best Mexican meals of my life. The restaurant itself is adorable and provides wonderful, personable service. We had to wait an hour before getting a table due to not making a reservation ahead of time, but it was well worth the wait. It's easy to understand why people are lining up to eat here after you try the food. Every single dish we got was amazing - chips&guac, ceviche, mussels&chorizo, tacos, etc. The restaurant also serves up some killer cocktails and sangria to complement the amazing food.  Pro Tip: definitely get the mussels&chorizo. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Xqvz7wAAapUI8YAIydfaSQ.review_text: I... Love.. Don... Pisto's!!! Came here for a friend's birthday a couple weeks ago. I had heard good things about it mainly from the 7x7 list, so I was excited we actually got to go here!   First of all... pitchers and pitchers of delicious margaritas. Need I say more?  The chips were delish and I loved their salsa verde. The guac was also amazing!   They had a nice taco menu (I got to try one and they were really great), but what really blew me away was their hamburguesa (also, their item that's on the 7x7 list). Oh my goshhhhh this was the best hamburger I've ever had, I think. They cook it perfectly medium rare in bacon grease and onions (or something like that), so it had a slight hot dog-y flavor?? Not sure what it was, but it was so effing good! Served on a toasted bun with guac spread on top.. and that was it! I am salivating right now just thinking about it...  Also had some sort of tequila shooter at the end of the night (something mixed with pineapple something or other? not sure at this point..) but it was delicous nonetheless.  This is an awesome place for a birthday or get-together with a group of friends. It's not super stuffy, but also not dirty/dive-y.. perfect for Friday nights!

gAlI8OzLQn4YAiO7Ip_ViQ.review_text: Free margs while waiting for a table? I don't hate it. People often ask where to bring friends who are in town for a "fun, delicious dinner with good drinks". I don't hesitate and recommend Don Pistos. Everything is amazing-- the guac is unparalleled, margs are delicious, etc etc. Standouts in my mind are the fish tacos, mexican sashimi, and the hamburguesa (grilled in bacon grease, simple bun and only Guac on the burger-- trust me, it's all you need).  Love you Pete, keep up the delicious work.

xxTxE0YPqr1h59Jx-pAhCw.review_text: One of my favorite places in SF so far. I tried the Mexican Ceviche and the Grilled Calamari, both of which were excellent! Their seafood is fresh,  and their friendly service at the bar and at the tables make it a fantastic place to hang out. While their dishes may not be 100% authentic Mexican, they have a lot of taste and spice and are made with premium ingredients. Minus 1 star because their wait times can be over an hour, especially on Fridays and Saturdays, which can get annoying if you're not the type that plans ahead.

zf7g3tmLV4AvzASh1cNpog.review_text: Most definitely a place to check out in San Fran. Be sure to make a reservation - this place is always packed! Now to the nitty gritty...  The Pro's Cool, modern space Friendly, accommodating staff THE HAMBURGESA! If I could give ratings on food items alone, it was be five stars all the way. The burger is so flavorful and different than any other I've had in the city... a truly special meal!  The Con's Not a full bar - only serving wine & beer Overall the food (besides the burger) hasn't blown me away. Good, but nothing noteworthy

KxBYaUy007O8hl0LjIVnow.review_text: Where are the 6 star reviews?! I keep coming back, and they keep. getting. better.  The Hamburguesa is a CANNOT miss for anyone who loves hamburgers. The Poc Chuc (pork chop) is the best pork chop you'll ever put into your mouth.  NOW SERVING BRUNCH DAILY! They have some of the best Huevos Rancheros in the City, hands down. They also get their Brioche bread from the bakery next door, fresh daily, for their delightful french toast. I need to eat here daily.

tRyZ7RnmHi6rKFO0hRXZ6g.review_text: BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS / SANGRIA / MARGARITAS. Come for that and brunch, if nothing else.   Show up early (and I MEAN early), cause the wait can get nasty fast. The food is insane; Best guac I've had in the city. Service is spot-on, ambiance is casual enough that you won't feel awkward getting brunch-wasted by noon, like me. I recommend the Hamburguesa -- It's marinated in bacon; Not really sure how that works, but I'm not questioning that kind of magic. Keep it up, Pisto's.

Cce8rVboil4nvAZbVUF_1Q.review_text: We came on a busy Saturday night without a reservation and waited about 40 minutes.  Luckily there are several places nearby to enjoy a beer while waiting.  Tried several dishes including the tamales, rib-eye, and tacos.  All were average.  The tamales were great but could have used more flavor (like a red sauce, for example).  Tacos were fine but not as good as Tacolicious and other places nearby.  Standard selection of Mexican beers, although they don't have a liquor license so tequila shots are out (apparently the margaritas are made with an agave-based wine rather than with tequila).  The upstairs has a cool space, although we were seated downstairs (which has bigger tables and is probably better for groups).  It was very loud and somewhat warm, although it was an unseasonably warm day in SF so I can forgive that.  Service was average, although they were very attentive at constantly refilling the chips (maybe to draw our attention away from the small-ish portions).  All in all it was fine but I've had much better Mexican food in SF.  Like so many places in SF this seems to be overhyped and overrated.  Next time I'll go to Tacolicious, Mamacita, or Tropisueno instead.  That said, I've heard great things about the brunch and may give them another try to check that out.

yUPZfdDPqOR3kLvTvaS2NA.review_text: All fish menu? Over priced and pretty drafty by the door. Probably give this place a miss.

Jldzk3pQnaang4nhTQsGzg.review_text: Hands down the best burger i've had in a really long time, everything else was just ok.  After putting this place off for over a year, i finally got to try it! their burger was actually listed on the 7x7 list and i usually don't trust that list because it's a hit or miss, but this time i was not disappointed!  We were lucky because they only have the burger on their menu a few times a week. When it came out, the bun was perfectly toasted, the patty was big and juicy and flavorful and the guacamole was delicious.  We also ordered chips and guac for appetizer (which was just ok) and tacos to share. the tacos were good, but the burger is what really took the cake.

awF4toYWn5kobojnLxPTNA.review_text: Awesome tortilla soup as other reviews said. Margaritas Limey, strong and drunk too fast. Chicken asada was grilled to the perfect tender point. Smooth and creamy guacamole was flavorful and fresh. Great place. Hard to find with no outdoor sign. Guess you have to be cool to find it.

5VCUps_Y6FbNwCyzuavQIw.review_text: Liked the atmosphere! And it opens late. A good spot to grab a late night dinner.  Sangria is awesome here. Tacos are delicious. Also had Sunday brunch here once, and it was delicious as well. Quite interesting brunch menu, simple but tasty.

GRzU8pISt8Y2FTlZWV4eIQ.review_text: YES! Food, drinks, the scene!  Took my gf here for our 4-year anniversary dinner. We put our name down and they said it would be an hour wait. No problem, we grabbed a drink at Maggie's down the street and came back. This place was packed and the spot to be on a Saturday night. Sangria's are a must.  We finally sat down and ordered the Mexican sashimi, carne and fish tacos, and guac. Everything was spot-on. Guac was fresh and chunky with a little kick. Mexican sashimi was very tasty and the fish was fresh. No stringy-ness at all.   The tacos were great. Very filling, but the salsa on both were a little too spicy for us. We'll take note of that and ask for it on the side next time.   Reservations for 6+ people, and I would recommend this route if you're looking to come on a Fri/Sat night. Otherwise, plan ahead and get here early.   Looking forward to coming back here!

L5MCW6ZMjs_GrOAS7IxN2Q.review_text: I came here to catch up with middle school classmates. We made the mistake of choosing to come here on St. Patty's Day and the wait was an hour long. The food was good but the portions were small.  The noise level was unbelievably loud, definitely not the right place for a middle school reunion. But I would recommend it if you are looking for some good Mexican food in the area.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: What's the best word to describe Don Pisto's? W-H-A-C-K-E-D. Let me count the ways: (1) Brunch menu for dinner? I'm sorry but we didn't just wait 1.5 hours to "eat a f*cking omelette" as my friend put it. (2) Out of Salsa? What the heezy? Have you ever heard of McDonald's running out of ketchup? (3) Out of Lobster, Ceviche, and Carne Asada (limited dinner menu with just 3 entrees). They must have ran out of salt too because everything we ate was ridiculously bland. (4) Flavorless Guacamole ($6) that makes Chipotle's seem authentic. yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE… (5) Bland and watery Chicken Tortilla Soup ($12). yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE… (6) 7x7's Hamburguesa ($11) that was well-done and tasted like a meatloaf. As whacked as the 7x7 list itself. yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE…   (7) Weak, fruitless Sangria. Perhaps they forgot to go grocery shopping that day and the kitchen was having an "off" day but the icing on the whacked cake was the service. After waiting for 1.5 hours, we wanted to enjoy our dinner. Instead, we were rushed in and out the door in 31 minutes (yes, I timed it). As we sat down, our waiter hurriedly said, "you guys are my last table....are you ready to order?" Slow your roll, Mr. Testaverde, we didn't even get a chance to breathe much less look at the menu. $38 later, I wished we went to The Mission for AUTHENTIC Mexican food instead. W-H-A-C-K-E-D. OTHER NOTES: *To my dear Yelpy friends who gave Don Pisto's 4-5 Stars, please don't hate me. *I'm a fan of their sister restaurant, Chubby Noodle (my review: yelp.com/biz/chubby-nood…). *Reservations only taken for party of 6 or more. *Expect 1-1.5 hour wait on weekends. *Small bar area with 5 seats. No hard liquor available that night. *Tight and cramped seating for about 30 people in dining room and 5 communal tables in lower dining area. *Street parking is atrocious.

WsC4GysNUklYfzyQ3oEyqA.review_text: A friend from Spanish class has been buggin' me to go with her to Don Pisto's. Raving. Raving. Raving. "Okay. Okay," I promised. But the weeks went by... I dunno... I'm never in North Beach. But finally tonight, there I am. After the Rhys Darby ("Flight of the Conchords") show at Ccobb's--where my waitress bought me a cocktail and told me I was her favorite customer--grin, I popped over to Don Pisto's for a couple of shrimp tacos. And loads of really good chips--no charge. Tacos were fantastic--holy guacamole. But skip the wine-based marg and go with Pacifico.  My friend texted she was already in bed, so missed my cherry-pop.  But the place was super fun alone, so no harm, no foul.  Great staff. Great food.  Great vibe. Hit it.

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: My friend told us we were going to this "little taco place down the street" and I totally thought we were going to some hole in the wall taqueria. This is definitely not that.   This place was pretty hopping for a Saturday night at midnight. It is EXTREMELY loud inside but I loved the ambiance. Its really dark inside and while there were candle things on every table, none of them were lit.   We had waters and chips and salsa set on our table immediately. The chips looked like they were made in house and the salsa was just okay. It tasted too much like lime for my liking. I got the red snapper tacos even though I wasn't the least bit hungry. My friends ordered the carnitas and another ordered the ceviche. The waitress explained how the kitchen was extremely small and the food doesn't come out at the same time or something. It was hard to hear her but I don't think it was a big deal. Haha. The ceviche ended up coming out last which my friend said was really spicy.   The fish was cooked perfectly and it might just be because I wasn't hungry but I thought the tacos were just okay. The portions look small but the tacos are extremely filling. They all came with radishes and a pepper on the side. Neither of which I tried.   Service was fantastic. We had a great waitress. I think it ended up being around $60 for 4 entrees and two beers.   Oh and right after this we ended up chasing a hobo into Chinatown after he stole money out of an ATM after my friend left her card in the machine. Haha ohhhh North Beach =D

NR6Y46Ni2JjQcj4vDbqKUA.review_text: I feel like I should explore North Beach more because of this eatery...it's amazing!    Had a tiny trouble finding it since there's no sign, but during peak hours it's easy to spot since there's always a crowd waiting outside to get in.  I love the interior...spacious and dim.  Apparently all their food is organic here, something I didn't know till after.  Their menu is small, but that's probably a good thing since it allows them to focus on bringing quality instead of quantity which they definitely do!  I wanted to try the tacos, but since their hamburguesa is on the 7x7 list, I was obligated to get that and am happy I did!  I'm not a burger person in general and this one was only bun, patty, and guac but it was easily one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had!  I think there is bacon in their patty?  Bacon makes everything taste better IMO.  The patty was very tender and cooked to perfection while the buns they use is out of this world.  I couldn't pinpoint exactly why I liked it so much but it wins for best buns!  The only problem I had with my meal was that the margaritas were pretty weak.  Not sure if that's a regular thing.  Either way, I'll def be back to try out their tacos next time since I was eyeing my friend's during the entire meal.

ysCBsXWPB-LAiewVS3jZfQ.review_text: Nestled along the quiet corner of Union and Grant, Don Pisto's is the unsung hero of contemporary Mexican cuisine of North Beach. The interior from two dining rooms front and back are fairly small in all its brick lined glory, solidifying a guaranteed intimate experience just perfect for dates and small groups. I've partaken in the Don Pisto's journey before in small doses and encounters, but never to organizing a large dinner for coworkers and friends for what was an incredible experience from start to finish.  I owe it all to their incredible host Christine. She was the glue, kept the gears moving and was so professional and efficient throughout the process. After an initial call to setup, along with a barrage of back and forth emails customizing a menu with our logo and inserting various items with respect to dietary habits; everything was done within an hour. Upon learning that this was no ordinary group dining event (going away party as well), she took it upon herself to also pick up and store a cake that we had waiting in the wings. If that's not top notch service, I don't know what it is. Above all, she made me look damn good to the group and all I did was make a quick phone call.  When we had arrived, it was clear which table was ours - we were dead center and 16 seats deep in almost communal fashion. The main dining area was already small to begin with, considerably scaled back with our large group absorbing much of the scene. We weren't the classiest bunch of individuals, just the ones everyone wanted to sit with. And in the corner, smiling from afar, was Christina - plotting every little bit of our meal and getting us everything that we needed without even having to ask. It was a symphony of service and she was the leader of the orchestra.  Meanwhile our table was an endless river of sangria and giggles. The company was good it almost seemed as nothing else mattered. Our meal table was full of hits too numerous to mention, highlights include:  * Delectable shrimp taco, cooked perfectly and wonderfully juicy on a soft corn tortilla. * Mexican sashimi, with a twist of lime and cilantro and we're off to the races * Oysters, as fresh as they get from the bay. * Lobster is succulent and tasty, but very different to share. * Al Pastor was as good as advertised. Tender bits of rib chop, with the zest of pineapple.  The evening was a success. We ordered extra pitchers of sangria as the night went on, and before we knew it, it had been over 3 hours. Throughout the time we never rushed and service was stellar to the very end. Christine thanked us on the way out and even sent a follow up email the next day to offer her token of appreciation. After some cake, more sangria, a group photo, more sangria, and feeling stuffed beyond galore, we still managed to rock the rest of the night.  Don Pisto's gets nothing less than 5 stars for service alone. Throw everything else in the mix (ambiance, food, price,etc.) and you've got yourself a spectacular spot for just about anything.

bYHATM9F2aSQoxruIm33Ng.review_text: Great food. Ceviche was fantastic. Fish tacos were great. Favorite part though: the tortillas and the chips. It's the little things for me - and these are important details many restaurants go cheap on. Not Don Pisto's.  Short but great menu. Very very loud.

YgFV0pciG20qgGEXAj-MUg.review_text: Spot on service. Maybe because it wasn't as busy at 11pm on a Tuesday, but everything was delivered or refilled super fast.  Food itself was pretty damn good too. Guacamole was awesome and surprisingly the salsa was my favorite thing here and FREE. Tacos were pretty spicy for a white gurl like me. Pork chop is a huge portion, so share :)   Ambience is pretty hipster but the music makes it chill.

nVbstcP76ZWpIKOq3Lhhog.review_text: Wow, is this place delish!!! I'll definitely be craving the mussels, served in a crazy  chorizo sauce with big hunks of bread for dipping. Be warned -- it's very rich, and very spicy. But oh, so worth it!  They also his this crazy hamburger with bacon ground into the patty, and, as though that weren't enough, an avocado spread. It was good, but a once-in-lifetime type of deal. Because I'm pretty sure I'll keel over in a heart attack if I ingest any more of that.   Regardless of what you order, enjoy those incredible tortilla chips with that addictive green salsa, and round things out with a perfect margarita.

JW0tg-u1GZJSiat4r3prxg.review_text: This place is real busy however they take down your name and number and call you as soon as a table is free. We were told and hour and half last night yet after going for a short stroll they called within 30 minutes. The food was wonderful. Good sized serves that didn't leave you feeling over full. My friends were saying best Mexican they'd ever had! Our server was awesome and friendly and kept a good eye on us. Love it. Will recommended to all my friends.

8kgQupO4TS2bpCGSPhTTIg.review_text: Hamburguesa. Enough said.  This little burger might be one of the best burgers I've ever had. Seriously. It was that good. The bread was perfection, and the patty was fluffy and filled with bacon. The layer of guac between the bread and patty was the perfect consistency and went amazingly with the patty. YUM.  The chips and salsa are bomb dot com as well. However, they will ruin your appetite, because you will eat  ton of them, and be extremely happy about it.  Also, for $17 you can get bottomless mimosas, sangria, margaritas. Unfortunately, my stomach was unable to handle liquor that morning, but my friends loved their drinks.  Finally the venue is adorable, and the service is IMPECCABLE. Though there is a slight wait, if you have a party of 6 or more you can make reservations! Score!

GiC_S3Hhfh02Yy6c9prDvg.review_text: Wow! Some of the most delicious food I've had! We started with their chips and salsa (tomatillo), and I we had to keep getting our bowls refilled because the salsa was that delicious. We had the mussels and chorizo, and the broth blew me away. it was absolutely amazing. My bf and I also had fish tacos and chicken tostadas. SO much flavor in every bite. the rice and beans on the side were just mediocre, and the margs weren't as strong as I needed them to be ;), but overall, this is some of the best Mexican food I have eaten. Such amazing spices and savory flavors. I am definitely coming back!

DVnDB6C2m5xqEFnjfwCdDA.review_text: Thursday, 8:00PM. Waiter: Corey.   Long line...  Quickie: +Good food +Cool decor  Suggestion: *Expand menu  And then...? One of our order items took abnormally long...but Corey/management made it up to us by waiving the charge. Couple that with delicious grub and they've made us fans that night!  ********** Stuffed my face in:  1. Burger      +Toasted bun, moist  2. Steak tacos      +Zesty salsa  3. Chips and guac      +Fresh and flavorful guac  4. Pork and pineapple      +Interesting take on a taco, they pulled off the savory and sweet combo

Hnu5s_myOZZIS2eny7liVA.review_text: This was the dinner leg of a friend's bachelorette party. Our menu was pre-decided and the restaurant provided cute personalized menus. They also seemed to accommodate dietary restrictions (vegetarian, dairy-free, etc.) well.   Overall, I thought the food and drinks were all very good: -- Margaritas and Sangria by the pitcher: I only had the margarita, which I thought was just fine.  -- Chips, Tomatillo Salsa and Guacamole: Delicious! The tomatillo salsa has a kick.  -- Ceviche: Fresh and flavorful bit big chunks of shrimp, tomato, avocado... -- Calamari: Grilled, not fried! -- Fish Tacos: This was my favorite dish. A nice chunk of fish atop corn tortilla and topped with a cabbage slaw and some sort of dairy sauce.  -- Chicken Tostadas: Crispy tortilla topped with moist, chopped chicken. Tasty.  -- Carnitas Tacos: I didn't try one of these but it looked good. I was just too full at that point.  Aside from the food, the music was our JAM (90s hip hop/rap/dance hits). The downstairs room, where our group of 10 was seated, along with a few other large groups, was WARM. They had lots of fans and such but it was still uncomfortable. Service was good but seemed to stall at times, without good pacing between courses and we had to request additional drinks and wait a while for those refills.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Pretty good spot! I came one Wednesday, because I was told about this bacon marinated burger they had. Except my friend built up the hype and told me this sucker was 1/2 a pound of meat...which, I don't think it was. But it was a pretty decent burger.  They can split it in half or quarters for sharing. Between our 3 people...it was harder. ha.  Burger - quite delicious. I'd like it a little more medium (or at least have SOME pink). I'd guess its not possible, since they have bacon inside it, and that needs to be well cooked. The burger has a huge layer of guac on it, and it just adds to the fatty drool-worthy ness of the dish.  The mussels in chorizo broth was so delicious. It comes with some buttered and grilled bread, which they can refill for you. It's so delicious. The shellfish is cooked perfectly, and the sauce is a little spicy, but to a level that just makes you keep going for more. We kept trying to sop up more sauce while also digging around the bottom to find chunks of chorizo. I wish I had a spoon.  The salmon sashimi....was amazing. Like, amazing. They had the freshest slices of salmon, sitting on a bed of sauce (white wine vinegar and soy sauce), with thin slices of jalapenos, cilantro, and I'm sure something else. It was just...delicious. I'd say its a must-order.  We also had a pitcher of their margaritas, which was good...but not for that price. There was a little too much ice put in there, and unless you're drinking it all in 10 minutes, it gets diluted pretty quickly.  Service was very good - our waitress was great about being attentive without being too pushy. Environment is a little intimate, but it seems good for larger parties as well. The bathroom...is in an awkward location around the corner from the kitchen, down some stairs. But is fine. Overall, a pretty good experience!

yfr7xoIX77mmatXrim9EZg.review_text: I'm a fan of Don Pisto's. Who would've thought the best restaurant in North Beach, aka Little Italy, is a Mexican restaurant? But it's true.  The ambiance is cool - low lit lighting, brick walls - but not TOO cool or romantic.  They seriously must do something to their chips.  They are amazing. I generally fill myself up on those amazing homemade fried tortillas.  Then I eat even more, willingly, and enjoy it even more.    My go-to here is the hamberguesa - a VERY simply burger made of quality meat, with a spread of simple but delicious guacamole on the top.  Nothing more.  And nothing more is necessary, that's for sure.  It just packs so much flavor.  I also have enjoyed all the different types of tacos, and the calamari in particular is great.  I have yet to go for brunch, but that's surely at the top of my list.  My tip to newcomers: the sangria isn't very strong - try something else. Don't miss this unassuming (sign-less) North Beach spot.

Xsim_eDuetehqeaH5S8Fng.review_text: Good tacos! Came early to avoid the crowds and got right in. Menu made for sharing.

mZHZh1ZxQvBX8plM9NIuFQ.review_text: The absolute best hamburger I've ever had. Will come back every trip into San Francisco. LOVE Don Pistos

DZUkOq_hjvEiYw3cJEV7nw.review_text: I absolutely loved this place when I first tried it, but then I learned of their health score which made me reeeally sad :(

QDJ3jq5xnVh-u4BpEUM9zg.review_text: I've been to Don Pisto's twice while in the city and I would definitely recommend this hip little restaurant. Don Pisto's offers delicious sit down Mexican street food. I have not been disappointed with any of the menu choices that I've made so far.   It may sound silly, but my friends and I LOVE the free chips and salsa. The chips are unlike any other restaurant and the salsa has just the right amount of hot sauce.   Some recommendations to order include: -Carne asada tacos: The portion was small, but this small finger food was delicious.  -Brioche French toast:  DELICIOUS- Don pisto's offers delicious  thick slices of bread with a topping of sweet  maple syrup.  And of course, you cannot forget the bottomless Aqua fresca mimosas or Sangria's.

ah05Jawc0qDoRE4QIrpWog.review_text: This place was freaking delightful. Came out here during ChefConf 2014 and was so happy. Came with a group of 6. We asked the waitress to just bring an assortment of food so we could try everything. The hambergesa was the best out of everything. But that doesn't mean everything else wasn't delightful also, because it was.

ZSMsUvgfkEgv1v3GJxKJXQ.review_text: I like it here. Ceviche is good Tacos were good And Margaritas were good!... I would recommend it definitely. Only thing that was bugging me was how hot it was in there but, it is a tiny room and the kitchen is right there. But everything else was great!

bfSuJtjD8By7ByylmJDMGw.review_text: Best Mexican Food Restaurant in San Francisco. The ambiance is perfect. From what I can remember it was kind of hidden but once inside you're tummy will start to rumble. You can full on see the kitchen from which they cook all their food. The bar is a bit small but a great seating spot to wait for an open table. I have this thing for ceviche, and their ceviche was the best! It helped me improve my ceviche skills at home from some of the added ingredients I saw in the bowl. I also had the chicken tacos (to die for). Margarita's are the best after a long day  of walking. I was impressed with the hubby for finding the place. The music was loud which we like. Can't wait to visit again.

2gtHoqz3Kctf8iBWV7rBNg.review_text: Very very good guacamole.  The green salsa they bring to the table is also great. We went on a Sunday and had the special: Tacos Sonora.  It came as one big homemade flour tortilla loaded with meat and toppings.  We had our choice of carne asada, carnitas or al pastor.  I had the al pastor on the recommendation of the manager and it was excellent.  I would have liked two smaller tortillas rather than one giant one, which was delicious but a little unmanageable as a taco.    They have an assortment of Mexican (and Mexican sounding) beers.
