I had a Pacifico which went well with the tacos.    We went with kids.  My two youngest shared the french toast and bacon, which, although not Mexican, was very good.  It was plenty of food for both of them.    The place was LOUD. We waited about 15 minutes and sat at two tables of five because they didn't really have a 10 person table and it was crowded.  The wait was worth it and I'd go again.

lFdcgrMkHCmvTjMEw4CVDQ.review_text: Small, small tacos.   I was so excited to try Don Pistos but I left disappointed. I knew there would be a wait and was told 45 mins for 4 people by the man host yet there were several empty tables. They dont take reservations and they dont seat incomplete parties and it seemed like they didnt want to seat anyone. There were literally 5 open tables and a bunch of people waiting yet nobody could sit. Lame set up.  Onto the food: the portions are TINY. The calamari app was good, the tacos were great and the guacamole was fantastic. But for $9 for 2 tacos (carnitas or carne asada), they need to be worth it and they weren't. They had 2 tablespoons of meat on a small corn tortilla. I also tried the fish tacos which were awesome (they're grilled!) but again, a really small piece of cod.  Don't think that I can afford to be jipped here again when there are other Mexican spots that can stretch the dollar! (T-lish, Tropisueno and Tacko it is!)

_5Lz3GpMME7EprsFE76gLw.review_text: Easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. The Hamburguesa alone is enough of a reason to try this place. Hamburger marinated in bacon and onions topped with guacamole... you're already making your reservation aren't you? That part is a bit of a drag; they only accept reservations for parties of 6 or more. So if you plan on going solo or with a small group make sure to get there early. The wait can get to be over 2 hours.   Atmosphere is fun and hip with good music. The service has always been good and prices are very reasonable. Only wish this place was bigger so the wait wasn't so bad.

wdghJO_nUpBo8ecY0ZTm6Q.review_text: Don't be fooled by the lack of branding on the exterior... this is something worth waiting for (we waited two hours).  Great tacos, the 'make-your-own' chicken taco dish and of course, sangria.  However, for all of those looking for this infamous burger marinated in onion and served with only guacamole, they were sold out and said it would now ONLY be served on Wednesday -- visitor beware.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Don Pistos is a great addition to the North Beach dining scene. In a sea of mediocre Italian restaurants, a solid Mexican spot is just what the neighborhood needed. And that's exactly what it is, nothing groundbreaking but a solid neighborhood joint.  The menu is small but everything on it sounded enticing. We ordered with our eyes instead of our heads (aka ordered way too  much food) and tried:  -ceviche of the day: shrimp with chunks of avocado -carne asada tacos (we wanted carnitas but they ran out) -pollo asado tacos -hamburguesa: they had me at marinated in bacon and onions!  The tacos came two to an order with a side of pickled chilies/carrots and were surprisingly large. The chicken was a clear winner over the steak, probably the first time I've ever uttered that phrase.  The ceviche was also a nice portion and had a great, acidic bite. It was served with homemade chips which were really tasty but served cold...I would have preferred the chips warm. We were also offered some chips and salsa as we sat at the bar waiting for our table. Nice touch.  Now, the hamburguesa. I don't know what got in to me to order a burger at a Mexican restaurant but it was definitely the right decision! Slathered in guacamole and served on a soft bun, this is a must order for the burger lover.  Service was over the top friendly, though we asked for our food to be paced it did come pretty much all at once. I'll chalk that up to opening month issues. Also, the menu doesn't offer your typical Mexican restaurant options - no enchiladas, no tamales, no three combo platters. Don Pistos is sticking to the upscale street food theme and with food this good, I think they are really on to something.   Bonus points for being open late (12:30am during the week, 1am on the weekends) and have a large selection of Mexican beer! No margaritas, unfortunately, but next time I'll be sampling the sublime looking sangria.

dbqwzNAIseUSYnmusg-D5A.review_text: Based on the "Hot on Yelp" on my iPhone we went to Don Pisto's while in San Fran. Really enjoyed everything, the bartender was awesome, the drinks and food were great. Will go back someday. Family style Mexican menu is also very cool.  There will be a wait not sure on reservations.  Food- 5 Stars Amazing tortilla soup, HUGE portion (seriously, a meal in itself for 2 people)   Good tacos and great tostadas  Drinks- 4 Stars Great Acai Sangria and good beers. Very small bar they do the most they can with it.  Atmosphere- 4 Stars Loud but fun. Seems like a good date place although there was one loud ass party of 8 or so there when we were there that occasionally made it too loud to talk comfortably.  Value- 5 Stars.  Cheap as hell considering the amount of food, the quality, and the location.  Service- 4 Stars. Very good and timely. Cute never hurts either.

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: I don't go to Don Pisto's anymore.  I think it got a bit too popular and its ego outweighs its character now.  Very sad.    [I promoted the place *a lot* and had some really snotty behavior from Pisto peeps the last couple of times I tried to bring some friends in.  I admit that last group of friends was being a bit stupid (drunk) but wasn't loud or obnoxious, just a bit dumb.]

PWscTKskBJNGW38u1z_Frg.review_text: Very much enjoyed the meal here but will advise that the portions are modest so keep this in mind depending on what you are looking for. Of course, what you do get is very tasty and presented nicely. the staff were friendly and almost bordered on overly-attentive, seemed like every other minute someone was asking how things were or filling our water glasses. Not a bad thing but almost comical by the end. Would definitely return to explore the menu further, the raw tuna tacos were great!

Fio2gV152lDCp7F6gIZYiA.review_text: LOVE IT!  Walked in on a friday at 5:45, and already 1/5 full! (opens at 5:30)  Chips and salsa placed in front of you when you sit down.  Thick chips, salsa verde, my favorite.  This is going to be a good dinner.  Mexican sashimi was fresh and refreshing.  Fish tacos were so succulent.  The fish were not fried, rather pan fried.  Would be perfect if there was a little bit more seasoning/flavor with the taco.   The beef & eggs (wagyu) was melt in your mouth (needed a couple sprinkles of salt, which was fine because it was on the table.  holy cow I love having salt on the table!   Corn tortillas are perfect.  I wanted to get more, take it home and wrap everything I have in my fridge with it.    Sangria was great, but a bit watered down.   Fresh food done right, could add in a little more flavor on couple of dishes

4qN6pRVY0HkwNoW82vKMoA.review_text: Found this gem on the recommendation of a waiter from another Resturant.  We arrived about 615 so no waiting.  Awesome sangria and lobster tacos!!!!  Don't expect typical or texmex!  Trendy and hipster!

TwAdpqIA5TzhSpfJzqerkA.review_text: I live for their puerto nuevo lobster meal, hamburguesa cut into 4s just cuz, pitcher or margies and chips and fresh green salsa for days. I crave this joint weekly.  I love the unassuming location and relaxed, almost sexy vibe.  Very chill crowd, fantastic waitstaff, even when you and your friends are last men standing. This is definitely my go-to for (very) late dinner with ridiculously scrumptious Mex food.

5ZXT4BQB-C1XjUpKmh7kaQ.review_text: I first heard about this place on Thrillist and bookmarked it for later, so come last night when Cathy Y. and I found ourselves hungry at the corner of Washington Square park we headed to Don Pistos.  Because what better way to celebrate St. Patty's day than with a little south of the border flair (yeah, not so festive for this holiday, but we won't hold that against this place).    We were initially impressed by their green salsa (ooh a little st. patty's day spice perhaps?) as evidence by our quickly empty chip bowl, and then more so impressed by their guac.  I opted for the tortilla soup and my friend got tacos.  She loved her dinner, and I loved mine but I was unfortunately too full from all the chips (and maybe the fact that i'd had a huge slice of cheesecake about an hour earlier).  All in all, fresh tasting mexican fare that left us happy/in a little bit of pain (the good kind of course).    We dug the vibe, appreciated the water pitchers on the table, and enjoyed the acai sangria and the background music.  However, it was really crowded when we got there and the waitstaff was clearly hurried and stressed out by all the people, so it took awhile for us to get seated, even after a huge wave of patrons left.  But i'll forgive them this time, because once we were seated it was a pleasant experience.

ek-DTKEOtfWewahooEiMfw.review_text: Loved the food! Super cute place but small and the wait was fairly long (a little over an hour).  We were sooo hungry by the time we sat down but I don't think this is why I loved the food so much.  Carne asada tacos were a must order, and so was the mexican sashimi..

vQvfR5H5ZRQNVgjLoqch-w.review_text: Great little place! Delicious food and lovely atmosphere. I would return and recommend to friends.

ZcV07Slk8KSZ8NPa3qhh8Q.review_text: We live in North Beach, love our neighborhood, and always want to support local merchants. We were excited to try Don Pisto's earlier this evening. However, we were treated quite rudely simply by arriving five minutes too early prior to opening and asking if we could wait inside with our infant daughter as it was getting cold outside. We explained that we did not expect service until opening, just wanted to wait inside. The host acted like we were the most uncouth people who have ever walked into his restaurant and made it clear he was doing us a big favor by letting us stay. Needless to say we promptly left. Nobody should be treated like that. Sadly, we will not be supporting Don Pisto's and will encourage our neighbors to do the same.

tOD7m_OdxytzTvT4qlUWSQ.review_text: North beach may be considered Little Italy, but Don Pistos reigns king for me.  As you walk through the doors, there is no denying the warm and inviting ambiance.  The decor gives you a taste of a modern Mexican flare with warm tones of beautiful paintings around the brick walls.  The staff is attentive and accommodating with quick service too.  The fresh fish tacos were most amazing and the warm tortillas tasted homemade.  I also had the lobster on another occasion and it was absolutely delectable.  The summer stew had a spicy kick which compliment the sweet calamari so incredibly well.  I am excited to try their brunch soon too.      Don Pisto's is one of my favorite restaurants in the city and the owner Pete is so passionate and creative about his place.  You can taste it in the food and feel it in the energy of the resturant.  I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to you.. great vibe, food, drinks and ambiance.  You have to try...

Pdk3RZGes5-jgYT4NP3vdA.review_text: The tacos were awesome and the margaritas did the job too!

7CIKyVHB2V2gbc3JtYjbjA.review_text: Amazingly good fresh real Mexican food and strong margs too. Would eat here once a week if i lived in SF.

9BPYt5jFN0vQjP42sCQdOQ.review_text: I'm honestly not too sure what the fuss is about this place. I tried to call ahead for my group of four and thankfully talked to a nice guy that said he would "take care of me". That was great and all, except I noticed when we arrived, that he was running the restaurant more like a night club. I'm pretty sure we got seated anyway in the order that we arrived in, so nothing that fancy or special there. I did hear him mention to another couple that it was an hour and a half wait...at 9 pm on a Saturday. I couldn't believe people were still eating that late!  When we got inside it smelled delicious, albeit, was super hot! We really enjoyed the margaritas but were pretty surprised to see the less then extensive menu. For a Mexican place, I have seen hole in the wall places with more food than this place offered.   The waitress was very nice and attended to us rather quickly. She answered all of our questions and I would definitely give them a thumbs up on service.  Everyone in the group got tacos of some sort. Usually when people order a taco "meal" there are three small ones. This place only delivered two, and they were tiiiinnnyyy! Seriously, my boyfriend took his down in two bites, but probably could have managed one. They were also super greasy which is not my preference. I thought $11 for two tacos was pretty expensive, but I also do recognize the area and apparently the hype.  All in all, I don't think I'd visit again having had the "experience". The food was good, but it was tiny portions, and it's not really worth the wait, especially in SFO where you can find just as great of places that are cheaper and you don't have to "know somebody" to get in!

v3p1cJQ-nrKysOnUk2L7pw.review_text: Just moved into SF and felt like Tacos. Waited for 45 minutes at the bar. Cozy place and busy. Had the shrimp and red snaper tacos, they were fantastic. The micheladas were spicy with real limes, absolutely fantastic.

TZQ1UrV5BKOo6uIz3xGkSw.review_text: The Mushroom & Serrano Chile Omelette was fantastic. The side of potatoes was pretty much equivalent to what I would imagine a crack addiction to be. Everything was fresh, service was quick, and it did not break the bank at all. Fabulous.

nLOF2qXMJfTbbcVtDo8oZA.review_text: I have been looking for a good sit down Mexican restaurant in SF since the only one I like thus far is Tropisueno. Don Pisto's is now another favorite of mine.   I went without a reservation on a Sunday and was seated within 10 minutes. I was pleased to find out they had Sunday Drink Specials and ordered Sangria for $3. I normally don't like Sangria because it's too sweet but this Sangria was tasty and cheap! Hard to pass up.  My table ordered the chicken enchiladas, steak and eggs, and shrimp tacos. I would recommend ordering a few things for the table and sharing. The tacos are definitely a lighter choice than the main dishes. Next time, I want to get the tortilla soup because it looked awesome.  Overall, the food is great and it's inexpensive. The ambiance is great for a young group - it's dark and sexy. The only downside is it's extremely hard to find parking in North Beach.

3MMTwPtpiMlBDe-p07XK9A.review_text: Every year I visit San Francisco for a week and every year I come to Don Pisto's for a margarita fuelled meal. It's always fun, flavoursome and the service is terrific with that great mix of friendliness and authority (ie. "how about I just order you two serves of the octopus and a jug of margarita to get you started?"). With more than a few people in your dining group, having a waiter who can tell you what to do means you eat quickly and there's none of those stupid conversations about what to order.  Start with chips and salsa and a side of guac. Then move on to ceviche, octopus and the must oder mussels with chorizo. Trust me, you'll want to stab your dining partners for the last slurp of the rich broth in the bottom of the bowl. I've tried replicating this dish at home and it never lives up to the deliciousness that is served here.  Finish with some tacos to fill out any gaps in your stomach before you shuffle out the door. The special fish taco of the day is always a winner.

tXhscxwFTd-ayLTdPx_2yA.review_text: When we came in they wouldn't seat us due tot he party not being complete, the lack of a full bar was pretty annoying in general. I ended up with a beer, which is not what I wanted.   After being seated we just decided to pretty much order the menu (for the most part). The tacos were very good, the pork and fish ones were really fantastic, but the rest of them were decent.   There are better places in SF to get similar tacos and upscale food which I believe are better than Don Pisto's. It's still a hell of a lot better than what you get in most of the country, but I am a hard grader when you have places like tacolicious and nopalito in your city!

irFk4niiXe5iR-C7mgjy_w.review_text: I thought this food was ok, their pitchers of margaritas were good, and it was a bit pricy and SUPER crowded.

nj2d6vt4TlE-7_OEN0-kGw.review_text: I have never had better tortilla soup. There, I sad it. Seriously though... this place is so awesome. It's a little rustic, but go with it, you won't be sorry. My friend and I shared the tortilla soup and mussels with chorizo. I usually HATE chorizo. Really, I do. These mussels were so tender, so delicious, so unbelievable. I barely even tasted the taste of chorizo that I don't enjoy! Everything was just wonderful.  Order the sangria to go wash down your meal and be very happy that you did! Don Pisto's is a meal you won't forget, and an affordable one at that. Check this place out if you are in the area, it's a North Beach spot you'll thoroughly enjoy.

mFsgzbMr11tQvm58yfuE4w.review_text: So, I am giving this place four stars partly based on the fact that North Beach is to Mexican food as the Mission is to Italian.  The only two regular Mexican restaurants her, Zorro and Nico's are complete garbage and that sets the bar a little lower.   I am a fan of Mojito's tacos, but it is more of a bar that serves Mexican food than a Mexican restaurant.   That said, there are some really good items on the menu here.  The crevice is pretty unique and the pastor is some of the best I have had.  Also the service here is really friendly and fast considering how packed the place can get.  The down sides with this place are that it has a rather limited menu and is on the pricy side for Mexican food.

pYXjk01AkHFaUWrCGvkz1w.review_text: I think my new love is ceviche. Tangy pieces of rare fish sounds oddly appealing. The thought of it makes me salivate. A failed attempt for dinner at Limon brought us all the way from Mission to North Beach, where we luckily scored a parking space on a Saturday night. Don Pistos was bustling with pretty people, making us feel short and inadequate. We were not dressed in our best Saturday night attire as we had just come back from the suburbs of Sacramento. This place is perfect for pre-clubbing eats or group dinners (they have a separate area for groups). The guy who helped us, who I assume was the manager, was point on with his service. We ordered the sangria with our food and when he noticed the food came out before our drinks, he comped us for the drinks. Unexpected but really nice! The meal came with complementary freshly made chips and salsa. We opted to add guacamole ($5), which added to the experience. LOTS of guac = happy Tina. The sangria was good, though a bit too much for my sensitive EtOH tolerance. The mango ceviche yelp.com/biz_photos/voFE…: AMAZING. Must get for sure. Sweet pieces of juicy mango with tuna drizzled with the perfect amount of lime juice. I would come back again for this. Our group also had the tacos (carne asada, camarones). Greasier than we would have liked but still good. The Hamburgesa (burger marinated with bacon, onions, guac) was also good. Overall, very hip Mexican street food joint. Definitely more expensive than your typical taco joint but it's all about the experience. Plus, their ceviche is delish!

HLYSw1EpzjqAD6Y2PYLh7g.review_text: The carnita tacos, and shrimp tacos  are awesome, loved the margaritas the service is great, very friendly we will be going back.

VG_3vXKC9s4gwWHr338U_A.review_text: Kinda a hidden gem since there is not company signage on the building. We had lobster, pork tacos and the pork chop, mussels and a few more items and they were all great.  The dipping sauces are very good!!.  We got there about their closing time and they did not rush us.    I really think you cannot go wrong with anything!

aMBkcgtRHVu2AnRczmtmAg.review_text: I'm really sad to have to write this. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood. I keep trying to give them more chances; but things have gone so far down hill in this establishment.  It all started about a year ago when bottomless brunch became a limited 2 hour deal. Fine, I get it, you don't want people sitting at your tables all day, not a huge deal.   A little after that, they started charging for chips. I'm sorry, is this not a Mexican restaurant, I find that a tad chintzy.   On another visit, I find out that they have converted that lovely bar (see past review) into seats for dinner guests. This would be fine, but now their is NO where for anyone to wait to be seated. I realize theirs always a wait here, but at least let me visit your bar while I wait the 45 minutes to eat.  If this wasn't bad enough, on what will sadly be my final visit for a while; I see they have taken about 50% of their taco's off the menu. They have also switched that already limited bottomless brunch to 1.5 hours.  I miss the old Don Pistos.

VMrZCUfRwLp31QUH8YAh4Q.review_text: I was on the hunt for good hearty Mexican food with my friend Jess and found this amazing local hangout. We got tortilla soup, which feeds 2 and Carne Asada tacos. Great combination of flavor and spice and accommodating service! #Moosh

1BuH5Es8d161YjfBmt6cDg.review_text: The service was great! Our server had personality and a sense of humor. I ordered the ceviche ($13 at the time, it varies depending on what seafood they are using). This was delicious and pretty spicy (and I can tolerate spicy food very well)! The sangria was delightful, as well! It was so good, I could have had endless glasses of it.  Oh, they serve chips and salsa verde for free. Delicious! We kept asking for more. I believe they are both homemade.  I also had a bite of my friend's hamburguesa. The bacon-cooked patty was to die for. I definitely would come back again. I would love to try their brunch. We went on a Sunday, and they served brunch all day that day. Not sure if it's the same for Saturday.  Tip: definitely make reservations in advance if you have a party of 6 or more. They only take reservations for large groups. Otherwise, you'll be waiting for a while, as they are a very popular venue in North Beach. Who can blame them--great food, great vibe, great service!

As3PGConLtPOKgfGtAizNQ.review_text: Fun restaurant to come to for some higher end Mexican dining experience. The place has a rustic look and feel inside and is a little on the smaller end.    They provide you with unlimited chips and homemade salsa. Their tacos were good, but I'm not too sure if it was really worth the price. I think i would be just as happy eating $2 tacos from a taco truck, but then again like i said, it's more for the experience here.   Don Pisto's is right next to all of the north beach bars so if you're craving some Mexican food before you begin the night this would be a great place to start.

Kho08pWNfeGnRbZTnMKy3w.review_text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday. I am from out of town but our friends are locals and love this place! They told us we should get there early, because it opens at 11 am but people already stand outside and wait to get in.   The ambiance inside is nothing special but you would come here for the food.   I got the bottomless sangria which could have used a bit more alcohol, but the food was great! The chips, salsa and guacamole were also really good. I got a large flour taco with carnitas which was amazing! The flour tortilla tasted homemade which was what made it extra good.   I highly recommend this place!

-HtarjA0N2I65xUg3bw6Pw.review_text: Came here while doing a little exploring of the city on my own on foot. It turned out to be a long trek but well worth it. I sat at the bar, where the full menu is offered, had a glass of wine and some food. The calamari app is a revelation (took that from "I Love You, Man") and is a must have. The bartender was very friendly and funny. It's a very small bar and he does a great job of getting everyone sitting there involved with one another. The two girls next to me did some app trading and socializing thanks to him breaking the ice. Everyone at the bar was even given a delicious house made shot on the house at one point. The Mexican Sashimi was the other app I tried; also amazing. My entree was the pollo asado which came with mini tortillas, guac, and a very flavorful salsa verde (ask for their hotter salsa to spice it up, also very tasty. The pollo had a glaze over it and fell apart very easily into pieces, which made my taco building that much easier. Very small menu, but smart because everything is made to perfection. Do yourself a favor and stop in while you're in the area.

hn0u7yiDBoHAIoCw1CNX3g.review_text: Fantastic place to eat. Everything was great. Highly recommend the ceviche, pescado tacos, camarones and diabla shrimp! Rice is delicious. Size proportions are great for sharing. Staff is friendly and atmosphere is lively. Definitely would come again

uat5RITkk8BQpnGO453dVg.review_text: The House Mussels with Chorizo Sauce could be my last meal on earth and I'd die a happy man. Awesome place to come and grab a bite. Staff is awesome. Overall great place to be.

4Ev2ab9JLlbaZbwI0jPuRQ.review_text: Get the Guacamole, and 24 oz corona

9-piWE67DPPQko8uL4wULg.review_text: This place is excellent. Best restaurant in NB. I highly recommend the pork chop and the bacon burger as well. Avoid the tacos and lobster as they are a bit overrated. Grab a beer and guacamole to start. I recommend sharing everything. Excellent date spot. Put your name on the list ahead of time though.

CSbiiQ39fsks93wLzhvKxw.review_text: Hands down, my favorite "upscale" Mexican restaurant in SF.  I used to try going here about once a month and even had my college grad party here.  (They have downstairs reserved for large groups too).  The staff is friendly and accommodating and the food is just delicious.  Only twice have I tried something that I didn't LOVE, and it was the lobster and the carnitas tacos.  Don't get me wrong, I didn't LOVE them but they certainly were not bad.  My favorite dishes are the red snapper tacos., tortilla soup, and shrimp tacos.    They have the freshest chips and the most amazing salsa to start your meals.  Also, try the pitchers of sangria and margaritas.  Most restaurants offer pitcher drinks that are watered down, but not here.  Very nice indoor design, I feel like it's a place where you could celebrate any sort of occasion or just go out on a date.  Be warned though, it's important to get there early as they do tend to have longer waits and parking in the area is a nightmare.  Love what you're doing Don Pistos!

3IBoCe--upk24sxjM-xcxA.review_text: So I have been wanting to try Don Pistos forever.  Yes, forever.  Before it was even a concept.  Before I was even conceived.  Etc.  Forever.  Finally went with a group of friends.  Here is what was put in front of us at one time or another at the throughout dinner.  * Corona Light * "The Don" Margarita * Chips and Green Salsa * Mexican sashimi * Grilled calamari * House-made Chorizo Mussels * Al Pastor Tacos * Hamburguesa  I wanted to love Don Pistos way more than I did.  I wish Yelp would let me give a 3.39 star review or something.  This isn't a three star rating restaurant, but nor is it a four star rating restaurant, in my opinion.  It just feels like something is missing.  True, they don't have a liquor license and so technically the liquor is missing.  And yes, the kitchen is extremely small and they don't have dessert options.  And maybe there isn't a sign on the outside of the building so you could say that is missing, but I prefer it that way.  But, I don't really hold any of those things against them.  It's something else.   Maybe it's just that I wasn't blown away by anything that I had to eat here.  Not to say things weren't delicious though.  They were.  Just not all that memorable for me, which I had hoped for.  But let me make myself clear.  I do not dislike this place.  The staff is very friendly and inviting.  I like the simplistic atmosphere.  It's a comfortable place to have a good dinner at.  And I didn't even touch on the Hamburguesa which is outstanding.  It is delicious.    So...at the end of the day though, I do recommend Don Pistos.  Make your own call.  I trust you will have a good experience.  And honestly, might have a different of opinion and be completely blown away by their food.  It's worth a visit in my book.  I'm sure I'll give it another shot at some point myself.

si_JzsBn0s98cKPf4T1qhw.review_text: We are eating our way through the alphabet and searched on Yelp for an appropriate "D" restaurant to try out.  The restaurant is tucked away in a residential neighborhood, and if one wasn't paying attention the storefront would easily be missed. The ambiance was simple; a dark space with mood lighting, lots of chit chatting, and the smell of food and smoke wafting from the open kitchen.  We ordered the "Hamburgesa" and "Poc Chuc".   The "Hamburgesa" was different, definitely not the typical version we are used to. It has a slightly smokey flavor to the meat. While it is tasty, I don't think it'd be something I'd particularly crave for. It was lacking something, maybe needed more guacamole, to balance the savoriness of the beef.   The "Poc Chuc" was much better. It had a bold flavor and cooked perfectly. For $17 (versus $25+ that I've seen at other places), I thought the pork chop was a good value as the chop was quite large.   Overall I enjoyed my dining experience here at Don Pisto's. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but the "Poc Chuc" would definitely be the thing to entice me to do so.

roDaNB-sGL6PZF1pCiLY4Q.review_text: Don Pisto's is my new go-to for brunch with friends or family visiting in town. Great atmosphere, good food, good drinks, appropriate price-point.   On the brunch menu the Pork Tamale with Poached Eggs is tasty, I would likely order again. The tamale could use some additional bread-item to mop up egg-yolk however. Not enough tamale to do the job.   Pork Tacos are a bit lacking. They could use a little more citris, or possibly simmer in its juices a bit longer. Something was lacking flavor-wise, would most likely branch out and try other items on the menu next time around.   I'd like to reiterate the food is good. I'm going for the constructive criticism here. :)

h3Yg3OE9uD6XEAPyEm3qEQ.review_text: I've had Don Pisto's bookmarked forever, but am rarely in North Beach. The other weekend we happened to be starving in North Beach around 5:45 so decided to cross Don Pisto's off the list. Good thing too, because a little after 6 and there starts to be a wait.   + Loved the beer list. Pretty much any Mexican beer you could want.  + Chips and salsa - yum! The salsa is a green tomatillo and is very tasty.  + The tortilla soup was just okay - the one I make is better (thanks to Rick Bayless's Sopa Azteca recipe).  + Now, on to the hamburguesa... yum. whatever you've heard about it is probably true. The beef is a different consistency than most burgers (more like a meatloaf? hard to describe), it's cooked all the way through but still very moist. It's topped with creamy guacamole. The bun is soft and a little sweet like a torta bun. We decided that it's a perfect thing to split -- too delicious and rich to eat the whole thing. But definitely a must-order. + If you have a large group reservation, there is a huge private room downstairs -- don't worry if the main part of the restaurant looks small!   There are a lot of delicious options for sharing and the Mexican beer list is great, but what I really like about Don Pisto's though, is that it's a great value.   After writing this review and thinking about the food, I already want to go back!

A89MjFltabOCP4ThDSiAlA.review_text: 5 stars for the quality of food combined with the bottomless mimosa/sangria/margaritas!  This place has surprisingly one of the best burgers I have EVER had. It is cooked in bacon and tastes amazing with nothing on it.  Whole brunch menu is great and the tacos are good too.  Overall it is a fun atmosphere for a big group!

T1ucuBhKtXNtuZSahbN51w.review_text: Came here on a Saturday night. I love the playlist they had playing. It was loud old r&b music and we almost felt like we were in a bar. Not the best for talking at a large table but definitely a fun vibe. The chips were bottomless and served with a yummy green salsa. I got the red snapper tacos, which weren't served with anything else so might not have been enough food if I hadn't had so many chips. I also got the sangria, which was good, but nothing to write home about. I think there brunch is supposed to be better so I would like to come back and check that out. Overall, a fun restaurant but the food isn't super special for SF standards.

qXuKi6fzmSCu5DqAoHIw_w.review_text: Their Pork Chops are to die for. The chips and salsa are very good, the sashimi was excellent, the service was very attentive. It's rare that I find places I absolutely gush about, but this place is very good though it can get pricy.

LOJD_5jiDVJELHZJAH30xA.review_text: Worst service we've ever had. First, people who walked in, without a reservation, were seated before us. We waited for 30 minutes. We ordered 4 different plates...all came at different times. 1 came...then 7 minutes later 2 more came....then 15 minutes for the final dish. Food was great, but only had enough for a 4 year old. Extremely disappointed by the service. We read reviews and expected it to be great and we couldn't wait to get the hell out of there.

DUCVhBH9quiMZo5phvNzIw.review_text: After reading some of the reviews I was glad we stopped by for lunch rather than waiting in line for dinner. I was hoping the understated (bland) interior existed only as a muse to blow me away with some great food! Not so much.  I guess I just don't get it....      To start we had the guacamole. Holy bland! Break out some spices peeps! It tasted like room temperature avocado soup:( Since I didnt want "brunch" at 2 in the afternoon on a Thursday, we had about 4 or 5 choices for tacos.       We had the carnitas and the al pastor tacos. So I get a warm tortilla, warm meat and some hyper spicy salsa? That's what people r waiting in line for? Seriously, I'm curious. I guess I'm too much of a texture snob. I got the warm/soft. Give me some cold and crunchy.  Something to balance out the meat perhaps. Seemed very one dimensional to me.       I had heard great things about this joint so needless to say I was underwhelmed. Had I waited for an hour or so and gone with a big group, now I woulda just been pissed. In my opinion, a complete lack of imagination and execution. Being the minority with that perspective, I would normally give a place another chance. However, with such a limited menu I hardly see the point.  Movin on...

J0G7SAItOT4opuLSK2-tmw.review_text: I liked the atmosphere a lot - it felt like everyone inside was your friend...or lived in the same village or something. Ya know, old timey stuff. It's kind of dark inside though. Don Pisto's was like the "unicorn" for my roommates and I, since we've wanted to eat here zillion of times, but were always deterred by the wait time. Well, this time we beat the system by having a large group and therefore being able to make reservations! Yay!  We got free chips and green salsa to start with, which was super fresh and hot (well, the chips were. The salsa temperature was normal). The chips were those fatty kinds that have a double layer with air in between. They were also extremely accommodating and kept refilling our chips and salsa whenever we asked, and also provided multiple plates for our large table. Waitress was really friendly and joked around with us.  I got the Hamburguesa, as well as the Sangria. I like white Sangria better, so this one was kind of strong flavored for me. I liked the flavors of the Hamburguesa, but couldn't really get over how...soft the patty was. I've never had a hamburger where there wasn't some part that was hard. The Hamburguesa is like biting into a mushy meat and guac cloud. My friend said that that was how you could tell the patty was freshly made and homemade, since it was soft (he also mentioned that it's cooked in bacon grease), but I'm still not into the texture.  I was surprised that a restaurant with so many patrons and so well known for their bottomless drinks only has 1 bathroom per gender.

b8EnjL9DwA6rNDQ9yoIwWg.review_text: Food: Everything was good, but my favorite part was the 32 oz Coronas in the brown bottle. Best Corona I've ever had.  Ambiance: Intimate and hip with a dark Spanish dungeon kind of feel  Service: Good   Price: A little pricey for Mexican food, but well worth it.  Overall: If you're in the area and don't mind waiting, check it out.

wT3KT-3jvLLXynC8ss8Whg.review_text: Came here at 5:45pm on Saturday evening and it was packed! We put our names down for a 30 minute wait. Walked over to find a full bar (there were only 4 seats). My friend had the sangria. I've had better at other places but this is the only one I know that offers bottomless sangria for $15 - awesome deal!  It's a pretty small space and we were seated once a table had finished and got the best seat in the house (mind you, this place doesn't open until 5:30pm.) We ordered the:  Mexican sashimi - salmon in a tangy ponzu like sauce w/jalapenos. Although decent, I've had the same type of dish at sushi restaurants so it was nothing new or inventive. Ceviche - lots of seafood w/squid but a little too hot for my liking Guacamole - couldn't stop eating it - delish! Hamburguesa - meat patty cooked in bacon fat?! Mmmm.. :q I enjoyed the flavors but felt like it was missing an acidic element, for example instead of having plain radishes on the side - maybe pickle them/ Al pastor tacos - sweet, spicy and tender. Pretty good  All in all, a solid meal in the NB area - reservations highly recommended!

RPtDPYhO1VckFZsjQ-Vv3A.review_text: Really delicious salmon...tempted to give it 5 stars based on that. Fish and Carne Asada tacos were great but not mind blowing.

fou9pya19z4NWWAGZslxXA.review_text: Great hipster Mexican joint in North Beach. Really cool vibe and well worth a visit.   The free tortilla chips and salsa were fantastic as was the guacamole dip and the carnitas tacos (a bit spicy) I ordered. Awesome margaritas as well.  Excellent and very friendly service---our table was a little bit wobbly and the waitress without being asked came over and put some napkins underneath to stop the wobbling.  Prices are good, most tacos were under $10.

sgiF4xmzbq__evyAevKApQ.review_text: Always a fun time, and not to mention good food.  Bottomless mimosas are strong and the tacos are to die for.   Chips and salsa to start, you cant go wrong.

Xwn64gTZJhpV9SkMUkmuzw.review_text: A party in your mouth!  On a girls trip up to San Francisco my foodie friend suggested we go here.  We met up with another friend that had recently moved up to San Francisco and we all had dinner.  This food is slap yo momma in the face good!  You have to get the tortillas.  They are fired in pork fat.  So not healthy for you but WHO CARES!  We also ordered some sort of beef but it was more like a baby cow it was so huge.  There were 3 of us and we ate off of it and still had plenty to take home.  I don't know what they marinated it in but it was delicious!  It was perfectly cooked, tender and juicy.  I am certain I heard the angels singing while I was eating.  Then we also ordered some lobster thing.  OMG!  I almost started to cry it was so good.  I think my eyes are starting to water just remembering how GREAT the food was here!  A must go place!  They don't take reservations and tend to fill up quickly so get there early.  They are only open for dinner.  I love North Beach anyway this just made it even better.  Did I mention how good everything was? I am soooo NOT EVER becoming a vegetarian with meat this good!

0EccxN9uPM7QFGDFe9f1BA.review_text: Steer clear of this place. We came here on a Saturday night for my bestfriend's birthday. We had a party of 10 and had made the reservations several weeks earlier.   The service was poor and food was average at best.  I decided to order the "hamberguesa" but because I am severely allergic to gluten, I had asked them to keep the bun off the order. The server responded by saying since this is their signature dish they can make no adjustments. She was extremely rude about it. I understand not wanting to change the items on the menu, but I was merely asking them to keep something off my plate for medical reasons. Additionally, you would think they would make a minor adjustment considering we ordered $750 worth of food!  The rest of the food was very average. I found out later that the owner of this restaurant is not even Mexican.   I would suggest hitting one of the authentic Mexican restaurants in the city where the actual owner and head chef is Mexican and where they will treat a food allergy seriously.  Sorry Don Pistos. You are lucky to even receive one star.

Z5UMkDcKeXMaypr4br3yQg.review_text: After climbing up the stairs to Coit Tower my wife and I were tired and hungry.  She knew I wanted Mexican food and found this place on her wonderful Yelp app.  I'm so glad she did.  We actually almost walked right past it.  No big signs to advertise the location, but a delivery truck parked outside clued us in.    Cutting to the chase:  Chips and salsa:  Fresh homemade chips, and salsa verde served to go with the bottomless margaritas.  Yum.  My wife and I ordered and shared the Fish Tacos and the Taco Al Pastor.  The fish tacos were very good, fresh grilled white fish (I forgot to ask what kind) very moist and tasty.  The star of the show, however, was the Taco Al Pastor.  OMG  Some style of pork with, a sweet/smokey sauce with pineapple, and fresh cooked   beans served on a homemade tortilla and drizzled with creme fraishe (I think).  One of the best thing's I've ever eaten!  The only downside it that we don't live in San Francisco.  I would come here all the time if I did.  Friendly and timely service.  Keep up the good work, Don Pisto's.

_HjtE-SCg6qye_ukSYrfjg.review_text: Awesome tacos and service. A lot of Chicago people work here so we felt right at home although we were on vacation. Get the chorizo and mussels!

xfbSQGUaUAlkQ_v-ZCR09A.review_text: Pisto's gets a solid 3.5 stars from me.  Don Pisto's is a fun brunch spot in North Beach. My favorite item on the brunch menu is the huevos rancheros. Poached eggs on top of crispy tortillas, topped with cheese & avocados. They come with a side of crispy potatoes. I also recommend the chips and guac.  It can get a bit loud and rowdy in there, but you can drown it out with bottomless mimosas or sangria.    Pro tip: You can make reservations if you have six or more people in your party.

J_M-GT7t8sWGcYyPKsTRVg.review_text: Wish they had a full bar, but the scene if fun and lively, and the price is rock bottom.  The service is great, as well.

krhueH9uihxVjhhDNcqi5g.review_text: Yum yum yum.  Cinco de mayo in the city, wandering North Beach, what do you do? Yelp "margaritas" and Don Pisto's comes up.  We arrive here around 11:30, put our name in and grab a margarita for the man, mimosa for me, not too upset about the 30-45 minute wait.  Looking around, the drinks are flowing, everyone is having a great morning, the kitchen is busy, and the food smells amazing! Less than 10 minutes later we are seated and told about the bottomless mimosas, margaritas, sangria (and you can have all 3 if ya want) for $17. Ordered guac, steak tacos and a pork "burrito". The food came out pretty quick and I have to tell you, this was some of the best mexican food I have ever had. The pork was so juicy and flavorful, the steak tacos were delicious. The homemade chips were the right amount of salt and crunch and the salsa and guacamole were addicting.  Pair that with our everflowing drinks, I died and went to food heaven.  I am pretty sure that every trip to SF in my future will include Don Pisto's brunch.

RfpMMvDobLoZ49-Lpfr3Yg.review_text: I was really excited to go here based on the great yelp reviews.  I have to say that I was a bit disappointed.    Let me preface this by saying that we went here for someone's birthday so we had the $30 fixed menu.  (It came out to $45/person because we were charged for an extra person, plus tax and tip).    The servers were nice.  We started out with the chips and salsa.  The salsa was probably the best part of the meal.  It was tasty.  We then had guacamole.  The guacamole was fresh, but was lacking in flavor.  It was a bit bland.  We had some ceviche and then tacos.  The tacos were good, not great.  I thought that it was way too pricey based on the amount of food shared by the table (enough food for about 2 scoops of guac, one scoop of ceviche, and one of each taco).  Their tacos are on average about $9.00 (for 2 tacos).  I'd rather go buy some authentic tacos for a couple bucks - better tasting and a lot cheaper.    I don't think the food was worth the price and parking in north beach is terrible.

mMb2HlX95z5467Y1o0UlJQ.review_text: So great. Tacos Al Pastor were incredible. Staff was very friendly and took good care of us. The guacamole was really good - simple, not overly seasoned. Atmosphere was really cozy and pleasant.

w6SaPljfM2KfW9guNXCkGA.review_text: I have been hesitant to write a review becuase I am not sure I can be concise about everthing I love at Don Pistos.  We come here pretty much every Sunday for either brunch or dinner.    Brunch: Bottomless mimosas for $12 is a must.  They make these with a different fresh fruit juice (was watermelon for a few weeks, then pineapple... my fave!) that puts a nice refreshing spin on the mimosa... or orange juice if you specify.  I also love the Sonora tacos.  I wish they would serve the Machaca beef and eggs on their brunch menu!  Pretty pleeeeaassseeee?  Dinner: What don't I love on the menu?  Guac is delish but I love to start by splitting the Tortilla Soup.  It is killer and can be shared by up to 4 people.  Because everything is so good here, I like to come with a group and share many dishes.  Even with free flowing drinks and a group, I rare spend more than $40/person.   - Chorizo mussels ($14) : perfect for when I have eaten too many chips and salsa.  Don't be fooled by the description of white wine sauce - the chorizo gives it a rich flavor perfect for soaking up with the bread  - Machaca beef & eggs ($17 ish)- tender juicy marinated shredded beef with a perfectly cooked egg on top to be scooped into warm home made tortillas.  Perfection.  - Chili verde chicken tostadas ($11) - light refreshing and crunchy.  Love the side of beans.    - Carnitas tacos ($8) - just yummmm  They serve beer and wine only but manage to make good margaritas somehow.  But the sangria is even better.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: Hooray for late night eats. After seeing a show at Cobbs down the way, we were pretty hungry. After 10pm on a wed things get dire. So we saw they were open till 12 and headed over. This place used to be El Raigon an Argentine steak joint back in the day. Still exposed brick walls and dimly lit, theyve kept the same vibe. Friendly bartender-server sat us by the window. After looking at the fairly concise menu we went with:  -Grilled Monterey calamari -Carne asada tacos -House made chorizo and mussels -Poc chuc  Id say the tacos were somewhat average and for the price many taquerias and trucks will do you morejustice however the other dishes were very well executed. Seafood perfectly cooked and the pork for the Poc Chuc had a great crust and still juicy internally. Te application of citrus and chili was also well done.   The patrons seemed to be twenty somethings in large groups for this night. Service is solid and obviously the line can produce great food. 4.3 stars

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: Been here a few times and keep forgetting to review it!  It is always great to find a late night spot! Came here a few weeks back when my cousin was in town and stopped by Don Pisto's at 11:30pm to get some dinner. He had a late work event and I was actually at an awesome Yelp event until pretty late.   The place was relatively empty except for a few people at the bar and a couple tables so the service was friendly and fast. Unfortunately, they had ran out of a few of the dishes since we came so late which was a bummer, but still had enough options for us to order.  Personally, I had the fish tacos which were REALLY good. The fish was not fried (which is key!) and the slaw provided the perfect tartness. Even after a 5 course meal, I happily ate both of these. :) We also had the guacamole appetizer and may I say, the guac is solid. Super fresh and clear that they had just made it for us moments after ordering.   I'll definitely be back to Don Pisto's for all my late night needs. I haven't tried their brunch yet but given the reviews, I think I'll be going pretty soon!

cufhYFdyrUAt4SWe-m0grQ.review_text: If you greet me with sangria and margarita, the odds are high that I'll like you. I like you, Don Pisto's. First of all, the main dining room isn't that large. For the people who just dropped in and expect to be seated in a reasonable amount of time... on the weekend... in San Francisco... just... no. Think, people. Think. It's not going to happen to and to fault the restaurant when reservations are possible... well, that just doesn't make a lot of sense. Chastising out of the way...  What impressed me the most about DP's (heh) wasn't the food, although it ranged from decent to pretty good (I didn't partake in the lobster taco extravaganza; I was trying to be cost-conscious). What left such a positive impression on me was the service. You know that study that says that service is the crucial element in a dining experience and that people will come back and recommend a resto with okay food and excellent service over one with stellar food and crappy service? It's true. It's 100% true. I came here with an unwieldy group of loud eaters and drinkers. Not only did our waitress handle us with a smile, she was on top of orders, drinks, plates, and silverware the entire time. I was impressed. Whereas I, likely, would have been chain-smoking out back if faced with our motley crew, she smiled, joked and navigated our table with the ease of a consummate professional. For her alone, I would come back and recommend (with reservations for a definite seating) it to others. However, since man can't live on service alone (heh), I've gotta tell you to try the shrimp tacos and al pastor tacos. The pollo asado is pretty tasty, as well -- even for those folks who recoil at the thought of ordering a chicken dish when going out to/for dinner. But, truthfully, everything tastes better with a belly full of sangria AND margarita, so be sure not to skimp on the libations. Don Pisto's is a terrific party if you do it the right way.

tSUQVGXYtxA_7NCA6uUgrw.review_text: I am as guilty as charged when it comes to judging books by their covers. This same notion is also applied when judging restaurants by their appearances. I've never been a "hole in the wall" type of lady, so exterior and interior design could be the final reigning factor when trying to figure out where to dine at. With Don Pisto's, I was sold the moment we drove by.   Don Pisto's is discretely located in the North Beach neighborhood on Union street adjacent to a sweet little alley way. The missing restaurant signage and all cream brick facade made Don Pisto's even more mysterious and intriguing. I was unsure of what promises a signless restaurant could hold, but was convinced that the crowd of people that congregated at the front meant the place was popular. Once inside, we were encompassed by dim lighting, red brick walls and a noisy atmosphere. Somehow the chill vibe with a side of chips and salsa accompanied by a strong marg seemed perf for that night's dinner. Although the estimated wait time was about an hour ten, we decided to list our names and grab a couple of drinks at nearby bars since there were several that were walking distance from the restaurant.   Four beers and an hour later, we finally received a call letting us know Don Pisto was ready for us. We settled for the Wild Monterey Calamari, House-made Chorizo Mussels and Carne Asada tacos all washed down with some margs and cerveza and devoured with a side of chips and spicy chile verde salsa. I was impressed with the calamari. I automatically assumed the calamari would be the typical deep fried battered rings of goodness, however much to my surprise (and my inability to read menu descriptions) the calamari was grilled and served on metal skewers. Although I am obsessed with the usual deep fried calamari rings, I absolutely loved Don's take on grilled calamari. Also, I am not the biggest fan of radish, however the radish salad that accompanied the calamari was quite delectable.   So why three stars? Unfortunately the carne asada taco just couldn't win me over. The taco was drenched with the essence of arbol chile salsa. Now me and spice we have a civil relationship. There's a limit to how much spice I can take, perhaps one can still label me as a novice. Jalapenos, good. Arbol chiles, bad. Very bad. The first bite I took seemed promising until those small hints of heat escalated into a raging fire in my mouth. I wanted to cry, I wanted to die, I wanted to drench my tongue with loads of milk and forget that arbol chile salsa ever entered my mouth. Two bites into my taco and I threw in the towel. I could not manage the spicy no matter how hard I tried. Fortunately our server was very kind and understanding about my lack of tolerance towards absurd heat. She quickly brought out another serving of tacos with less spice, however by the time that was brought out my appetite was already lost. I tried to abate any remnants of heat by devouring everything else in front of me -- mussels, chips, chips and more chips, which ultimately resulted in me being too full to manage even one bite of the second serving of tacos.   Despite the end of my dinner ending with such unfortunate events I was really impressed with the service at Don Pisto's. I truly appreciated how our server tended to that heat mishap and continued to provide such benevolent service.

Bx1iLCgUyu4HPepkYut4Uw.review_text: Came here last night with a party of 7... we did have to wait a while, but I thought that the wait was justified considering the size of our party and the fact that it was Saturday night at a popular spot. Also, the wait did not even seem long, we got drinks at the bar (bartender was great) and had a good time sanding around talking.   The service throughout the meal was friendly, and the food was amazing!! I had to get the Hamburguesa after hearing so many good things about it, and it was worth it. I had expected the food to be really good, and it even exceeded my expectations. One of the best burgers I have ever had. Some others at our table got tacos, and everyone was satisfied with their meal.   I love the atmosphere and the people here... I can't wait to go back and try more things on their menu!

flH3oA_8fuPM9m7al1Cugg.review_text: I can't believe I haven't yelped this place sooner! Literally everything is amazing from the authentic street tacos to the chips guac and salsa that is completely addicting!   It's like a modern lounge/taqueria that plays top 40 hits but tacos taste like authentic taco truck tacos. You have to try it to believe it. :-) I can eat here everyday.   Oh and also, I threw our office holiday party here in their back room, everyone was just as in love with the food as I was. They have a group menu of your choice that you coordinate in advance with Margeux I believe is her name. Highly recommend!!

lcBxErp_W1aNAPD_2RikcA.review_text: the brunch is amazing. bottomless margarita/sangria/mimosas and you can switch between the 3! the breakfast burrito is perfect and not too big of a portion like most. the chips though... that's what gets you. they are so good, so don't eat too much to spoil your meal! i sound like your mom...  and i change my mind. this is better than nicks!

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: Don't blink, you might miss Don Pistos. We came through an alleyway and didn't see a sign as we headed straight for it (thanks to Yelp).  Walking in, we were welcomed into its dark wood & brick interior. The fresh-made chips and salsa kick started the meal. Our thirst was quenched by the sparkling red sangria. And our appetites were delighted by the fresh tacos, guacamole and Mexican Street corn (gotta have this - it'll knock your socks off, in a good way). Glad we didn't blink.

deY8YTZCcbZkSQ8PFdUs-A.review_text: A tucked away, neighborhood restaurant.  Know the address because I don't even think there was a name on the door.  Casual, brick interior with basic wood tables.  Nothing fancy, it just felt good/comfortable.    Sat down and ordered the chips and guac and a round of margaritas and their speciality shot of tequila.  The guac was excellent.  The salsa had serious kick and was also fabulous.  The tequila shot was a unique tequila and made it go down a little to easy (which led later to another shot).  The menu is simple without a ton of options, but a good range of them.  Two of us ordered their street tacos (one carnitas and one pescado).  The carnitas were amazing!  The pescado was also good, but after the carnitas, I couldn't relate.  Our services was great, friendly, and just right.  We had a great time shooting the breeze there.  Like I said, it was all just comfortable with great food.  Can't wait to go back on my next trip into the City.

v4JB1KYwrZ3ykWpgExqGeA.review_text: Amazing. Guac and chips to start were great and we are very particular about that.  We tried the tortilla soup that everyone raves about and it was good, but not my favorite.  The tacos and tostada were the beat We had a relatively new and I

y2C3X-sbOVfXL0X-mxkplw.review_text: I can't begin to say how much I love Don Pisto's!   This is the one restaurant I don't mind waiting an hour for a table - and it usually takes this long every time we go!   This is my favorite place to enjoy Sunday Brunch, I mean what's better than Bottomless Mimosas/Sangria/Magaritas?!?!?! I crave their chips and guacamole all week long, soooooo yummy!!!! =)

p-8vlScJDlYfmDQoKAmshg.review_text: Don Pistos....  Please keep in mind that I'm really good at cooking Mexican food and have grown up enjoying amazing Mexican food my whole life. I'm biased.   I love that this place is in my neighborhood. I love knowing that if I absolutely need to have some Mexican food and I don't feel like cooking or heading to the Mission or to Zorro I can go here.   This is definitely a place to go to for a special event. This is where you go when you're feeling fun and fancy, but not too fancy. This is where to go when you got a slight pay raise or your tax return. This isn't the place to go when you want delicious or authentic Mexican food.   Servings are small, prices are high, the drinks aren't strong. My favorite item was grilled calamari. The ceviche was good too but way too overpriced.   Your best option is to go here for brunch and get the bottomless margarita/sangria/agua fresca option.

4T2uVlRjkl0eogswfL2bTA.review_text: One of my all time favorite spots in the city!   Margaritas are strong! Chips are crispy and salty! The food is spicy!   I have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered here.   Be ready for a long wait before being seated, BUT the hostess is willing to take your cell phone number and call you when your table is ready.   GO GO GO GO GO....this is an all time, bucket list, must try type of place!

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: Yes it totally trips me out that this place doesn't have a sign but you'll notice it because there are tons of people surrounding it.   We came at 6pm- half an hour after it opened on a Thursday evening and was able to get seated right away but the place was getting packed quick!  Wasn't looking for anything heavy so ordered 2 sets of tacos- 1 fish and 1 pork and a pitch of sangria.  The tacos came in 2 and they were so flavorful!   This was the perfect amount of 2 people. Can't wait to come back and tr different things. Yum!

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Underwhelmed after hearing so many positive things about this place.  It almost feels like anytime you said "Don Pistos" the response you get is "OMG i LOVE that place".  After drinks we walked over here on a Thurs night around 9:30pm and were seated immediately downstairs (group of 7 of us).   I ordered the shrimp and carnitas tacos (2 for $9-$11).. even being relatively drunk neither of the tacos stuck out to be very flavorful or delicious. Just whatever, probably not even as good as tacolicious.   I wanted to try the hamburguesa that everyone RAVES about but apparently they only make it on Wed nights. WHY?  I was not impressed, but would be willing to give this place another try on a Wed and try the sangria and chips as well to see if it helps.

WdozhJg1HGsOajMnAP8vKQ.review_text: Love the bottomless sangria   The French Toast Brioche is amazing and the Huevos rancheros is one of my favs in the city

vppka_ZryQUa15YWqOEzXA.user_location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
vppka_ZryQUa15YWqOEzXA.review_text: Dear Don Pisto's, we're breaking up and I'm leaving you... for your sister (Pisto's).  Three long, unforgettable years were brought to an end this past Sunday (2/23) as I witnessed DP's successfully generate their competition.  In an "effort" to drive more traffic their new sister restaurant, Pisto's (which is less than a stone's throw away), they removed the treasured al pastor, carne asada, and carnitas from the menu.  This now leaves camarones, pescado, and suadero, the bland "replacement" for the missing beef and pork, as the only taco and sonora options.  I simply can't stomach how a Mexican restaurant would remove the arguably three best options from the menu.  Furthermore, how can one not offer the Mexican flag ships, carne asada and carnitas?  Not only have you now cut the sonora and taco choices in half, you simultaneously scratched off half of the already limited menus.  I suppose this happened earlier with the street corn and the now limited hamburguesa (Wednesdays only).  Did I mention these options are available daily at Pisto's?    Despite Don Pisto's being dead to me, there is actually a huge positive side.  Pisto's gains every amazing dish that DP's once served.  These dishes are what made DP's the top Mexican restaurant in the city.  Pisto's has essentially become what Don Pisto's was three years ago.  This is not only true for the food, but also the price point.  If you are new to Don Pisto's, skip it and pay a visit to Pisto's down the block.  Kate and Summer, I applaud you for leaving Don Pisto's and bringing all the perks, as well as the head line-cook with you.  -An old regular.

MTHfYILqTelMfu2vyT-ycA.review_text: This place is awesome! Our waiter, Nick, was great, he was just on top of it! Don pisto's should give him a raise. Bottomless mimosas is the way to go! Food was good, but you outta order a lot of it...portions are small.

NxqbODpDwsDrKH7GCyIDPA.review_text: Really good carnitas and care asada tacos. Margaritas were okay. Could upgrade the tequila. It would be awesome if they had a tequila menu with a good selection. Atmosphere is great. The staff here are awesome. Unassuming yet classy hole in the wall vibe. I'll definitely be back!

KI7gPbRvdngGcgq3-RD7Gw.review_text: Probably one of the better kept secrets of North Beach :).  Came here for brunch last Saturday...MEXICAN brunch...what a nice change of pace :).  I even appreciated the dim clay-colored walls as it was refreshing compared to my usual sunny brunch spots.    To be honest, I'm not (and never really will be) a big fan of Mexican food -- but so many great things about this place that I'll get over myself and give well-deserved review.  ($0) Complementary tomatillo salsa and chips -- Amazing!! So limey and appetizing. Just be careful not to fill up and miss out on the food. ($2) Mexican Sodas -- I got the mandarin one which tasted like Fanta (meh..), but the non-alcoholic Sangria the bf order was really good.  Wish they sold it at Safeway. ($9) Chorizo and Poached Eggs -- More like a potatoe and chorizo scramble, with two poached eggs on top.  A bit simple and even with the spicy kick of the Chorizo the dish got boring soon after.  I think there are definitely better things on the menu (i.e. the omlette i was eyeing at the next table look mucho tasty). ($8) Breakfast Burrito (chorizo, queso oaxca, eggs, salsa fresca and sliced avocado) - Boyfriend seems to really enjoy it.  No stupid brunch line and great service -- I'll definitely be back to try the omlette next time, along with the bottomless sangria ($15).  Seems like it'd make for a great group dinner spot too!

ZzKyPEZtQ5qYO2u3rpIipw.review_text: Went to a birthday gathering during the evening of November 15th. We had a group of 12 that ate downstairs it was super hot, no circulation whatsoever! . Food was okay nothing to rave about, but nothing to run from either.  Service was not the greatest. I was glad to have  had great company with me  to distract me

TNAma2LPzhbtiuKkTTjU0A.review_text: Delicioussss.  Tortilla soup might have been the best bowl of soup of my live.  Torilla, avocado and chicken in it.  I'm sure a ton of other spices but it was just incredibly flavourful.    Tacos (Carne Pollo) I had were excellent too.  Even the tortilla chips were great.

4xKzexoWTwAbBt48VNzsLQ.review_text: Absolutely amazing! Extremely authentic and tasted like gourmet Mexican food. The staff was bet good as well.

kibikQ72DgWuM1zWf-THOQ.review_text: this place is more tacolicious than tacolicious (or any other taco joint in this town).

IYrF-qqy7u6LNa0zqDjvWg.review_text: The mussels with chorizo tasted pretty good at the time, but gave me and my friend food poisoning. Rough.  The burger was a huge disappointment - dry and overcooked. I literally don't understand why this dish is on the 7x7 100 Things to eat in SF list.  The chips and salsa were probably the best part of the meal, and that's just not enough to bring me back here. Sorry, Don Pistos.

fMBA_z1hwURKp9uArgSmKA.review_text: Mexican food in North Beach?  I was a bit skeptical at first so I Yelp'd Don Pisto's when I found out my fiancé and I would be dining here.  I was so excited after reading everyone's reviews.  We were a group of 12 and luckily someone knew the owner so a large table was waiting for us upon arrival.  The bar area is very tight and gets packed quickly.  I noticed other patrons who arrived around the same time as we did and they waited over 30 mins to be seated.  Our party gathered at the bar to drink and waited for more people before we took our seat.    I started with their Acai Berry Sangria and it was quite refreshing.  It did not include any fruits so it was a nice full glass of alcohol.  I moved to their Margarita halfway through dinner.  I wouldn't say their alcohol is strong since I had several glasses and only had a slight buzz when we left.  We had 2 pitchers of Sangria, 4 or 5 pitchers of Margaritas, and several buckets of beer.    We ordered family style and shared everything. My faves were Al Pastor tacos, Carne Asada tacos, Shrimp tacos, and Fatty Lamb Ribs.  The Hamburguesa was huge in size and had a nice twist to the typical hamburger but I probably won't order again because there are better options.  The sashimi was fresh but the portion was a bit small.  Guac was tasty though I enjoyed the free green salsa much more.   Do not sleep on Don Pisto's.  The food & drinks are nothing short of amazing.  We'll definitely return... hopefully for brunch.  NOTE: there's no signage out front so look for the address instead of the name.

Wr15soCpLKYgTPEmuFusvQ.review_text: not your typical Mexican joint!  We had the ceviche, calamari, pork chop, and every kind of taco they had.. also the burger! amazing guac and verde! love love love!

iyZGLIhZffqIycfvBwTyCA.review_text: Food was good but not memorable. My husband wanted the burger but they only make those on Wednesdays. Chips and guac were great. The tacos were pretty standard. Not sure what all the fuss is about. I'm from Southern California and tacos like this are everywhere. Maybe the five star reviewers are from other parts of the country.

NK4Rl_WzKC4ocT6NbOYs8Q.review_text: Great food and good sangria! Brought in a small group of friends on a Friday night and although the wait was obviously long we all sat in the bar and had amazing service from the bartender.  Everything I tried on the menu was awesome but the mussels are incredible! My husband hates all seafood, but even he thought they were great.  People complaining about the long waits here or anywhere else in NB need to realize that all the good places are packed pretty much Wednesday - Sunday. If you want to avoid crowds try to go early afternoon.

1kI6IQhkQvgL7fj9OLPNeA.review_text: Came here last Friday night and waited about 15 minutes for a table, but eventually found spots at the bar. It's nit picky, but whoever built the bar, built it a bit too high for most patrons to sit comfortably and eat. I am 6'1, and it was still high. Get higher chairs guys.   On to the food. The chips and salsa was a purchase at $3. Kind of expected to be free at most Mexican restaurants. They give you green salsa, which is good tasting, but I generally prefer a tomato salsa. I had the Tortilla soup to start, and it was very good. It was a good size portion perfect for sharing (as it mentions on the menu). My main was the Pollo Asado. The chicken was fresh and organic, but had no real flavor other than the chicken flavor. Not much "asado". The dish comes with a proper red salsa, which is what should have come with the chips in the first place. Also comes with green onions. No rice or beans. For $18, a little more garnish on the plate would be appreciated  Props to the bartender Nick who was welcoming and engaging. Gave great service and was busy, but found a great balance to engage the bar eaters as well as service the rest of the restaurant. It should be noted that they only serve beer, sangria, and agave, which tastes different than tequila and is not as strong. I stuck with the beer since I personally drink tequila and do not like the taste of agave.  I am cool with trendy spots, but for the discerning Mexican food connoisseur, a little bit more would go a long way

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: I miss El Raigon which used to be in this location but Don Pistos is pretty good too. I've been here twice.   The first time was with my family after Beer & Oyster Festival. I greatly enjoyed the amazing green salsa with fresh chips (the "table bread") and the huge bowl of chicken tortilla soup (about $8).  The second time, my tipsy friend was really craving a burrito. I'd already eaten but still enjoyed a little of the salsa while she devoured lots of it and enjoyed the little tacos that she ordered.   The service was very nice both times and the food hit the spot for a post-drinking meal. I'm sure I'll be back sometime as this is also probably the closest restaurant to my house!

EXKkKWAxWQAEmAWo-nL3Yg.review_text: Great atmosphere, nice food, exceptionally nice people and a long wait which is made a little less painful by drinking at the bar.   It's great to have this place, as an antidote to Italian and Chinese that is cool and in North Beach as well.

uDzxt09D9BX4J-3aDIxJgw.review_text: Let me start by saying, I guess it depends upon what you are looking for. It is small, loud, and if you sit too close to the kitchen you are blasted with a wave of smoke which comes off the grill. Apparently the fan needs an upgrade. The tables are packed in and the ceiling is low, hence the noise.   The menu is very small and limited for those whom have never been, you have been warned. This is not a place to get a traditional plate. It is "Chic" Mexican. So Chic in fact they do not even have a sign, just a street number on front. You park hoping it is the spot, walk up and say, "OoooooooK, I guess this is the place?" A little presumptuous if you ask me but so be it. Maybe the sign is on order??  1 J. Mandarin:                                                          $2.50 1 Guac & Chips:                                                      $6.00 1 Rice:                                                                       $3.00 1 Pinto Beans:                                                         $3.00 1 Tacos Al Pastor (2) small tacos (Ala carte):   $9.00 (!) 1 Sashimi (Salmon):                                              $13.00 1 Corona Light:                                                        $5.00 Subtotal:                                                                   $41.50 Tax:                                                                             $3.53 Total:                                                                         $45.03  Pros:  * Chips were better than average and fresh. Salsa good. * Sashimi dish was out of place here but delicious and stole show * Service initially very friendly, faded quickly as server became overwhelmed.  Cons:  * Environment, way too loud unless you are looking for a clubby dinner spot and we arrived soon after they opened.  * Parking a serious challenge in this part of North Beach * $9.00 for 2 small taco truck tacos!!! I have had better from trucks that were larger, as well I prob would get 4 at this price. The difference is what you pay is definitely not evident in the taste. * Guac boring, weak. * $45 in Mexican? You shud not walk away hungry. Servings small.  Heard as walking away: Don't believe the hype. This place is not worth the salt of 4.5 stars, unless you are looking for bottomless alcohol. It seems as though alot of reviews place serious value on this alone. Not a problem, I understand, but for this reviewer, no Senor. Will not be back.

uZUieUpmg8z12x-_K8z62Q.review_text: Hoping it would be better. No sign, so have to know the address or see the menu on the window. We were told it would be a 30 to 45 minute wait, but it was over an hour. Tried to cancel, but we were told "your next", but really it was after  2 or more groups got seated before us.  They were out of the al pastor tacos. They did offer to have the cilantro and onions on the side. I can't eat cilantro. It tastes like soap to me.  It was very noisy. Very hard to have a conversation. The carnitas tacos were pretty good, but nothing special. Being from Texas, I have had better.  The margaritas were okay. I was hoping for better since they got such high ratings.  Don't think I'll return or recommend.

0MV8OUNg5Gw14DcVoiNrJA.review_text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and we had a great time.  We went on a sunday, so the drink specials were an awesome way to start our meal--along with the yummy chips & salsa. I am a sucker for fresh chips & salsa verde.  We opted to go with the Paseo Nuevo style lobster dinner for 2--It was a super reasonable $34!  Lobster.Flash Fried.in. Pork Fat.  YUMMMM!!!  It was a very fun and interactive meal--the lobster came split down the middle and we made little tacos with their homemade tortillas, seasoned rice & beans, and amazing herb browned butter.  It was a little bit messy, a lot of fun, the ambiance was dark and romantic, the drink specials were awesome, and it was all so affordable.  I'd come here again in the heartbeat :)

OnhM-m4MHhgWGiBWd9apYg.review_text: Cool place, lots of unhipster hipsters, solid sashimi, good bartender, what's not to like?

Vohh0dqc3lekYNDajK0bCg.review_text: No wait on a Sunday afternoon for brunch? Why not!  We had the chorizo with poached egg, fish tacos, and torta.  Chorizo: Potatoes were cooked to perfection, well-seasoned and crispy. Chorizo added a nice salty touch as well. And the egg just glued everything together. Yum.  Fish tacos: Finally, fish that isn't dry and tough in a fish taco! Fish was perfectly flaky and not bland at all.  Torta: The bun was crispy enough so that it had a nice crunch, but just soft enough so it doesn't scrape the roof of your mouth. The meat inside wasn't rubbery like it usually is in tortas (not that I'm complaining). And the cheese was just mild enough with an interesting texture that tied everything together.  Will definitely come back here to try breakfast burritos next time :)

RtJnTneQVNgOCPlx-j4pQQ.review_text: Like it! great food, friendly, communal tables, full bar.  lovely servers and bartenders, very efficient service so you never wait too long.  Chicken tostadas, Hamburgeusa, tacos, all very good. Mussels excellent. And one of few places that will actually leave off the cilantro if you ask them too.

VsgknCPc4ReaMXD3LX-S8w.review_text: Best mexican food in town -- open late, fun atmosphere! Recommend you get the ceviche, any of the tacos, chicken tortilla soup (best ive ever had) yum yum, damn all of it is excellent!! Get ready to wait during weekends as it is full! Best times to go are later at night, and during the week late at night (past 9pm). No sign at the door, just a red light!

cGkaVApa14hAZWQCPLB4pA.review_text: Mexican in the italian neighborhood?  ABSOLUTELY.  This place is awesome - the food is cheap and delicious and the drinks are great -  they do not have a full liquor license - so beer and wine is king, but it is so delicious.  Amazing tacos, the pork chop is the best I have ever had, and the service is great.    They do not take reservations, so...be prepared to wait, but there are many great places in NB to have a cocktail while you

dCJJTk8nIFbZ0zjABFsvfg.review_text: Great experience. We ordered the chips and guac, daily ceviche (shrimp), margarita and Mexican pickles. Turns out they were out of the pickles so they brought us an oyster plate on the house!   The shrimp wasn't quite as crisp as I would have hoped, but the avocado garnish was excellent. The oysters were fresh and flavorful. I appreciated that the plate included two different varieties to try.  The guac and salsa were perhaps the best dishes on the table, though. Salsa was fresh and green with perfect spice and the guac was super creamy and fresh too. Chips were ok.

2DbpFXvzuHDE3A-mhIpaTw.review_text: Had a great time at Don Pistos last night... There margaritas are delish, not too sweet, and the food was really good... My only complaint was the music, I thought it didn't fit too well with the vibe.  But I would definitely go back some time!

Xd_2uetx9LxA2hQassydJA.review_text: Just realized I haven't reviewed my favorite restaurant in the world.  I became a fan of Don Pisto's thanks to its tacos and the wonderful Hamburguesa, burger that tastes just a little bit like bacon with great guacamole on top. I then became a big fan of the poc chuc, that wonderful slab of meat. I am currently obsessed with the Chorizo Mussels, a gorgeous spicy dish that really showcases how the chef is a magician with sauces and spices. I always make a point of asking for some extra toasted bread upfront (dish comes with three slices that you can let soak in the sauce and spread chorizo on...).
