I typically also have the pitcher of margarita -- not the best margarita I've had, but definitely makes me happy and works well with the dishes here.  Only downside: Yet another great place that's overwhelmed by its own success. These days wait time for a table is one hour even at 8pm on a Wednesday night. I've been here probably around 40-50 times, including one time when I brought in a group of 15, and the staff at the door still look like they don't ever remember me -- I typically get a "nice to see you again" at every establishment that I patronize so frequently. Upside though: kitchen doesn't close until half past midnight, so I usually roll in kind of late (or put my name on the list and go to 15 Romolo for a drink and come back for my table).  If you like this place, definitely also try Chubby noodle inside Amante bar by the same team. Once again, magic with sauces and spices.

RsmzkgQ6S9ghtKb2DGX0Mw.review_text: Mighty packed little suckers...enough filling for 4 tacos. The meat is tender and seasoned well. The pineapple got lost in the flavor of the al pastor. The carne asada was the better of the two. The salsa verde was a nice starter. Will come back for carnitas

fbUfCeF38GztVF6t4P8xMg.review_text: I am not really sure why this place has 4.5 stars. We just went late last night and I thought it was a solid 3 stars but really not exceptional.  Service - really good, friendly, attentive, definitely one of the pluses  Ambiance - cozy but a little too loud. Something about the acoustics of the place makes it really hard to hear your friends. Also I was distracted by the copious amounts of smoke billowing in the open kitchen. It seemed to be ventilated well but I found myself looking in that direction all night and worrying that we were breathing in all that smoke.  Food - I always find "fancy Mexican food" to be something of an oxymoron and this place was no exception.   In terms of deliciousness and flavor their tacos really can't come close to the way tacos should be consumed: standing huddled next to a softly purring truck, squeezing limes with one hand while clutching greasy paper plates with the other. For that kind of experience try Las Peraltas in San Mateo or La Tonayense in the Mission/SOMA.  The carnitas tacos here at Don Pisto's tasted rather flat and fatty and the pescado tacos were too much on the other end of the spectrum, painfully spicy and absurdly salty.  The tortilla soup, while enormously generous in portion and well balanced in spicy flavors, was frightfully brothy. My gold standard for tortilla soup is the lusciously thick and filling soup served up at the Farmer's Market on Fairfax and 3rd in Los Angeles. Again this one was sure to disappoint when you go in comparing it to a decidedly superior experience.  Add to that that the tacos average about $4-5 APIECE and you begin to feel like it's a completely overrated/overpriced experience.

83wHDpKcaNYlBHiLXfEiEA.review_text: Had a great group dinner here a couple months back. Good cocktails, simple and delicious menu. I felt like we couldn't go wrong in what we ordered and everything was sharable. Fun to go for more fancy Mexican food.

9PmbPjWtx3YiInz2wcLHbw.review_text: AMAZING!!!! My favorite taco spot in the city bar none! Everything about this place rocks! I have eaten here at least 30 times and can't stop. There should be a Don Pistos on every corner, and I'm not kidding

fgH2vvy9tG1mm39-fsUwhA.review_text: Sangria and taco Sonoras were so good! The guac and green salsa were solid as well. Simple menu and pretty good service. Small space and it can get pretty loud/busy, but this place is a must-go-to in north beach for a modern twist on Mexican!

3vwYSQlR22JKfXYSaktq0Q.review_text: After dining at Don Pisto's the other night I'm confident when I say that I had the best Mexican meal of my life.  The Carne Asada and Carnitas tacos were exploding with flavor.  A lot of times when places advertise these two meat preparations you get dry selections of the stuff that might as well just say BEEF and PORK tacos - not here.  I haven't tried the other tacos yet but if these two are any indication then each will absolutely rise to the top of your list as the canonical version of each meal.  I also tried the lobster cooked in pork fat.  That's probably all you need to read, really.  The interior of this place is perfect, the service was super warm and friendly, and the vibe was perfect.    I'll be be back daily.

-vWRrvnQII1MbWzkN4E8fQ.review_text: My husband & I cannot get enough of the carnitas. It's the best in the city! Actually everything at Don Pisto's is great. Brunch, lunch or dinner, you can't go wrong!

Q8BTKVWjh5B5icEWl1PWoA.review_text: So we spent so much time researching restaurants for our 3 night trip to SF and out of all of the places we went (including fine dining) this was our favorite.  It's such a hip, fun, atmosphere with good libations and the food is just amazing...so unique.

xVzzyB43dKf53pbgcZq5lg.review_text: For all you Chicagoans, think of this as Big Star's smaller, more down-to-earth cousin without a full bar. Jarritos. Tacos. Bottomless sangria or mimosas at brunch. And, laid back, friendly service. Wait, let me back up: They have delicious tacos. Try the Pastor and Carnitas especially.  This is a must-go for me now anytime I'm in San Fran. It gets a bit crowded on the weekends, and because its tiny plan ahead to avoid the wait.

UyhnjAlyMXtbR-qB5kkhlQ.review_text: I am a big fan of Don Pisto's, as are all of my friends who have eaten here. I have a friend who ate here three nights in a row one week. I kid you not.  Be warned that the food is heavy and that there is not a single vegetarian option on the menu.  My favorite dishes are: * Chicken tortilla soup - Simple but delicious! A good size for sharing with one other person. * Pork chop - Amazingly juicy. I do not normally crave pork chop, but I would come back here again and again for the pork chop. The bed of coleslaw on which it is served is addictingly spicy.  Everything else is pretty tasty as well. The complimentary chips and green salsa are yummy, but save room for your entrees. The guacamole is hearty and flavorful. The lobster, cleaved in half and poached in lard, is very good, but there is not much meat to go around.  My only complaint is that the sangria is a bit too light on alcohol and comes with way too much ice!  Reservations only accepted for groups of over 6. There is a party space downstairs for large groups. Don Pisto's does not refuse to seat partial parties, which is always nice. Without a reservation, you will likely have to wait half an hour or longer.

_6p-f3UH0psT5XJyPC6PTg.review_text: This restaurant is amazing! The food is so so so good. It's a somewhat smaller menu, and I think we ordered almost everything on the menu. Our favorites included: tortilla soup, half chicken, the Rib meat tacos (heaven in a taco). I am still drooling over everything there.  The downside to this place: The service. They don't take reservations, so they try and rush you out of there. We wanted to ahve a nice long dinner, but we were pretty much ushered along after only one hour of being there. I get they have long waits, but maybe they should think about reservations in their future, or a bigger place? Oh, and the service was slightly snooty, which wasn't fun either. Otherwise, I'd give these guys 5 stars.  Either way, definitely a treat - just know that you will wait long for a table, and they'll kick you out as soon as they can.

Y6YiC2R26d0FH5UGdwzOrg.review_text: My first review must be a 5 star rating for Don Pistos - I cannot say enough good things about this place!  I have been a big fan since I moved to North Beach a year ago, and always make sure to bring any family and friends visiting from out of town here for brunch or dinner. It is a half a block from my house and the prices are totally reasonable, not to mention the food is always amazing!  I think I've tried almost everything on the menu but favorites are the hamburguesa of course, the chorizo mussels, french toast, chorizo + poached eggs, pork chop... the tacos are good when you're not too hungry, always love oysters and sashimi, and I just tried the carnitas torta yesterday (bomb). They have hands down the best bottomless deal in the area (mmm, sangria), even their (free!) chips and verde salsa are delicious.  Yesterday it was my birthday, and the owner Pete was able to fit me and my party of 15 in super last minute, upstairs no less! The service was excellent as usual - I wish I were able to tip our server on top of the 18% auto-gratuity, but alas, getting money from 15 drunk santa clauses is never easy.   We came here one time and a couple of us ordered the chorizo + poached eggs but our eggs were overdone and cooked through completely. We asked for a few new eggs just to toss on top of the dish, and Pete came by to those of us that got it and comped our plates anyway. Completely unnecessary, and we were not irate by any means, but it does mean a lot for the owner to be attentive and take pride in the food and service - I think it's one of the things that distinguishes a good restaurant from a great one.  I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone! I will be coming back as long as it's around and so am I.  Thanks Don Pistos!

oXaLeQhCMFcbdg9vL4cgBg.review_text: its great. they keep the menu simple with just a handful of choices all of which are excellent.  i have tried every plate except the lobster....i'm not a lobster fan however my friend who has it often says it is really good. no hard liquor but plenty of mexican cervezas.

YC-i8JOxowtXP1mE8FNufw.review_text: This place was delicious! Everything our family had was absolutely spectacular. The food was super fresh and better yet tasted fresh! I hate when places claim their food is "fresh" but it taste like cardboard. Anyway, this place not only had great food but I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. The main room was full but there was another room that was just as accommodating. I had such a great time and I will definitely be back. I can't express how amazing there food was. Oh and did I mention that they marinate their chicken for 48 hours?? No wonder why their food tastes amazing!!!!!

yL2B5MhSAXpnj2mKIbB3iA.review_text: The line was out the door! The breakfast burrito was to die for and complimentary chips and salsa was enough for us to sit down. Husband had tacos and ended up ordering more after he finished his first place. Highly recommend

lbrxN0BHNMNUXj0dAe-dQg.review_text: Tacos are superb.... Though a tad bit small in portion, especially two to an order.  A grown man needs 2 orders of tacos hands down.  Tortilla soup is likely underrated. I recommend it.

b8Eyq2Jf6N1dem5fO8KNvA.review_text: Pretty good food and service. I couldn't decide between two items so they let me try one on the house.

pw6Ue8SaS0WAIp_uIZnrzA.review_text: Don't remember much  That could be because I sat there for 5 hours drinking bottomless Sangria.  I actually do remember the Tacos Al Pastor I had with crushed pineapple.  Oh my god, soo good.    Ok, so I just read what I wrote so far & decided there's nothing else to say.  Ummm, Go here?  Answer: Yes

ZR1FxN8BOH-92iHE5ABePA.review_text: Consistently delicious food and drinks. I always get the al pastor tacos with extra pineapple. The salsa is packed with lime and flavor.  The drinks are awesome - the michelada and the sangria are perfect.  Kate is the best bartender in North Beach!!  Go try it. you'll be happy and full of chips and salsa.

utsD7uMz380XQqAr27L5YA.review_text: Great food - def try the diabla prawn. Enchiladas were good too (not too cheesy). Four stars because margarita was horriblé.

gHDqDsYd9k-3VqjwEOz6UQ.review_text: Went here with six other friends for a birthday celebration. Got seated almost immediately and had a fantastic experience and Nick was a very attentive waiter. The group was doing bottomless mimosas/margaritas/sangria for $17 so we went with it and ended up having an amazing experience. The wait staff and waiter were nothing short of outstanding. Would definitely come back here with a big group of friends.

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: If this was a report card, Don Pisto's would get an A. I have so many favorite restaurants in this area already, and Don Pisto's adds yet another reason for me to love North Beach.  What we got:  - Carne asada tacos and camarones (shrimp) tacos: Much fresher and lighter than the tacos you might be used to. i especally loved the shrimp tacos. - Ceviche: Theirs is much chunkier than I'm used to, but it worked. It comes in a light dressing which really brings out the flavor. - Tortilla soup: Simple but delicious. Very comforting.  Drinks: Sangria and Blood Orange Lemon margaritas. Both were strong and delicious. The blood orange margarita is really tangy :) Ambiance: Industrial brick on stainless steel - dim lighting, reggeton music Service: A short wait for a table (20 minutes) but great service Total: $86 (dinner + 4 cocktails) Verdict: Go! Amazing food and drinks in a hip, trendy atmosphere.

h0FPJR1jCDpwq0C4t8ArLA.review_text: Incredible for brunch.   We get there right at 11 and are always able to sit immediately (of course, they also open at 11 so that might have something to do with it). The breakfast burrito is a great portion, neither too big nor too small. Hamburguesa is bacon-y goodness covered in guacamole. Bottomless mimosas are standard, but great nonetheless.

8-ycEWbiKEwlE96jfyLjpA.review_text: MUSSEELLLLLSSSSS!!!!!!  Seriously, get the chorizo & mussels.  It's the shiznit.  SO delicious.  Ok fine, we also tried the mexican sashimi (salmon) and the Pork Chop.   Both were absolutely delicious as well, but the mussels stole the show.  Let me get to the review.  We walked in this past Saturday around 7:30 and had to wait about 30-40 minutes.  We sat at the bar and grabbed a drink.  The bartender or whatever the guy was, was friendly, and entertaining.   We got sat and ordered.  Everything came out timely and was delicious, including complimentary chips and salsa verde.  The sashimi had a sauce and a small jalepeno slice.  The very last sashimi piece had an extremely spicy jalepeno and i was burning up for a good 10 minutes.    Next was the chorizo & mussels.  This was super hyped up by a friend and it did not disappoint.    Finally, the pork chop came out.  I was astonished.  It was 2 huge pieces!  I was thinking to myself, this is unfair for the poor pig... it has the tall feat of topping the mussels.  Guess what, the pork chop was AWESOME.  Super juicy/tender/delicious.  It was served on a cucumber salsa type thing which added a great refreshing crunch.   I had some awesome food in SF this past weekend but Don Pistos takes the cake.  A++++++++++++++++++++++  seriously... ++++++++++++++++++

l4pabLd84WrBxt-nHVsZ3g.review_text: I don't know what it is exactly about SF, but in comparison to other metropolitan areas its $$$ and above establishments have been absolute, thorough failures,  while its's hole in the wall-s and Gastropubs shine brilliantly.   Mescal selection galore + a kitchen truly worthy of adoration.  Add this place alongside Garaje if you're visiting SF for a weekend.

R5IjNOjLt0DD34Bbe2ow8Q.review_text: I'm sorry, but all I have to say is this:  GO EAT THERE!  The food was amazing!  The service was amazing!  The atmosphere was upbeat and fun.  The room was loud, but....great fun and well worth having to repeat a few sentences between bites of deliciousness.   Oh, it was crowded when we got there...we had to wait 30 minutes or so for a table....we thought about leaving and eating at an amazing pizza place nearby.  That would have been a HUGE mistake.  I will definitely be coming here again, as soon as I'm back in the area.

L2j8Ci1d30tDU4-kbeOr4g.review_text: Really great pork chop that's super juicy and tangy. You can watch them grill your pork chop thru the see-thru window.The tacos are alright - not too amazing. The guac is really good here so addictive you just want to keep ordering it.   I hear this place has the best burger as well but they don't serve it during the weekends. No reservations taken unless it's a group. It's really a fun chill place with not too crazy prices. Definitely a nice place and I'd return

YttNCzfHbDyGRyeGGX4gCg.review_text: Amazing service - you can really tell that they care about local customers.

o4vWLQGaQmCC0aWZJHyEDA.review_text: This was my first visit to Don Pisto's after hearing countless positive reviews. This place did not disappoint! The guacamole competes with Tacolicious - fresh, creamy, melt in my mouth guac. Very yummy! The tortilla soup is pretty fantastic and hits the spot when you're looking for savory and soothing. To quote our favorite ex-governor, I will be back!

yDA54PXql-KLgOaykqgebg.review_text: Sangria is DEFINITELY not one of my favorites.  LA prices with nothing to show for it. Waitress was great. 3 star max.

4xd4JQHHHGiYaG0f6jYVPw.review_text: Don Pisto's is an excellent new restaurant, just a block away from Washington Square Park in North Beach.  This neighborhood has been lacking a quality Mexican place until now.  I had the chance to try out the ceviche and the tacos with shrimp, and both were very good, especially for SF standards.  I was impressed by the quality of the fish and shrimps they used.  I heard from others sitting nearby that their torta and carnita tacos were also really good.    The venue is nice, especially for the neighborhood, filled with mostly locals.  I highly recommend this place as a late-night place to eat,or as a pre-dine place before barhopping in North Beach.

6mvf1AuvzVaEpPrN_iESWw.review_text: The food is deeeeelicious, the service is good, the music is great. They give you freshly made tortilla chips and salsa verde when you sit down, and they refreshed it for us when we asked. Their Al Pastor tacos were amazing, as was their Pollo Asado, and their flour tortillas are freshly made in house right when you order.  They have Mexican diet cola which was delish.

75RntWgoKzw9hOnAG61lUw.review_text: Hmm, I am a little stumped by all the Yelpie love for this joint. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, it just wasn't all that amazing.   The place was small but the vibe was cool. Nice mixture of people all looking like they were enjoying themselves. I also liked the fact that you can see the (very very very) tiny kitchen and see the chefs working hard.   We were seated at a small table for two and immediately ordered a pitcher of margaritas. I was super pleased with the price but not so pleased with the quality. I thought I was going to be blown away because I asked for "salt on my rim and sugar on his" and was told by our waiter that the bartender wouldn't do a sugar rim because it undermined the integrity of the drink. WHOA, I figured I was about to be served the best margarita of my life. Unfortunately, it was completely non-remarkable. I have had a better drink from Chili's.   The guacamole was on par with the margs. It was in some serious need of flavor...lime, salt, cilantro...anything??  Entrees were fine. Had the tamale special, enchiladas, and fish tacos. All were in need of some salt. For a Mexican restaurant, this place was missing the pizazz that makes this type of cuisine stand out.

yqcWOC-5Jl-BJ8kSkKQB2A.review_text: Bottomless sangria, margaritas, and mimosas? You can interchange them you say? Ummm...sure! haha  From the three, my favorites were the margs and the sangria. The waitress was really nice and kept filling up the cups! The food was great for lunch. Went on a Saturday and the wait wasn't long at all but the place does fill up.  Had a pork tamale with poached eggs and we tried the chorizo scramble. The chips and salsa were delicious! The pork tamale was done right, but may have used more pork. Th texture of the masa was good and the eggs were poached perfectly.  Good service, fun atmosphere, and awesome drinks. Go here for brunch!

yD-6TEgxUIZirRj5TJGnHA.review_text: We went to Don Pistos for a work related team dinner. It was on a Wednesday night. The restaurant itself had a nice cool vibe to it. Loved the background 90s hip hop music playing in the background.   The service was not bad. Pretty quick. Felt a little rushed though.   The good was actually pretty good. It took a while for it to come and because of that, we filled ourselves up on chips and salsa. The tacos were good but the fish tacos were way too spicy. I love spicy food. Trust me. But there is a line between spicy good that has flavor or just spicy. The cabbage on top was good but the spice on the fish way overpowering. Not as enjoyable. Would've been really good if they toned it down a bit.   The rest of the good was ok. Not phenomenal but also not bad.

ap_uxhcfZ6_0US3VwFN8MA.review_text: Overall this place is pretty good. The food is tasty and fresh, service is good. My only complaint really is that when we ordered the ceviche it did not come with chips. I had to order a basket of chips for $3. I live in San Diego & we have our share of Mexican restaurants here.  I have never in my life had to buy chips at a mexican restaurant, and I can get over that, but if I order ceviche it should come with chips.  Other than that the place was cool, pretty hip & trendy so its busy but good for them. It really bothers me that I had to buy chips with my ceviche though, thats pretty lame. If it weren't for that I would have given 4 stars

c8hitmrFzciWdxU0g6PXsg.review_text: I spent a good deal of my New Year's Day morning trying to figure out some way to cure my throbbing hangover. My girlfriend suggested we go eat at Don Pistos in North Beach and it turned out to be an excellent choice. Being from Boston, I was blown away by the quality of the meal as I have never been to a comparable Mexican place in the Northeast. The margarita and sangria did wonders to aid my hangover and get me back in my feet. The best part of the experience was meeting the owner, Pete. He went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and even brought me a bowl of his special hangover soup. The lack of sign on the front doesn't stop the locals from coming in droves as it was literally filled with people my age. (28) I would say it was the best restaurant I visited in San Francisco and I have been constantly stuffing myself for a week now. Definitely check this place out!

kg8tWKYrB9I6VThlxTaD-A.review_text: They don't take reservations for smaller parties, so when i found out that we had a party of 6, I immediately picked up the phone and reserved that table!   We  got there and were promptly seated. I didn't have drinks, but had a sip or two of the Micheladas and they were delicious!   The chips and chile verde salsa wasn't too runny, and had the perfect amount of bite to it.--So far so good! and we hadn't even ordered our entrees yet!  For entrees, we decided to try everything out:  1. Carne Asada Tacos--just a regular beef taco, but it was definitely good. If I had to pick my top tacos, I would go with the Al Pastor and the Camarones though  2. Carnitas Tacos--Didn't try it, we had so much food, I physically couldn't fit the in my belly. Sad face  3. Pescado Tacos--Again, Didn't try it, we had so much food. I was so full!  4. Camarones Tacos-The shrimp was SO juicy, flavorful, and had a great kick of spice. Very good!   5. Al Pastor Tacos--Very spicy (in a good way), with that hint of citrus from the pineapple= perfection. My favorite tacos of the 5 that we ordered.   6. Mexican Sashimi--this was just ok. Of course, I'm comparing it to the one I had at Nobu. I would skip this entirely. They had a mini jalapeno on top, so I understand the concept, but it doesn't really deliver.   7. Tortilla Soup--this might be the best soup I have ever had! It definitely serves more than 2. We had a table of 6, and we all had a bowl, and some even had seconds! There was avocado in the hot soup--I don't think I've ever had it, but it was delicious. The perfect amount of salt (tortilla soups tend to be overly salty), and it wasn't creamy. There were huge chunks of chicken in it as well.   8. Hamburguesa--I can't describe it. Everyone thinks, "what the heck is a hambuger doing on the menu?" Well, TRY IT. There is something about it that is just so good--it has a smoky flavor, kind of like it's been on the bbq just a little longer, but definitely made with love.   9. Pork Chop--cooked and seasoned perfectly! It was juicy and not dry whatsoever, and the mini cucumber salad on the side was something I wanted to learn how to make.   10. Chile Verde Chicken Tostadas--this was good, for sure, just after all those tacos, this is the least memorable dish. you can skip this if you are ordering all those tacos. It's basically a crunchy version of those tacos.   11. 2 servings of rice--it wasn't just plain old rice. It was damn good. They did some seasoning to it, and I'm not usually a rice person, but needless to say, I ate that up like it was my last supper  12. 2 servings of beans--you can definitely tell it wasn't out of a can--or if it was, they really disguised that well! Felt authentic to me!   Overall, service, company, ambiance, food = GREAT! Will definitely be going back!

a_7DlZwtpetqQP60Z9TyXA.review_text: Had an array of tacos:  snapper, shrimp, & chicken.  All were excellent and authentic.  The complimentary salsa verde was also very good.  Highly recommended place...easy to miss though since it is on a side street and not obviously marked...google maps on the phone is your friend.

YBHxkIq2M5ixRavhQe6dZQ.review_text: In love with the food here... The guac, the tacos, and most of all the corn is to die for

MnLna1x1mb5IoE8c9NQe0A.review_text: After last night's meal, it is safe to say this may be my favorite restaurant in the city. It's SOOOOOO delicious! I have two very important words: LOBSTER BURRITOS. They brought out a 1.5 lb lobster, fluffy thick tortillas, rice, beans, melted butter with cilantro and some cream sauce, and amazing salsa to allow you to make your own burritos. SO GOOD. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and we were both so happy and full after this meal. They also have amazing margaritas and sangria. We also had oysters as well, which were really great too.   I've also been here for brunch a few times, and their brunch is out of this world as well. I only got the breakfast burrito, but I think they took it off the brunch menu (sad face, but I'm ready to try more items!). I also think this is the only place that i've found to have bottomless mimosas, sangria, AND margaritas during brunch. If you come with a big group that orders a variety of the three bottomless options, they will just start bringing out pitchers of everything.   Yes, there may be a wait, but it is very, very worth it. They also allow you to give them your number, and you can leave to go to a bar somewhere else until they call to tell you your talbe is ready. After now having had both types of meals here, this restaurant can do no wrong in my book. GO THERE, I promise you will not be disappointed!

x1rubTo9E3OXsk-PIcjnhg.review_text: My boyfriend suggested this place and now this is our favorite restaurant! In the beginning it was hard to find because somehow my GPS was telling us to go to this one Italian restaurant. But we eventually found it. So far we've tried the pitcher of sangria, tacos (al pastor & carne asada) and the mussels! We especially love the mussel and the meat sauce in that dish! I suggest everyone to try it. The food is great, atmosphere is cool, friendly service, and the bartender is funny and he remembered us!   I also heard breakfast is good too, so I think I have to try that. The only bad thing about this place is that they don't take reservation, but I think it's worth the wait.

5pOXfsd9vmRZWzxzW3aZGg.review_text: This place rules! Fresh, quality ingredients, bold flavors, great service, and in a cool space. It's in North Beach, though, so parking is miserable. And the menu is somewhat limited. That said, what they do offer they really pull off well.  I'm a big fan!

2gP8s5dOJmwVKVm0GNMU0w.review_text: yummy! pitcher of margarita - strong liked the salsa the tortilla soup seemed like it was missing some kind of spice but the tacos were quite scrumptious

S90cznhfdL29yMSEZ_EnJQ.review_text: Oh, how we've been wronged in the UK. How so very much. When our American counterparts mock our take on Mexican cuisine, *this* is why. They've not just been unnecessarily harsh. For we have not been eating Mexican food all these years. Nope, we have been eating an attempt at Tex Mex instead.  Real Mexican food doesn't come cosily under a duvet of melted cheese, like it's shy and hiding from the world. Nope, it comes fresh, light and spicy. Tacos aren't crunchy shells, they're miniature pancake-like wraps. Chips and salsa ain't from a bag and a jar, they're freshly fried and that sauce ain't bright red nor could it double up as a base for pasta bolognese. Salsa verde's where it's at, and it comes while you're ordering drinks. Margaritas, to be precise.  What genuises (geniii?) Laura N and Kevin L are. These two London-based Americans took us out for our regional UK and Ireland Yelp dinner and decided to show us exactly the cuisine we'd been missing out on. Fish tacos, shrimp tacos, pork tacos (all with zingy fresh salad, lemon juice and marinated meats), steak and eggs, spicy tuna sashimi... my oh my. Not a spot of grated cheese in sight, nor a dollop of yoghurty sour cream. Don't make us eat this then send us back to our respective cities across the Altantic where we cannot actually get this type of food, pretty please.  So I know they do a pretty mean burrito in Pancho's in Manchester, I have it on good American authority (thanks Anyonita G), but this? This is something new altogether. It's not about the refried beans, the cheese, or any of that. Oh how this carrot was dangled and cruelly taken away. Plus, it's one of those uber cool restaurants that doesn't even have a sign or anything, everyone who's worthy of its treats knows where it is just from being eternally hip. Well Don Pisto, I'll miss you greatly. And I'd happily take that 21 hour trek just to reacquaint myself with those tasty fish tacos. Onwards!

3bh9OmTJRLNtj-dqYauugA.review_text: Upscale mexican type of thing? Yea.. it works!  The burger cooked in bacon fat was as delicious as it was unhealthy.  The tacos are great.  The margaritas are great.  Stop reading the reviews and go try it!

DvArWwFCs_7zRL8dy297wQ.review_text: Love this little joint so much! Their lobster dish is so exciting to eat! Love the space and love the vibe.

fpkSUebX9DZKrBeE2BnyKw.review_text: Muy bueno.  Now this is my kind of place. Pretty discrete location on Union in North Beach, but that adds to the appeal. The decor is nothing crazy, exposed brick walls & great lighting -- it just works.  The menu is small, so go with a group and order everything on the menu & it may just be one of the best meals in San Francisco. Well, I take that back... but it's pretty damn good. You have to go with a big group, order tons of food & the fab drinks and it's unbeatable for that type of night.   Let's start with the Chips & Salsa - hands down do not compare to any I have ever eaten. I honestly do not know what it is that makes them stand out but they're like crack... so addicting.  Standout menu item #1: Carne Asado Tacos. Steak was marinated and cooked to perfection. Melt in your mouth good. Def get more than one order.  Standout menu item #2: Tortilla Soup. Esssuper spicy but incredible. It was too hot to handle for some of the people in my group, but I live for this delicious-ness. I wonder if they do take out, because I could easily eat this 3 times a week.   & the drinks.... I am a margarita connoisseur. And the margaritas at Don Pisto's are excellent. Except they're missing one important ingredient: Tequila. That's right - all the cocktails are made with beer & wine. Including the margarita which is made with a 48 proof Chardonnay. The sangria is delish too. Get pitchers & I guarantee you will have no idea you're not drinking liquor.   Ever been to La Esquina in NYC? It ALMOST reminds me of that. Let's be real: nothing compares to La Esquina but if you drink enough of the Chardonnay margaritas, you might be able to fake yourself into believing you're there.

0gGcIkHOTDMl_6p5RGnuFw.review_text: My beloved has been driving past this place for a long time, but had no idea what it was. Our date night consisted of a spontaneous moment where i jumped out of the car in the pouring rain to put our name on the wait list of this unknown location. The signage was very limited so, up until they called to tell me our table was ready, we had no idea the name or what to expect!  We were seated within 45 minutes of putting our name down. The table we were at was COLD. They had the door open (it got very smoky in the dining room and they opened the door to vent the place out) if you are coming on a cold night be SURE to wear something that can keep you warm if needed.  The Sangria was unfortunate, very watery, no fruit and had what I think might be soda water in it. If you are looking for a bold tasting sangria, this isn't the place for that. We switched over to a margarita and that my friends, was well worth it.  We shared the Chirizo and Mussels, what a brilliant combination! I'm a huge huge fan of mussels these were wonderful, the meat adds a good spicy to the mussel without overpowering it which impressed me, I thought for sure I wouldn't be able to taste the delicate sweetness through the intense heavy flavor but boy was I wrong.. thank goodness!  J and I also shared the pork chop and when they say pork chop, I think they mean a whole side of pork.. it was HUGE, I had never seen a pork chop that large before.. It was easily enough for two of us and then for a decent meal taken home with us as leftovers. The chop was served with a very light lime/cucumber/chili salad and in my opinion that was the best compliment to the meal as a whole. it added this soft refreshing bit that cleansed the palate.   The menu is small, so be aware of that.  Music was strange, we walked in enjoying salsa music and it switched to pop/rap and all sorts of other things, an eclectic mix that is for sure  Minus two starts for the seating/ smoke/cold and sangria.

cZoZP462CdMzKA0MmCO_4A.review_text: As Don Pisto's only takes reservations for parties of 6 or more, our party of 4 had to wait for an hour and a half (Saturday at around 8 pm)--understandable, but just be ready. And of course the North Beach parking was atrocious as usual.  Once we got in, it was quite noisy, with a posh crowd, loud talking, & techno bass beats. We asked our pleasant waitress what the "must try" items on menu were--she recommended the following   - Wild Monterey Calamari - charcoal grilled, orange, lime, radish salad - Diablo Prawns - wild mexican prawns, spicy diabla sauce - Puerto Nuevo Lobster - whole maine lobster, homemade flour tortillas, rice, beans, arbol salsa, cilantro butter - House-made Chorizo Mussels - mexican country sausage, white wine, and cilantro - Poc Chuc - grilled pork rib chop, orange chili marinade, spicy cucumber salad  We ordered the calamari, prawns, and poc chuc, but replaced the lobster and mussels with this item, which would later haunt us:  - Pescado Tacos - market fresh fish, arbol & avocado salsa, cabbage & onion slaw  My take on the Calamari:  Maybe the best calamari I've ever had. It wasn't really rubbery at all--more meaty. Served on skewers. Wonderful grilled flavor. And the fresh citrus provided a refreshing accompaniment.  My take on the Diablo Prawns:  Big and fresh. As with the calamari, absolutely no fishy flavor. The diabla sauce was essentially chipotle sauce--strong smoked chili flavor. Not bad at all.  My take on the Pescado Tacos:  What was the "market fresh fish"? Who knows--they didn't tell us. It wasn't fishy I guess. The description had me at "avocado salsa", but I was distraught that there was barely any avocado flavor at all. The cabbage & onion slaw was boring. And the corn tortilla wasn't hard, and it wasn't soft, which means that...it wasn't good.  My take on the Poc Chuc:  This was executed quite marvelously--the meat was extremely juicy, and the orange chili marinade provided a brilliant overtone. The meat surrounding the bone was superiorly marbled. I was indifferent about the cucumber salad.  All in all:  It was a lovely meal, not holy enough for 5 stars, but fancy enough to kick it above a standard 4 star.

DgDmMxHmFsXLMp58FBzgfw.review_text: El Pastor Tacos= try them, you won't be disappointed The mussels & chorizo were also very tasty and the portion was plentiful.  I noticed that there is no signage above the entrance to the restaurant, so don't go expecting to see a sign or you might be circling around for a bit.

dJoBuLQDUuPVT9xaHmmI8g.review_text: Being a mere visitor to SF, I felt guilty eating Mexican food outside of the Mission.  Holy crap, this is a guilt I can live with!!  Being Sunday, they extend their brunch menu all day, meaning there were a lot more huevos, a lot fewer tostadas.  We weren't expecting this, and almost left.  SO glad we stayed!  I ended up with the taco sonora with carnitas.  It's served on a large, homemade flour tortilla, topped with beans, pico de gallo and crema.  The tortilla was what all other tortillas wish they were: fluffy, chewy, substantial enough to encompass the mass of toppings.  The carnitas also pulled their weight ("pulled"...get it???), being obscenely juicy and crisped a bit for extra flavor.  Eating that burrito/taco was the messiest undertaking I've experienced since letting my students experiment with finger paints. The only addition was a healthy drizzle of their AMAZING salsa verde.  I would come to Don Pistos to eat only that salsa and their ridiculously tasty chips.    The busser said their menu was on the smaller side because they get their ingredients fresh.  You can absolutely taste that freshness, which makes Don Pistos a necessary indulgence.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: We arrived at 5:30 but the clock on their register was completely wrong.  She thought it was 5.  With a lazy, uninterested look, the waitress basically shooed us away and said they weren't open till 5:30.  After I notified her of the error on her machine, she told us to sit where ever.  It was rude but I was too focused on eating and drinking so I got over it.  Chips, Salsa & Guacamole to get started and a pitcher of Acai Berry Sangria to quench and refresh after a long day in the office.    BIG UPS to Jane L. not only for being awesome and recommending this place but also for knowing the chef... cause he sent over a complimentary Ceviche De Camarones, which was a nice start to our meal.  Fresh tasting, light, and great flavors.  HOLD UP Cast Iron Summer Stew ... bring yo fine self over to OUR TABLE!!  At first, I wasn't sure if I wanted anything soup-y but this was a spicy piece of heaven in a hot, steamy pot.  Can I get a bowl of rice??  If you like spicy and want something soothing and homey, this is perfs.    Carne Asada & Carnitas were yummy but we were all pretty full and didn't really finish them.  Eh... I guess that means they weren't amazing.  CAUTION: Those peppers on the side are SP-EYE-CEY ... avoid the seeds if you're sensitive ...  Overall, the food was great and the waitress eventually warmed up to us (after realizing someone in our party knew the chef).  Good times.

qAkNfsSn-rUH8Fk2HbwH5Q.review_text: Get over your pretentious self.  Ordered the burger, and they would not put the guacamole on the side (I can't handle cilantro).  I actually asked several times in disbelief.  "The chef does not like to alter his recipes."  Hmmmm...while I understand and respect that, it's not like it was cooked into the burger meat; it's a spread.  And last time I checked, I didn't see any Michelon stars...

ATvdj2Znnh_zcVyGkA0vAQ.review_text: Awesome Mexican spot! It's quite small and worth the minor wait I had. It was about 20 min but we were able to sit at the bar and start appetizer and margaritas. The bar isn't big but it's definitely cute and the bartender was so nice. We basically started with guac and chips which were super tasty! I had the shrimp tacos which were so delicious. The tacos are small street-style but most of the menu looked great. I liked the location and overall ambiance, as well. A place I would go back for sure!!! Margs were also pretty satisfying.

De12G1mj4E3xg7bBjQsgNA.review_text: Don Pisto's is perfectly hidden in North Beach. No tourists, just locals.   They have insane chips & salsa, and the tacos are to die. You can't go wrong with the shrimp tacos or chicken tostadas. Chorizo muscles are also incredible.   Come here for great sangria, even better food and a lovely atmosphere.

8a0hUcmEowyXjzibwStrSg.review_text: Went there on a recent trip to San Francisco.  It was so good that we tried to make excuses to go back to that part of the city the rest of our stay there.  Great young vibe.   Make sure you walk or take the bus so you can enjoy their margaritas appropriately.  Excellent, relatively inexpensive food.  Can be _very_ busy hence the negative comments.  Looking forward to our next visit to SF.  Don Pisto's _will_ be in our "todo" list.

1fWmdp2nNkpc4F5kqMvaIQ.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
1fWmdp2nNkpc4F5kqMvaIQ.review_text: I only review my favorite places and this is defintely one of them! When you walk up to the brick exterior with three little red lights, you know you're in for one delicious dinner!   As soon as this place opened in the neighborhood (a few years back, I think), my dad and I checked it out and we were hooked! I probably come here at leastt 6 times a month when I'm home :).   Quick overview: -intimate ambiance  -quick and friendly service -some darn tasty food -can't go wrong with the camarones diablas, the fish tacos, or really ANY of the choices!

lqkOwVbYONxxmc8qvKCmHw.review_text: There is a reason this place gets nearly 5 stars.  Dined today for a late lunch and others have said it well.  Delish! Bottomless drinks for $17 is a bargain, and they make sure you're never empty.  Wife had breakfast, I had lunch and both were outstanding.  Salsa was the best ever, super fresh.  Service was top notch.  Vegetarians beware, one option-- huevos rancheros.  Wife loved them. Highly recommend!

ZS_SiPpiLocKfYNjRZTeww.review_text: I refer to restaurants by the name indicated on the signage.  Since there is no name other than the address I see no reason not to call it 510 Union other than that there are too many restaurants only referred to by their address in SF.  The menu and Yelp claim otherwise but that's not enough evidence for me.    I'd been curious walking by every day on the way back from work to see an eager line of patrons upon closer menu perusal I was suprised to see well described Mexican and seafood items a departure from my expectation for sure.  For an early dinner we grabbed a few seats at the small bar before the crowd set in.  We were a bit cozily seated with the hostess stand on the right spilling over to the bar but I don't mind.  The bartender was friendly and had great recommendations.  A few glasses of Revolero, some great tacos and the highlight mussels with sausage so good I pretty much ate it like a soup by the end of the meal.  Pondering stopping by every day and claiming a permanent bar seat.

j1id73GjPe5LxkGX_l2xhg.review_text: Small gem in north beach. There are no signs outside of the restaurant, so don't be alarmed to walk in. The kitchen is TINY..but it does the trick.  I've been here many times for dinner, once for brunch, and once for a group dinner that was hosted in the basement (they apparently worked out a prix fixe deal for unlimited tacos).   Highlights:  - Pescado Fish Tacos (2 per plate) - SO good. Crispy fresh fish, served on two soft taco shells with salsa. - Camarones Shrimp Tacos - good, but the fish tacos are better. Also served on two soft taco shells with salsa. - Guacamole - its good...not the best i've had, but it's good to order on the side of your tacos.   - Brunch Menu: Mushroom and Serrano chile omelatte - this was delicious. I wasn't expecting much from their brunch, but was surprised by how good this item was.   Parking in the area can be tough. This place also stacks up quite a wait, but its really hit or miss. You can put your name down and leave a phone number and theyre pretty good about calling you back when your table is ready.   I live close by to Don Pistos, and it's become part of my regular neighborhood restaurant rotations. Its fresh, tasty, and well priced.

N5JVHopD1fHrqnOLIg5JQg.review_text: We were looking for a taqueria style restaurant & this was number 1 on the list. Food was good, home cooked/grill style Mexican food. Was advertised as food for sharing but portions were very small.  Pollo asado was 2 small chicken pieces, guacamole, slasa, 3 green onions & 4 corn tortillas.  Sangria is good but strained of all fruit.  I wouldn't go again but if someone wanted to meet there I'd be down.

sAqu1ueoTR-eK8rQiFkO0w.review_text: Expensive for what the food is. Server was slightly rude and very inaccessible. Food was good but not great, especially for the price. The pescado taco was pretty delicious though. Everything else was just good. Mussels with chorizos were okay. In my opinion, the chorizos did not go super well with the mussels and the bread were too dry and crunchy.

iluTwVJVhpIsevXHW-PnFQ.review_text: My search for a great Mexican restaurant are over!  Don Pisto's, where have you been all my life?  First we were told there would be an hour wait, put our name in and made our way to the bar.  Nic, the bar tender is a joy to watch and interact with.  The bar may be small but it is very very busy and you get a great view of the cooking line.  We had so much fun that when two seats opened at the bar we took them to have dinner.    The guacamole, is divine, it is very simple with a little seasoning, a great texture, and perfectly salted that it tastes like guacamole should taste.  The ceviche was life changing it was so good, the Al Pastor tacos not only changed my life, I believe wars have been started over who gets the last one.  The Pollo Asado was pretty good too, but I was still dreaming of my friend's Al Pastor tacos, and kept wishing he would need to step out so I could help myself to the rest of his dish.  The staff is fun, happy, and shoot, just makes you glad you came.  A great blend of wonderful service and food.  Really an operation that others should model.

-rSFELTPGb7OAoqS68c3SA.review_text: Great food! Great atmosphere! Loved the great authentic tacos!

SuMBnQQ7G1dKAP7ciIC82w.review_text: This is the best mexican restaurant in the city.   The service is awesome and super chill considering people stop by to drop off their numbers to make a reservation every five seconds after 7pm.  The guacamole is just so perfect- chunky avocado, perfectly salted and simple. The lobster tacos are life-changing. Three components that make it so: cilantro butter, bacon black beans and lobster.  The Poc Chuc is juicy and delicious. Can be shared between two (split some tacos too) The Hamburguesa is a great choice if you want a mexican burger. The Civiche is so refreshing. Never ever tastes fishy- and is always chilled. Also- Chorizo Mussels are neck and neck with the Lobster tacos. They are perfectly cooked and merry so well with the Chorizo. The toasted bread is like a godsend to the remaining sauce and bits of Chorizo. Orgasmic.   So that's a portion of the menu for you. Ambiance is young, hip and loud. Expect it to be busy and chaotic, but expect the food to be everything I have said.

VOD79PseKkg08eIMvNbNHA.review_text: Encanta las hamburguesas! Hamburguesas son deliciosos! (I knew high school Spanish would come in handy someday).  "Marinated in bacon"...How can that not be good?! I'm a total hamburger snob and this is a great interpretation. When the burger gets to the table you're hit with the essence of bacon in the air and that first bite is so juicy you'll need extra napkins to mop up your face. The guacamole adds a nice textual touch as the bun, not a traditional burger bun mind you, rather more akin to the bread used for a torta.   Not to be outdone are the tacos. I had the camarones for my first visit but I will definitely  be back for the others. The shrimp are cooked to succulent perfection with nice heat from the avacado salsa. Overall a great taco.  Only weird thing was when the wait staff said "We're a bit backed up on the Pacifico beer orders at the bar..." Were they having trouble with the bottle opener? Anyhow, food was great...I can wait a few extra minutes for my cerveza.

n21x7Oa0LTnJEaSO-b6khQ.review_text: I've made two visits to Don Pisto's and am already anticipating my next visit.  The restaurant is cozy and lively, their service friendly, and their food delicious.  The dining area is small, with ten small tables (2 or 4 people) and one large table.  Additionally, they have a private room in the back for large parties.  Reservations are only accepted for parties of 6 or more.  What would make me happy in life would be a never-ending supply of their thick, creamy guacamole, juicy, tender carnitas tacos, and charred-just-right hamburguesas.  Oh, and their sangria is mighty flavorful, too.  If I could, I would give them 4.5 stars because they are so close, but not quite perfect: - The guacamole took so long to arrive that we only had 3 minutes with it before our food arrived.  Once I tucked into the food, I was too full to enjoy any more guac and most of it went to waste. - The tortilla soup I ordered on my first visit was less than satisfying - thin and flavorless - really not up to par with their other food. - The hamburguesa was a tad too salty on my second visit.  But, overall, really, really great.  Don't let the horrible North Beach parking situation dissuade you - this place is completely worth it.

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: 3.5 stars but rounding down since they don't serve dessert and it gets way too loud in there! We came here for a work dinner since I was able to make reservations for a party of 9. They wouldn't seat us until we all arrived, and the table but a little squishy but we made it work. We ordered a bunch of different dishes to share:  -Tacos (2/Order, Topped w/Onions & Cilantro). My favorite was the Al Pastor (Grilled Pork Rib Chop, Charred Pineapple, Avocado Salsa, $9), then the Carnitas (Slow Braised Pork, Arbol Salsa, $9), Camarones (Sauteed Shrimp, Garlic, Red Onion, $10), Pescado (Market Fresh Fish, Arbol/Avocado Salsa, Cabbage, Onion slaw, $10), then the Carne Asada (Mesquite Grilled Steak, Arbol Salsa, $9). -Mexican Sashimi (Lime, Cilantro, Chile): This was awesome since the hamachi was really fresh and flavorful. Highly recommended! -Wild Monterey Calamari (Charcoal Grilled, Orange, Lime, Radish Salad, $15): Just ok. The calamari tasted fresh, but it was a little bland- Skip. -Ceviche: Pretty good, and I normally don't like ceviche. The fish was really fresh, and the flavors worked really well together. Recommended. -Chips & Salsa ($3) & Guacamole ($6): The salsa had a good level of spicyness, and the guacamole was also good, but needed a little more salt. However, the chips were really good, and salted perfectly. -Hamburguesa (Marinated in Bacon, Onions, Served w/Guacamole, $11): I've had the hamburguesa before and really enjoyed it, but thought it was just ok this time around. The patty was a bit overcooked/on the dry side.   Our server was really good, and was able to make some recommendations to help us with our order. I thought the food was good, but not amazing. However, prices are reasonable and all their ingredients seem really fresh. It would be nice if they had at least 1-2 desserts available on the menu, since I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't at least have fruit or cookies or something. Overall, I would recommend checking out Don Pisto's once if you haven't been, but there are other really good restaurants in this area to dine at also. Parking can be a nightmare in this area, but there is a lot a few blocks away that is available, as well as street parking. No valet though.

gghESxwjBOUzvWjHJBTlCw.review_text: Trendy, yet reasonably priced and delicious Mexican food in North Beach.  Chips and salsa was quickly brought out to satisfy our starving stomachs.  The tortilla soup was great and actually spicy, and went very well with the chips as well.  The carne asada tacos I had were some of the best I've had, they were truly delicious.  The service was excellent, our waitress was highly attentive and the food came out very fast.  Prices are solid for the quality of the food and the atmosphere was very cool.

re6fN6eb3NTL7hKK-5CYUQ.review_text: My BF and I love Don Pisto's. The hamburguesa, guacamole, tacos and mussels are our favorites. Bottomless mimosas on weekends is a nice touch. I like how they use fresh squeezed pineapple juice.  The only thing I hate is the fact that there is ALWAYS a 30 to 45 minute wait to get seated. I also think it is over-priced. We eat here pretty much every week and do not mind paying for pricey Mexican Food because the quality is great.

l_NU5sK-1soFEfetmZb7yA.review_text: Out of all the places I hit up on my 10 day recent adventure to SF, Don Pisto's would have to be the most memorable. Our lovely waitress (Kim) definitely had something to do with it; my friend and I showed up parched and ravenous after a long day..and even more so from hiking up ridiculously steep/sketchy/neverending stairs to get to Telegraph Hill (thanks google maps). Kim kept us hydrated, and seeing that we were from out of town, kept coming back to chat with us as well as offer some great recommendations of things to do.   Onto the food and beverages...the red sangria was perfectly tasty and strong, but the agave/pineapple shots were to die for. After annihilating the yummy chips & salsa, we got a little sampling of the sashimi (great!), and tried the steak and fish tacos. I preferred the steak, but it may have been a bit too spicy for me (and I like spicy).   Great atmosphere, trendy crowd, and great vibes all around though!  Must come back when I'm in better shape...thanks again Kim!

zqttuCEWI4-l4ZBCbfGk6A.review_text: Jettison all of your ideas of what 'Mexican food' is and go to Don Pisto's ready for an entirely new interpretation. I had heard amazing things about this little spot in North Beach and finally tried it out earlier this year. Since then, I've been back twice with totally different groups and tried a few different menu options. The first time, I liked it. The second time, I reallllly liked it. This most recent experience? Exceptional. Like, whoa. It's not the greasy Mexican food that you're probably used to having; it's fresh, clean and puts a whole new twist on Mexican fare.   The set up of the menu makes it super conducive to sharing, so plan for that! All three times I've been in, I've had the sashimi, which has been exceptional. Most recently, we also tried the grilled calamari which was ahh-mazing! So, so good; very fresh and super healthy. The tacos that I've tried (the grilled fish and the shrimp varieties) have also been great. The tacos are on the smaller side, so make sure you're ordering enough for the group!   They don't have a full bar, so don't be shocked when you have limited drink options. Still, their margarita and sangria options are really delicious, so you won't be disappointed (I happen to be a big fan of their sangria)!

sND8hpfRodfx0wcP_mVmtQ.review_text: I get emotional just thinking about my experience here. Intimate, perfectly lit setting. Wonderful service, awesome music, and terrific food. If you want to impress someone this is the spot.

LNkxJgykMMMMnSlSb8bqlQ.review_text: You must try the cheviche. It is raw fish that is soaked in lime juice, and the lime juice acids "cook' the fish so it is doubly tender. Add the special tomatoes and onions and the cheviche was astounding.   On other occasions I love the crunchy tacos carnitas. They speak to your more base instincts, what I call your inner carnivore.

ZlaOyyWijIsEo4hCMKSaAg.review_text: Atmosphere: Upstairs = awesome, downstairs = fun for big groups, but can get kind of loud.  Food: Nachos and salsa before you get your food are great. Salsa has the perfect amount of spice. Been there a couple times now and I have to say the best items on the menu are the elote con queso, pretty much all the tacos. Not the biggest fan of the fish, but I think this is just something of preference. The al pastor tacos are a must order.  Drinks: Probably the only reason why I gave this place one less star. I can't remember the name of the drink on the menu, but definitely do not order the spiced beer. Does not quench my thirst at all and doesn't go well with the food at all. The margaritas were also eh.

_hSRnczD0QIJAulwPRv2vw.review_text: Loved it! Came here with my boyfriend for the first time and it was the best guacamole I've ever had. The Pollo asado was delicious as well!! Definitely going to go here again next time I'm in the area.

1FGl_88eqBJWhju-po_0YQ.review_text: I've been going for brunch for a while and *everything* has been really solid. Last night I went for dinner for the first time and the pork chop may have been the best piece of meat that I've ever had. Absolutely amazing.

-i4ld-4fNAqwSsNsXrU51g.review_text: I can't even begin to explain the magic that happens at Don Pistos. From the intimate seating, to the personable & attentive staff, this has got to be one of my favorite places to eat in the city. I have been here about 5 times, and seriously dream about the food when I am not there. I've tried just about everything on the menu and it is all impeccable & full of flavor. The seafood is fresh, the meat is tender, the soup is amazing. It is just one of those places that everything on the menu is to die for.

hWLQPwgl99Q6VfXdRhMuiw.review_text: Let's be honest. We all know the nightmare that is trying to find parking around Telegraph Hill. We also know that there never really is a good time to go, and that your chances of finding good parking your first time around the block is about as high as winning the million dollar lottery. That being said, Don Pisto's is worth the agonizing ordeal of finding parking.  The flavors and textures of all the dishes we got were spot on.  - The calamari is a must! It comes out grilled perfectly, and full of flavor. Plus, the presentation is gorgeous, and the colors on the plate really pop.  - Mexican sashimi with salmon. I was apprehensive about ordering this dish, but my love for sashimi would not let me pass this one up, and I'm glad I didn't. The fish was fatty and fresh and had a bit of zest to it, which was nice because then it didn't end up being overly oily on the mouth. This dish was good, not the best sashimi, but the name tells you what to expect and it's definitely a must try for the curious sashimi-lover.  -Al pastor tacos. The pork was seasoned very well. Not over-salted like at a lot of places, and the chunks of pineapple really bring out the natural sweetness and flavor of the pork. Yum! Not your usual al pastor meat if you're used to the shredded kind, but this one gives you great texture and a mouthful of deliciousness in every bite. I really enjoyed my meal here, and I definitely will be coming back...I just pray that we can find good parking again the next time around.

g5OkMQY1t4abo0UXJLZu1w.review_text: Good food and service, bass on the stereo was up too loud though. Made things a little too loud.

MSRq1PRc0HBHjSH5SlaFmQ.review_text: Why, why, why does the wait have to be so long every time? I've never been here when there wasn't a wait and I'm always starving when we show up. When the hostess says it'll be about an hour for a table for 2, I always smile and say, "Ok, put me down!" but inside I want to throw a fit like a little kid.   I know that kind of wait isn't atypical in the city, but still.  I wish they took reservations for tables less than 6.   But, even with the wait, I still love this place.   Those chips and green salsa are great.  I should try branching out, but I've always gotten the Carnitas tacos because they are perfect. Perfect. And, like others have said, you can actually get 4 tacos out of the meal.  My boyfriend gets Machaca, which is also pretty perfect. I'd never had it before having it here. Tender beef in a soupy, slightly spicy sauce with an egg on top and tortillas served on the side. Really filling.   My mouth is watering, but they don't open until 5:30.

1lMn8YSfRJxLdtvBnyhbSg.review_text: We're regulars at Don Pisto's.  It's our favorite restaurant in North Beach at the moment.  It's also our favorite Mexican restaurant in the city, which is a little surprising considering it's location. The food is always good. The service is great.  The weekend brunch has bottomless Margaritas for $15.

rBK521JFkTydG4qvALLHUQ.review_text: At the time of my writing this, this place averages 4.5 stars with 697 reviews.  Need I say more?  ok fine, i will.  COME HERE.  EAT.  EVERYTHING!!!  I've been here more times than I can count on one hand.  What keeps me coming back?  The pork chop.  Don't get me wrong, everything else is fantastic (tortillas soup,  ridiculous sliders marinated in BACON and onion, tacos, etc etc deliciousness), but the pork chop - oh my god the pork chop.  This is the most tender, flavor impacted pork chop you will ever have.      And, not only is the food good, but they can accomodate large groups (big downstairs group space)! a rarity in SF - i know, i've scrambled last minute many a time to try to set up a birthday party or special gathering.  Not only do you get all of the above, but the prices are incredibly reasonable.  After the number of places I've been to in the city where I can easily spend over $100 for two for mediocre food, the checks here are always refreshingly reasonable.

1RpQc0iT647cDC_pwBQRJQ.review_text: Oh yeah!  This place has a nice feeling and I would recommend anyone to go here that's not in a hurry. Went by a weekend night some time between 7 and 8 and asked if they had a table for two. They had but we would have to write down our nr. and was told that we would have to wait for approx. 1 hour. Went to a nearby bar and 1:30h later the door guy called, our table was ready! When inside I ordered Chips & Guacamole, Oysters and the Poc Chuc + some mexican beer.  Order a Poc Chuc and you will not be disappointed! "But Poc Chuc...", you may ask, "...what is that?" Pork chops with more pork than chops. Little bit spicy, lots of meat(!!!). On a side note: The guacamole was one of the best I've ever had. Just wanted to make sure no one misses that one.  Like the former governor: "I will be back"

eUjJ0SDe6eBoZB7iKYifnw.review_text: I wish I stayed close by, I would have a meal here almost everyday :)  It's smallish, service is personable and the food rocks!!! Love their veggie options and cheers to their Michelada's!!!   Hic hic hooray ;)

oujXc4jOWBrGlDMe4wQt3w.review_text: This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at.  Not just for Mexican fare, but, like, ever.  The setting isn't even really my bag (club-ish music playing and a disproportionate percentage of 30-something yuppies that are Chestnut Street dwellers).  Nevertheless, the establishment itself is cool inside with its exposed brick and intimate layout.  Most importantly though, the food is just knock your socks off bursting with flavor.    It begins with the salsa that is probably the best I've ever had at a restaurant.  The chips are also well above average.  As for appetizers, I have never been disappointed with the specials (last time was chorizo mussels).  All the tacos are great--in particular, the carnitas and al pastor.  But the creme de la crop is the pollo asado: phenomenally flavored and perfectly cooked chicken with a wonderful salsa (not terribly different in taste from the standard), excellent guacamole, and perfect tortillas.  Best of the best with this dish.    Honorable mentions: excellent margaritas and sangria, and friendly staff--including the owner--who graciously offered me and my date [big] free drinks for having to wait for a table to clear.  I've been here five times now and have no intention of not dramatically increasing this number.

6bNqyc7Ul_E1yOcMfaEQvw.review_text: The fish tacos at this place are the best one I have tried in a long long time. The complementary nachos are unique and freshly made as well. Love this place

uUUtWWrDq3NMsu1nR03I9w.review_text: I like when menus consist of few items because I feel as though the chef/cooks can really perfect what they have to offer.  There was a  downside I saw with this at Don Pisto's. If you have minimal options, at least make sure what you do have on your menu is ample--2 items on the menu were completely sold out by the time we ordered  The Sangria is pretty mediocre to wash down after the delectable mexican sashimi. The tacos were good, but I'd say short of what'd I'd expect upon paying $11 for two street tacos.   I'm not sure I understand the hype of this place.

-DfMAin0kc1_IsizunPwVA.review_text: Loved their calamari and fish tacos!

yUCzjLBSd8NtYjQQqAhz_A.review_text: Dear Mission Mexican Restaurants: You have now been schooled for a third time by non Mexican chillangos on good Mexican food. (First two were Mamacita & Tacolicious) This time a SF-raised & Betelnut-trained chef rocks Yucatan-inspired food like spicy salmon ceviche, sopa de tortilla and micheladas that reminded me of hanging with my cuates back in the day at the beach.  Major, major props to this place.  Dear Anyone Who Eats Burritos: Burritos are as Mexican as Taco Bell.  If you want real Mexican food, come try this place.

wph0lYMvsZca7ryMMRp7ZA.review_text: Must eat: guacamole, their green salsa dip for the chips. Use that on the order of carne asada.   The steak is too tough even though medium rare. Love the atmosphere. Very lively and busy at night. Like the music. A mixture of classic rock and rap from the 90s -- love it and the updated songs of today. Make sure to check the hours of operation and not go when they are closed.

HFECrzYDpgbS5EmTBtj2zQ.review_text: It takes a great hamburguesa to make putting ketchup on it unnecessary.  And so it was as 3 of us ordered this savory take on Mexican street food. The bacon and onion accented marinade was spot on as was the topping of guacamole and a perfectly toasted bun. It was also more than enough food despite its presence on the small plates part of the menu. To round out our 4 person table, we also ordered a delicious and spicy grilled Wild Monterey Calamari and a couple of fish tacos. Water was plentiful for the spice, while a some Lagunitas IPAs and a couple glasses of Rose kept the meal and the conversation flowing.   This place is popular and luckily we had the flexibility to wait over an hour for our Table. That was made easier by the professional touch of the greeter and his willingness to call Gayle's cell when our table was ready. The other thing is that this place is loud and hard to carry on a conversation. Perhaps this is the new generational normal, but I would have preferred something a little bit more casually intimate to match the cool rustic dining room that was nicely accented by the brick walls and heavy wooden furniture.  There's also a downstairs that could double as a room for larger groups.   Don Pisto's was a great choice and I thank Gayle's hip young professional Nephew for suggesting it.  As there's no sign on the outside, I would have walked past this place on my own, with no clue of what Nuevo Yucatan (and other Baja locales) wonders lied within. Maybe Gayle and I will do Brunch next time.

w-gGmwVa8XoCDOYH1yBJKA.review_text: This place is great, though a little pricey. It's a little on the loud side, but a great precursor to a night out in North Beach. Also I wish the hamburguesa was always on the menu :(

Dsn0E5ad3oom8iGIrFXPsQ.review_text: Don Pisto's MIGHT be my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and I've been to A LOT. But the simplicity of their fresh food has never disappointed me. I've had a variety of things here now. Oysters, chicken tacos, pork chop, lobster burrito for two (OH MY GOD holy best thing I ever ate), and even their chips and guac are delish.  Don Pisto's is one of those places I take all of my out of town friends to impress them. People think you can't be blown away by Mexican food (myself included), but this place is a sure winner every time. If the lobster burrito is ever on the menu, you HAVE to order it. Just shut up and give them all your money.  Cons: Stronger/cheaper margs plz. Then you'll never be able to get rid of me.

gdyTYdj-Y29Uwg1y-H5iUg.review_text: Really good food at really reasonable price. Got in and out quick and the service was great. Had the fish tacos and a veggie burrito, both stellar. Chips are made in house and guac and salsa were terrific.

tWyRL6KijkZ-MKvijEwb6Q.review_text: After reading the reviews they had me at "old school rap playing in the background" who doesn't want to hear Tupac and Biggie Smalls while enjoying street tacos. The ambiance made me feel so gangster I decided on the managers recommendation for the diablo prawns.  If you're not feeling as manly as you know you can be these spicy as fuck crustaceans will get you that Movember beard in a hot minute. The salsa was amazing, def roasted the ingredients and the heat was just perfect. Disclaimer: if you were raised on spicy like me then this will take you back to the days your mom would run you out of the kitchen with all the pepper roasting happening in the casa.   I had a couple sangrias that were way too easy going down. The carnitas tacos were amazeballs. As an appetizer I had the Mexican sashimi, melt in my mouth salmon! Sarah was my bartender and I give 5 stars on the service. For my entree I had the mussels with chorizo. These flavorful bad boys will get you to foodgasm heaven.   No dessert offered here but the manager was enough eye candy for me.  I'll def be back!

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Don Pisto's is a fun restaurant that is good for food and drinks. It is an ideal restaurant for groups or dates as it is a very social environment. The menu is pretty limited in items and I was not very impressed with the tacos but I was a big fan of the pork chop. This beast feeds 2 easily and it was grilled perfectly well. Meat was tender, juicy, and well-seasoned with great al pastor like flavors. Cool spot in a fun neighborhood right next to the North Beach bars.

kp1SDNjwwBPFmdF1kadRmw.review_text: How have I not written a review for this place??  Granted, I've only been here for brunch (3 times, and counting), but the food is seriously good.  The food here is greasy, spicy, flavorful, and just all around satisfying. I recommend the breakfast burrito, taco sonora (al pastor style), and the hamburgesa. You won't be disappointed!

YxUCrj2W3ylaeDk4fgwqOg.review_text: -Our Order-  2 margaritas, diablo prawns, white rice, pinto beans, carne asada and al pastor tacos  -The Short-  Ambiance: Laid back Crowd: Young & privileged Food: Perfect for late night grub with minimal expectations Price: Absurdly over-priced Service: Ok, with a slight hint of ambivalence Wait: None  -The Long-  This restuarant's biggest asset is the ambiance.  The minimal modern decor, friendly low key vibe of the staff and abundance of young hip patrons lends Don Pisto's an air of greatness.  It is unfortunate that the food and drinks do not measure up to the hype.  Don Pisto's biggest misstep for me was in pricing.  The $8 Margaritas are a house-fermented mostly sour concoction that probably would not move the blood alcohol level of my bichon frise.

4S9hut2coaGZB0NaB1DYig.review_text: When it comes to good Mexican vs. great Mexican, Don Pisto's fits into the latter category. Providing a contemporary take on traditional Mexican street food, Don Pisto's uses quality local ingredients to come up with tasty delights like: mexican sashimi, grilled pork chop, tortilla soup and wild Monterey calamari. There wasn't one disappointing dish amongst the bunch and everything tasted fresh, authentic and stupidly good. The wine selection is fantastic (with several Californian options), the place is laid back and the chilled ambiance makes your 30 - 60 minute wait worth your while (this place is packed so I'm afraid you will have to settle in at the bar unless you're extremely lucky). The price/quality is also worth the trip as four of us ate (including a bottle of wine) for under $120 USD. Doesn't get better than that: fortheintolerants.com/20…

qjBuaL6LapSDKpV7MIhrPQ.review_text: CHORIZO. MUSSELS.  This combination was amazing and something I would have never thought of. The best part of the dish is not only the pork and seafood marinaded together in chorizo sauce, but also that you can use the shells of the mussels as tiny spoons to scoop chorizo! Definitely order this anytime you come with a group as it is great to share.  I thought the tacos were decent, but nothing close to tacos in the Mission. Also, almost $10 for two tacos? Hefty price tag for ridiculously small portions! I've also heard good things about the burger, but haven't tried it myself.

JtsMi2_H7kPNDuE6xjd3Sg.review_text: Good food but beware of service. We had a reservation for more than 5 and we had an emergency, because we reduced the party size and were 5 minutes late we were told we would have to sit a communal table, all fine but would have loved less attitude from the Hostess. Won't go back anytime soon.

vrV9pxKrhH8vDo9lgbcysQ.review_text: Excellent food, service and atmosphere. My only gripe is no dessert is offered bc they want to get people in and out faster said the waitress.   We had grilled calamari, sashimi, agave shots, sangria, tacos, and the lobster. Really loved the menu and staff!!  Love this spot and will be back.

OZvIS0abL93Gk8XV3-ZPGQ.review_text: great for what it is.. great tacos (some of the best in SF), good music, good vibe.. reasonably priced for SF.

qFmnhf6QKVFiw61ITJW7NA.review_text: I have been to Don Pisto's several times now. With their trendy tacos, south of the border-inspired sashimi, and drink specials, this seems like a promising spot. But I have come away each time feeling like it was a disappointingly lackluster experience, especially given their prices. The waits are long, service is decent, and food is just... alright.  If you are looking for authentic Mexican food, I advise you instead to head down to one of the many taquerias on 24th Street -- you and your wallet will be much more satisfied.

9QNkErhUpLn8A5IeiIwkHw.review_text: Came here during Labor Day Weekend and it wasn't as packed as it usually is. Started off with some margaritas and sangria for drinks, then our group shared a plate of Mexican Sashimi. From there, I personally had the Poc Chuc (grilled pork chop loin) because I've always wondered about the dish. Let me tell you, it was BOMB and would recommend it to anyone. It was grilled perfectly and I  was given two large loins. It was a very pleasurable experience as usual, and going to continue to hit this place up.   Note: Our waitress mistook one of my friend's dishes, so when it came out he mentioned he didn't order that dish. She quickly took it back, and brought the correct dish along with a sangria (on the house). She was great overall and enjoyed her service.

3C2SBg_zqsZT4I_UUdJPWw.review_text: Rating: 3.5.  Visited on a Thursday night.  Our tab was the following:  1 sangria 1 michelada 1 guacamole and chips 1 order of two tacos al pastor 1 pork chop  Total: $53.29.  Sangria was weak, full of ice, and lacked any fruit.  Michelada lacked spices and peppers to give it a rounded flavor.   Chips were good though guacamole needed salt, some pepper, and a kick (throw some diced jalapenos in there).  Yes, the two al pastor tacos were on the smaller side but they were the best items we ordered that night.  The al pastor is also good when compared to traditional Mexican restaurants of high quality.  Pork chop was unevenly cooked, a little too much of the glaze on the side that was undercooked but it was a huge piece of meat. Don Pisto's is not a place I'm going to go out of my way to eat at but may give it another chance if a friend wants to go to it.

9_ZperMneTHX_-nEP-URMA.review_text: This place hides in the brick wall on union st. My sister brought me here after she stumbled upon it with her friends. It was packed so the wait is a little ridiculous, but it is worth it. Also, for the most part the service was good.

XtTe0SLLEXjonEsrLYr6OA.review_text: Service - 5/5 for the entire staff. The hostess was friendly, bartender super accommodating and fast, and the waitress attentive, polite, and knowledgeable about the menu.  - Water service is excellent  Food - TACOS: I had the snapper, al pastor, and beef tacos. Besides the presentation on the dish, the tacos are OK IMO (especially when they're priced at $8 - $9). The al pastor was the most flavorful out of the three, but in all honesty, I mostly tasted the corn tortillas with every bite.  - CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP: This was delicious and I would highly recommend it if you enjoy soups.  Atmosphere - Excellent spot for a date, but the Mexican style club music can get a little old.  Overall - I would really rate them as 3.5, but seeing how we have an abundance of tacos in the Mission, Don Pisto's are really just OK. If I were to go back again, I would definitely order one of their specials like the lobster dish.

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Lived up to the hype for me and friend.  Both really loved the Pollo Asado entree.  There is some secret ingredient or something.  Maybe bacon fat?   The calmari on skewers was excellent as well.  I normally prefer my guac to be "pure avocado and this was cut a bit, but in conjunction with the Asado plate, it was fine.  With just chips, it might have been a problem.  Nice service and not a bad wait if you get there around 6:00 on a thurs.  Price is fair for the excellence.  Def will want to go back to try this bacon fat burger.

eGssBzcX3CsCUaCjCzYLiw.review_text: The tacos here are delicious! My favorite has got to be the al pastor and the camarones.  My only complaint is ordering the chips and guacamole first. SO GOOD! I ended up becoming completely full from eating this and had no more room to try the other tacos. I will be back for more!  The music is pretty loud so if you're looking for an intimate dinner, this is probably not the best spot for you. Otherwise, definitely recommend for you to dine here and have some yummy tacos.

DJPyN_3mDSIGU4zFF27RWg.review_text: First time here and everything was awesome. We were having a super late dinner around 10:45 so the place was emptying out. The service was quick.  We had el pastor, chicken, and shrimp tacos with the rib eye and the lobster.  Everything was amazing and super delicious, the chicken tacos stood out the most because it was super tender and marinated.  I definitely look forward to going back and it's perfect for late night eating when everyone else is closed.

OZTXTYIWow3lT_yKNwXGnA.review_text: After recently relocating to SF, locals told me to prepare for the amazing food SF has to offer. After eating at Don Pisto's I think I finally got an idea of what they are talking about. Luckily we came late enough one evening where we didn't have to wait long for a table, so that was a huge plus.
