If you come here I recommend trying: the mussels - the sauce they make it in SO good, its a chili like sauce  the burger was absolute perfection so tender, we ordered a second round  the tacos were good but a little dry for my taste  Overall, great service, great food, and great atmosphere.

1-FM0MtSSEFSHETOpVUVPQ.review_text: Stopped in with the Mrs while we were in town for our honeymoon and walking around the area. It was around 1:30, so we ate off the brunch menu. We ordered chips and guac as an appetizer, and the guacamole did not disappoint.  They have bottomless margaritas/sangria/mimosas for $17 a person (for 1.5 hours) and it was well worth the price. All three were excellent, and the servers were constantly refilling our glasses.  We both ordered the carne asada tacos, and they were unbelievable. Some might be put off by the two tacos for $9, but the quality was off the charts. Not to mention the endless chips and salsa to go with it.  I would recommend this place to anyone. The service is second-to-none, the food is excellent, and the drinks are aces.

YXsJVcTJ5L0-jrj6rLK3jQ.review_text: My visit to Don Pisto's was very solid.  I was killing some time on a Saturday morning in North Beach and wanted to try this place since hearing a great recommendation from a friend.    The brunch menu is solid and full of tantalizing choices.  I went for the hamburguesa, and asked for it with a sunny side up egg to boot, because that seemed like a brunch thing to do.  My dish and egg arrived and I slid the egg onto the hamburguesa, and cut the whole thing in half, sending dripping yolk cascading down the sandwich.  Making a production of it all without intent drew some casual onlookers who nodded with approval at what I was doing.  The flavor was solid and I couldn't have been more satisfied.    Service was really good as well.  On my way to the restroom I ran into the owner in the basement prep room, and had a good chat with him.  Apparently he's been working in the restaurant biz since he was 13 and knows what he's doing.  He was very pleasant and offered me a parking card with some leftover credit on it to feed the meter as well!  You can't beat that.  He told me I really ought to get in there and try dinner as well.  I definitely will do that.

JEcIwDbQY0M4JHmJvo-Rrw.review_text: a perfect place for a date.  Ambiance: romantic. dim lighting with a lit candle on the table. Parking: hard to find around this area of the city Wait time: none, only two of us at the time we arrived. However, if you are going in a big group I would suggest, calling and making reservations. Food: great tacos, chips and salsa Drinks: only tried the margaritas. bought a whole pitcher.  Service: great!

z-R-_pNPK8FqHFSfC422SQ.review_text: Came here on a whim cause the bf saw it on Yelp after me telling him I was craving Mexican. Had to get the tacos here. We shared Al Pastor and Carnitas. I really liked the Al Pastor, but the carnitas seemed a bit dry and not as flavorful. We also had their ceviche which was really good. Had lots of large chunks of scallops and shrimp. The guacamole was fresh, but could use a bit more salt and lime.  Overall this was a good meal. Our waitress was pretty nice though we didn't need her assistance much. The restaurant ambiance is cool, laid-back and kind of modern. Walked in and definitely wasn't expecting to see this place, I was thinking we would go to some hole-in-the-wall place for Mexican food.  I like that this place is open late. Great for the late night snack.

uQyAo7snL5K5mDOm1bj_fg.review_text: Or something south of the border I stop by my local Don Peastow North Beach. Me and my girlfriend get that seven and the wait is long but there's a bar that we can wait. We don't drink anything but it's nice to sit down sometimes. Finally we get a table for two. Our server Denise comes and brings his chips and salsa, salsa Verde if I'm not mistaken. Along with two classes of non-iced water. So we dip and sip! Now, to your average chip and salsa guy one salsa is pretty good but my girlfriend is in the know and she asks the knees for that red salsa salsa row ha ha! Denise brings it out to sweet and we get then do some serious chips! My girlfriend orders five tacos and I ordered two lobsters and we are mouthwatering waiting! Good thing we had two kinds of salsa and chips to keep us satisfied and knees made sure our glasses were never dry! Unfortunately, my brothers ex-wife showed up and we had a duck out of there without being seen because we didn't want to have to pay for that apartment incident. I'm only giving this place for stars because some of the chips were too salty.

KYOnxzlRbBC1k1XYxuVqJA.review_text: Don Pistos is my go-to place for groups in SF.  They have great food; a lively atmosphere; a perfect location for going out afterwards; and can accommodate large groups, which is hard to find in San Francisco.   As far as menu choices go, I highly recommend the pork chop - its one of the best I've eaten - but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Their ONLY issue is the lack of hard alcohol.  They make the wine (agave) margarita's but it's not the same, so you are stuck with those and beer/wine.

MSMcQB0EMRS_4n8xeuVFtg.review_text: Found the restaurant while browsing Yelp for some good Mexican restaurants in San Francisco. Decided on Don Pisto's as the reviews were good, prices were right and the atmosphere was perfect for a casual dinner out.  Took the transit to Union St. Make sure you know the address if you plan on going as their is no signage, which clearly isn't needed since the place was packed.  The restaurant itself is loud and small. Full of people in my age group - mid 20's to 30's. We were told the wait would be about an hour, and after travelling across town and really wanting a Mexican fix we said no problem. We were welcome to stay at the bar; had a Margarita and a Dos Equis. Margarita was excellent - we had at least 2 more each.   Less than 20 minutes later we were seated. I have a feeling they try to weed people out by saying you won't be seated for a long time.   We shared the guacamole which also came with green salsa. Both were great. Chips were homemade and not too salty.   Next we shared the Tortilla soup (sold as 2 bowls); lots of chicken and flavour in the dish. You could tell it was homemade too.  Each of us finished with a different taco. Small, and served with piping hot mini corn tortillas I had the Carne Asada (very spicy) and my wife had the Barbacoa. Hers were not was spicy as mine, but both had a different sauce. Sharing and trading was encouraged!  In the end we had a great meal, ate just enough food not to feel like we rolled out of the place. Our server was pleasant, food came up fast without feeling rushed between courses. If in SF again we would definitely return!

a966ddkJ6FhbE4u8MIoVVA.review_text: What to say about Don Pisto's? This tiny restaurant, hiding in North Beach is a true gem of the city. A few reasons why:  1. The staff is phenomenal, friendly, and attractive. 2. The Poc Chuc (Pork Chop) will change your life. 3. Mussels with Chorizo - yes please! 4. Amazing tacos. 4. Margaritas and Sangria to die for. 5. Great atmosphere and clientele.  But actually, none of that matters because you know what this place has? Great Chips.  Tips- Come with your ID and don't be a pain when the bartender asks for it. The bar has a pretty steep curve to it, make sure you use your napkin. Try not to get addicted...

bvQ3ZUWc0LnbesxMtIl16w.review_text: I walked into Don Pisto's a sniveling little noob, a whiny young whelp ignorant to the ways of the world and hyperbolic Mexican food.  I walked out transformed. I was a foot taller, with bronzed skin, broad shoulders and a jaw like a bloody lantern. My teeth were whiter, my brain was bigger and my sexual prowess had increased a hundredfold.  Such tacos I have never before encountered. The real holy grail here, though, is the Mussels With Home-Made Chorizo, a powerful scarlet sausage skinned and crumbled over a steaming broth brimming with what I can only assume is testosterone.   Don Pisto made me into a colossus. The earth trembles with my passage.  I am Andre the Giant.  I am Charles Atlas.  I am Galactus, Devourer of Worlds.

3qW5Y3nAfVaR39teuzMyBg.review_text: z is that place sucks I'm I went up over here trying to get parking for 35 minutes this place suck then they will have some private event fuck that shit

0yQ2sjBMyX_gLzVcYFjm5Q.review_text: Score one for Lauren.  The best tomatillo salsa, best guacamole, best chips, best tacos, best burger...  Have the Burger on a home baked bun, grilled bun, half pound patty marinated in something really tasty and drenched in a huge scoop of guacamole.  The atmosphere is a brick cellar, old woods and hidden side street with no sign outside so best to know a local.  Wait can be up to an hour or more; so, be prepared.  I warned you; but, the wait is Worth it.

kgicol92cNFUNz73yrMAvA.review_text: My favorite taco place in San Francisco!!!  My family from Asia are not big fans of having foreign food.  I was praying that they would like this place. I order almost all the dishes for 8 of us to share and they love it all.  The tacos were delicious with the cozy environment! Groups of party is allow at the downstairs, great for parties!

5j6fzbja_e3c84ydiFyxog.review_text: I LOVE this place! We came here for brunch. Bottomless orange and pineapple mimosas! Mexican food! What is there to not love? I ordered the ham and poblano scramble. So. Delicious. The eggs were so creamy. What amazed me was how hot my dish was throughout my meal. My food was perfectly warm until I couldn't eat any more (there had to have been 3-4 eggs in my dish!) and the cheese was melty and yummy. We were also served bottomless chips and green salsa. Our waitress was super attentive, and came over to refill our waters and mimosas several times and never let our glasses bottom out. This place bumps top 40 music, which I thought was fun. Not so loud that you can't have a conversation, but audible enough to feel happy on a Sunday morning. And with bottomless mimosas, who couldn't be happy?  Basically, fantastic food, great service = must visit again next time I'm in San Francisco.

WF3Z6S_ZFEV7UmPNWlkISg.review_text: I cringe giving Don Pisto's 2 stars because I used to love this restaurant.  When Don Pisto's opened a few years back, many of us living in North Beach  were excited to have a Mexican restaurant with a signature menu. Although a little loud at times, the ambiance was also a lot of fun.    I loved the food and vibe so much that in 2010, I had my birthday there with a group of 20 friends.  Pete, the owner, was very accommodating, and we had a great set-up in the main room.  The food was delicious, staff was excellent, and the evening had a great vibe to it.  I have not been to Don Pisto's now in about 8 months because the lines can be so long - which is great for Don Pisto's because that's great business and they're bringing in people from all areas of SF.  For those of us in North Beach, it's become a place we once loved, but now can't get in without waiting 1-2 hours.  I tried to go in the other night and looking at the menu I realized there were less choices and that you now have to pay for chips and salsa.  Plus, the bar disappeared and there is no place to buy a drink and wait for your table like the old days.  Another drawback is the music.  It's very loud, even outside on the street, and it appears there's now a DJ which takes up part of the space in the main room.  Conversation is difficult and the music choice is appealing to a younger crowd. More like a club atmosphere.  Sad to say, but it feels like a trendy Marina restaurant these days for 20 somethings ready for a night on the town. For those of us looking for excellent Mexican food, great ambiance, and a welcome feeling for all patrons, Don Pisto's is a restaurant of the past...

Xei4NJ0N_SkdQ42xxrk67Q.review_text: Came here for brunch before Union Street Fest for bottomless mimosas and they definitely did their job, a little too well. The brunch food is just all right and at $17 for bottomless mimosas, it's a little pricey, considering you can get $9-10 bottomless mimosas at other places (just $7 at Cafe Mystique in the Castro!). But what I love about Don Pisto's is that you can swap out your mimosas with sangria or margaritas. Definitely a great way to pass a weekend morning!

UtZj_fcV_0WZz8D74RSosA.review_text: Good: - hamburguesa - tacos - ceviche - sangrias - inexpensive - lively  Bad: - pretty loud - tight - tends to attract some show off and loud happy hour characters  I haven't had a problem with service, which has always been curt but respectful. But I can imagine sometimes the staff may get stressed out and offer poor service because of the number and attitude of customers.

xSjvbfo6gM-sD2rXCkhR6w.review_text: Came here on the night I arrived in San Francisco last week. Kind of hard to find because there is no sign, just 3 red lights outside the door. The salsa they give you is fantastic. Just the right amount of heat. I had the chicken tacos for dinner and they were one of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place.

z9cYL4QDlg8-hjSZcx0JtA.review_text: Don Pistos was pretty good, but definitely not a place for a date. My boyfriend was in town and he's a fan of tacos so I figured Don Pistos would be a good place to go to. I'm giving it four stars because although the tacos were excellent, I couldn't hear jack shit while I was there. It was so loud that I couldn't hear a word my boyfriend was saying. I was literally yelling throughout my whole conversation. This place is really meant for groups of 3+ because the ambiance is definitely not intimate and crowded. I think if I was with a group I'd have a better experience but it was hard getting a word in while I was there.  Despite, the noise level the tacos we had were very delicious. We had the Al Pastor and the Carne Asada which was very good. The Carne Asada is a little more spicy if you like spicy food but the Al Pastor was perfectly cooked and blended together with grilled rib chop and pineapple- the Al Pastor was my favorite out of the two. I'll be going back but with a bigger group!

a2wL432MCURrkqWbgoDVrg.review_text: OMG. Bottomless fresh pineapple mimosas and margaritas. Don Pisto caused us to go Ghosting at the local park afterwards. Please refer to: youtu.be/fdTSBalHfOo

OTfPrBeCZirP4wb2XTIxkg.review_text: Don Pistos is one of my new favorite restaurants in San Francisco, which is hard because this area has a lot of really good food.  My husband and I have only been there twice but both times the service was great and the food was even better! The Al Pastor and Sangria are my favorite combination but the other food is good as well. They don't have a dessert menu which is a down side, so instead I just have one order of the Al Pastor as my entree, and then order another for dessert!  The pricing is also good, about $9-11/per taco order which includes two medium sized tacos that they give you extra tortilla to make it into four.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this place! When you are in the area just look for a bunch of people inside a restaurant on Union street that has no sign.

p08A1KxUMeC0Jar_su7I-Q.review_text: Had a terrible experience here! We called early in the day and asked to make a reservation for for 5 adults at 6:30. They told us that they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more. When we asked how early we should get there and if they would be busy at 6:30 they said we should have no problem getting a table. When we arrived at 6:00 just to be safe, they told us it was a 45 minute wait. When they finally did seat our party of FIVE they sat us at a 4 top which meant I had to sit on the corner where there was barley enough room for my plate (while there was an open 6 top right next to us that they wouldn't sit us at). I mean, I have worked in the restaurant business before and when there is a party of 5 you sit them at the 6 top and suck it up! But that is not even the worst of it. One of the people in our party ordered (off of their TINY menu) the mussels and about ten minutes after ordering our waitress came up to us and said they were out of the mussels because they had a bigger party coming in later that they had to save some for in case they ordered them. We were there ordering them NOW and they were saving them for a party larger than 5?? It made no sense! He changed his order to the steak. He asked what came with the steak and the waitress said "nothing, but I can add a side of rice and beans for you if you want." He took that as a consolation prize for not having the mussels and said yes, but when the bill came we were charged for them. Another person in our party ordered the "fried calamari" not realizing that the menu said that they were grilled. The waitress put the order in for calamari and when it came back they were grilled. She could have at least told us that they weren't fried! We would have changed the order! By the time we were getting up to leave, they finally sat people at the 6 top right next to us that was empty during our entire dining experience.  I will not go back. The food we did eat was average Mexican food and small portions.

JUDK3oQCINsatzWjorVc9g.review_text: Brunch review! Five stars overall not only due to their food, but due to their amazing service and for putting up with so many drunk people all weekend.  Drinks were constantly refilled up until the moment we left and despite the fact that we were there for almost 3 hours, we were never asked to vacate the table. The food was great (huevos rancheros for me, french toast and breakfast burritos were among the other items ordered), the salsa is some of the best I've tasted at a restaurant, and I just really liked the feel of the restaurant.  Great, semi-hidden (mean that literally because pretty much everyone knows about DP's now) spot in NB for brunch.

uNIyxmljF0IVuVEifJNQ6g.review_text: It was my birthday and my pals wanted to take me out to a fun dinner.  Not knowing where to go, we decided to wander around downtown and found ourselves in North Beach.  My buddy had heard of a swanky spot for some hip Mexican food, which seemed out of place for North Beach, but after checking it out online and seeing it's amazing reviews, absolutely had to check it out.  It was really tricky to find since there's no signs and located on an otherwise quiet street but we eventually found it after walking by several times.  They started us off with house chips and salsa, which had really fresh and had a nice bite to it.  We ordered some oysters on the half shell, which were fresh and delicious, and bargain at $2 each.  I decided to get their special burger, which is marinated in bacon and onions, and cooked to a beautiful medium rare and topped with guacamole.  WOW!  It may look like a simple burger but it was full of flavor.  My girlfriend's ordered the tortilla soup, which was exactly what one would want on a cold night and cleared the sinuses right up.  Everything was executed flawlessly and was awesome.  Service is flawless, perhaps one of the best experiences I've had in SF.  The restaurant itself has a speakeasyish kind of vibe and it's really hard to find if you don't know it's there and had exposed brick walls inside.  Despite being hard to find, the place gets busy pretty quick so I recommend arriving early.  It was a super fun experience and I can't wait to go back!  Food: 9/10  Service: 10/10  Price: $$  Atmosphere: 10/10

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: I was a little skeptical when we walked through the door because I didn't see any sign labeling the place as "Don Pistos." Did I miss it? We walked in and a guy, who I later found out is a waiter, welcomed us and asked us to put our name down on "the list," (a clipboard with lined notebook paper) which we did.  We made our way to the bar, had a seat and started off with a beer (Pacifico for me and Negra Modelo for Phil). A guy sitting next to us was already eating and his ceviche looked fantastic. I turn to Phil: "We need to get that!"   Once our table was ready, our meal consisted of: Cevice du jour: shrimp (5 stars) Tacos de carne asada (5 stars) -- don't be fooled there are 4 tortillas instead of 2, so you'll fill up more than what you'd expect. Tacos de pollo asado (5 stars) -- these were a substitute for the carnitas because they were out. Hamburguesa (5 stars) -- marinated in BACON and onions. Smothered in guacamole. I was too full to finish my portion but it was delicious. Michelada (4 stars) -- I've had authentic micheladas and this one came pretty close; but I have to say I've had better. Something was missing (a little more spice or lime juice?). I'd never had Sol beer, maybe it was the beer selection...I have yet to decide what went wrong.

05UqTkPt9nsP1IFhOD6r5w.review_text: don pistos is well worth its 4.5 star rating. the food is so simple, yet SO consistently delicious. i adore the shrimp tacos and perfectly salted chips. it's reasonably priced. the service is friendly. the margaritas delightful. you can do easy take-out if you're so inclined. there's nothing not to love about this place.

9QoXklTk-Fl1Q1Cy8fCbdQ.review_text: Delicioso! Great lobster and reasonably priced.  Three of us shared the lobster with the fresh tortillas.  It was just as good as being in Puerto Nuevo without the line around the block.  The margaritas were so-so.  Next time, I'll stick to the real good food and a chilled Pacifico.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I expected more from Don. He seems to have amazing reviews; afterall, you don't come by an average 4.5 stars with that many reviews often. I don't know, though...I.don't.know.   The ceviche was good. A-ok worthy. The tacos were also good. A-ok worthy. The service was good. The ambiance was good. You catch my drift. Everything was fine... good, even. Four and a half stars, worthy, though?! An average two hour wait? Are they slipping crack in other people's food and we just missed that batch?   I don't know.

h3KpLypa9SZEw2ydFNC19Q.review_text: 3.25/5 mimosa brunchieee  so there were hella (17) of us there, all drizzunk, rowdy, hungry, thirsty. repeat.  our waiter cory was great and kept up with us, making sure our glasses were never empty for long. the food overall though is okay, nothing necessarily to write home to mama about. especially if you're drunk, she'll get jealous. i think it'd be interesting if they came out with more flavors for the mimosas.  oh, and i was oddly fond of the chips. i dunno why, but i'm pretty sure i cleared a (couple) bowls by myself. yes.

i-iykZde8rKAqq9RQGS-Hg.review_text: We came here on a recommendation from a friend who lives in SF and it was not a disappointment. The place is pretty small and nondescript from the outside, but walking in, you see the flames shooting up from the grill, the great mix of people and the lively energy of the place, you know that you're in for a treat. Its mexican street food style, carnitas, street tacos, chips and guac. The grilled calamari was amazing, but a little spicy for me. The salmon sashimi was delectable and our friend ordered the lobster. It was the entire lobster, grilled with rendered bacon fat and served with taco fixings. It was awesome.  I recommend getting a reservation as it filled up mighty quick, but the wait didn't seem like a long time.

LNooRhqlM6ebjgm5KT1KLA.review_text: The food was just OK. I feel like there are better Mexican restaurants in San Francisco to go to.

qr3MYNEtnxBvB8NOtuW0Gw.review_text: Modern Mexican Street food....  YUMMMM  I always get the fish tacos and ceviche + Green salsa tastes incredibly fresh with the best chips to complement them - No happy hour prices so kind of expensive. Half of the price comes from flare and ambiance---also the fact that it is in North Beach. Bar is small, space is limited + Flavors are great, and have not been disappointed with the food yet.  Conclusion: I always recommend tourists to come here, its delicious and def worth trying. Its a good spot where locals go to.

aLU6mwo__pRXxN6hZi6nTw.review_text: Great tacos!! Plus, the sangria and guac are pretty awesome!!!

pO6eKh8gRBEeWEKb3kXU5Q.review_text: Big fan of Don Pisto's! I've been frequenting this place since I used to live in North Beach and it has consistently left me wanting to come back for more. Perfect for friends visiting from out of town, double dates, birthday parties, Sunday brunch or just to satisfy your taco cravings!   In summary: tasty food for unbeatable prices in a toasty and trendy dining environment.  Now on to the food. The free salsa & chips are amazingly fresh. The chile verde salsa is a perfect balance of citrusy, spicy and savory.  The chicken tortilla soup is HUGE! I've shared an order of the soup with 4 girl friends before. It's good but nothing special. All the entrees (carne asada tacos, carnitas tacos, fish tacos, hamburger, chile verde chicken tortiallas...) I have ordered have never disappointed me. My favorites though are the chicken tostadas and al pastor tacos. But you can't go wrong with ordering any of their delicious tacos!   Warning: The place does get pretty crowded on Fridays and Saturdays so expect to wait awhile if you go during the weekend dinner rush. But I promise the wait is totally worth it!

hxo5--VketoAHchr0GOK8w.review_text: Delicious tacos and fresh calamari. Small menu but very good for small bites and sharing.

hN6rCuE6rA_e9oTWRc7WDA.review_text: Stumbled on this place while walking through North Beach, and boy are we glad we did. My boyfriend had the carnitas torta and just about fell off his chair with ecstasy. I had the fish tacos and they were perfection. The chips are thick and homemade and salty and amazing. The salsa is green and chunky and spicy and awesome. The service is super friendly. If we lived in town this place would be on our weekly circuit. I guess we'll just have to hope they open an outpost in DC...

ZBZqU3td_dLvSh5IxZ8IiQ.review_text: Don Pistos I must say, coming from a Mexican family in Los Angeles, you have made me LOVE salsa once more! You know it's good when your nose is running!   The ambiance is so cool...club meets lounge meets restaurant. The music is Rap...way cool!. The overall vibe is very happening with making ANYONE feel good in here.   The food:  Iced Tea= Thumbs up!  Guacamole=Great seasoning and taste! Chicken Tacos=Great spice!! Awesome appetizer!  Al Pastor Tacos=Really good especially on flour tortillas! Enchiladas=2 THUMBS UP!  Service=You really made me feel at home and waited on us hand and foot! BRAVO!!! Thank you for a great experience!

4lVT1jQmCrQWeLbG-gtSUg.review_text: Stop reading this and go here. Get anything. Favorite tacos and guac place so far in SF. Just wish I could get a real marg and it would be 5 stars!

Dujfh1Qhx3BzbEL9vEQM7g.review_text: It's true...this place is really good and worth the wait.  The burger and pork chop were excellent!  Tortilla soup was also very good, served 3 people and had a spicy kick.  Would come back to try more of the menu.

DAikVU-yTq7nIRZmeR7gwQ.review_text: VERY busy for a weeknight. Upscale American influenced Mexican food is the best way I know how to describe it. Local hangout which is hard to find in North Beach. The shrimp tacos were by far the best, the carnitas and carne asade tacos had really strong sauces/salsa that took away from the meat. Good date location. Good guacamole!

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: A one hour wait on a Saturday night..what did I expect in the North Beach area around 6:30pm.  Lucky me...the wait was much shorter and we were able to get some drinks while we were waiting.  Couldn't say I was crazy about the margarita but the service and food made up for it.  A bunch of us order a few items to share.  My favorite was the ceviche, sashimi and the fish tacos.  Also, I loved the fact that I learned that they do take reservations for parties of 6 or more and they have a dining room large enough to a party of 40 guests :)

HSaNZ5e22Sp5rd-q0U0HKA.review_text: Food here is great! Came here and had:  calamari carnitas tacos pescado tacos   The calamari was by far the best dish. It's not fried, it's grilled, but come on cool skewers :) The chips and salsa is also suppper tasty. What can I say? I'm simple. Sangria was yummo too.   It's pricy though.... for the above, our bill came out to about $70 before tip.

33rJdL8yNvSsE2X5AjH0EA.review_text: The food here is absolutely delicious. It's truly outstanding and this would be a five-star review based on the food alone. However, the service and atmosphere were so unfavorable, they far outweigh the quality of the food itself.  The restaurant's first floor is very appealing. However, we were seated in an expansion space in the basement. It is a dark, cramped, characterless cement box that has none of the character of the space upstairs. And, it is LOUD. SO loud that conversation was limited to the people immediately beside us (we had a party of 7), and even then it was extremely difficult. I cannot overstate how loud it was. The server was literally shouting to convey the specials, etc., and we still had a hard time hearing him.   Beyond the space, the service itself was unacceptable. I'm sure this had everything to do with our server specifically. He lacked basic skills in meeting the needs of our party. Five of us received our food; it took more than 10 minutes for the sixth member of the party to receive his plate, and the seventh member of our party never did receive his meal. We were able to get one order of drinks and had to practically wring a second order out of the server at the very end of the meal. He didn't check in on us to see how things were, to ensure our drinks were full, etc.  Just bad.  Don Pisto's needs to more effectively screen its servers -- and it needs to shut down that basement until they figure out how to mitigate the sound and approximate the environment upstairs.  Until then, why not serve the food out of a food truck? It's so delicious! We had hoped this would be a regular neighborhood spot for us.

gHEctn7SjnPDztr_KEaKvA.review_text: This review is long overdue!  I absolutely love this place, and there has not been one dish that I've ordered that hasn't made me happy. Here's the list below...  Chips & Guacamole,  Carne Asada, Carnitas (on the salty side), Tortilla soup, House-made Chorizo Mussels,  Hamburguesa,  and my personal favorite, Chile Verde Chicken Tostadas   In addition to great food, the staff is really friendly and the ambience is awesome. Don Pisto's is a very inconspicuous, no sign outside, only red lights over the entry way. Inside the restaurant has cool brick exposure, and wood furniture.   One of my favorite places. Take someone here immediately! They'll love you. ;-)

u9KyoDzSRlcLQY1kBrRlIA.review_text: bottomless. brunch. cocktails.   need i say more? for like $17 bucks, you could choose to get either a mimosa, sangria or margarita and find it magically replete throughout your meal. they even lets us choose any of the 3 for our refills, cause they're awesome. the food is alright, everything is around $10 bucks but the portions aren't that big. got the chorizo and poached eggs but found it a little too oily. my friend's mushroom and serrano chile omelette was better and more substantial. doesn't matter, though. the food still tasted GREAT by the end.

a7dPjzrWpB-KZrFNZ5HWNg.review_text: Hamburguesas marinated in bacon drippings. Whole lobsters, cooked in pork fat, drizzled with cilantro butter and wrapped in fresh tortillas. Poc choc (pork chops) grilled to perfection. Mussels steamed with spicy sausage. This is not your typical Mexican joint.    And yet, everything tastes fresh and delicious, as if it came straight from a seaside hacienda in Mexico. One where they make excellent, chilled margaritas (served in a pitcher, with salted glasses if you like).   To top it off, the staff are all muy simpatico, providing excellent service. Our drinks were always full, our vegetarians were aptly tended to, and our large group was encouraged to stay long after the plates had been cleared. Muchos gracias in particular to Christina Alarcon: when we told her we'd be celebrating a special occasion in the restaurant, she suggested a nearby bakery for dessert, and even picked up our cake for us! Muy excellente!

LUj0l-kLPO9OUdg1bahiww.review_text: I heart this place. First time was last week for my bday. Second time was tonight. I think I'm addicted.  Their chips are amazing, mussels and chorizo are to-die-for, hamburguese is out of this world. Everything here is unique and made with love.

fWtoDLus7FVfFkxHBkD1hw.review_text: Carne Asada tacos were amazing. Guacamole is really good, not too oniony. Perfect portions for lunch with 2 tacos and chips/guac.  The best part?! Bottomless mimosas for brunch! The service is fantastic, usually when you get all you can eat/drink, the service is super slow, not here! If my drink got low, our server was here to top it off without even asking. Great place overall.

FtVuSS1D0rdeMtr_nf2hrw.review_text: Excellent quick lunch. Al pastor tacos are awesome. If this place was in my neighborhood I'd be there often. Good salsa and chips as well.

5q0CF8yqgN2WH2B9My3cTA.review_text: On a cold hungover sunday...  ------$3 Sangria  ------delicious quacamole & the good tortilla chips (not the thin ones, these are actual    corn tortillas they fry:) ------tortilla soup ------grilled jalapenos & hot sauce when asked ------pleasant server ------nice dark warm feeling ambiance ------in my neighborhood.  :) go. now.

b6_gR3caZcaf3PIein5ktA.review_text: What a beautiful cure for the day after New Years Eve!   My girlies from Miami, my BFF Jess H., and I were desperately seeking last minute dinner reservations somewhere that my East Coast gals could actually get a taste of West Coast style Mexican...  My favorite Mission spots= too informal  Colibri= booked!  Orale, Orale= not quite in the mood.   Tommy's Tequila Bar= too far!  Don Pistos= JUST RIGHT!   I called ahead and was excited to hear there was only a 45 minute wait for a party of 6 so we rushed over and put our name in. Sadly we were greeted by no no sign on the door and a 2 hour wait and no space to drink at the bar, sigh. We had a flight to catch so the possibility of getting my gals something other than Mission burritos on the way to the airport was looking pretty dismal.   I went and explained my predicament to our hostess and ten minutes later we were summoned to our table. It was perfect. We headed to the basement/banquet style room that had more than enough seating. Yay!  We were greeted by our darling server Kate and amazing tortilla chips and salsa that tasted just like my Mom's. They were even served in the wooden bowls, just like at Mom's! Then we heard "bottomless margaritas and sangrias" and we were all in.  We ordered an assortment of tacos: carne asada, fish of the day, carnitas, and al pastor. The highlight was definitely the carne asada, it was a little dry but somehow managed to make me order a second round. I liked that the tacos were served street style: 2 small tortillas, onions, cilantro, pickled jalapenos and carrots, radishes, and limes.   The bottomless pitchers were flowing. At one point Pete the owner of the joint, came and professed his love to the ladies at the table and proceeded to give the men shoulder rubs. You get the picture, it was a great meal!  I'm not gonna lie to you folks, some places on mission have better tacos but this place is all about the entire package, the vibe. Good service, great ambiance, fabulous music, stiff booze, and yummy food.   Side Bar-I love the name, anyone who has been to Mexico should get a giggle out of picturing the real Don Pisto.

73sLVBp9WDLMUKsjA0J1uw.review_text: 5 mimosas under an hour and all I can say is that champagne is a sneaky bitch.   My friend suggested Don Pisto's for brunch on Saturday since I was in the city. Knowing they had bottomless mimosas for only $15 per person. It was 2:30 pm when we came in and we knew we only had an hour on the clock to essentially get the party started.  We sat down and we each ordered mimosas (with pineapple juice instead of orange juice) and both had our eye on the Chorizo & Poached Eggs (housemade country sausage, crema, and potatoes).   We started on our drinks while munching on the complimentary chips and salsa on the table. Honestly, before the food even came to the table, I think we knocked back two or three yummy mimosas on empty stomachs. When we did get food, I was ready to scarf it down. The potatoes tasted great with a little hot sauce and I loved how the chorizo was crispy. Once the poached egg was broken and running down everything else, I was in heaven. For only 10 bucks for the plate, I was more than pleased!  At the end of the meal, we had four mimosas under our belt. We were the last people to leave as we finished our meal. Our waitress came by and gave us our last refill, finishing off what was left of the pitcher. I felt like a lush as I stared at the drink filled to the rim. A fellow employee decided to urge me to finish up and I felt like I was at a frat party. I chugged it down as I proclaimed that I hated the employee, to which he told me he loved me ;)   Drunk before 4 pm? Gotta love great starts to epic Saturdays. Thanks, Don Pisto's. I'll be back next time to really enjoy your grub sans alcohol!

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: OMMITY NOM NOM NOMITY! Can't believe some peeps are giving Don Pisto's bad reviews, but then again, I did go for brunch for my pals birthday, and my friends paid for me and all took turns giving me massages.   Jay Kay! I paid for myself and it was a whopping *$49* for effing BRUNCH, and there were sadly no massages, but what can you do?  Anyway, my roomies and I arrived and the rest of our party was seated and in high spirits, working on their Bottomless Mimosas, Margaritas, or Sangrias (all $16 and ALL INTERCHANGABLE!). Two items had started to come out and thank goodness because we were ravenous.   It's family style brunch, which worked out well as some girls were hungrier than others. We had the Huevos Rancheros (which were my favorite), and it was a different variation of the dish which I appreciated. Small, fried corn tortillas made crispy, covered with pinto beans, beautiful sunny side up eggs, and Pico de Gallo.   We also had the Fish and Al Pastor Tacos (so good!) and the Brioche French Toast that came with a side of crispy, salty bacon. Their chips are amazingly thick and salty, served with a spicy green salsa and fresh guacamole. I had the Sagria and it was refreshing and light, but got the job done.   I knocked off a star because service was not up to par; we were constantly flagging down someone to refill a drink, bring water, plates, etc. - I know that makes us sound high-maintenance, but if someone had been paying attention, we wouldn't have had to ask for much. It was also pretty pricey for what it was. Either way, I'll be back with my Russian pals to show them the gem I found!

wruLzteKIsCvekKUZl2EPg.review_text: The tacos here are good, but overpriced...  But you're paying for the ambiance I guess.  Now, the pork chops, delicious!!!  Enough to share (or not).  I also came back a couple of times for the calamari which is excellent as well.  Definitely one of the few good restaurants in north beach.

QsWrDJ36vYXOTCiBJyV7YQ.review_text: This used to be my favorite place to eat in the city, but I am not sure what is going on with the ppl who run the restaurant. The food is great, but the service is absolutely horrible. They make you wait forever for a table and then seat a friend of the owner, the chef, or themselves before you (despite the fact that you have been waiting for over an hour). They will seat a group of three people so they can use half the table for another group (but this never happens and there are just three ppl sitting at a large table), but they will not seat a group of 5 people. Worst the hostess is not even apologetic for the long wait or giving your table away to a friend of the owner, chef, or themselves.

2hDkUWqn1E51p70FuMe4UQ.review_text: We had a great meal here. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. The tortilla soup was my favorite!  The only downfall was having to wait an hour and a half to get seated. The restaurant isn't extremely large so be prepared to wait. Luckily, the hostess will jot down your name and phone number and call you when your table is ready. (That way, you can walk around and grab a drink somewhere before!)

Fvkd_yglpHh8w27ILL1gQg.review_text: Great service and food. Server was vey nice. Salsa was great and fish tacos were amazing.

MtOqvo8YNyxEN7XQxbTQXA.review_text: Great place, great food! Love it! Have been many times. But Please change the music, it is like a late night dance club, does not fit and makes it difficult to talk or listen. Would definitely be a four or five if better and quieter music.

jisQEtwfrOKBmssWoiXljg.review_text: I came here for the hamburguesa on the 7x7 list. It was sooo delicious! If you are a burger/meat lover, you will totally love this dish! I don't know how they cook it, but it's soaked/marinated with bacon (anything with bacon just taste a little better, right?). Omg it was yum!! My boyfriend and I shared that dish, along with the fish-of-the-day snapper soft tacos. That was also pretty good - with a little kick if you like it spicy. While waiting for our table, we got the chips with oh so *fresh* guacamole. Thinking about it now is making me so hungry! If you're thinking about coming here, think no more, just come!

9bIKpt4MumCLVsDUT8u_PA.review_text: My husband and I have been going here for a few years, and WE LOVE IT. Every time we visit San Francisco we make a point to eat brunch here. The unique mimosas and high quality Mexican fare are fantastic, and if you go when it opens (10 or 11 am?) there is no wait. LOVE, love, love this place.

LkyT0hPUs_47mCtS4MQs3Q.review_text: This place tries to walk a fine line between fancy and casual. It's not "upscale mexican" like Mamacita, but it's definitely not just some taqueria...  All the food I had there was very good - guacamole was excellent. The drinks and chips were always refilled promptly, and we were able to split tortilla soup between four people. It was a stretch to split it that far, but i'd say 3 people could easily share the tortilla soup as an appetizer.  In fact, I'd say the only thing I take issue with is how the tacos are priced and portioned. For about $9, you get two tacos. And these are SMALL tacos. You can see in the pictures that they're not going to fill you up. In order to have a full meal there, you need to have an appetizer or two. But for $9, I find the tacos overpriced. I would have rather seen 3 tacos for $12. At 3 tacos, that would be enough food.  All in all, the food quality is good, but I'm only giving it four stars due to the awkward portioning / pricing.

CKaK4A5IET_69oHr4q2X7Q.review_text: Don Pistos is a hidden gem, by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city!! The staff is fantastic - they are all extremely friendly. The food is outstanding! By now, I have tried almost everything on the menu and while everything is excellent, the lobster, and poc chuc (pork chop), both of which I typically would not order, are real game changers.  The ambiance is great - comfortable and fun (can get a little noisy). They also have an awesome brunch, with bottomless drinks. Drink specials Sunday evenings. This is a fantastic restaurant for group dinners, birthdays, etc. They take reservations for parties of 6 or more, but otherwise no resos - so be prepared to wait if you go at a prime time!

pWX8636X1eG8seFwbEjqXA.review_text: Amazing Mexican place! It was a bit hard to find as a tourist because it didn't really have a sign outside but we were persistent and it paid off. Small place but the atmosphere is awesome. We ended up sitting at the bar and sharing drinks and food with the other patrons while chatting with the bartender who introduced us to all the kitchen staff and made recommendations. Everything we tried was phenomenal I will return next time I am in the area and I highly recommend anyone else to give it a try too.

HDlXlNwXjxvo026xRyDqgw.review_text: Still the best! And now I can say you need to try the Pollo Asado if you venture here. The chicken is prepared to perfection. And if you have to wait for a table, the bartender is cool as hell. As he knows well, I won't come to SF without at least once visiting Don Pistos!

0DqauCVXWR25yIHL_Eua7Q.review_text: Cant believe I hadnt been to Don Pistos earlier!  Came here for dinner a few months ago and had to wait about 20 min. for a table, which was perfect; we sat at the bar and had a margarita and just enjoyed watching the kitchen (open kitchen right when you walk in).  Their menu is somewhat small, which I love and the food is absolutely delicious.   Come here for brunch too!  Their huevos rancheros are a perfect size (two small fried corn tortillas with beans, pico de gallo, eggs, etc.) and you leave not feeling greasy and overly full.

Em6AV2DXQMrQk0wCio6Yfw.review_text: I went to Don Pisto's on a Sunday morning at 10:30am. Still quite open (though right before Christmas, so that could be why), I had several tasty items. The salsa verde and tortilla chips were very yummy and the guacamole was fresh and simple.  I had the Heuvos Rancheros for brunch and asked for the sunny side up eggs to be made over medium (not a fan of runny whites). It was two eggs on top of a crunchy road tortilla and I liked the twist. The taste was simple and good, but enhanced with a little salsa verde and hot sauce on top. The breakfast potatoes are crispy and delicious. My friend had the Poached Eggs and Chorizo and the bite I was allowed was much more flavorful than my dish.  For a drink I enjoyed a Bloody Mary, which was spicy and salty and awesome.  Definitely give this place a try for brunch!  The price point is perfectly reasonable, the service was friendly, the restaurant clean and overall it was a worthwhile experience.

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: Don Pistos, that really popular brick laid restaurant with no name outside indicating that they are, in fact, Don Pistos. Haha. I walk by this place on my way home all the time and it is always busy! I finally came here on a Tuesday night when they were quite busy at 10p.m. My sister and I got seated promptly and ordered mussels, steak tacos, fish tacos and sangria. Everything was delicious! The mussels also came with chorizo and garlic bread. It was so yummy. As a bread fanatic I especially enjoyed the bread. But my favorite of the night was the fish taco. So yummy and flavorful and surprisingly it had a nice crunch to it. I will definitely come back to try the other wonderful lookin stuff they have to offer!

li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
li0Hwxz08hpK81Z7eH1YvA.review_text: What's not to like? LOVE this place and live right near by now so will be frequenting often. Bring on the margarita pitchers & guac!

8ExCZVowOo3LK2QG6G8Xmg.review_text: Thought this would be the perfect place to bring my sister when she was in town visiting. I made a reservation for 6 (they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more). One friend couldn't make it and the other was running a bit late. When we had checked in, and let our hostess know that it would only be a party of 5, she was extremely rude, had an air of annoyance, and frankly was a B****.  When we were seated, our waitress was also very annoying. She came across as overly confident, a bit aggressive,  (to the point of coming across as a know-it-all rather than a helpful server) and kept calling us all 'hun' (sorry but females should know that no other female appreciates being called hun by women their own age). Definitely rubbed me the wrong way.   The table for 6 was so big and the place so loud that we could barely hear each other speak.   The main reason I wanted to come here was for the food -- however, several of the options that I had enjoyed the most were no longer on the menu. When I asked our waitress why, she said because it wasn't in season -- the items I had specifically asked about were the sliders and the corn. How is beef not in season?   The girls at the table (my sisters and I) also noted that our waitress wore a low cut tank to flash around her cleavage (Sorry but this isn't pleasant for female patrons).  When the bill came, I insisted that we not give a good tip as it would be the most appropriate way to let her know that the service was not good, and the entire dining experience very annoying ... but everyone ended up tipping 20% despite my protests.  Overall, it was a HORRIBLE experience and I would never come back. Not only would I not recommend it, but I would advise against it. It could potentially ruin your night, especially since SF is filled with tons of great eateries staffed with less pretentious females.

cbehkbJXi_sauQbjco9iaw.review_text: I love the atmosphere here. The food is really good and just a solid neighborhood spot. The owners are great and know what they are doing.  I could eat their chips all night long.

VjRBWso0SbN2C0MgO8ezwg.review_text: I am so glad a friend recommended Don Pistos for dinner -- it's delicious, fresh, inventive, and the kind of Mexican food that's impossible not to love.    The sangria was good, but skip it and head straight for the margaritas, which are perfectly-sized to enjoy two rounds... although, really, you might as well have 3 or more. The guacamole is excellent. The entrees are fantastic (I tried the shrimp tacos and loved every little shrimpy piece... but we were all sorely tempted by the bacon marinated hamburger on the menu).  I would recommend getting a seat upstairs so you can enjoy the windows. Also, the place is unmarked from the street -- so yes, that is Don Pistos on the left as you walk up Union.

YeBKOlqYD8xWk5YMnRIiFA.review_text: After I found it ( no street sign) it was definitely worth the hunt. Food was excellent for both of us and I am a Mexican food snob. Try the fish tacos and pork chops. Nice but small bar

v-0CBt05fnYIg3IUAdOpGw.review_text: Second time around and it's just as good as I remembered. Some may think, "What is all the hype about? It's just Mexican food." True but there is just so much more to it than that.   On weekends this place is nearly impossible. Unless you want to stop off around the corner to Tony's and grab a slice while you wait 90 minutes for a table (which I highly suggest!! but thats another review)...but on weekdays come around 6 pm and you'll be able to nab a table.   Why should you come here? For 2 dishes - the pork chop (marinated to perfection) and the chorizo and muscles (holy moly good). All the other stuff is just as good but the above mentioned is "knock your socks off" good. You'll thank me later....

jkr3YVCEoRNKkxinUZpW6A.review_text: There are only a handful of restaurants where I tend to be a regular at, and Don Pistos is definitely on the shortlist.   The food here is awesome. And I mean that not in a "well...it's pretty good for North Beach" kind of way, but in an "I know we just ate here last night, but tonight would be great too!" kind of way. If this was a Mexican restaurant in the Mission, it'd still be just as delicious.  I'm addicted to the salsa verde that comes with the tortilla chips. Love it, could make a meal out it, but then I'd miss out on everything else. Their fish tacos are consistently wonderful (actually spicy without even having to ask!), and tortilla soup very good too. The only thing I keep missing out on is the lobster or whole grilled fish specials, both of which I do want to try someday.   On my very first visit, our server forgot about us...but this was completely made up for with a round of sangria on the house and a plate of churros for dessert. Loved the wacky idea to serve breakfast all day on New Year's Day-- and the food was delicious too, especially the breakfast burritos.   One caveat, on my last visit, everything we had was just a bit too salty...I'm really hoping this was just a one-off.  We'll see.

isbS14dZgmbpTJuXeXmfPQ.review_text: I'm a total idiot for filling up on the chips! I had to wait 10-15 minutes for my friend to show up so by the time she got there I'd eaten the entire basket. This was a rookie move. I couldn't finish my plate which rarely happens. I recommend the chicken tostadas and carne asada tacos. Plenty of other good stuff on the menu I'm excited to try on a return visit.  Thursday night I showed up at 9 and was seated immediately at the long table up front that was split up into a few parties of 2 and 4. Service was friendly.

ADaFN4i2layZbwWsJmKSdA.review_text: Everything about this place is great, especially the food. Reasonably priced for amazing flavorful Mexican food in manageable portions. The only reason this isn't a 5 star rating is because of the hour minimum wait on any given night of the week, coupled with the fact they only take reservations for parties of six or more. Go for brunch and get the omelet or for dinner and get fish tacos.

bNXCmEFhUGW4AD2GFdod8A.review_text: This place is a great secret spot. There's no sign above the door, but the food, drinks and atmosphere create a reputation where no sign is needed. It's a great spot to meet and catch up with friends. It was a bit loud, but what can you expect from a place that brings so many people together.

tbizy4X3Pna4edEPuwfPiA.review_text: I admit, I gave this restaurant a 4 star review 4 years ago, but since then, things have gone wayyyyyyyyyyyyy downhill.  I'm not sure what other people are talking about, but the food is mediocre at best.  We have lunch catered from them about once a month and the tortillas are always too greasy, the meat (beef, pork and chicken ) all bland tasting, the chips over salted, and the beans under cooked--overall unpalatable.  Not to mention the last time we catered, a number of us felt sick the next day.  Stomach issues everywhere!...scary, no?!  We will certainly not be ordering from this or any other of this guy's restaurants again (i.e. Pisto's Tacos, Chubby Noodle, etc.).  Who likes spending a weekend hovering over a toilet?  My guess is that they don't care about the quality of their food any more and that they are only trying to cater to the people who come to drink at their establishment.  Don Pisto's has morphed into a nightclub that has no regard for their neighbors  rather than a restaurant that takes pride in the food that they're serving.  It's so sad when a restaurant has gotten so popular they don't feel the need to keep the quality of their food up because they just expect people to keep coming.

8DPJRWmZUiquYjNf7d60PA.review_text: Solid, solid spot.  Got a recommendation from a few friends to try Don Pisto's when the SO and I were in SF so we did - and so glad we did.  First, huge props for the music: Naughty by Nature, Snoop, Warren G., etc. - not for everyone, but I definitely enjoyed it.  It's a small, loud place, but the food is great, prices are pretty reasonable and it can be a quick in and out spot if you want it to be or you can relax for a while.  We had the Pork Tacos and Tuna Tacos, we weren't extremely hungry and had a red-eye out of SF so wanted to have just enough to put us to sleep.  Two tacos to each dish, they're small tacos, but those dishes coupled with the chips/salsa were perfect.  My only complaint harkens back to the music, but more about the patrons, the young, obnoxious, I'm killing it in SF folks who think it's fine to get bombed and have a table of 8 start loudly singing Gangsta's Paradise was just super annoying for our table and pretty much everyone else.

LwqpH0H8v0KUzczxo3fkqQ.review_text: Dollar for dollar, Don Pisto's is the best restaurant in the city.  D.P.'s is like one of those upscale NYC Mexican restaurants but better and 1/2 the price.  Fun, lively brunch spot, the best chips and salsa around (thanks for hooking me up with the salsa recipe!) and usually blasting some good old school rap to boot.  No vegetarian options listed for dinner but don't be fooled.  For a measly $7-$8, they will prepare a massive vegetarian platter - beans, rice, guacamole and cheese with fresh tortillas to make your own tacos.  It doesn't sound like anything special but it is.  Trust me.    Side note:  It used to be a great place to have a party but they've jacked the prices up on groups.

wxTeRyO8inyneN5kYCposw.review_text: It's four-star good.  The food is good, the service is good, the menu is a tad limited,  and nothing is exactly "outstanding" or "stunning"; which is just fine.  Good, reliable, consistent, tasty. I live nearby, so it's totally worth it. Would I go more than a mile out of my way to go here? Not really.

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a Don Pisto hamburger today.  The food is good and definitely shareable. You get free chips and salsa for the table (booya) and the taco plates come in numbers. I recommend the hamburguesa, which is apparently marinated in bacon and onions, whatever that means. After the first bite you will realize that it's actually marinated in heaven juice.  The drinks are okay but reasonably priced. They have pitchers, enough said.  My only qualm is that the kitchen is basically within the same room as the dining area, so it gets uncomfortably hot and steamy while you feast.  Other than that, it's a great spot with a lot of energy. Check it out but be prepared to wait to be seated.

m2xC5oWJYhbk7U4TLbm5zQ.review_text: I love don pisto's!! I go there all the time. Great service! My favorite are the tacos al pastor! And it opens til late which is great! The only thing is that is so hard to find parking around the area, and it can take me a long time but it all worth it ;)

GZ1gYeGuNwZHn6MKrQFf6g.review_text: The Hambuerguesa Torta is overwhelmingly phenomenal. And so simple. I had heard such good things that, as I waited for my food, I started suspecting I would inevitably be disappointed. But I was not, friend. Not even close.

ANIHEYbREdtMo84FsDm7MA.review_text: Sat at the best table in the house last night and had a wonderful dinner.  Great atmosphere, amazing chips guac and tacos.  Daniel, the host, is super friendly and accommodating.  Thanks Pistos! YUM!

wLePt38a-51-UCPDRWZFTQ.review_text: Yep, 5 star!  The quality and flavor of everything I tasted was perfect.  You need to try this to get an idea of authentic Northern Baja mexican food.  We had some tasty sangria.  Grilled Calamari, and when that dish arrived and i learned over to smell what was going on, I knew I had arrived.  Delicious shrimp tacos and an awesome hamburger!  The food was perfect.  The scene is casual and packed.  Service excellent and friendly, from everyone.  It's in North Beach which means parking crisis, so plan accordingly.  Also with it's popularity minimum 30 minute wait, but they'll take your number and you can stroll the neighborhood while you wait.  You gotta try it!

QYSGtd0lKNg9DXHp3BJDBQ.review_text: Short Story:   A good place for food and drinks.  A bit pricey though!  Long Story: I came here on a Saturday night with 5 other friends to catch up and eat great food!  We made a reservation for 6:30PM and we were promptly seated.  The ambiance there was a feel of being part of the "in crowd" as the place with popping with people and great music.  It felt as if you were at a club but instead of dancing you were sitting down and eating.  The menu was really short, half small plates (tapas) and the other half entrees.  All in all, about 10 dishes.  The menu is a bit tricky as some of the entrees are really small and some of the tapas are quite large.  So, portion sizes doesn't match what you generally think.  It would be helpful to have pictures.  We ordered the salmon tacos, pork chops, yellowtail, and others.  These three dishes were phenomenal and I would highly recommend getting them.  The other dishes we got were only okay.  The pork was tender and cooked to perfection.  The yellowtail was fresh!  Verdict: I would go back again!  Now that I know what the portions are :)

U5XEKqRfb0fUZ_BYVqEeNA.review_text: Everything we ordered was amazing! I wish they had a location closer to home. Don Pistos is a must if you are in the city. The staff and service are wonderful and you leave feeling like you were served by family.

geVD8OCq9xgZOq-BCl5XXw.review_text: I went here for a birthday dinner, and it was one to remember. The wait was an hour, but luckily there are tons of watering holes nearby. DP's has a business relationship with a bar down the corner, Amante. You can get a few good appetizers there (from the DP chef) or you can go to Columbus cafe next door for some great happy hour deals. At DPs I got the LOBSTER, and boy it was amazing. They dont have a full liquor licence, but the margaritas are some of the best I've ever had and I have been to Mexico. I got like 4 of them that night. The ceviche was also great as so were the fish tacos. I really like the interior and the atmosphere, and the service was friendly. Its a crowded place, so skip it if you are one of those personal bubble people.

J-W8lby5Ly_dlW06VbuAuQ.review_text: I have been going to Don Pisto's since it opened in December of 2009.  The food has always been excellent and affordable.  I recently went for my first brunch there and was just as pleased with the meal.  The Chorizo and Eggs were just the right amount of spicy and the eggs were poached perfectly.  However, no meal can be complete at Don Pisto's without the hamburguesa.  I love hamburgers, probably my favorite food.  But, this may be my favorite one.  It doesnt have a ton of bells and whistles, just meat, guacamole and bun.  But, it is AMAZING.  Its always cooked perfectly and with exceptional flavor. I even had one along side my chorizo and eggs.  I also really like the tacos, especially the al pastor and carnitas.  And the Mexican sashimi with a little serrano for some heat. And the chips and salsa, of course.  The service has always been good.  I like that they explain their style to new comers, so everyone knows what to expect.  The only downside is there can be a long wait sometimes, but its well worth it.

ZXdxAb-wqcNzSwUZMPq7xg.review_text: Best Mexican Food I have had north of the border.  Excellent Margaritas, taste like fresh squeezed..sans the sweet and sour, which makes it perfect for me.. Great guac & chips, not that you need anything more than their super tasty complimentary green salsa to go along with their homemade chips.  Amazing Guacamole Hamburger/torta.  Truly surprised, we came here with locals and they recommended the Hamburgers...I wouldn't have ordered it otherwise.  Makes for a great appetizer too, if you ask for it to be cut in fours.  We devoured them.  We were a large party of 10 so we tried a lot of what was on the menu.  Their Shrimp, Fish, Chicken and Steak tacos are good, but the Pork and Pineapple combo (aka el pastor) is amazing...and I don't like sweet...this isn't sweet, it is perfect. Can't wait to go back next time we are up in San Fran.

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: Great place for small or large groups.  Wish they were able to offer more than just beer and wine, I can survive on sangria.  The soups, tortas, tacos, ceviches are really good and surprisingly they have one of hte best burgers in the city, ground bacon in the burger, topped with guacamole on a fluffy bun.  Yum!

csAts8AgPHLLjr81FVWcfg.review_text: This is a go to spot for my girls and I because of the unlimited margaritas/sangria.   SERVICE: although its always like a 20-30 minute wait...I think its worth it. The host guy was too funny and really perky. Obviously he enjoys working there. He told us to grab a drink at the bar while we wait and he found us right away to seat us right away.Our waitress and bus boys were very prompt. They refilled the water and our chips and salsa right away. I didn't feel like I was hounded with "Is everything okay" every 5 mins. Thank you for that. Our waitress even had a little humor to her.   FOOD/BEVERAGE: Tried their agave shots. I'm not a fan of shots but this was easy to take. Very smooth. Very sweet. I felt like I was taking a shot of tea to be honest. Next came the meal: Carne Asada tacos. Meat is perfectly tender. A lil bit of spice. Complimented with a dash of onion and cilantro. These tacos were very juicy and tasteful. To wash it down, my friend and I ordered their sangria. It was okay. I think it needs to be a little bit sweeter or stronger.   PRICING: price is reasonable. Drinks and Food for two came out to be like $45 overall.   OVERALL: definitely will come back again and bring more of my friends. Although, to those with cars...parking is scarce. Bus it. Cab it. Walk it. Unless you do not mind paying the garage fees. Or if you're like me...pretend your car does "fit" in that spot....haha lol

MHpn5NUAqb93SVXdXxZ-Rw.review_text: Fancy Mexican goodness. The guac is great, the El Pastor taco is killer. The place is tiny so get here early or make a reservation. The staff was friendly, but gave us a dirty look when we asked if we could push two tables together. This is the best Mexican you can get in North Beach.

QHZY3xne6Jyk4Qp-I0GCJQ.review_text: Hard to find but easy to LOVE. Went here for the first time for a company dinner, and I was finally able to find it again (it's seriously a challenge).  Tacos are delicious, guac is to die for, civiche is...sorry I'm drooling.  Definitely a must-eat North Beach restaurant!

dSpNF7tK5jsv-PBKG1hE9g.review_text: Bottomless mimosas, margaritas, and sangria on the weekends.  The chips and green salsa would have been enough for me, I couldn't stop eating them!  The guac is MAYBE the best I've ever had, and the food followed suit. The service was a little choppy, but I was really impressed by how often my 'bottomless' drink was refilled.  It truly felt as if it was bottomless, I never went to drink and didn't have more in my glass.  It is ALWAYS packed. I suggest going at 1050am on the weekends and getting in as it opens at 11am.  I've tried to go at night and never waited the hour or so.

ZYkuMw1oFna5OQ_NxyOJNA.review_text: We had just finished a trip to Alcatraz, and were wondering where we could eat without getting sucked into a tourist trap.   Not that I have anything against that sort of thing.   Mr C did a Google map search while I opened yelp, and at almost the same time we landed on Don Pistorius. I am always in the mood for excellent Mexican food, so we pointed in that general direction.   Mr C let me out so he could find a parking space and I could grab a table. While I waited I had great chips and green Chile salsa.   And then guacamole.   Eventually he showed up.   We shared carnitas tacos, fish tacos, rice and beans, and it was everything I imagined and more.   Service was good, and friendly, and the food was to die for. (If you like that sort of thing. )  I can't wait to go back!

uElAyOGEwP0I3Bv6EsQPWw.review_text: We had a group of 10 & whenever you have a larger group you are concerned about service.  But not here!  The service was amazing, very attentive & informative.  We all LOVED the food, it was amazing, I think we shared nearly every item on the menu.  The tamale's were fantastic, the best i have ever had.  The portions were perfect for tasting lots of yummy food.  The drinks were great, my personal favorite was the red sangria, delish!  Would highly recommend this restaurant, we are definitely going back again.  It is a little noisy, but it did not detract from a fabulous evening.  Thank you to everyone who works there, we had a great time & thank for making us all feel so welcome!  Wow, we were all impressed, fabulous service & delicious food, what  great combo!!!

sA01SpCGxb5FML62w8rSng.review_text: Let me start off by saying that I am not really into Mexican cuisine. I don't typically mind it, but I rarely find myself craving it and never seek out restaurants on my own. This restaurant has changed all that...   A co-worker recommended it, saying it was his favorite restaurant in the city -  which is quite the claim! I decided to try it out one night while not feeling in the mode for anything specifically. Now I feel like an addict, eagerly inviting any & all friends just to have an excuse to go back to Don's more often!  Food Highlights: - Mexican sushi - Mussels - Shrimp tacos  Prices are what one should expect for the city and offer a bit of a flexibility. On a more lavish night you can share entrees, or if you're feeling like a cheaper bite you can easily fill up on tacos (and chips & salsa!).  The wait can be a bit long - typically around dinner the waits are 45+ minutes, but they'll take down your phone # so you can take a leisurely stroll in Washington Square park or go get a drink at one of the dozens of nearby bars.  Lastly, the seating is optimized for larger groups with a few big family-style tables and mostly four-tops. This means big groups come in and it GETS LOUD! If you're in a twosome / on a date, you may be seated at a family-style table with another twosome or small group - by no means a bad thing but  can make it a bit difficult to hear your conversation over all the chatter.

Q5eaqiu7PgIwBgrRHALIBA.review_text: This place is awesome! A taste of Mexico with a modern twist! Service was excellent. We had to wait a bit for the Possole, but it was worth wait! I definitely recommend Don Pistos if you're looking for something a little different give a shot! You have to try their Tuna Tacos and Green Chile Verde Posole!

3CQOj4EeDR7HRnLVPsQhBg.review_text: This is a solid restaurant, with tasty food, good drinks and fun music. It's a great spot for a weeknight pick me up dinner with some friends.   The menu gets switched up every so often, but they've consistently had great tacos. I'm not sure if they still have the pork chop, but it was absolutely delicious.  Just a heads up, the wait can be very long. Because we live in the neighborhood, on busy nights, we call to see how long the wait is, go and put our name down about 30-45 minutes before we want to eat, and then go back home to wait it out.

legEZzXG28Hy0ikwMnOLzQ.review_text: Not your ordinary taco joint.   It's understated (is their name anywhere on the outside of the place?), a bit rustic inside, but comfortable and classy.   Excellent service, very interesting menu and fairly priced. It can get quite crowded and loud, but we enjoyed a quiet meal nestling ourselves in after much of the lunch crowd had departed.

hjuV6w6AzKTaD1SzT72xSQ.review_text: Caro S. seriously is the best SF tour guide... And I live here!  We were trying to find a dinner spot for my FLL gals last night in town- New Years Day. When we called Don Pisto's we were told the wait would be about one hour, so we rushed down there. When we went in to put our names down, we were told the wait had changed to two hours. Devestated, we were asked to wait while the restaurant tried to see how they could accomodate our party of 6. We were seated in about 15 min. Wow!!   Since it was New Years, there were bottomless margaritas and sangrias. Most of us went with Taco's: Steak, Fish, Carnitas. $9 for two.   Our server was knowledgable, the owner walked around greeting and chatting with everyone, and the music was AWESOME!

P9D0oyIduE2g8LpgsrfgZw.review_text: I think it's hard to do fancy versions of Mexican street food like fish tacos.   But this place does it really well.   The interior of the restaurant is "quaint". Very plain, simple  wooden tables and chairs. The dining area has brick walls which I think makes a restaurant much louder and is about the size of a large family den, so basically the size of every single restaurant in the city. Be prepared with snacks so you avoid getting hangry before you are seated.  I have to mention that the tables also sport  glass Fanta bottles turned salt shakers.  THAT IS HOW WE DO IT IN MEXICO, CABRONES.  Here's what we got: -Tacos de pescado ($10) -Tacos de camaron ($11) -Chips and guac ($6) -Sangria ($7)  The tacos were both delicious. The tortilla was smeared with what I think is roasted arbol chile; each bite was heavenly! The flavors of fish, corn and spice were perfectly balanced in every bite!  Chips and guac: this is what chips and guac are supposed to be! Just PERFECT.   I like that the sangria was slighly carbonated and not too fruity. Highly recommended. I also saw Corona Familiar at other tables which is a 40oz bottle of Corona, but not the watery Coronas you are used to, my friends. This is a heartier, better version of the Corona we all know and love.   Don't ask me how or why, just enjoy it.

SXsdbHpZ0TIqR_hhTmBWxw.review_text: Hard to find, as there is no sign, but very good.  I had the carnitas torta and my wife had an Asada taco.  Good chips and green salsa.

t7fwH4BedLMVDpC2pR3vIA.review_text: I genuinely don't think your life is complete until you have their mussels in a chorizo broth.

JcC4oyByYbZCJq5Ybvg6SQ.review_text: Bit of a wait around dinner time especially 7, you would probably have to leave your phone number and hit a bar for 30-45 minutes before you have a seat, but the wait is worth it. I love the mussels and chorizo, grilled calamari and their pork chop! They hit the spot everytime I can't wait to come back

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: Tried the lobster ... this dish, they say, is good for two.  Wish though that given it is marketed towards two, they'd give you an even number of tortillas.  Was a good serving though and we were sated.  We also had the salmon sashimi - yum!  Will be back...fun spot to drop by after work.  Attire is casual, we easily got seats at 6:15 and by the time we finished there were about 3 couples standing outside waiting for a table the place had filled up nicely, even the bar area. Service was great, not too overbearing yet very available anytime we needed anything they just happened to come by to ask.

Gv-oXYXl1Lo6VQW1ziJgcA.review_text: Chips and guac here are definitely on point. The best I have had in the city yet, and I am a self described guacamole maniac.  The tacos were also delicious. I had the snapper tacos which was the fish of the day and it was really good. I tried the carne asada which was really spicy (a huge plus in my book) but maybe a little too salted.  The atmosphere is really cool too. It's a darkly lit brick interior and on the loud side but it somehow oozes class at the same time.  It's a little on the pricey side for how small the tacos are but you can always get back at them by eating a ton of the free chips and salsa.

ejoHof0oy5Lpv1-wi0RGOA.review_text: I had my first ever Michelada here and now I try and order it everywhere I go but no one makes it like Don Pisto's, best ever! The chips and guac were also excellent. The steak tacos not so great the shrimp was waaaayyyyy better.

vNoDfdIZj7R45HZ8kVvH3A.review_text: Drove to the city for lunch just to try this place. Our friends told us this was a hidden gem in the city but it turns out, it was packed! We grabbed seats at the bar so we didn't wait long. Fresh fried chips and green salsa, yummy. Great service from the bartender, he gave us a little history on the place, the chef, the family. Fun to have a little insight. We ordered the tacos Fish & Shrimp. Loved them both, the fish more-so. The atmosphere was perfect for a Sunday getaway to SF, little brick building, cozy & loud. Very happy we took the trip down.   We will be back to try the dinner menu soon!

_dKFcQEIOkJNzk74BPKBhA.review_text: Don Pisto's has great tequila drinks and food (really yummy guac) and a very fun vibe. There's a big room downstairs for private parties. Although the menu is somewhat small, I've heard great things about many things on the menu. I chose to go with the Mary's chicken entree which was delicious - and comes with all the necessary ingredients to make your own chicken tacos. Word to the wise though: do not under any circumstance attempt to eat the green onion. For whatever reason even after I couldn't cut it with my knife I decided to add a stalk to my taco... bad decision. Did I think my teeth were razorblades? Not sure. But I couldn't bite through it and what resulted was probably the most horrendous eating experience I've ever had on a date. Whoops.

PhVeWdWp-DIpBe0p7hW1Rg.review_text: This place is over priced! The flavors on the meat and seafood was good but the portion was way too small for the priced. Each order of taco comes with 2 tacos with no sides not anything else with it.  The tacos size is equivalent to street tacos at a taqueria. They make their own tortillas but it was soaked in oil/butter.  The tortillas were very greasy. It is a cute place but the musician too loud. It's hard to have a conversation here without screaming at each other. The staff are nice and prompt.

AsSn6xVwHLCRJcTKOLw5EA.review_text: Now, I don't normally like Mexican food, but Don Pisto's was quite a pleasant surprise. However, I don't think it's really Mexican food like what I imagined (taquerias). I mean, they have a burger and it's a damn good one, too. Really good. I tried 3 different tacos and they were all good, especially the fish one. Sangria was light and refreshing. The mussels were spot on as well, especially when you sop up the juices with bread. My sis-in-law said everything she's had there has been good and she was right.   The waitress was really nice and checked up on us from time to time. The chef didn't like that I wanted the burger w/o avocado (allergic), but he/she did it anyway. However, I was warned that it wouldn't happen next time. So, basically either I don't order it at all or scrape the avocado off and risk a swollen throat. I thought that was kind of mean, but I guess I can understand the chef not wanting to do any special orders. Iono...

zDwfnynIvw_ihizSBjOjdg.review_text: Really hard to find but glad we did. Had our 6 year old with us. Didn't know there was no kid menu. Great staff made up a quesadilla for him. He said he would come back every day if he could. I had the tamales and husband had the Al Pastor tacos. Fabulous all around!!

mIX8_6m5Yj5LHgvDKxgL6g.review_text: 14.10.11           First Visit  Food ---------------------------- 4 Stars Noise --------------------------- Too Loud Temp --------------------------- Low ceiling,                                                 hot on hot day even                                                     when windows open  All the dishes had nice strong marinade and/or nice thick glaze  Chips and salsa      Personal taste ... too thick      not too watery salsa  Diablo Prawns       wild mexican prawns,        spicy diabla sauce       presented on 3 skewers crossed over            nice presentation       Wild Monterey Calamari        charcoal grilled,        orange,        lime,        radish salad  Tacos - Al Pastor       grilled pork rib chop,        charred pineapple,        avocado salsa  Tamale       pork       very tasty (I have yet taste a bad tamale)       good sauce  Good solid bold taste ... just a bit loud

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: Had a really fun birthday brunch at Don Pisto's! I had the breakfast burrito, which was good, but a little on the small side and would have loved if it came with a side or two.  Same goes with the dishes my friends tried, everything was tasty but very simple. I'm not mad about it because the prices are more than reasonable.
