(However we did exit Don Pisto's and walk straight to Golden Boy Pizza :) )   I was glad my friend ordered the burger, which is on the7x7 list, for a good reason! The bottomless mimosa/margarita/sangria situation makes me smile.    Aside from the food, I loved that the waitress did not once rush us.  Our group of 10 was *really* enjoying the bottomless bevs and occupied a larger table for a few hours on a crowded Saturday morning. She even brought my boyfriend and I (both the birthday guests) treats.   Can't wait to try for dinner, I expect more of the same greatness!

xtAOe7CqCrfNZpcC83sZTw.review_text: My wife and I have been here several times.  It is the best value restaurant in San Francisco hands down.  The taco's are all phenomenal -- the best thing however is the pork chop (it is huge so plan to share). The atmosphere is also very cool,  old brick style building.  The service is what makes us want to go back so often.  Everyone is so nice, and so accommodating.  If I had to say one negative thing about this place it is that they don't take reservations, and it has become very popular, so you either have to go early or plan to wait.  We normally go early, however if you can't it actually is worth the wait.

7QgJHvGSCndSf-zOsAHf3A.review_text: I went here for brunch recently and it was great! I love that you get choices for bottomless drinks though I opted to stick with just mimosas. The waitresses were attentive with their refills as well. I had the chorizo and poached eggs dish and it was absolutely delicious - not too rich or heavy, especially since I always want to leave room for drinks when doing a bottomless brunch! Very happy with my experience here.

lCkqOtZZ_Sz_WKThOjakMQ.review_text: I absolutely adored this place.  I loved the coziness, trendiness, location, music and the vibe of the restaurant overall.  We ordered the pitcher of sangria, and shared three plates which was more than enough food for two, especially if you're munching on the chips in between!  The place reminds me of a mexican version of suppenkuche if that can be said? Just as busy and even has a fun little bar to grab a drink while you wait for your table.   Definitely worth checking out.  Only thing that scares me are the reviews mentioning the health dept is investigating?! gross :(

zW9Z278npO2i_phglHX18g.review_text: The last place most people would think of eating at in North Beach is a Mexican place.  I love Mexican food and dislike run of the mill places so I tend to be pretty hard to please. Since I've found out about this place been here twice when I was in the city so I guess I'm a fan.   In all I've had:  Chips & guac - Great chips - really great chips, on the thick side & salted properly.  The guac rocks too.  Just the right amount of salt and citric - makes all the difference.      Puerto Nuevo Lobster  I've actually been to Puerto Nuevo and had lobster before so I knew what to expect.  (This is a science project so if you're not a lobster person you may not dig the inner workings of the bug) - verdict - ROCKS! hands & face covered with the bug and the sides!  The dish really feeds two and with the sides its plenty of food for two people  Al Pastor tacos Like others have commented these are small tacos and two of them come with the order.   It takes a gentle touch to get pineapple into a savory dish and not overwhelm it.  Don Pisto's gets it right.  These tacos are two pieces of heaven!  Wanted to re-order another but with the chips & guac I was stuffed.  Interior wise, very laid back  pretty loud.  Latin music playing and its a partial open kitchen.  I'm sure there is lines at prime time but both times I've been there around 5-6ish we never had to wait.

Y7n2qqtFxewKcyli7YohKg.review_text: Man these overpriced tacos. Looks as small as el tonayese tacos but 3 times the price and don't taste as good. Seriously mediocre street tacos for $9 and up. On the street good tacos are $1.50 or less.

wrhOaPospStRs5q15ot4bA.review_text: This is really one of my favorite Mexican restaurants and judging by the other 5 star reviews everyone else agrees (which they should, because I'm right).  The margaritas are reliably alcoholic, the sangria is excellent. Everything else I've had here is off-the-charts good - ceviche, street-food-sized tacos - I esp like the fish ones, like scallops that they sometimes have. Even the guacamole tastes fresher, more flavorful and less mashed than what you get elsewhere.  Coming from Seattle it's basically impossible to find any Mexican food that's this good.  Note: They'll take reservations if your party is 6 or more, although that almost always means you get seated down in the dungeon (er, basement). Still delicious food, even if you do feel like you're well underground. Also it's in Little Italy, which I find an odd choice location wise, but it's worth the trip.  Go now, but be prepared to wait.

5PMiSCo8nXgf6VB1meCIGQ.review_text: What an awesome spot for brunch!  Good breakfast burrito ($9), awesome complimentary chips and salsa, a refreshing beer and a fun little shot = perfect Sunday meal.  Cool staff and a great vibe.  Be patient with the timing of your food and you'll be good to go.

CqLjup8l-5ZEgfxCPxY_Jw.review_text: Great food! Always fresh! Our favorite spot to stop when were in San Francisco! Chips are fresh made so is salsa and guacamole. I actually have brought left over chips home and ate them the next day and they were still wonderful! I love the tortilla soup and tacos, all of the kids are WONDERFUL!! Order everything/anything! In fact I think prob everything is fresh and made IN-HOUSE!! Its darker ambiance and there's music its kinda loud, but I like that! I'm really not to excited about the restaurants you can hear a pin drop in!! I really enjoy coming in during the very late evening like 10 or 11:30! Don't miss this gem its definitely tucked away Just look for the glowing red lights out front! A local hot spot!

HIVTNbYsC5krnlI8aCu5TQ.review_text: Excellent food - came in with three other people and ordered everything tapas style, which works perfectly for this place.   Everything we had was good - the house salsa was great, guacamole (solid, but didn't blow me away), spicy tuna tacos (not that spicy), diabla prawns (drool worthy), fish tacos (fish was only so-so), pollo asado (great flavor, though the chicken was on the fatty side), carnitas (perfect). We had a couple other items, though I can't remember what they were - everything was good, and we left stuffed, happy and slightly buzzed from the margarita pitchers.   Not extremely expensive by SF standards - $50/person or so.   I will definitely be back, next time to try their brunch, which I hear is awesome.

wsrh4A3qkQYy7PvB3cuE8A.review_text: Dined w a party of 10. No one was overly impressed. I personally expected much more from the Yelp ratings reviewed prior to choosing the restaurant. Margs were good, didn't love any of the taco selections (tried them all) and the menu is definitely small for more "picky" types I wouldn't recommend. Not to mention, the chef Willie "no substitutions or changes to menu items" as told by our semi friendly waitress. I wouldn't revisit.

176KIDWfALoQRtRlKEJBFA.review_text: I'm updating my review and ABSOLUTELY bumping Don Pisto's up to 5 stars. My close friends and I came here for New Year's Eve for dinner before we went to a club to dance the rest of 2011 away. My first experience with Don Pisto's was amazing, but I didn't think they could completely blow me away the second time. Yeah, I was wrong.  We all ordered different dishes, and we each tried a little bit of everyone's food. I had been wanting to try their tortilla soup ever since I saw it on the menu, but the order is big enough to feed TWO people as a full MEAL. Soooo, I talked my 3 dining companions into ordering it as an appetizer for the 4 of us (yenno, along with the chips, salsa, & guacamole we already had on the table...). We did it, and we were all SO glad we did. The tortilla soup is absolutely delectable. Everything about it was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was amazing. The spice sneaks up on you, too. I LOVED it.  I ordered the carnitas tacos, one of my friends ordered the carne asada tacos, and another ordered the camarones tacos. All exceptional, as expected.   Our 4th dining companion ordered one of the specials for the night, the machaca. It's basically marinated, slow cooked beef in a chile sauce, topped with a sunny side up egg. Eaten with tortillas (and rice and beans, if you like), of course. It was fucking PHENOMENAL. If I had known it was going to be that good, I would've ordered that instead of the carnitas. If that's on the menu when you eat at Don Pisto's, you should definitely order it. Trust me, it's worth it.

wwrkFOlT8kka2ovdViVgkw.review_text: I've been to Don Pisto's many times and it used to be a favorite of mine. Their burger is fantastic, probably the most delicious burger I have ever had in my life. Not anymore.   Last night, I attempted to have dinner there and order my favorite burger. I'm anaphylactically allergic to avocados (meaning when I eat them my entire face swells up and I can't breathe). Usually, I just tell the wait staff to not put the guacamole on my burger, they do that, and I'm able to eat the delicious burger and live to tell about it. Worked out for everyone.   HOWEVER, last night I was made aware of a new policy: They no longer will take guacamole off of food - as it would change the "vision of the burger." Even in cases of food allergy. Chef's orders. Seriously.  Thank you, Don Pisto's, for discriminating against a person with food allergies. You've just lost a customer for life.

3zLvaIqYSnH9xVZqZyHwzA.review_text: Being Mexican, I NEVER ate at Mexican restaurants- my mom is an amazing cook and nothing ever came close to her cooking.  Well, all of that ended when I found Don Pistos!!  From beginning to end, they are delicious!  Their chips and salsa are to die for- their chips are fresh and their salsa is just damn good- you can't stop eating it! I've had their salmon ceviche, their street corn, and tacos al pastor- ALL AMAZING!  If you haven't been here- then you must!!

AHI4Ew--zYhs0m8npEd65g.review_text: Great Mexican in North Beach, unexpected in that it feels like a cool Mission joint but off of Columbus Ave. I had a great breakfast burrito for a Sunday lunch. Savory and flavorful but not too heavy. The pineapple aqua fresca mimosa was like juice and yummy. They do bottomless for $15! The restaurant was close to full at 1PM but was able to sit immediately.

71RVNcSPEs8rxyxQllMGeQ.review_text: I can't say enough good things about Don Pisto's. A friend and I stopped in for a bite on a crowded Thursday evening after being told there was a two-hour wait at Tony's down the street. Though the restaurant was packed to the gills, we were able to snag two seats at the bar.   The food was all delicious - we split guacamole, to-die-for tacos, and one other entree - but the main highlight of the evening was our bartender. He was entertaining and kept us belly laughing all night long. I'd literally go back just to sit at the bar again. Top it off with some delicious sangria, and I'm sold.

GNDPGumn6Gy7c9a9xTk_mg.review_text: Mexican is not my favorite food as a rule, which makes the 5 stars here even more significant. went to a private party downstairs last weekend and the food was just ridiculous. everything was amazing, but the fish tacos were the best I've ever had, hands down. hope ya like spicy!

sImoVbJmmdz1fPm46qM12g.review_text: We had a great brunch here! Guacamole was flavorful, the salsa they brought out was awesome and our mains were delicious. I had the huevos rancheros and my husband had the breakfast burrito, both were perfect. They also had really good looking drinks (bottomless mimosas or sangria) though we weren't drinking that day, we definitely will come back and try out their sangria next time.  Service and atmosphere were also great!

feBLYI6ve4eNFWY9SxV4Vg.review_text: We wanted to go here for dinner before a comedy show but the place was packed and they don't take reservations for parties less than six people. When we arrived, we were told the wait would be an hour and a half-- we didn't have that much time before the show. Pete (the manager? Owner? Not sure,) was beyond accommodating-- so friendly and offered to walk us over to their other restaurant (Pisto Tacos?) and even bought us a round of drinks. The food there was good, too! It's that kind of service that gets people to come back. Even though we didn't eat at Don Pistos, the food and ambiance seemed to be worth the wait. Pete, you rock-- we will definitely return to both restaurants :)

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: I've literally attempted to come here multiple times but got deterred by the 1 hour+ wait times. This time, we were determined to wait it out by going to Park Tavern for drinks while we waited for their call.   Finally seated, we ordered: Guac + chips, carnitas and fish tacos, grilled pork chop, mexican sashima, and ceviche.  Hands down, our absolutely favorite dish was the grilled pork chop. A must try! I'll come back for this dish alone. Everything else we had was delicious, but pricey for pretty standard mexican fare.   I'll definitely try to come back here for brunch!

oarKDJg3V7mLpgdDVPYmSg.review_text: What a great place. I went late, at about 12:15, when closing time was 12:30; and they were as welcoming and friendly as you can get.  The atmosphere is relaxed yet upbeat; cool, but not too cool.  The service was fast and friendly and helpful.  And the food was delicious.  I wanted to lick the bottom of the guacamole bowl, but I managed to resist the temptation and left with my dignity in tact.

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: We tried Don Pisto's once before and the hostess told us that it wasn't likely that we could get a table. This time around, we came on a double date and didn't actually expect any openings on a Thursday night, but miraculously, we were seated right away.  The four of us shared the shrimp, fish and carnitas tacos and an order of their pork chops. We also got some guac to start. I liked that the tortilla chips were freshly fried and unsalted. The green salsa was very fresh tasting.  The food arrived in quick succession. In terms of the tacos, my favorite was the shrimp and (surprisingly) the carnitas, I liked the least. I thought overall, the tacos were nothing special nor innovating. I'll take a taco from a taco truck over these any day of the week. The pork chop was well seasoned, but just slightly overcooked.   The sangrias were pretty tasty. I liked the rustic decor and open kitchen, but the food was very average, at least in my humble opinion. I don't quite understand what all the fuss was all about. The ingredients were higher in quality than most Mexican places but I don't think it was cooked with heart and without that, the food simply don't have that homey feel to it.

updNAUcQkI9wm2yNoRNubQ.review_text: Don Pisto's is my answer to Big Star in Chicago. Minus the patio I guess. For those of you not getting the analogy, Big Star is amazing. Hence I'm telling you Don Pisto's ain't too shabby either.  The Don's top 4 accomplishments, in order: 1. Delicious Tacos 2. Bottomless Mimosas/Sangria/Margaritas 3. Great brunch items for around $10 each 4. A scene that's cool without having to tell you so  Only downside: this place is every bit as popular as it should be, so on the weekend expect to wait a while.

wCPkiI4PuHrv5dQif6gDvg.review_text: Baby wha happen?!?  This is by far, my favorite place to go when I want some good food and great entertainment in North Beach. i have been for both brunch and dinner and it never disappoints! Ladybird getting hungry just yelping about it.

RPymDnNtCs8xZQyt0veY7A.review_text: went there for brunch. cute! We ordered tacos and some omelet for brunch. Tacos were good. Good drinks. But the omelet was WS.  I'd recommend sticking to order from their regular Mexican menu. guacamole was good.  They need more bathrooms. there was a long line all the time.  It's a good size popular restaurant. It'd just make sense to have more bathrooms.

ltfsBefhwBH4K_dnUyGucg.review_text: Go, just go, go, go.   The tacos... YUM The salsa... amazing The winner? The HAMBURGUESA. SO good!  This place is a must try.

cP-I9nE4vsmYecV1wGEyNA.review_text: I threw a 30th surprise birthday party for my boyfriend a few days before Christmas.  I worked with Shannon who was AWESOME and so easy to work with.  The entire staff at Don Pistos is accommodating and friendly.  Our waitress (didnt get her name) was super helpful and allowed our crazy party of 30 have some fun.  The private room downstairs (which was free btw) was a perfect setting for a party.  The food is amazing, authentic and savory.  Did i mention their margaritas are strooong too!!   I HIGHLY recommend Don Pisto's to anyone.  All around 5 stars.  Cant wait to go back ;-)

nNoLwBUu45N-YkiTagNVvg.review_text: margarita + guacamole + tacos = perfect meal I love coming to this place. Although they don't take reservations, it's nice that they let you put your name and phone number down and call you when your table is ready. It's a nice opportunity to check out another local bar while you're waiting.

V_nH5J6ZzR3s-fyV_w8dCw.review_text: The pollo asado plate was amazing! Some of the best grilled chicken I have ever had. The guacamole is a bit pricey but worth every penny. I recommend it to everyone. Unfortunately, Not a whole lot of beverage options and the margaritas were so-so, nothing too special.

B-nMZAVydQK45uPCFKS-4w.review_text: Passed this place million times and finally got a chance to try it when my European colleague read about it and insisted we should go there for our team dinner.  The place was packed @ 8:30pm on a Wed night w/ the incredible smell of yummy grilled calamaris in the air.  We ordered just about everything off of their small but solid menu.  All grilled items were out-of-this-world flavorful: lobster, chicken, calamaris (had 3 orders to finally satisfy the crowd, i.e. me :).  Mexican sashimis were fresh, ceviche was ok but guac was the creamiest I've ever had.  Salsa's got a kick to it so we needed LOADs of guac to neutralize it.  Tacos need a little jazzing up, they were the only items our table didn't fight over.

q02KHjBcWLwemlKHIUQHNA.review_text: Taco's and Snoop Dog blasting? I don't think my life could be much better. The fresh sushimi, guacamole, and Al Pastor tacos are my order every time. Blast that 90's hip hop!

HVYFgJDyQGJRjGjVujU1SQ.review_text: Yummy food but I just go for the brunch all you can drink:)

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: Can you say amazing? Not only did they hold our table for us after giving us a reservation the day of, but the food was incredible. We ordered just about every taco (carne asada, fish, al pastor, carnitas), plus the calamari, the rib chop, and the pollo asado. Everything is seasoned really well, and the wait-staff do a fantastic job refilling the chip trays and cups. Their salsa was killer, and the chips tasted house-made (super warm and crispy). The tortillas were also some of the best I've ever had (yes, they can rival La Palma's and La Tapatia's). The vibe is chill, and I would definitely come back whenever possible. I almost got lost the first time around because there was no sign. :P

uT6ORAzPlEcLJRZv-MMCqA.review_text: I ventured in here on a warm Saturday afternoon with a good friend of mine. She had been here once and I was open to try it.  The establishment has a dark woody theme, wooden tables, floors. Very Spanish vibe.   We sat ourselves and just in time, we beat the crowd of folks wandering in for dinner. We ordered beer, Pacifico and Michelada, they have a pretty basic selection, nothing ground breaking. They also have sangria which I hear is very good.   Started with chips and salsa, a few oysters which I really liked, very smooth and crisp. We also tried the tuna ceviche which was spicy, but sort of bland. Then came the tacos, Camarones (shrimp) with a nice spicy avocado salsa.   Overall everything tasted fine, nothing stood out very much. Service was decent.

XYfT8BNHMVmCOjr_hJ474A.review_text: I absolutely love this place.  Great inimate ambiance, food is just absolutely perfect. Tacos are great as are the salsas and guacamole.  And even better is the service. The bartender is really cute - was all smiles which is big plus. Would go back again just to smile at the bartender before diving into a pool full of salsa.

WnzRueYdRWNSbkXB0_0i4Q.review_text: Don Pisto's attempts to fuse Mexican street food with a high quality , fancy, fine dining remix. Some places do this successfully, others end up charging 3x the price for the same meal you would find out of a food truck.  Don Pisto's does some things great and other things poorly. Thankfully, I am here to help you know what to order:  PRO:  -Unlimited chips and salsa verde spicy salsa - delish. -Chorizo & Mussels with White Wine Reduction Sauce - 4 star! Fresh mussels topped with mild chorizo and a delicious broth. Worth the $14.  -Seafood stew - tons of fish, prawns, squid, calamari etc in a buttery chicken tortilla-like stew. 4.5 star.  CONS: -I didn't try, but everyone who had the tacos were told to stay away. It's not bad, but not worth $8 for 2 small tacos. -They decided to no longer offer mango ahi which was supposedly amazing said reviews. -They were very crowded, but the place had no sign / name decal / logo on it whatsoever. If you didn't have exact GPS or drove by, you'd have no idea what it was called. Who's dumb idea was that?

mLuUtgNPHcDxRDD2ZuMg4g.review_text: Always packed, so you know it's good! No sign for the building, just a red light, so you know it's pretentious! I eat here about once a year when I'm in the city for a few days. Love the brick walls and lighting. Food is epic. Tortilla soup, salsa, sangria, tacos, all amazing! Great date spot. Good luck finding parking!! Plan ahead.

qh_IPvluQmI1jgqNrAyeuw.review_text: WOW. This place is AHHMAZING. I was here with co-workers last night and it was packed -- rightly so.  Our table ordered a bunch of different items of the menu and everything was insanely delicious. I only had a few items but they were so yummy I am actually deeply sad I am only in San Francisco for work and that I will be leaving this wonderful restaurant behind.   Lobster -- CHECK. ***This is a MUST*** Perfectly cooked with such a unique, light flavor.   Carne Asada Tacos -- Yes. Just the perfect amount of spicy.   Fantastic chips and guacamole.    A must go.

YSLkZZLj6U4H4mh7jNl40w.review_text: Ok...I thought going into Mexican food in San Francisco?....having lived in LA for the last 8 years my Mexican food standards are pretty high and I must say....Don Pisto's is AWESOME.    From the get go I was feeling the vibe.  We couldn't find the restaurant right away because they actually don't have a sign out front, but I actually liked that.  And from going inside there is no need for a sign....it was packed.  We made reservations and got a table downstairs in a separate area from the main area.    We ordered the camarones (shrimp), pescado, and al pastor tacos and all were really good with camarones being the favorite amongst the people I shared it with.    Another popular thing on the menu seemed to be their Bottomless menu which is bottomless mimosa ($13), margarita ($15), or sangria ($15)...all before 3:30pm daily.  Man...what a deal!!  Leave your car behind and head on down there for some drinks and tacos!    Will head back and try something off of their breakfast menu next time :)   Chatted with the waiter for a sec and must say SUPER friendly.  Found out it was his brother who is the chef/owner....and he also cooks for another kitchen right around the corner in some bar....ceviche and stuff...how dare I forget the name of the place!  WIll ask the next time I go back :)  Only complaint....it was so loud in the part of the restaurant we were in that my friends and I had to shout at each other to talk....the big group next to us were also super loud so mixed with the music....hard to talk to the person next to you.  It did get a lot better once that big group did leave but man......talk about loud.

zKjnzaHojLBSXndsW-_W5Q.review_text: My heart was broken when we weren't able to get a table with Mama.  Mama had better things to do than to take 6 yelpers under her wings. But thanks to Don Pisto, he came to the rescue.  He brought us so much joy from the bottomless pit to the....  bottomless mimosas.... bottomless margaritas.... and of course....  bottomless sangarias....  oh joy joy joy joy... need I say more...  Actually I do!  Their chorizo, to their breakfast burritos along with their omelettes are just amazing.  This is one brunch that is unforgettable for its food, hospitality and the bottomless cocktails and company.  Although it was pretty loud, it is such a great place for a get together to enjoy Don Pisto's ever amazingly brunch menu along with the cocktails.  He has made my day and I want more and more and more....

jeZPB1BSBDgqgQPhcjBAOw.review_text: Simple horizontal menu with delicious fresh taco options, fresh Mexican seafood specials, light refreshing margaritas, and tangy balanced guac. Low lights and chill environment but loud and vibrant conversations. Superb bar staff at the 5-seat bar.

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: place is pretty big.  there is a lower level with larger group seating.  exposed brick and other touches make for a nice atmosphere.    i was skeptical.  a mexican place in north beach?  but i was impressed.  oysters were really fresh.  ceviche was fresh and not too acidic.  al pastor tacos were quite tender and flavorful.  as always with al pastor, it could have had more pineapple flavor.  hamburgues was thick, juicy, and flavorful.

1WtwGYGC4rE-Cy3LMAro3A.review_text: Something's changed...  First they got rid of the side peppers... now all the tacos are doused in same sauce.  Service feels more like that of a tourist trap than a locals joint.  Sigh.  I used to love you Don Pisto, but you've changed!

_Q8rrkDjLabvBCj5SLf88A.review_text: This review of mine is more about the service and how we were treated at Don Pisto's and not of the food because everyone who has been here already knows how great the food is. Over the holidays I became really sick in an out of the hospital and on bed rest, so last Saturday I told my hubby that I needed to get out of town, I wanted to go to my favorite city San Francisco to go eat at one of my favorite little restaurant, Don Pistos, because of traffic my little family of four (our two kids 8&6) didn't get to the restaurant until 8:30. The line was out the door and people were standing outside. We put our name on the list and it was a 2 hour wait. My hubby knew how much it meant for me to eat there so we waited, the kids were tired, hungry and grumpy, he took them to have some gelato next door to keep them up but they hostess' at Don Pistos must of felt bad for us that we were able to get in within 40 minutes. We let the kids order bottled coke to keep them from falling asleep. I seen that they had this amazing lobster on the menu, but the server told us that they were sold out :( Bummer but now I will have an excuse to go again! I told my husband that I'd like to come again the next morning for brunch so I can get my 2nd fix of Don Pisto's. Everyone in my little family enjoyed their meals when the server came with our check she let us know that our drinks were being comped. How nice!! I love this place. We came back the next morning for brunch and I enjoyed bottomless pineapple mimosa's my hubby and I got the sonora taco my daughter got the torta and my son ate off of us. We ask for the bill and I don't know if it was the manager but a really nice young lady came over and told us that the Restaurant was treating us to our brunch. WOW!! how nice! it was such a nice gesture from Don Pistos! We all could not believe how kind they were to us. She said they appreciated our business and that we drove all the way from Fresno and they'd like to see us there again! YES of course we will be back!  We left feeling so blessed and This is my go to restaurant in SF. Hand's down my favorite place to visit. My birthday is this weekend and I am thinking of asking my hubby to take me to Don Pistos to have that lobster!

DD_XjXI_oSST3XwoEQ578w.review_text: This place was amazing! It was a busy Friday night so we sat at the bar. Friendly barkeeper who explains the bar is slanted so use your napkin under your drink. We ordered chips and guacamole. Simply amazing.  The green salsa is so good... Very lime-y but I love that. I had the Calamari and my daughter had the shrimp tacos. Huge YUM on both! We shared a side of pinto beans.  We were full but kept eating, it was so good!

YnHf1BPFjfj3kK_i1AC4rQ.review_text: Came here Sunday night with a crew of 5 name was put on the list half hour later we we're told our table was being setup false! They made us lollygag around the bar for another 20 minutes when we asked one of the staff member he blew us off with a bs excuse saying he couldn't control when would be seated. We ordered food which came out very scattered and some people at our table ate cold food waiting for other peoples food to come out!  To me the staff acted like a bunch of confused children in a math class not knowing how to properly tack care of their customers. Food was decent but I will not be coming back unless they get their act together.

efwxzh0RJDivZBQhfknQag.review_text: Amazing, fresh, well made top notch tacos. Guacamole and chips were good/average. The ceviche was fresh and really good. The tacos by far made the meal. We had fish and pork - both flavorful and delicious. The margaritas were also good, not too sweet, which I hate. Staff was friendly - shout out to Daniel!

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Bumping rating down from 4 stars to 3.  Came back for a group dinner, and the food was just okay. Service was really lacking.
